reviewText: good little set of add on lenses didn't really get the chance to use much but they all seemed to work fine just stepped up to the Nikon D3200 package so gave this one to my wife

I had one from 2 years ago, also cheaply made blue plastic, which transferred my pictures very quickly.  I gave that to a relative, and bought ths one, from "jacob's parts".  It's much slower, although made of similar cheap blue plastic.  I can tolerate the cheap feel, but 45 min to transfer 1 sd card worth of pix when it used to take much less than 30 is not ok, even at this two buck price!

Nice bag that I got for free when I purchased the K200D Body. Just wondering what to do with the velcro padded partitions that don't seem to fit anywhere. Would have been nice to have some illustrations. Quality I would rate a 4. Lots of pockets and Compartments. Just a bit larger than I expected.
This case is OK but it feels somewhat cheap and flimsy. You have to be careful when standing up the iPad vertically as it may flip.

Purchased this item in hopes of increasing my range over my Linksys adapter, but it hasn't.  It works fine up to about 40 feet, then you lose your connection quite often.  I will use it, but it doesn't do what I expected.

Well what can I say about a case.... It's good with one side to hold USB cable and memory card with a net and the External Hard Drive on the other side. The material is quite sturdy and resembles Nylon on Tumi products. And cute Amazon logo on the Zipper ^^

Technically I'm sure this is a fine product. My college professor suggested using a Trackball instead of a mouse for Photoshop work, but after ordering this and trying it out for awhile, I went back to the mouse. This was too clunky and big for my smaller hand and I was very uncomfortable using it.

It does it's job, but very hard to apply.  I finally learned to live with the air bubbles under the "skin" after trying many times to get it on correctly.It probably is a good - better product, but I had a hard time trying to get it applied correctly.

I am not sure how long a keyboard is expected to last under daily use but I have not had this all that long and it is starting to die already. The keys are no longer functioning all the time. I bought it because of the good reviews but I think I will try a different keyboard next time.
It can be forced into place to make the product fit, but it is too tight for my radio and required a little modification to make it look good.  I also painted mine to improve the look.
This is the 2nd one of these that I've bought because the other one broke shortly after receiving it.  This one seems to be lasting a bit longer.  Caution on these.  You get what you pay for.

I used this mouse for several months, but I finally came to the conclusion that it is simply too small.  Perhaps for someone with smaller hands that won't be a problem.  I also don't like the fact that it uses AAA batteries (related to the fact that it's quite small).My new replacement Bluetooth mouse uses AA batteries, which are much more common, and therefore easier (and often cheaper) to replace.  Especially when traveling.

The Case is really nice but the pockets are not so comfortable. If u have all the kit sensor, even the wifi USB, you can risk to loose it easily. An extra zip inside will be ok. It strange that GARMIN doesn't think on it before.

These headphones perform wonderfully, especially considering their low price. I have listened to rock, pop, country, and classical music, and these phones have sounded great in all genres. However, after extended wear, they began to cause me outer ear pain where my ear touched the interior part of the headphone. I have since switched my primary headphones to the Sennheiser PX100.

I appreciate the higher voltage needed to charge tablets, like the iPad, which has a bigger power draw than traditional smartphones. However, over time, I noticed that the charger doesn't hold up. The seam that connects the front plate to the back plate split apart and the construction quality could be better.

These wipes leave my iPhone/Kindle Fire/iPad2 clean as a whistle.  No more fingerprints, smudges, or gunk.  I also assume they are sanitizing my device.  Overall these are a good buy.The only downside is their size.  These wipes are well smaller than a dollar bill.  With only 15 wipes per pack, if you are cleaning bigger items (iPad for example), you will go through these in a hurry.
Sony comes out with great products but making this system exclusive just for Sony 4K Tv's is just pure greed. I had it for about 3 weeks and sold it.

I am happy with it, I fell I got my money's worth. I think the next generation could be refined though. When I am in the shower I want to change the volume, I sometimes turn it off instead of up or down because it hard to tell which button is which.
The price isn't amazing, it's not a rip off either though.They function just as they should. Therefore, "just okay."
I purchased this to replace one going bad after 2 years this replacement lasted about 3 month before it went bad back to HP Warranty

I like the semi hard case but not the cheap velcro straps that you have to use to store your camera safely in this thing. A simple pocket would have been a nicer solution but it'll do for now..... at least it was cheap!
not truly wireless as they connect the the wall outlet plus are wired to one another. the sound is good but not great.
Gave as a gift. It wasn't very pleasing to the recipient - my mistake. I thought it would clean glasses, but instead they will have to use it for just jewelry which was very welcome
I bought this because I need a 90deg plug like in the picture but the product I received was not like the picture the plug was straight.other then that it works as intended.

can't mount where I need them but they work good as cameras the low light function is fantastic but also the weak point for the motion sense. To prevent false motion sensing I have to set the sensitivity level too low
It's okay, took a chance and now it's in the drawer.  Kind of a pain to use, there have got to be better ones out there.
The router works ok, but I had bought this to replace the previous two routers that were not doing the job and sadly this router did not provide the strong signal I was looking for.
Haven't tried this out yet because I didn't realize it would be so big.  However, it does look very well-made.
clean sound, great range, goes through walls, bass is really bad. overall sound quality is ok but i expected better for the price

I use this to charge a Samsung S3 and it takes about 4-5 hours to be fully charged which is 2x longer than when I use a blackerry OEM cord but it's still better than the samsung cord that came with phone.
It's okay, the technology is old so there is not much we can do. As the memory it self it does works and do some performance improvements for my Dell Dimension 3000.

I hated that they stuck so much out of my ears. When lifting weights I felt like they kept falling out. This is just my personal opinion about them. But I did like the red cord (kind of like dre beats) and they were very loud.
I maybe should have bought a knock off, however it works and looks great. Be sure and buy the extra battery (I forgot)
I have no cloo what is or isn't special about this cable.  It is still sitting in the box but from past experience the price is excellent and i'm sure the quality of picture will be too

Don't like this case much, it doesnt fit my camera very well.  It's too deep for most larger cameras so my camera flops around a bit.  It's also fairly bulky and you wouldn't want this thing attached to your belt.  For $6 it does what is was designed for.

I bought this originally for an iPod touch and iPad 2... works for those, recently purchased an iPhone 4s and the iphone doesn't recognize that there is an external power source.  Swapped cables for one that I do know works on the 4s, same issue...  same charger and cable works with the ipod touch.  curious
Nothing great, but will do a little better than Apple stock ones.

With good program quality the 3D effect is very good. However, it is like viewing television through dark sunglasses so if the program content is dark the picture quality is poor. A film like "Up" is good but the "Dark Knight" isn't. Where 3D really shines is sports like the NBA playoffs. However, this is a relitively cheap price for an emerging technology that will someday be more than high tech toy.

Emits a high-frequency buzz, backlights (except for the 3 buttons that you really need) activate every time you look in the general direction of the remote.  Fit and feel is quite crude and unpleasant.  This is simply not an elegant remote.  Pre-programming is almost impossible; you are much better off using the training feature.
I bought this to eliminate my alternator whining problem... it doesn't. Although it does suppressthe sound slightly but if you turn up your system you can still hear it..

I purchased this with the EA 3500 wireless router and both products said they provided QoS.  While you can manage QoS on the router, this product has no way of managing QoS so I am not sure how they are really providing QoS.  There is no documentation on what their stock QoS priorities are.  In the future I will buy a managed switch.

Like others have said, this is only a 10 gauge power wire - maybe. I ended up using my existing 10 gauge power wire I was looking to upgrade because it was a larger diameter than what came here. I kept the kit and gave it 3 stars because just using the fuse block and a couple of the miscellaneous wires would have been $10-$12 separately.

I was hoping this device would help me recover the data on my laptop's hard disk.  Unfortunately, the disk is not compatible.  Take away: be sure you verify what you hard disk is compatible before buying this product.

I got these for my 5-year-old son. I paid $30 and got what I paid for. The construction quality is fairly high. Sound quality is good. If you are not looking to spend a lot of money on nicer head phones that are really over-priced because of the logo on the side, then these will do well for you.

its a simple product for every single camera out there, easy to use and also very usefull. if you looking to buy just something than can hold your camera stand still and let you regulate the lavel, this product is for you.

These work great but I can't figure out for the life of me why they decided to put the volume control mid-cord? It flops around so I can only use these when I have something on that I can clip it too (like when I'm biking or running with a camel pack).
these batteries are not as good as they said. but they can hold a charge for a while and do the job.

I put it on my IPad 4 and sticks good , but the problem was that it does not show you the original screen like when you don't have a a screen protector, it has Bearly unseen dots ,, you won't see the difference unless you compare it to unbothered IPad without screen protectorWhen sow the difference I took it off immediately , all in all it is not that bad but not that good either

I expected more from Klipsch than this. I feel like the music is tinny and lifeless.  I like my $50 skull candy earbuds much better.  I do not feel these are much better (maybe a little) than the free ones included with most ipods.  Sorry guys.
Normal headphones for the computer. Without special claims for quality of sound. I use them only for Skype. Not for music!

This was a good case. Not phenomenal or awesome, but acceptable. I didn't want bulk since it's a tablet and already bulky enough, but I wanted to be able to put it down without scratching anything.The cover flap had become very slightly bent over the time, most likely because of the way it props up the tablet.This does not very effectively prop up the tablet.
its o.k but the Microsoft Lifecam X3000 is much better, i own both.. better images, faster tracking and it has some real nice features and it's $19.99 AR

Purchased 3 spools; the price for Sony disks was unbeatable, but so far I have had 4 disks that have a flaw on the edge and I just opened the spool.  You can record on them but they will not play back.  Will have to inspect/review each disk before recording now, and I shouldn't have to do that.  Expected better from Sony.
Nice product but you are required to pay $15.00 a month to get music and it did not say that in the description when I bought this as a gift.
I would of rated it higher had I actually gotten the product.
it didn't fit my 7 inch HD quite right and felt like it was too big. It's cute, and I am sure a very sturdy product, but I can't use it without fear of my kindle falling out.  It could just be me
good quality , good finish but i bought it for my canon sx30i which already has a wide angel lens , i thought it will ad a lot but actually it didnt add anythingpicture without it is better

The case was very tight with the iPad mini it. I can't fit my iPad in it with the smart case on which is surprising because it's a very thin case. They need to make the case slightly larger. The case also had a very slight oder to it but went away within a day.

My title says it all. These are good headphones with good sound quality. Noise cancelling is there but not enough. I am not sure how these would compare with a Bose for example.Headphones are not padded and they can begin to hurt the head if worn for too long.

Was really looking for a good screen protector for the kindle fire.  This one is a perfect fit and goes on very easily but I could not get all the air bubbles out.  I spent quite a bit of time working on this but finally just gave up as it was not working.  So this is an ok product and works great to protect the screen if you dont mind bubbles.
I should have got the battery powered on I had last deployment. Its nice at work but I'd rather have the battery powered one.

I picked this bag because it measured 7 inches long (in the product listing).  My Canon XA10 camcorder just barely fits inside. The additional side pouches holds the XA10's battery, USB cable, audio/video cables, and the A/C power adapter.  I wish they could have made this bag just a little bit bigger! Just by one more inch longer and wider, and 3 inches taller.  This bag is better suited for cameras, NOT camcorders!

It's a decent light. The neck is floppy and does not want to stay where you put it. I find it annoying to touch the power switch 3 times to turn it off. It doesn't have a physical "clicky" button, just a touch switch.

I bought this to use it in my psychology internship and it does work but this is slow as hell, I get desperate trying to open a program and it is the same with the internet. If you don't have patience (just like me) don't get into this. At least I can say that at the end it gets the job done (but way at the end).

We got reasonable value for our money.  It works.  The price was okay.  Software is a bit obtuse.  However, it always does the automatic backups and files are available when we need them.  Far better than the mechanical external hard disk it replaced.  I definitely recommend going solid state.
The price was good and it arrived on time. It comes with a remote so you can use the tablet almost as a TV. Aside from that, most people will not find a use for it.KenWebmaster[...]
Power adapter AC plug easily get break( one of the prong left in the AC wall ),but the device itself is working fine.

As others have pointed out, this type of lens hood (Fotodiox) does NOT work with ultra-wide screen camera model (e.g. HDR-CX550v) at the widest zoom.  However, I have found one that works perfectly with the CX550v on Ebay (seller: Rainbowimaging). This metal lens hood works great for my cam and the price is pretty cheap. I'd recommend you check that out.

They work as long as you add your own adhesive to the back or the wires aren't heavy. I used these to dress an AV rack and some fell off after a few days. Some glue fixed that. For the price if you don't mind adding some glue in the mix, they're worth it. These things are a lot more expensive in the store.

I bought it because it supports many types of formats. It is not very responsive and if you break your remote, you can not use it. I can not seem to find information on the largest hdd it supports. It is ok, Would be better if it worked faster and the remote needs a redesign.
They aren't silver, they are orange purple and gray. Also they have horrible mids and the bass is muddy

The pen is great. But the touch function are not, it is hard to use touch as the others on laptop. So, I recommend to buy Bamboo Pen not this one.Also the latest driver is incompatible with my tablet pc's screen.
Good for value.  Hope to never use it.  Received information online vs as actual paper document.  Don't know if I like that

It works well if left alone, but this is not a screw on hood, its a 2 sided push-in.If you accidentally touch 1 side, the hood could just fall off, either getting lost or making a disturbing noise on a hard floor when quiet is needed.

It is a good bag, looks good, but it is on the small side (which it's intended to be), and the handle is a bit rickety.  I know it's not meant for rugged use, but just back and forth to the car and office it has had some use but seems to not be holding up that well (the wheels and handle).  I switch bags often enough though that that's not a big deal for me.

Big in your hands, so if you wear a size medium in gloves, this may not fit.Connecting to my 8-core was simple. Works well. Fast. Smooth.It's the shape that kinda bothers me. Unless you point your mouse straight forward, the orientation of the curvy design is a little off.I would recommend you try this in a store before buying online.

We've purchased this item in the past and it worked great.  I went to get a second and the second one the charging contact pin was broken.  The vendor honored a return request, but I was disappointed that it did not work.

My goal was to have a silent PC, I use an Antec P180 case, and replaced the stock fan. Unfortunately, I can still hear a very audible hum from them .. disappointing.My search for a quieter fan continues ...
Like some have said, not as comfortable as the OEM. Who knows with music (head cold, wife left you, fired) but, they seem to muffle the sound a bit. Better than before however.
Exactly what it says it is, nothing more, nothing less.While a Class 10, it's speed is more like class 5.Recommended.  I would buy another if I had a need for one.
Bought this for my new rig. First 4 months, product had no issues. A few weeks ago, I kept getting high pings in online games (3x+ usual ping).

Camera works OK most of the time. Sometimes it stops recording anything until you reformat the card to clear it. Video is good, but not at night. IR LED's will not give enough light for anything useful.

I found good reviews about it and bought itBut found its not that greatreason I did not like- auto focus is not quick to focus- you really need stable hands else it does not give sharp image^ i have found this to be a huge problem

"the TD2220 supports the USB HID Touch driver and is fully compatible with Windows 8"Not so.  As noted elsewhere you cannot swipe from the bezel onto the screen thus limiting the usefulness of this monitor for Windows 8.It would be a great monitor for Windows 7.
Im okay with this , the only con is that it dosent mirror every connection, maybe its my cell, but overall it dose the job

I still have not mastered the knack of bubble free installation, even though I've looked at various you tube videos, and tried really hard. Oh well, the product itself was fine, ease of application not good for me.
Just ordered it. Just waiting for it to come. will update then. Bought it for my son and to use when on a cruise ship. should be fun. will update the star rating at that time too.
I'd highly recommend you get the sandisk ultra series for microsd,so you can actually record in 1080p hd and all that for your phone if you're using that with this product.

The weather band reception is so terribly weak it really does not work at all.Other than that the light is OK but really does not produce much light.Just OK for $20 bucks.Note that it does have an 12 V AC adapter input for internal battery recharging.The 3.5 mm plug is for audio input ONLY and does not power speakers or headphones.Note that any special necessary cable for audio input or 12 V AC adapter are not included.

I tried this with my 5d2 with 24-70. It works well, but it has slight creeping problem. it will never stay where you line it up before tightening. The plastic between the camera and the ball head is too flimsy, you can even do a significant wiggle and see the difference.I will keep this for a future gorilla pod+flash combo

I have a new HP 15.6" Laptop. The 1360us.  Esresso Color.Thus it amazes me that HP markets this bag to fit up to 16" and it BARELY fits my 15.6".  My Brothers older HP fit perfectly, however this bag is to match the newer styled laptops, so why wouldn't it fit them correctly?Its nice looking, and good quality, but the fit scares me.  I wonder how many people with 16" laptops have gotten this and realized it didn't fit.

Not much to say about it except that it works.  I use it as a storage unit, and backup for three of my computers.  The large capacity is exactly what I was looking for, and this device fills the bill.

9 times out of 10 these have enough holding power to work for what they are meant to be used on - data cables, etc.  But when you have a few coiled cables and things that are dissimilar, the velcro stickiness is just not very strong.
For the price, this cover should be something innovative like the Smart Cover is for the iPad 2.On its own, this item is decent - but based on what you get, the price point should be $12-15.

The cable did not fit my Coolpix 4300, which is fine since it isn't explicitly mentioned in the description... except that it supposedly fits cameras that use the same jack as the 4300. If you are buying these cables, make absolutely sure that they fit the USB jack on your camera. Otherwise, you'll just have a useless cable to eventually give away to a thrift store, since they aren't actually worth anything.

I liked the design, weight and look, but it advertised to fit the Kindle 7", but it is too small. That was disappointing. Beware, if you have the Kindle 7", it won't fit, it's way to tight of a fit and the zipper will eventually cause damage.
This works as advertised. You do need to support the arm because the thumbscrew will not tighten enough to hold it.  I ended up buying a padholdr and installing that in my dash.  Much better.

I ordered this stylus when I was just getting started with my Kindle as far as using it for games.  I've already replaced the tip once.  I think the styluses I just ordered will out this Bamboo to shame.  It may be fine for some, but maybe I am too much a bull in a china shop for this wimpy product.

The design is a little flawed at the bottom cut out for the connector, leaves a very thing piece of material that soon breaks and then the whole thing kind of opens up and falls off. Looked very nice and beginning but not so good workmanship.

It's an ok case. I like that it's low profile. One thing that does bother me is that where the tablet is cradled it semi-blocks the volume button. Kind of weird that it was designed that way. Other than that it's fine.
Received the cable quickly and when I used it to connecct to an hp printer, it wouldn't work. Returned with no issue.
when they work ... they work great but once in a while they will create a loud crackle sound.  Make sure everything is plugged in well and check it while recording.

Good sound quality, but the ear buds have a weird design and they easily fall out of my ear.  It's also hard to position in such a way as to hear the quality bass tones.The mic isn't that great.  Not as good as the Apple headphones that came with my iPhone4.
You get a lot for the money. The cord worked, the 12volt worked, and the AC plug worked, once! The second try it would not charge the ipod. Like I said, you pay cheap, you get cheap!

I've tried most of the other iPad-targeted styluses and this one is pretty much the best.But, even given that, it's a bit short for larger hands. Plus, if you don't hold it at just the right angle (more upright than a pen), it tends to lose "touch," leading to skips in your lines.It's not bad, but if you're expecting to get something similar to a TabletPC experience on your iPad, you will be disappointed.

I purchased this beacuse I was trying to replace my daughters ipod touch shattered screen. I also brought tools and a replacement LCD touch screen. It took me 5 hours to do the replacement. It was working but the screen do not lay flush. I tried to conrrect this imperfection and broke the ribbon.
cheap cable and works the same way. don't yank it too hard or the connection will break and the cable won't work anymore. but it's cheap enough where it isn't a problem.
Look great and it those the job but nor for me. Sometimes i want my camera on my neck and well with this you have to be with the camera in the hand all day long

You'd figure the transfer rate would be noticable as I have a nice 3D high rated TV and these cables are used on my PS3 and Xbox360. However, I haven't noticed any difference in the play back ability of a bluray movie or anything. Infact, I still see some motion blur when I play a film. Guess this didn't really do the trick.
overally poor quality, especially the cable is bigger than original and hardly fits to cased iphone, it stopped working on second use..good deal anyway
Eh, it works but I didnt keep this tablet for long and the keyboard has a cable.
This is an ok smartwatch. It does its job, but does not wow me. There was an update that improved some but it was not enough. I do like the you can switch the watch bands out.
The Sony headphones aren't anything spectacular, they're just alright.  I notice some crackling when I hook them up to any device, but they're sturdy and compact.  I just put them in my purse and go.
These batteries did not work as well as the PROCELL  siza AA, & AAA. I was compensated for the trouble. Service was good, batteries not as good.  Thanks  Chuck
As usual all cords only last so long then its time to buy a new one. At these prices it makes it less expensive.

The light itself is excellent, especially when the batteries are new.  I don't use cheap batteries in this light but it doesn't seem to stay bright long.  I've tried rechargable batteries and the newer lithium batteries and still none of them keep the light bright for any significant amount of time.
This works really well as a basic case, but when you try to prop it up for easel mode, the ipad doesn't stay in securely and there is a lot of sliding, falling and frustration.
Is anyone else experiencing any audio drop off when playing Netflix or Blu-ray discs while using 2 hdmi cables for the 3D setup?

This camera came in fairly quick, considering that traveled from China, but upon arrival its video keeps on rolling and rolling, non stop. Can`'t record nor watch it like that, wonder if it's setup for PAL instead of NTSC?, and if so, how would you correct it?

The keyboard works fine, but requires an adapter to use on Nexus 7. The case and keyboard are a little too thick for the thin Nexus 7 especially since I have used it mainly as a carrying case. The included touch pen does not work on Nexus 7.

This tablet is a lot more complicated than expected and requires a lot of software and training. This is not what we expected. My son just wanted something that he could use for his drawing and it is very difficult to use.  Also, it should come with some kind of protective cover.  Not impressed.

Yes the antenna works.  Does both CB and the weather bands just as advertised.  It is not too well made since the grommet at the base of the antenna came loose the first time that it was used.  Some Gorilla Glue restored it back to service.

I use it to power a 12 volt marine stereo in my outdoor kitchen.  Had a lower AMP model, two in fact by Pyramid that both burned out within a few months this one seems to work better but still s***s off after a few hours of use when it gets too hot and the cheap stereo does not draw much power

This unit take a while to load BluRay disks.  Once they are loaded they will work fine, but its the initial wait that may annoy you a lot.  There are other units at lower prices that load disks way faster.
Not real sure but tried downloading drivers and everything but never really got this working. not sure if its the product or a conflict with something I have on my system.

I purchase the Klipsch reference series speakers and the hole pattern on the speakers are a 3" center to center.  The brackets that come with these are for about a 2 1/2" hole pattern.  Seem to be of good quality.  the drop protection is very easily detachable. I built a couple of brackets to mount to speakers and seems to be working out fine.
This is an OK card. It has lots of memory, but I would recommend an external harddrive instead if you do not plan on storing something large to carry around with you, because it is very easy to lose.

First of all, the rail is substantial, no lack of materials here. With that said, it just seems as if the individual parts were manufactured to loose tolerances which makes for a little slop when it's loose and a little bit of grab when it's snug. Overall the unit does perform well enough to do the job though.

I know Sony does not care about app development and user feedback.  But you cannot have a camera that does not have a "delete" function built into the software.  Please fix, really like the QX10 camera but hate the app.  Delete should be a basic feature, you have to copy the photos you want and then format the card.

Seems like a nice quality cable.  Spent more for this one to use my Ipad with my Sony MHC mini stereo system with Ipod dock.  Works fine, but does not indicate a charge. However, I have since learned that this does charge the ipad - it just does not show that it is charging! Works great.
Material looks like cheap leather look alike.  It functions just fine but not what I expected.  Was hoping for real leather.

it works just not sure how long it will last. bose charges a premium for everything so the quality shouldnt just be in the sound but in the build as well. not sure if i can recommend this since there are other headphones that are cheaper but offer similar sound and much better build quality i.e. v moda and sennheiser.

Very nice case but doesn't show the apple logo and the little strap is a little hard to put it around the case or open the case when the strap is around.  I think it should be design a little different, I like targus cases but this failed in some aspects.
if all you're after is capacity, this card is great and it is cheap, too.  if you need any speed, this card was 1/2 the speed of another card I have.

I'm not totally certain that the HD Connect device gives you HD since there is no provision for HDMI cables, only component. Since the picture over the internet isn't perfect anyway I don't see where this device is all that necessary or really useful. Just another fifty bucks.

I don't know why I bought this - I don't have a desktop.  I wanted a separate trackpad to keep the one attached to my keyboard safer from any dirt and allow me to be further away.  I don't really understand how to click on it unless I turn on tap-clicking, though.  It was kind of an unnecessary purchase for the price, and scrolling doesn't work all that well, but overall it works as advertised.
But battery go fast. I used for computer keyboard. Because my wife complain for room light made her can't sleep. So I bought one put up on the keyboard so I can type at the dark.
It does get the remote out of your hand, which is nice.  Trying to use the remote as a pointer is a lot more challenging but may improve with practice.
The card retention bends easily allowing slippage.
It protects the screen. That is what it was purchased for and that is what it does. That is all.

This case doesn't provide adequate protection for your phone from drops; it just makes it easier to throw your phone on the table without worrying about scratches.  I love how light it is, but have transitioned to a more protective case for everyday use.

I got this after got tired of the cable company. the antena get some channels but is has been hard to find a place where to put the antena. it take alot room and is not so easy to turn around when looking for the best reception.

I really like this keybard but the thing eats up batteries fast. Not only that but the keyboard/trackball is so sensitive that even the slightest movenent causes my Windows 7 Median PC to wake from sleep mode. The manufacturer should have included an on/off switch. This would have solved the two issues above.
This model is definitely bare bones.  It may be OK for the beginner, but it does not accept topo maps.  We returned this unit and later bought a eTrex 20 bundle from another vender..
Not the best but Roxio the usual handy Easy CD & DVD runner!Are the Basic Sotware most computer users need in most!It's Roxio.. the oldest good software company!

Got these for the wife.  She is not very tall so the length of the cord is too long.  She finds them a little hard to adjust and they don't stay in place real well for her. Otherwise she is happy.  They sound good.

T fan started making noise when it starts, I have to turn off and on a couple of times before the noise stops.This started after a cople of months. I think the fan should be stronger. I think I would look for another one.
It is not as good as I thought. The battery does not last that much...

I had no problems at all with it until it croaked last night. I bought it 1/2013 and it died 4/2014. I was running it constantly taped to my window so I could watch the wildlife in my yard, so maybe that's a reasonable life for a constantly used webcam, I don't know.

I have bought this product to use with my Zune player.  It is not bad but not great.  I tried couple of other products before and sent them back.  This I will keep as it works better than the rest.  You will occasionally get static but it is not bad.  I live in the Chicago burbs... may be that is a problem as there are many radio stations around.
Good, though not specially sharo. I use as  my walkaround lens but not when I need  pictures to be sharp and clear. Practical at the least but not bad. Normal,not and awe inspiring lens.

I havnt used this Warranty program yet,and hope I dont have to. Not because its a bad product only because that means my Galaxy Player had an unfortunate accident. If I have the need to use the Insurance I will rate it again and give a better and honest opinion
it's basic ear buds gifted to a teenage niece of ours for christmas. she said that the microphone was clear and easy to use.
I have to say that I was warned about this item falling off flash. I have both Olympus and Nikon. It worked for both. I dant complain with a lil adjustment.

I got this to replace my old Toshiba laptop battery.In beginning it worked great. It held charge for about 3 hours while using. Then with time it start loosing charge. So compare to OEM product is way cheaper but it will eventually die.Not bad for the money.
Bought this to use on a test stand and works fine for what I need but it definitely let you know it is on. It is very loud.
Based on reviews, I expected them to sound a lot better. They're better than stock at least. They're also a little too big for ford escort doors.
it works

The only best thing about this DSLR was that it was the first to have live view amongst amateur dslrs and also came with a swivel LCD which is much more useful than many think. However in face of recent competition, lack of image stabilisation, inability to flip LCD, absence of movie mode are big missing features.

It mounts on the inner threads of the front of the lens instead of the exterior ring, it doesn't let you put a lens cap. The hood also comes with some grippy ring which I frankly have no idea what it's for. I have to remove that ring if I want to mount the hood on the lens.

Like other reviewers have mentioned, the lack of image stabilization on this camera was a deal breaker for me. Picture quality was decent enough. But the shakiness in the recorded material was annoying and distracting.
This gadget can be used to store a set of earbuds for the iPhone or iPod, but it's rather clumsy and awkward to use.

5 stars for comfort. These actually fit my ears1 star for sound.  It sounds like a tin box. :(However, if your ear lobes are shaped funny (like mine), then these are a reasonable alternative to earbuds.....
it was a very easy install. but it did not meet my need for high performance over clocking needs. a

Worked for me for a few years, but seemed to have degraded over time.  One of the cables is a bit burned, which might be caused by other factors (?), but now only outputs 720p.  The other cable is in good condition still but only outputs 1080i instead of 1080p.I recently replaced these with HDMI cables that costed around $10 - hopefully spending a little more will make them last this time around...
It works as specified.  But only one socket works fine and the other side doesn't work.  I only use it like an extension now
Reception is VERY dependent on antenna placement. I was hoping to hide antenna behind tv, but ended up hanging it below the tv to get a signal. Old rabbit ears worked just as well.

This like other VCR rewinders I have ordered has fallen a little bit short. I have an old one also and it works better than this one. The problem is staying closed while it rewinds, none of my older ones have ever done that.

Works great most of the time, but occasionally gets an intermittent and or lost signal.My friend bought a box antenna from the dollar store for like 10 bucks and it works just as good if not better than my antenna.
working on computer rebuild, the vga cable looks very sturdy and should serve my purposes, with the two monitor connections.

and this is no exception.  works as expected. integrated clip a plus, but lack of waterproofing and consequential susceptibility to sweat damage (which apple considers water damage and will not warranty) is a huge minus.  but i'm sort of committed to the itunes road so i keep getting these little machines as my sweat damages them.  sigh.

The issue with this shield, like most of its kind, is the fact that peeling at the edges is almost unavoidable regardless of how closely you align it. It is extremely durable, though, albeit the specularity is a little much.

I got mine gone dead after the thunder or lighting strike. I contacted the customer service and they will not FIX it or replace the unit because they consider it as accident or misuse. BUY A POWER STRIP FOR THIS UNIT BEFORE YOU BUY THIS UNIT!!! I WASTED MY MONEY ON THIS WARRANTY CRAP THEY PUT UP.
It is a little flimsy but works for household storage. Would not use it if I was on the go or in the car with kids.
The blower is good.the brush pen is of low quality. The bristles comes off even in the first use.

We bought this because flat panel speakers are atrocious in general. This speaker set from Bose is certainly better than TV speakers but all in all underwhelming. In comparison the speakers on our old 27" Panasonic CRT TV are actually better than this Bose set. OK, but if we had to do it again we'd probably try to fit a sound bar.
good little bubble, fits camera well.. i don't use it.. with the programming, i can make my pics straight.. if that shot comes up, you don't have time to look, and make sure every thing is level..

This is good for general link up TV cable. Don't expect too much of it. As it is real cheap cable that you can buy. If you looking for a Quality cable. I'm sure this is not your choice. Now, I switch it to use for FM antenna.

This is the first USB floppy drive I've purchased, so I don't know how others may compare.  It has worked just fine, but is much slower than any internal floppy drive I've ever owned.Not a huge problem - everyone is moving towards USB flash media anyhow.  I guess I can say it was an OK purchase for the inexpensive price.

For it's length, it works okay but there is not enough shielding for it to carry Full HD (1080p at 60Hz) signals with Audio, it causes interference and ruins the picture/audio.I see it works best at 1080p at 24Hz with Audio or lower resolution, anything higher and you will need to upgrade to a fatter cable with better shielding.

I bought this for the convenience of having a ziplink cable, but the sound quality is noticeably bad.  I'm no audiophile, so normally I can't tell the difference between most headphones and earphones, but these sound really bad.Only get if you absolutely need the convenience of having a ziplink cable.

I will be using these jacks with the punchdown tool that I purchased.  Biggest part of the job will be threading the wire through the old house.  I hope that when I start connecting the wire that the tool will make connecting the jack  a lot easier.
great for the money i wouldn't use as your key light but hair or fill is deff a possibility its slave is nice and sensitive! nice little strobe AWESOME Price
Worked just fine but someone stepped on it and it easily broke.  I may get another one though.  It is very inexpense.

The speakers sound better than my flat screen TV. The sound quality could be better. Its missing that good sound you would get from a good sub woofer. I think there alright because of the look and all the things you could do with them. It probably could hook up to anything. You could even take them places with you. All you need is batteries. It just was not what I was looking for but you might like them.

These earbuds sit just at the entrance of the ear and produce a decent, but not noise-blocking sound. Unfortunately, the sound died on the right side after only about a year of use, but I suppose – given the inexpensive cost – I shouldn't have been surprised.

It works, but really Amazon, start including it in the box and charge the extra $20. I mean how stupid to sell a product that uses a charger with a different charge rate than the older Kindles yet you don't include the charging block. Almost to the point of ridiculous when it comes to their marketing department. Seems as if somebody at some point realized, oops the box isn't big enough to include the wall adapter.
Great quality, but adds some weight to your tablet and is a bit over priced compared to other options available online.  I returned mine and went with a leather folio over this hard plastic.
Before this arrived I used a paper clip in an ordinary extension cord. This has allowed no additional channels to be received. It does work so 3 stars seems fair.

This is a good camera for outside shots.  It's a great looking small and very solid package.  However, indoor flash photos have been a consistent disappointment.  A "bloom" of haze consistently appears on the right side of the image... Eventhough there is nothing blocking the flash or the lens.
I do not know why they send a remote for a unit with out power adapter and do not tell you what one will work otherwise it works fine
Provides good protection but is very reflective.

First off, this works very well.  We use it for an old iBook without an airport card, and with a PS2.  I have a Linksys router and figured this would be an easy setup.  Not quite, 4 hours later it was finally working, and I honestly don't know what I did to finally make it work.  Haven't had any problems with it since then.

The price for this remote is very inexpensive, and does work with the Nikon D80 as advertised; but the range is very low, about 4 feet.  To use this for wildlife photos it is pretty useless.  OK for close self-portraits.
I purchased these for my wife and they were to heavy for her to hold very long, they have good optics but wife unhappy with them.

These speakers sound great for mids & highs, but completely lack any bass extension. Anything resembling mid-bass was also flabby sounding. The build quality is good on the speaker though. If you're using them on your desk, you'll need the DS2 desktop speaker stands.Also don't get the N22 amp, get the NAD D 3020 instead. the N22 amp is underpowered for these speakers. I have both.Good:Great mids and highswell builtwell packagedBad:These things yearn for a subwoofermuddy mid-bass

Used it for about two years where it didn't have any issue. But it suddenly stopped working during my weeklong travel. Could be due to lighting shock during a thunder storm. Still it quite worths the money.
I was not disappointed by the build quality. It's nicely constructed. I must admit this was part of an alternative approach to inexpensive sound. It was not a bad product. The price was right!

Initially when I installed it the monitors stayed in position, then my cat bumped one and it would not hold swivel position.  I had to really tighten and play with it to get it to stay put.  I think next time I would spend a little more on a better unit.

I ordered two of these because my car's iphone cable doesn't fit my phone's case. After some use the female side got loose and now the first one no longer works. Good price and they work but these won't last with constant plugging and unplugging.
A good cover! I like that it is easy to clean off, a great smart cover for a kids iPad!
I had to buy other stuff for this to work on my coby. Love the color that is the only thing I realy can say good .
If you NEED something like this I suppose its an ok product for the money.Its cheaper and flimsy.Probably better off getting a regular sata hook up that has a connector for mSata.
it felt rather light like nothing was inside it personally i like my mouse heavy so i can have better aim in fps or tpf but good for the price

Paired right up to an iPad and is working just fine...  Wouldn't want it for higher price, but no complaints for this price on this date.I'll just say that I expect to get my money's worth out of it as long as I don't drop it...  don't think it would survive a drop well.But, don't  know if any of them would.

like any thing else I purchase, I seem to have a problem with reading all the fine print.And this is no exception, I purchased this adapter to stream movies to my tv from my computer.well, my lg tv is not compatible with this adapter...make sure you read all the info on these things...
Nothing spectacular with this product.  iPad doesn't stay in place well as you are typing so kind of a pain.I returned it.
I purchased the item to connect cable essentials to my television. It is durable and lightweight for anyone to handle.

I've used this backpack for many years now. It was at the time the only backpack that fit my dell xps 17 brick of a laptop comfortably. Initially I would have given it 5 stars, But the pocket linings on the inside have ripped over the years, and one of the zippers has broken.

When It arrived I was excited to get it going. I tried plugging it in my monitor when I discovered it did not want to go in. I looked at and and found it had an extra 4 pins surrounding the tooth pin. I had to do some research and found out there is three basic types of DVI: DVI-A, DVI-D, and DVI-I.This adaptor is a DVI-I adaptor. What I need for my Computer monitor is DVI-D.

I bought this thinking it would be very handy.  Turns out I use the tablet without the keyboard mostly.  I bought the tablet for something that was handy and very portable.  The keyboard kind of takes away from that.  The docking keyboard works well and I've had no problems.
The IO card was easy to install. Start to finish in ten minutes. It works with printers, GPS, wireless hardware and card readers.

It sounds ok for the size was hoping for more bass. Going to keep because of the size and it takes batteries. If you want better sound by the sangean wr-2 it has great sound for just a little more money than th Gozo.
Everything was great accept for the screen protector is a pure waste of time, poor quality screen, protector. Everything else works as intended!

In my case I have a Fuji Xp70 so the lens is in the top left corner. I am about 1/4-1/2 inch short on adjust ability to get it centered over the eye piece. Will update later if successful on how well it works and give it more stars if it warrants it.
These worked fine.  We used them while on vacation and we were able to communicate well over the ~3 mile gap of our largest separation
This case looks great and works great, but we were not happy about how quickly it started to fall apart after just 1 year of use. It is not very durable.
It is a great pad to have but there are some downsides to it.  The battery is constantly being drained and you cannot update the android software.
Nothing extraordinary, just about a neoprene sleeve to protect a little more accurate as you would with a towel. Meets expected. What more could I say?

the reason I bought this card is I like the Dolby home theater 4  application, which gives me much more option to adjust tonality and equalize to my preference. With that said I feel the card is overpriced for what you receive it seems that my sound quality actually went down from what I received from my motherboard the Asus rampage extreme.
Its a good product as long as you have the compatible router.My router (Arris) isn't compatable to the Chromcast.Make sure you check your router first for compatibilty.
Great router for $25 refurbished and an improvement over my old Cisco router but still no great shakes at throughput.
Good camera.  Decent software.I don't like the clip that attaches it to our notebook.It seems to me that the clip is a nessisary and fundemental part.  I suspect there are better products available.

Did copious research before I bought this one and was excited when it arrived. Good size and seemed solid.HOWEVER, within the first month the first port started to go out without reason (which seems to be the flawin ALL these products no matter who makes them) it has been servicable since then, but basically one portcan't be relied on to work, which stinks.Proceed with caution.
This wont charge my iPad or run an external drive. Pretty much just for wireless mouse/keyboard or low current draw stuff. It does look nice though.

Compared to similar priced Polk subwoofer this falls short.  OK for music but marginal for movies.  Not much output and few connection and operation options.  Best I can say is small, cheap and better than no sub.
This product wasn't compatible with my Cisco IP Phone 7941. The product says to visit the Headset Buddy website for a list of compatible office phones so I'd check that out before purchasing.
Not really recommended since it does a poor job of hugging onto the iPad.  It's good in a pinch, but will not be my primary case.
Considering a real fisheye lens costs as much as my DSLR this is a mildly amusing toy. The area of focus is 30% of the image, the outer area is 3 martini blurry. But, what do you want for $50??

This case is adequate for the new Kindle Fire 8.9 HDX. The case is much too heavy, probably because of the many magnets, flimsy to fold and awkward to use. It hardly matches the outstanding quality of the new HDX and is certainly not worth the price charged.

While the bag is very durable, and has lots of useful compartments, I'm looking at replacing it. The chest strap is the major disadvantage for me. It is placed to be very uncomfortable for women. A waist strap would have been much preferable. With all the places the chest strap could be fastened, I'm surprised they didn't make the placement adjustable. It's not possible, as the plastic fasteners holding the chest straps to the shoulder straps are solid pieces.

I had to return this because it did not fit my vehicle. I did not read carefully when looking at the car models listed that it works on and sure enough the connector for the stereo was the wrong size. My fault not theirs.
This is a good product except that the straps that hold the tablet are a bit flimsy.  Weak elastic in the corners.
Finally got it set up and working, but will not get my NETFLIX tv is about 20 feet from router, tv #2 in basement familey room also router would not get NETFLIX, very dissapointed in this product,

This is an inexpensive, fully usable pair for youth, too. But even without abusing it the eye piece feel apart after about 6 months. unfortunately it wasn't easily fixable. Hoping the replacement lasts longer.

I like this flash drive -- it has a nice weight to it -- it feels much more solid than normal flash drives.  "That sounds good...  Why did you put 3 stars?"  Well...  the security thing only works on machines you've installed the program on...  If you take the drive to another computer, you can access whatever you want!!!!  That is not secure!!
fun to play with and to experiment with.It only draws 350 ma. but it dose get very warm.only tested on standard radio stations as of yet.buy it to experiment with

The camera is ok. I have not taken any great WOW inspiring pictures. Have not used it as much as I would like to in order to figure out all the little tricks. Was supposed to be point and shoot, so far not seeing that. It took forever to get the camera. That was biggest disappointment. Will use camera more in coming days to get a true feel of how it works.

As some others have said, you get what you pay for. Assembly was difficult to figure out from written instructions and the lousy small diagrams. You are better off just figuring it out for yourself.They give you a lot of parts, but still had to go to the hardware store because Sony has depth restrictions.But it worked.
I ordered 4 of these its ok not what I expected but they do their job.. installation was easy and quick butNot loud enough for me

Great mod/smart Power Supply Cable Sleeving Kit- UV Blue  kit, but for noobs it would be good if it came with a brief instruction manual. Wad a little more difficult than I thought to get it over cables that already have connectors attached. Better for new builds with open wires with no connectors on one end. I didn't use 5/6th of the kit.
Expensive, but necessary replacement for the original. The Garmin 765T it enables is a great product. More features than current models.

Sorry to say but this so-called NEWER model of ear-buds don't compare at all with the earlier model Philips SHE5920. The full rich surround sound is not there with this current model. They are basically OK sounding. I gave them a 3 star; because... I was able to use some of the extra ear bud covers on my original model Philips SHE5920 ones.
Doesn't come with camera mounting screw.  Also hard to tighten down.  But it works and it's functional; in the end.

I had a Apple track pad but it was knocked off the desk and broke so i thought I would try a rechargeable one instead.It is not quite as responsive as the Apple and it runs of of charge pretty quickly if you forget to turn it off every time you stop using it.I am giving this to a friend who likes it and am going back to the Apple track pad.

The left clicker breaks within a couple of months. I got another replacement and it also broke on me. The placement of the back and forward button is awkward. Sensitivity isn't that great. However, the battery life is excellent and this mouse is very portable.
Rated as OK because of it rather large size. I wnt with bigger for my downstairs entertainment area, but even for there it's hard to hide and more then I need
They look really great but for the price I expected a MUCH better quality. They perform at a level equal to much cheaper and plain designed units. You ARE paying for the looks on this one...
My Radio Shack signal booster worked fine at nearly half the cost.  It has two outputs and a dial to control the amount of boost.  Save some dough.

These are fine when new, but tend to give out at the place where the tip goes into the plastic. After a while the connection gets dicey, then can give out altogether. I keep getting them because there's no alternative that I've found and they're not all that expensive. It's just a bit disappointing that they don't last.
This is a very good mouse. Its design reduces a great deal of stress on the joints and wrist. The only issue that I do have is that this mouse is not FULLY compatible with MAC computers.

This came with zero instructions, and it's easy to put the card in the wrong way.  It's also difficult to take the card out.  If you look at the product picture, you'll see a stamped triangle.  That hard to see thing should match the little white triangle on the card.  Insert until it can't go further.Once in, you may need to use a pin or ball point pen to push it out.
Fit well but NC gives me a headache after a while.ComfortableGood tonal quality.Noise canceling hurts my eardrums after 30mins

This battery is working fine in my Motorola 2-way radio.  However, I had trouble fitting it into the battery compartment as it seems to be slightly thicker than the battery the radio came with.  I cannot close the back of the radio fully.  So I put a bit of duct tape to hold the back cover on tightly.
You can read my review of the Corsair 1500 on that product page, but seriously, spend the extra $30, Corsair's 1500 is the best headset literally ever made at that price point.
Price is ok, poor finish. The velchro is not  stiched straight, . Will fit 17.3 inch laptops. For the price it  is OK

I got this as a secondary case. For those times when I do not want to use my good case that has a keyboard. It will do when I still want protection for when I do not require the keyboard, and do not want to damage that case, but not the best looking product I have seen. Would not buy this for constant protection.
it's nice and black long and also sleek. prefect for the price. You know beggars can't be choosers. It also fits the loop perfectly.
Would not work with my new PS4. I bought the longer cable just for this use. Haven't tried it on anything else yet.
This isn't the same quality as the one's that come with the laptop, Not a grounded plug, a little flimzy and when it over heats it shuts off my laptop (like instantly).

This budget tablet has a great interface and it's good for reading magazines, playing casual games and listening to music. However, if you're trying to watch video using anything other than YouTube, it's not going to deliver a satisfying experience. If you're looking for a high-performance tablet, buy a Kindle Fire HDX. If you're trying to save some money and looking for something similar in size to the iPad mini, this is a reasonable option.

So the item works as intended, but I only gave it three stars because it came in kind of beat up.  It looked like a possible refurbished item.  Some of the plastic areas looked partially melted, but it worked well and I didn't want to give up a power cord for a few days to send it back.
This product does exactly what it needs to. But it is pretty short. You get what you pay for.. as always.
Fragile construction for intensive work, but you funcionality is good. Best materials, for example, in on/off button, is a important thing.

I've ordered these many times before, not because they keep breaking under normal use, but because I tend to do  a lot of exercising, weights, running, biking, and hiking so these have held up the best (they also stay in your ears really well). A pair lasts me about 8 months. These have gotten a little pricier over the past year, but they're still worth the price.
The features are good and bad in ways. Music is easy to be download to the device. Like the sound is to low.

I do not think you get close to 9db gain... more like 1. The antenna is a lot longer than I expected, however the gain for having the larger antenna really did no more than the OEM antenna. Somewhat disappointed.

Perhaps for other people this would be a great purchase. However, In my case, I have small ears. The cartilage on the top of my ears are very close to my head. It takes quite a while to fit them properly. But they do seem to stay in place. The sound seems decent, I'll have to keep wearing them to see how long they last.
After going through about 3 different straps, I find this one to be the most handy and sturdy for the tasks I have it used for.

I bought this for a portable TV/DVD purchased from Amazaon and it did not fit.The bag was too small for the unit, so it was a waste for me.  The quality of the bag is good just make sure the size will work for your product.

Looks like it would work on a bigger flash attachment. Way too big for my Nikon SB400 flash. Attachment opening too big, and it blocks the lens on my Nikon P7000. Looks to be made to an OK standard, certainly cheap enough, I'll keep it for a bigger flash, if I get one.
This is a good product, it can charge 4 devices at the same time, however, i would love it more if can charge Ipad, unfortunately, it doesn't

After  three years almost to the day, little white dots started showing up randomly and got progressively worse. Googled a bit and found out this model was shipped with a defective DMD chip.I called Optoma in California and their customer service was completely awesome and they had extended the warranty on the chips.I sent my projector in and two weeks later it was back on my ceiling playing Martha Stewart re-runs and Albanian torture porn.Optoma customer Service!!!!
Nice concept, but the price is high and the quality is somewhat cheap.  Works OK. Bought other Belkin products in the past, which were of much better quality.

I was expecting something a little bigger, especially for the price. The sound is OK for such a small system. If compact size and very low operating power(3W-5W)and standby power (3W) are what you want, then this system has decent sound. However, I think you can probably get something equivelant for half the price.

Recently we had a few power supplies fail on some switches around our university, We used these adapters to replace the broken ones. Everything works flawlessly now, but when handling the power adapters you can feel a give in the plastic. Not saying most people would be squeezing these or anything, but if you were to accidentally drop one at anytime, I fell like it would probably shatter. But at only a couple of bucks, does it matter?

Ordered the glossy version received the Matte+tempered glass version. - 2 stars.Overclocked to 120Hz no problem at all, had to adjust the color profile due to gamma shift on the overclock.If I wanted a matte monitor this would be 5 stars, unfortunately I wanted and paid for a Glossy monitor.Fortunately for the seller, I am too lazy to return it, so I will just keep it.
It works, it was cheaper than going to walmart or the PX. If you can wait a little while for it to be shipped to you then you can't go wrong...
Great DVR, faster than the previous models. Only thing i don't like in this unit is the A/V port which does not give high quality when you connect slingbox to it.
Back when i cared about iphones, this did the job for me.I would recommend this to somebody also.6 out of 10
Quality it OK. Netflix runs directly from my Vizion smart tv gives better quality. I think other than dish world nothing is new here. Does not have power off button. voltage input 110V only.

Replacement battery from some random Chinese vendor. Got my laptop working again but it quickly lost its charge and after a couple years it is now back to being a useless brick. Laptop can't even power on from the battery, have to remove it to use the power cable to turn the laptop on.
This lens cap work just fine, but its thickness is a bit much.However it is inexpensive but works fine so I can not complain much.

this product really doesn't fit either product it was ordered for...too small by a tiny bit for an easy fit for the tablet and it is too big, but usable (if the user is really careful) for an e-reader.

I bought this for my Fujifilm X100S. It fits perfectly. Appears to be of very good quality. I have used this protector before on my Nikon D7000 and really liked it.However, this version has a new silver, reflective border around the screen. You can see it clearly on one of the customer loaded pictures. This shiny boarder makes this protector screen look cheap on my X100S.Took it off my camera and threw it into the trash bin.

Owned for three weeks and decided there wasn't enough bass (no seal problems here).  Even classical sounded lacking without decent bass.Also lacked ambience - transients - the sound of notes decaying and richocheting around your ear drums.  I got used to this, though, and didn't mind it.The bass I minded - even if just for classical, but there is also rock where bass is even more important!Decision made.
Overall its an okay device, but for me, with astigmatism, if it had a dioptric adjustment, it would be better. For now, it would only work for someone with perfect vision, unlike me.

The player is fine and works well however the menu interface is not intuitive and is hard to navigate.  Bought for the high end feature however since the remote driving menu is so hard to use this device never gets used. Would not recommend to a friend.
