May be best for a more permanent install.does not coil well and can kink

I bought this for making YouTube videos, While I did not expect the quality to be high end, I was not as much disappointed in the stands, but rather the amount of light it produces. It did improve my lighting, but there is more to be desired. After purchasing and using this, I would recommend to get a set that has multiple bulbs, oppose to the single bulb setup that these have.

Got this for a friend who's wifi switch on his laptop broke in the off position.  He uses win 8 and Linux. He reports that in Win 8, he constantly has to pull the card in and out, other os will lag and freeze up. (Probably a driver issue)He also mentioned that is a Broadcom chipset...which is apparently difficult to get to work in linux and theor no updated drivers for either Linux or windows.

I've loved the speed of the SD Extreme II, so was happy to snatch up the Extreme III for a good price.Unfortunately, even after formatting, this card is slower than my Extreme II during picture capture, making multiple shots noticeably more difficult.The time from power-on to first click is slightly slower also.So, I'll use this in my iPaq, and keep using the old Extreme II for photo work.

At first it did not pull-in any channel. I realized I had not followed the instructions correctly. The USB powered amplifier must be close to the TV end, not the antenna end. Anyway, even after doing that, its performance is not very different from my old rabbit year. I am having fewer drop-outs, but definitely not a spectacular difference. BTW, I live near Houston, not very far away from the city..

Bought this for around $250.  It is good for surfing the web and not many great apps.  Won't play AVI files unless you purchase an app.  If you buy the app it plays fine.  Waiting on a stable Android release for this.
Does not fit the iPad mini very well. Good that it is adjustable, but not worth the expense.
I returned this since I had ordered it by mistake - meant to get CD/DVD writer.  It looked very nice, just was not what I was intending to order.  My mistake - had my head under my wing.

Normally, a flash drive simple works, and there isn't much to say about it. The problem with this drive is the cover over the plug end. The cover doesn't lock into place, but rotates freely around the connector. As a 'permanently' attached device its fine, but if you plan on using the drive for transporting files, get a different drive where the cover locks in place.
Many gaming mousepads come with a travel case, this one doesn't.  The mousepad is nice though.

Sound is good but not great comfort is not very good. Volume button is defective on 2 units Klipsch isn't very good on customer service. These need Comply foam tips to make them comfy and sound amazing see my video review here: [...]
none of them fit my dell laptop, i don't know why, my dell laptop says it's a 20V, but it didn't fit

but not that good.the video one stop working after few months, but the sound ones still going strong.no hissing that I can notice.Since they were cheap, I just separated the cables, threw the video to the garbage and replace it.

Cable is functional and very inexpensive, but it is not snagless as pictured.  As noted in the reviews these are hand-crimped connectors and not as nice as the snagless factory-terminated variety.  That said, while I have only used one of the two I purchased and have not had any signal quality issues with it.Bottom line:  This is a very basic cable at a very low price -- just make sure this is what you want when you order.
I bought a handful of these and replace a couple times a year. They scratch easily and don't always stay together over time
Is has only 21mm lense size, make it somewhat dark to watch details from far away of concert hall. It's really small when folded (about 3in * 4in size) which makes easy carry.
The cable is good for short range network assembly. Definitely better that a Cat 5 or 5e. I used it between my Modem and router.

I ordered two of these through Amazon and used the first one right away and it was good. Unfortunely I didn't try the second one before it was two late to return to Amazon. Having to wait for warrantry return service right now with SanDisk.  Its been going on two weeks since I returned the chip on RMA but have hear nothing yet.  Good news is these chips are warrantied for 5 years.

The fit was so tight it wouldn't close and it was very difficult to open when I finally got it latched.  Perhaps it would have stretched out over time, but I opted to return it and get the Moko 360 rotational case instead, as I like the idea of a vertical stand as well.http://www.amazon.com/MoKo-Degrees-Rotating-Vertical-Horizontal/dp/B0083OYVS2/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid;=1358906680&sr;=8-1&keywords;=moko+360+degrees+rotating+stand+case+for+samsung+galaxy+tab+2+7.0The quality of the Elsse seemed fine as does the Moko.  Right off the bat, I liked the Moko better.

This does connect to the iPAD 2 to my televisions, but the cable does not charge the ipad via the usb on any of my televisions (1 Sony, 2 vizio, 1 westinghouse). So I feel confident there is something not working correctly with my cable or the ipad 2 is not being fooled.  Otherwise, it does exactly what I want.
Good for AM & FM but I could not catch any SW or LW stations. Otherwise, it is a nice little device.

I had a leather Nikon case for my old Canon camera. They fit well and it is so easy to get the camera out of the case for quick shooting and to put the camera back. But this case does not do that at all. It takes a long time to get the camera out and put the camera back in. But it does prevent the camera from getting scratches.

I had high hopes for this screen protector.  It came in great packaging and fits perfectly, but I am disappointed in how smeary and glare-y the protector is.  So far it functions well.  May upgrade to a better protector that doesn't glare or show fingerprints soon.

I guess you get what you pay for.  Thirty years ago Vivitar offered a quality product.  Seems like their quest for a low price point forced them to sacrifice quality.  The lousy threading on the filters Is either a result of poor workmanship or low grade metal.  Two of my filters are now essentially useless after only a few uses.  I am concerned they will damage my expensive lens if I continue to use them now.
Not what I was looking for. This docking station was for an older model Lap top. I thought it was a USB Docking Station. My bad, should have paid more attention.

not the quality I was looking for. nice color, but poor and somewhat pliable, making me question whether or not my Kindle is say. It does hold it well, clipping in perfectly, but there are much better cases available.
One of the USB ports do not work,do not worth to sent it back,It's OK,with time will take it apart and explore why is not working.

I had a WD My Book before my purchase.  I had more problems getting the proprietary and/or Windows backup software to work consistently that I gave up using many swear words late into the night.  I don't have a good reason why I rewarded WD with another purchase, but the WD My Passport works a star better than the WD My Book.  I would not recommend for purchase.
The battery does the job and I bought 2 of them for back ups. They don't last as long as the original but do help when you need it to finish up the day. What do you expect from the price!

i bought this thinking it would be great for xbox and pc gaming but when i got it the lack of 1080p really ruined it for me. if your into gaming at 1080p this monitor isnt for you, even with that said it is a great looking monitor its just really annoying because the xbox does not have an aspect ration for this so every time you'll get a notification telling you to switch it to 16:9
Has no RCA style input jacks, to match the Audio jacks of many top end TV's.. Returned unit.
Need to install in dust-free area, works great if you can get the bubbles out. Have plenty of caned air on hand, I didn't.

JayBird has good quality of sound, very light weight, and good looking. However, the problem is that JayBird does not stay i the ears well when exercise and eat something. I do not think that is a worthy of investment.
I have a drawer full of mouses but wanted a white one to go with my wife's laptop. I ordered this because it said it was white, but that's a lie. In fact it's gray.

I thought this charger that is not included with my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 would make it a quick solution to charge my kindle. I plugged it in & waited about 4 hours for the charge. This is fast? my b&w kindle charges in about 20 minutes. Perhaps it's because of the color & web but I really didn't think it would take that long to charge.

I ordered two of these flash drives, and after about one week, one of the flash drives died on me.  However, the other one works good, and this is the first issue I have ever had with SanDisk products.  Disappointed with them, but still optimistic.
Very fragile and the lights on this were much brighter than I thought they would be and that made me not use this product.
LG is a good manufacturer, and this system is great, but the LG LFD790 - Home theater system can be had, used at least, for at little as $150, so why not?  Both produce great bass and balanced sound.
This is NOT an Apple product. Although, it is basically the same. The leather Apple cover costs $70. For half price, this is a good deal.

I purchased this for my son, who has a lot of cassette tapes.  It worked pretty well for about a year.  Unfortunately, even though he was careful with it, it has already "died".  Not very much value for the money.
I applied the first of the three screen protectors, for it was a little more difficult than others that I have applied.  But it is perfect size.

I liked the idea of using this on my monopod for a quick release. The only issue I had was with the rubber around the screw. When I would tighten the little plate to my camera, this rubber would start moving and shifting eventually keeping it a little lose to the point I stopped using it because it wouldn't tighten well on my camera. It's a great idea but could've been built better.
It works sort of, but if I had it to do over would opt for something else. Some times the pictures turn out pretty good & other times not so good.

I bought this card hoping to get 5.1 sound through it's optical output.  This feature is hard to find nowadays in a sound card.  Unfortunately the Asus XONAR-DG only outputs 2.0 sound through the optical out.  So this was a disappointment to me, even though the quality of sound is pretty good.

I got what I expected for a refurbished Dell 630; it was slow as sin and took about four hours of cleaning, installing speed up software and removing unwanted programs.What I am not pleased about is every time I log on, I get a notice that the version of Windows installed is not genuine...what's up with that??  It is working, but if this is pirated software, that is pretty lame on the vendors part.

The concept itself is great. The hardware is phenomenal. The software, however, is not so great. The Android app is pretty annoying and the browser interface only gives you the basics. You do have the ability to use your own file manager and have your storage show up as a network drive so long as you're running the Pogoplug Backup Companion (not compatible with Linux).

I never actually used this assortment of wires and connectors but I did study the logistics and determined that the power connector would need to be modified to function with my hardware.  If you are tech savvy and know what solder is, then this is a good value.  If not, it's useless.

The speakers are great for the price, but one of them came blown out. After going through the trouble of installing them I found that it was blown, and there was that busted raspy sound on one of them. I also purchased some for the front side panels of my car, which worked just fine.

Easy to install, good protection, but a long way from clear. It's a Matt finish that distorts the view for my old eyes. I bout two, one for me and one for my mother on law. It's absolutely usable, but I have to keep focusing my eyes and working to see what's on an otherwise beautiful screen. Particularly for looking at details. Took it off and trying another. Rand.
I tried it out once since receiving and it doesn't seem to respond when traffic is coming, I will try and call garmin and make a new accessement in a few days.
Somewhat tinny, but for the money they are the best available headphones.  I think I'm gonna spend the money and try some beats though.

Very concerned with how much it sags when I hang my 52" Samsung. The angle that it sits at also makes the TV almost unwatchable which is disappointing after all of the great reviews. Everything seems sturdy except the actual mechanism for hanging the TV which is baffling.

Received the kit, and when we opened the box- only the two metal supports were in there- no screws of any kind. Re-checked the shipping box- and they were not there either.Normally- I would have returned the package and re-ordered....but my husband was anxious to get our sound bar installed- so he went to the local hardware store to pick up some metric screws.
Nice enough legs, but the "quick-connect" head isn't a great choice for a mini tripod.  I would have preferred a normal thumbscrew.
Not the most comfortable pair I've tried, but the sound is decent.

This seemed like a great idea, especially after I had difficulty removing an F-connector (coax cable) from the back of a cable box.  however, this tool is a little bulky and can be tough to get in tight places.  I'm better off most of the time just using my vise-grips or other pliers.  I guess if you are doing dozens of F-Connectors at once this might save your fingers some cramping.

It works and does what it should but i was expecting it to have better grip. It feels nothing like the shape of the cameras regular grip and the vertical grip is very haigh and you have to get used to the eyepiece being in an awkward position. other than that does what is should. Cheap. Have not tried the timer yet
worked okay but only lasted a month ordered 2 had to return one within 2 weeks and then another one in 30 days after receiving them

At first it seemed just what I wanted, good protection, useful for video. But found it to be so heavy I had to take it off except for sitting at a table watching a movie or putting it in my briefcase for travel. Otherwise while sitting reading or emailing it was a bother. So returned it and bought a soft zippered case and a screen protector. Lighter, easier to use and still good protection.

Nice keyboard layout; and nice feeling mouse...which can be used by either your left or right hand with ease.The weak point is the signal sometimes gets weak...even with fresh batteries and the receiver within 6-12" from the devices. The keyboard is a bit noisy when typing.Otherwise it's a decent product.

Maybe I got one from a bad batch or something, but the top and bottom edges don't wrap the Touchpad, they seem a bit small.The sides are ok. I like the plastic, it's not a dust magnet.Overall it's ok, it will protect somewhat the touchpad.
The pouch is very good but not too convenient when it is installed at the camera R strap. I will keep it but in my bag.
I haven't had the opportunity to try these yet.  I am disappointed that the maximum recording time is purportedly two hours.

Nice little item for the price only there needs to be extra spacing behind the tablet to raise it to the foam support arms. Plus the suction cup doesn't hold for very long till the entire assembly falls over. needs to be glued down or maybe mounted to glass?
The USB cable (part that goes into iPod) snapped off after fifth usage. The car charger takes at least 10 mins to start working.
This is diffenently not a tablet for adults or skilled adults. If you just want something to play a few games on or check your email... well ok. This is a entry level tablet.!

This is a stiff plastic like cover. Put them on with out any problems. Though try to work in a very clean area, once you peel the backing it becomes a dust magnet (but that goes with all covers like these). I had some box tape handy just in case i need to clean some dust. I did like the fact that it came with a bubble squeegee.

I bought 4 of these video cards for a small render farm I recently built.  I wasn't expecting them to be great for the price, but they do the job intended and the speed is about what I expected from an inexpensive video card.  Good if you're on a budget.

I brought this to carry camera and phone. The length of this strap is designed for camera and strap around your neck. I was gonna use it with phone but it was too long. Otherwise, this is a good camera strap. Well built.

This fake camera is okay. We've had some good comments on it but we've also had some "Is that camera fake?" questions so you'd have to judge for yourself. I'd probably look for something that looks a little more authentic in future.

This was very reasonable priced and includes velcro strap.  It does the job nicely. Although this grid is a bit oversized for my flashes (Sb26  and FL600R) - it still straps on securely, especially for stationary lighting on a stand.
For the money you can't go wrong.The voltage, though, is slightly too low for a fast charge but, it will charge your stuff overnight.

The KOMPUTERBAY 2GB (2x1GB) DDR SODIMM (200 pin) 333Mhz DDR333 PC2700 LAPTOP did not work in my computer it would not post. I returned it with NO hassle! they provided a prepaid shipping label & refunded the money FAST! I ended up buying Crucial memory that worked first try. I will always buy Crucial memory from now on. I give 5 stars on the ease of returning this!

This is strictly for two prong fans if you have fans that require more power and are four prong this is not something you will want. If your okay with wires (heat sensors) going all around your system then it's fine but if you have a see through case and four prong fans this is something I would not get, period.  It does not look aesthetically pleasing on the inside which is what I like as well.

The amps seemed to be insufficient to drive my device. This is a bit disconcerting as now I really have no use for it. A shame because I like using other Tp-Link products but I cant recommend this one based on its performance.
I did not use  this item and I decided to return it, because I could see a different make and more capacity.
According to all reviews my wife shouldn't of bought this, although it was a GREAT gesture! Not enough bang for the buck :)

i was looking for protection not perfection and this works but it is a bit of a pain to get on I was glad it came with 3 because I will be changing it later do to the dust that got trapped under it when trying to get it on
When it comes to a filter I guess you get what you pay for its hard to put screw on to the camera lens.

I tried an old Motorola phone, and a Galaxy S4. The Moto will charge and the S4 will not. It appears to be a known problem that was not known to me when I bought this cable. Still, I can drain my phone battery to spin up a USB hard disk! Neat!

The adapter connects the drive to the laptop, but somehow kept disconnecting from the laptop whenever large amount of data like pictures and videos were transferred. This means that instead of transferring a large folder at once, due to the disconnecting issue, I had to transfer only small chunks of the folder at a time. Definitely more time consuming, but still glad that at least data can be recovered.
Works fine for charging (no data connection). Mine split in half at the seam after a few months of use.
A very pretty color. However, my kid's hand (dry) is dyed with the color. It seems fit pretty well and no cracks or peels off so far.

I like this case for the smart cover functionality. It looks nice and it is thin. The only problem is the cover starts to fray with treading exposed after only a couple of weeks.  It looks like it's a couple years old after only a couple of weeks

I like it the sounds good but if feels like flimsy compared to sony E-series and the User interface is notthat friendly you have to familiarized the controls, but I returned it coz they send me a wrong item.

I like the cover.  The keyboard works as designed, but I find I don't use it as often as I thought I would.  The whole thing is a bit bulky.  I do not have problems with repeating keys that others have mentioned.

If used right after charging the capacity seems roughly comparable to Canon, perhaps a bit less. However the discharge rate is higher than Canon, so the shelf life of the charge is less.  Given the lower cost the compromise is reasonable.
It looks like it will do the job of protecting the tablet, but I wish it fit a little bit tighter.

The Flip is very easy to use and the HD video is great in good lighting.  If you have a steady hand the video won't be shaky, and I'm sure stabilization features will be in the next generation of these camcorders.  Not sure if this has happened to anyone else but somehow dust got trapped on the inside of the screen.  Doesn't affect the functionality much but it's annoying.

Really nice but 3 stars.... The player works greatPros: Size, speaker is loud enough, separate antenna, it just works!Cons: 2 major ones no fast forward only skip track and NO DEDICATED VOLUME CONTROL really annoying having to hold down next or previous track button to get the volume control.
These worked great on some replacement Sony earphones I had. My cats like to chew on the buds.
Had to do the side install to get a decent connection. They are not the best on the market, but for the price it's tough to beat.

I've had cheaper ones like this before. this one seemed okay when I first got it, but over time it ended up losing its connection. Must be something in the wire when stretched. It worked pretty good, but is now junked.

I am not a Hi Fidelity enthusiast that will debate Tubes vs Transistors. I am using the card in a 2.1 configuration.The card plugged in and worked without incident. I was replacing a full profile card that sat between to Video Cards in an SLI configuration.This cards low profile made it easy to fit without contacting the SLI bridging clip.No Complaints.

This is a two piece mount not one as shown in the picture but I did not had a problem with it. The only bad thing about this is that the two small "wheels" that are on the side that you twist are made that great it broke when I was installing the tv but is really not that big of a deal.

Bought this one and the Adonit Jot Pro Fine Point Stylus Pen for writing purposes on the iPad mini. This one is easier to use but the Adonit is definitely better for writing. Unfortunately, the Adonit tip stopped working (I reviewed that one too; not sure why since it looks perfectly intact and normal). So, by default, this Bamboo Solo Stylus is the one I'm using currently, This one certainly doesn't have any flimsy parts, so maybe it'll last.
Got these to take the strain off of a couple cables around the house... I got two packs of five and found one bad one so far... Still have six left that I haven't tried...

its structure is not rigid, does not support either the weight of the camera, the compartments are weak, the second time you use it, the left strap broke, do not recommend it for heavy cameras or to bring many things ...
The plastic around the lightning charger cracked after minimal use and now the lightning charger wiggles around.  Still works, but kind of surprised that within a month of use it would do that.
Sometimes the adapter did not work as well as I expected.  However, it got the job done when I needed it.

Mine flickers somewhat when you move the flexible arm, and it's sometimes hard to turn on because the button doesn't always work right. But with some fumbling, it worked, and I've read for several hours in the dark already. Also, this thing is much bigger than other Kindle lights I've seen. Not a problem for me, but be aware of that when making your choice.
Slow read write. Constantly freezing when programs try to access large amounts of data from it. WD makes outstanding external drives but this is an awful effort. Buy something else.
Does what it is supposed to do.  it seems a little small though.  I would buy the next model up/full size next time.

This cable is OK, I didn't realize until it was too late that this cable was stranded wire, which is very difficult to put Rj45 connector on. I thought I was getting solid wire. My bad, next time I will have more diligent.

This could be a great oiled leather folio case, but the one I received was warped and didn't fit the iPad Mini properly.  With the warped shape, the Mini couldn't sit straight and the cover wouldn't close properly.
Yes, it performs slightly better than the Chromebook 1 (XE303), but not enough to justify this higher price.Check out my full review with Benchmarks over at ModoGiz.com

If you pay less than 50$, they are worth it.  They are good for short distancefit good on the wrist and they are a fun little toy to play with.This is what kids used to dream about in the 50-70's. Wow just like dick Tracey.Now the technology is here and all kinds of little gadgets are available.  Suremost walkie talkie are better than these...but for what they are ...there worth it.Enjoy

Just purchased these earphones and while they work very well for the type of noise I need to reduce (e.g. riding lawnmower, air compressor), the ear pads are for small ears. They are quite uncomfortable for my ears which are about average size. They do not meaningfully reduce spoken sounds so a noisy seat mate on an airplane will be just as obtrusive.

These work fine for my DVD - the picture is clear and the color is good.  The only problem is that one of the video cables falls out unless I prop up the cable.  If it hangs down it is just too heavy.  I'm happy with the picture so I just rigged it so it stays on.
It's not the greatest set up, but for the funds I have it will work for now. I will recommend getting some stronger bulbs cause the ones that come with it are not very strong.

Connected to my PC and was able to program, but could not get to work on a Internet ready TV.  Got a connection and could see the network, but kept losing signal.  It was upstairs and on the other side of the house so the distance may have been a factor.  Had to return to Amazon as I could not keep the signal strong enough.
It works great, but I found I really preferred just tying on the touchpad of the I pad itself. It was a bit bulky.
Wife didnt like the fit,  not very soft and hard to fit on heads,  they were cheap and we took a chance, now they are yard sale fodder.

I have no gripes or complaints about this sleeve. It does a fit and do a good job of holding the keyboard. I do not consider it a great value. Short of making my own or adapting a sleeve designed for another product there was not much option. This sleeve does not really afford any protection as there is not padding or protective materials so obvious care must be taken to not knock it around too harshly.
The battery backup is to small to feed and iphone 4 it only charges less tan 50% of total charge, the ipod can be charged completelly but is so big for than small charge backup
It does the job... it does lose the connection easily so if you want to by a wireless keyboard, go for the other IOGEAR version... its way better and less bulky

I bought this a few months ago and still use it. I used it on the 4th of July for taking photos of the fireworks and it worked like a charm. I'm not sure about the long time quality of this product but for the price it will do for now.
This is probably the best GPS I have owned yet but the battery is worthless
Fit is reasonable for the money but not as secure as factory stock.Fine on lower dollar components but be careful with high-dollar equipment.
Screen works, has one dead red pixel right in the middle of the screen. Didnt go without a monitor for another couples weeks so I cant return it:( Other than that it works fine.
My phone is unable to sync contacts or link to my laptop for speakerphone calls. Maybe a software issue, I'm not really sure.

I was overly excited when these came in. They're really nice speakers and look good. But, the bass isn't as strong as it looks. It's big but not powerful. The output and the input in the back aren't that good. They move a lot and the sound fades. You have to move the wires to the sound back. Overall, I wound't recommend those speakers since you can get better quality with the same price.
Quality isnt the greatest. After a couple weeks of use the item became brittle and I tossed it. Wire coating started separating and eventually the risk of exposed wires wasnt worth the risk

The move backwards key sort of sticks and delays and has caused character deathsI understood you can create a default then transfer that to any game  profile but I couldnt and CS said you cannot do this.It doesn't save my profiles even when I hit save.. have had alot of trouble with this.

I wanted some smaller capacity flashdrives for use with application deployment, unfortunately, the read/write speeds are extremely slow, while they will do what I had intended for them, but find the performance inferior in comparison to other flashdrives for the same costs.

I tried using these in bright sunlight, against window glare, against a bulb and under low light conditions. the results were mediocre and the filter did not do much.. had a negative effect in low light, while I was expecting it to act neutral. I ordered its bigB the B+W HAZE MRC, and everything changed to my delight, under the same conditions..  packaged this one and returned it to Amazon.

hi guys and dolls,...I have these and don't seem to work but they're in a cool dry place until I get a HD television.My 19 inch HD tv must not be HD for the glasses not to work. So, I opted out for the cardboard paper cut-out3D glasses and they definitely work so long as the picture is slightly distorted.Then I got a pair of clip on 3D glasses and they are cool too.MarkMontedoro
Good product which I have used before, but there was no brass adapter included which is required for mounting on a stand :( Not sure if this is a newer version from previous.

Took a little options review on the Nikon Support Website for my D5000 but using the brief and not clear tutorial that came with the Opteka GPN-1 Geotag GPS I was able to install with no problems.  I recommend the product but suggest a more detailed setup instructions specific to the camera brand it is for.  Love using it at a fair price.

I'm using this with my D40 and kit lens.  The case is cheap and feels cheap, but if you're just looking to cover your camera while out it does the job.  Plus, it's very light weight so you're not carrying around extra bulk.  Not sure how protective it would be if it fell off your shoulder on to the ground, but c'est la vie.
It is ok. II like the fact that it swivels but it does not charge very well. I have tried it with several cords and none seem to do well. It will charge some and so it is my back up charger
Because It Was Just Okay!None!, None! Not Recommend It To Anybody, Not Good At AllBut It's Okay If It Work.

i have 3 of these LED lights.2 of them broke the hot shoe after first used.the LED light itself is great.i like the adjustable light output.but the plastic hot shoe doesn't last long!!anyone knows where to get a replacement metal hot shoe?

I want to like these earbuds but i was disappointed with the sound.  To me, the sound from the earbud sounded flat.  I was hoping for more highs and base which is important to me.  I would not recommend this product.Pros:1.  Style2.  Design3.  Battery case4.  Easy to pair5.  Voice feedback to inform user what the earbud is doingCons:1.  Sound is flat.

This unit would have been a lot better if it would of come with some way to mount it. There wasn't any double sided tape or mounting holes. The angle needed to get the GPS be be level was not available by its design. Live and learn.

This is a great product and both charges and plays great with my old IPOD NANO, but I recently bought a new FIFTH GENERATION IPOD NANO (16 gig) and it plays great BUT THE CHARGING FUNCTION WON'T WORK.

It's advertised for 2 - 1000mAh batteries; however, I received one 980 mAh and one 800 mAh batteries.  That being stated, these batteries are holding their charge well.  I don't know if they were mislabeled 1000mAh batteries BECAUSE they hold their charge well.  Otherwise, I'm happy with the purchase considering one 2CR5 (a compatible) li-ion non-rechargeable battery can cost just as much as these two.
It works well, but I would appreciate something simpler as it is something most user will use only few times a year !
Item does not hold the Magellan M1700 securely and does not work on Compact or mid size cars; the arm should be flexible in my opinion.

These worked well for 1 year. Comfortable, very light weight, descent sound and stayed on my head no matter what the sporting activity. Unfortunately, after 1 year of use, the right speaker failed and no sound comes out of it.

I bought this product almost 6 months ago, and i still cant resolve the problem i have with it. Video quality is good, and u can record you're favorite programs and all that stuff, but my problem is that the audio sounds like if there was interference, so as the video, and i just cant resolve it.

I've had this player for almost 2 years and the DVD playback has started to freeze. It was always a problem but now it's more and more.My more expensive Toshiba DR750 plays the same DVD's with no problems. If you want longevity it's better to go ahead and pay more.

I wanted a cover with a clip on the back and that I got.  I can plug in my ear buds with out a problem, but the plastic is too thick to allow by car cord to hook into IPod without removing the cover.  That one corner of the cover remains off since I use it in my car frequently.
This case does work from when you drop it and everything else. My only concern is the way it was to clip together, doesn't work to well. Still good tho. I'd order another one I I needed too

The pros are it's small and simple to use. The cons are that it's not really as "big" space wise as you may think. It does the job it is supposed to do; however firmware updates are necessary to keep this guy stable.  Rebooting issues have plagued it along with poor performance. Very light duty and rip easily.  Be careful when installing and they work fine.  Shipping was fast.  I suggest buying more than one set, for future use.

It works for what it's intended for, which is a dedicated media plug. It's nice to have the cable and phone connectors for filtering noise on the line. It's a nice bonus but not a necessity. This product fulfilled my need to storage space with more than ample, however, it was not as substantial as I was expecting. MY only complaint is that the hinge won't tighten or hold so if you're photographing in vertical positions and not holding the hinge down, the flash will flop over 90 degrees. Horizontal is not an issue.

I love the ability to have a backup camera in my car now.  This was pretty easy to install and adjust.  Only real problem is the image quality is rather poor.  Based on previous reviews I expected a clearer image.  But since I had nothing before this, I can't complain too much I guess!?!?

Although the file transfers are fast, the USB connection between the laptop and the hard drive can be easily disconnected if I have to move hard drive, even by a little bit. I do not experience similar USB connection issue with my other external hard drives.

Decent sound quality, bass and comfort for an earplug style headphone.  It's nice that it comes with three different size earpieces that are easy to change. Product works as specified.  Charger broke after about 1 year of use.  Canon design of charger is superior.  Battery is roughly as good as Canon.
Might just be me and my luddite IT skills, but I couldn't get it to work with an HP Laserjet CP2025DN and a Motorola wireless router.

It works well but the design does not lend itself to staying in the outlet when you are plugging usb cables in. The stars are not for quality of product or shipping, etc. simply that it just isn't a good design for an outlet. They should simply add a cord so it can sit on a desk.

Turned out I bought the wrong product, but instead of returning it for a restocking fee I just kept in cause I want to split a signal to two monitors in the future. I'll probably give it to a school for their use. Otherwise I guess the product is just fine.

Worked really well the first couple times I used it. Started freezing periodically a few days later. It's a warranty so no real info I can give on it. Hope I never need to use it, but I feel it's worth having for the peace of mind, even though it doesn't cover much. Not much different than any other protection plan out there.

It works exactly as advertised, but runs a little fast. I would like to know what genius decided to put the buttons for setting the clock & alarm on the bottom of the clock, however. Also, Buttons are very difficult to read because the lettering is the same color as the body of the clock.
Too sensitive, is set off by wind, sun & shadows.

A small earthquake would send your touchpad or ipad flying to the ground, still attached to this mount.  I am not impressed with how poorly it secures to the cabinet.  I feel that a better spring could have been used; or a spring at all, could have been used.

This product does exactly what it is supposed to do.  It was inexpensive and shipping took forever because it actually shipped from CHINA... I mean really... from China. The problem was my fault, not the product.  The product was nice and would have been great if I had order the right one, but I did not. I've purchased quite a few of these (at least 3 or 4 sets). Although I'm not a fan of how cheaply made they are, I've had one split all the way apart. I can't beat the price. great amount of storage space plus data is secured with sandisk securemanager for windows...  the size is small and discreet but not small enough to lose...

the design is pretty, but it's just a basic bag. I would recommend buying a woman's briefcase/laptop carrier instead. This does little to protect any item placed inside of it.

does a great job connecting to Sirius, a louse of a job staying connected. It may work for a few weeks, then POW, clock jumps ahead, stations need to be reprogram in. Radio does sound good when playing.

A mouse as sophisticated as this one needs a reasonable instructional reference. Of special concern is the programming of the buttons with a computer other than Windows-based machines is a hassle. I really wanted to like this pair of headphones. It looks amazing; however, contrary to the reviews that I've read, the sound quality seems a bit lackluster, even after burning it in for around 100 hours. The sound stage did not impress me and the volume was a bit lacking.

Arctic silver is the most common CPU/heatsink paste.  I didn't use this and opted for an organic non-metal base thermal paste so metal 'dust' wouldn't get in my circuitry if/when I swap out CPU's.  One came with my top rated air heatsink.

Case is very nice for protecting the Zen, but with two design flaws.  One, the ring will bang against the front ov the cover and scratch up a third of the screen view.  two, there is no way to attach an arm band to it.

Seagate drives are usually high quality, and I have no reason to think that this one isn't, but it is quite noisy, and at a high frequency that really irritates me.  It's so maddening that I'm considering unplugging the drive, and only reconnecting it once a month for backups.

Product loads DVDs and Blu Ray discs quilckly and has a lot of wireless options. But the images just don't look as good as the Panasonic I replaced. Kind of wish I'd kept the old one. Will do until I can afford an Oppo.

This is indeed an OEM drive - came with no warranty card, no SATA cable, screws, shipping list, manual or any other insert. I guess they ran out of them because the seller is now some other outfit.
Functional but not very quiet. The flip outs could be a little higher, it is definitely higher quality though and I am glad I bought it.

Without the fan noise, this camcorder is the best. I'm kinda perfectionist and a very little noise like that annoys me. As with many of the higher capacity flash drives, this is pretty slow to write.  I created a 2.4Gig zip of a bunch of mp3 files and wrote to this drive today using a Windows 7 Pro machine.  Took over 9 minutes for about 4.5MB/sec.  Then wrote that same file back to the hard drive and took just over 2 minutes for about 20MB/sec.  Has nothing to do with USB2 or USB3.  That's the drive's speed.

Also, this mouse uses two AAA batteries, not two AA.

Im sure anyone with little cash and wanting okay headphones will be plenty satisfied with these, but if you are looking for some real cans your going to have to take a jump into the $100's. Anyways, for anyone with some cash to spend and wants a pair of over the head headphones that are durable, comfortable, and with okay sound then the Sony MDR-280 is your set of headphones.

USB drives aren't only about their storage capacity, they are about the data transfer rates as well.  To fill up this 16GB card, it will take 5-10 minutes.  There are other drives out there than can fill it up in a minute.  I'd personally suggest you look for another drive.

My favorites are still the hmdx jam classic, the kinivo, or the volcano, in that order. This has decent sound and pretty loud for a small speaker, but not as good quality as the others. Its pretty much always popped up now as one of the parts that lock it closed cracked which doesnt affect anyhing other than easy storage.
Bose product just not the original missing the mic and in wire controls i use this for my iphone and im really missing the mic and controls on the wire
Great remote for iPhone if you want to use it as camera remote or music control.Unfortunately you can't control  keynote slides on iPad using it.
For the price,  this was a good buy. It does have a somewhat weak joint, the one you tighten after positioning the tablet to your liking. Tends to drop a little on larger bumps.
Had to use lots of washers on shaft as the width of rim is very narrow.  I took the bearing off old wheels to shim them out.

This product work as designed most of the time, sometimes the audio is kind of crackly. I would say it works exactly right about 80% of the time, the other 20% you have to adjust your plug to get it to work.

This is an elegant and well built product.  However:1.  Almost $40 for a stand?  MINUS one star2.  Super tiny and hard to use screws even with normal size hands?  MINUS one starFor that money I would expect to atleast get a cable to come with this.  It is very elegant so if money is no object, get it.Besides that,

the description says increase sound quality and volume. it did increase volume, but if it increased sound quality, it wasnt noticed.it is built good, i like everything about it, looks, size, volume increase, i dont detect any hiss. but im disappointed because it did not improve sound quality enough to be noticeable to my ears.

Received order....Printing on paper label glued to memory card Adapter  DID NOT HAVE CLEAR PRINTING QUALITY.  I doubt that this is a genuine Sandisk memory card. Have purchased other Sandisk MICROSD cards with SD Adapters and printing is much cleaner on them.

ive had this for a while now (over 6 months) and it has come in handy.  to me it seems like it charges my phone really slow.  also it seems like it dosnt hold its own charge for too long.  maybe a couple of days decreasing its charge even when youre not using it.  im sure there are better options out there by this time. it also seems really bulky.
These don't last quite as long as the official Panasonic batteries, but for this price I don't really care.
Not a bad product, certainly everything worked, but it was hard to fit the main power cable into any kind of adapter. Installation could have been easier with another kit.
I use these with my LG Env Touch phone and I can hear people pretty clear on my end, but the person I'm talking to complains that my voice goes in and out. But for $2, what do you expect?

just got this camara and it is cheap looking but it works good with my aftermarket stero.i dont see how this camara is going to last outside my car . it is so cheap get something else no deal here. you get what your paying $12 for..

I'm giving this three stars only because my friend whom I brought this for never used it. This battery was for the older model Go Pro and he fail to tell me so I could return it.  It still a good quality product that never got used.
it wasn't better than other antennas, and it broke easily too.  The reception was clear though, and was easy to use.

Fairly comfortable.  Work very well. A bit confusing to tell if you have turned them off. Too delicate. The first two pairs I bought came in an intact box with cracked lenses.  Within one day of owning a new pair they were knocked off a sofa onto a hardwood floor and the lens cracked. My sunglasses wouldn't break with such a small fall.  It seems unless you are very careful these will not last as long as you TV.

The charger isn't exactly aesthetically pleasing, but it does what it's supposed to.  Seems to charge a smartphone faster than my computer.  Sits a little uneven in the socket so that when you pull out a cord from one of the three slots it's hard not to pull out the entire device from the wall.  Also, one of the slots was almost impossible to plug a device into.
Hard to get and keep steady - you'll get dizzy the first few times.  Once you get past that, it zooms quite a ways and is pretty clear

This would be great if the keyboard wasn't so small. I have small hands, and I type for a living but I just cannot type comfortably with this keyboard. I'm giving 3 stars because I think it's a great idea...just an idea who's time has not come.
The item was as described and I have only the one complaint, saved money through Amazon. It is amazing how fast Amazon Fulfilled items get to me.

I mistakenly ordered this bracket. I needed one for a 1310T so will be passing this one on to a friend who needs this size. The price was so low that returning it is more expensive than giving it away.  My bad.
Fits loose with my 13" retina =/ About an half an inch wiggle room on each side. Its ok. May buy a plastic cover to make up for it but it works fine.
This was a little long for what I needed so I had to modify it to work. It is definitely sturdy but a little bulky. Used it for my BenQ W1070

I do not write reviews very often, but figured i would say something about this mouse.WAY TOO HEAVY!The mouse seems to weigh a ton, and for some reason, it does not glide well.  Its almost like it has velcro on the bottom of it.  I think if they could drop about a pound off the weight, it would be a nice mouse.
The color is brighter than my expectation (and previous D-LUX 3 genuine Leather case...This is more close to yellow...
I had thought when purchasing this that it was a "Canon" brand battery at a discounted price on Amazon.  No.  It is an off brand, and I have a fear of damaging my investment if it heats up.
Perhaps it's just the old school tech, but it takes a lot of "grinding" to finally display the files on the diskette.  But, for retrieving info that may be on the disks it is a valuable tool!
These are MUCH better than the paper sleeves for vinyl records.  But their are definitely better ones out there.  The corners have a hard time sometimes when putting into the album cover.

If you want to get your old cassettes onto disk, this will get it done.  Just don't expect to much!  It's pretty easy to work with and get things transferred, but the quality of the recording is one step above taping from a radio with a microphone.  However; listening to cassettes on it is about like the old Walkmans.
It's a pretty cheap card and has a good amount of storage, but it has fairly slow write performance. Some competitors' MicroSD cards offer much faster performance for similar prices.

The good news is that the card has only failed once, the bad news is that I only used it once. After loosing 100+ pictures I no longer have confidence in the card. Because it is a full size SD, it has little use outside of a camera. I am open to usage suggestions for it, so far it has not worked well as a can opener, Frisbee, or as a bookmark.

I bought this for taking pictures of products to sell on eBay.The studio part is pretty descent, but the lights are weak. This may work better in sun light out doors or buy more powerful lights.The included "tripod" is worthless for a DSLR, it is intended for use on a small point and shoot camera.Overall, not a bad product.

This cable works perfectly, but it wasn't designed the best. The better cable is the L9, which places the cable coming out of the dock on the side, rather than the bottom. This makes for a much smaller package when trying to stick your ipod and a DAC in your pocket.

This is exactly what it says it is...  an USB extension cord.  It allows you to connect a USB device to your computer without having to have them right next to each other.  The connections are little flimsy and the the data transfer rates are slowed a bit.  Additionally, when using the extension cable the amount of time required to power pass (charge) a device goes up exponentially.
Tried the A2000IS camera and found it too slow for indoor pictures.  Nice screen, good ergonomics, but just too slow to take pictures even with the AF beam turned off.

This case does afford further protection to the ipad but I have found when you turn the keyboard around so it is out of the way (on the back side of the ipad) you will accidently touch a key and it turns on the keypad and then you either have to wait for it to time out or turn the keypad off. Otherwise this works as designed.

Originally got these for snow boarding and fosnowboardingund a few things on the mountain.It does not go though rock. Often times the top, bottom, traverses are separated by hills that the signal has trouble bouncing around. And it's not great in cold weather, battery dies quick and sometimes device malfunctions.When it does work, the signal is very clear and the charging options is a big plus, but I wouldn't count on these to save my life.

Nice strap. Should do the job for me when traveling to foreign lands. Just a bit stiff and doesn't fold easily into carry case when attached to camera. The clasps on the strap have a cheap locking mechanism and don't protect the clasp from being opened by a thief. One of the "locks" was actually split and fell off when I attached the clasp to the ring. I have have to rig some other "lock" when traveling.

Yes, this is a nice sleeve as others have noted, but I was disappointed that my two-piece power supply would not fit in that outer pocket.  Yes, as another reviewer noted about their similar issue, I suppose you could stuff the three-prong AC cord in the main pocket beside the netbook, and then leave the brick and cord to the PC in the pocket, but that wasn't what I was expecting.
Not too bad but not the best. It feels too spongy and not as firm as my previous neoprene case.

Tiger is better than amazon on the case. I ordered the same one from amazon and fans were not working. I hope this case won't break any soon. Have to let you guys know that front panel isn't really strong peace. So take it easy when open and close. This is a good looking case. But for quality I suggest other brand like cooler master.
Buy a Zune. This is not good for video. Too small. This is the first Sony product that I wish I would not have purchased.

These paper sleeves are very thin compared to the Memorex ones.  They will work fine for giving away free cds but I wouldn't use them for anything needing that professional touch.  Some even came missing the plastic window.  For the price there ok but very flimsy if your used to the name brand sleeves.

Good price for the screen size. Im using this with an led projector and it makes the picture look fine. The inner mechanisms are working but not without a lot of trouble. It takes several tries to get the screen exactly where I want it. If u will be pulling the screen up and down a lot, this might give you some trouble.
Although this was probably a pretty good cooler, I couldn't get the Push-Pin Mounting to work and broke one of the thin plastic arms holding the fan.
can't say much about it - I got it for my grand child an I hope it works...

I live in an older house with plaster walls and my regular wireless network does not make it more than two rooms before the signal gets weak.  Setup is easy, but do NOT use an extension cord or power strip.  It is very sensitive to this.  Also do not expect great speed.  My download speed is less than 1/2 what I get on my regular wireless network.  But its easy to set up additional a/p.
Works okay, would be nice if it could split off into 1/8".Does not use the HD graphics settings. :[
The cover is good, but it takes a lot of work to get it on. If you have the patients, it's a pretty decent shield.

I bought this to prevent fingerprints on my high gloss screen.  It does it's job.  My only problem is the broad tip on the pen.  It's just not as fine as I would like it.  Like I said, there's nothing wrong with the pen.  It does it's job.
Works OK, but range is very limited.  Not nearly as good for mirroring as Apple TV for iOS devices.

This case offers good protection for the transformer. My only complaint is that it adds way to much bulk to the tablet. That is why I very seldom use this case. I normally use a slipcover for my Transformer.
I live in a VERY remote area and even though I can see the TV transformers within 10 miles of my house, I couldn't get much of a signal beyond the 1960s snowy image.
Cap keepers are very cheap and won't last long.  The first one we put on only lasted a day.  The filters and cleaning cloth did work just fine and I would give them five stars.

I agree with others saying that the rubber band holding the sleeves together is a bad design. It crumples the plastic on some of the sleeves and ruins them. The product itself is usable (and most of the sleeves are fine), but seven dollars is really too much when you end up getting less than you asked for. I think next time I'll buy some sleeves that aren't crinkled before I get them.
I bought this as replacement for my chinese hotshoe and it works as advertised. not great or bad for the price.

I used two of these on different cams and found that the screw would not tighten completely, leaving the camera flopping around. If you use this be sure to add a washer to it to pull in the thread and camera.

It's really just a big fan.  The device works, but it elevates the laptop a good inch or so off the surface making the angle of typing slightly off.  Also, the device is fairly loud.  Sounds like an airplane is about to take off.  I originally bought it for my daughter, but I don't believe she's using it anymore.  It got to a point where the noise alone was the big turn off.
I had to take it out because it took some of the screen sharpness. Put a regular screen. Much better.
It seems to work well with both my phone and tablet (Android).  I think the app that Nikon produced for using this wifi adapter could be much, much better.  Was it worth the money I paid for it?  No.

I got this on sale and I am mostly satisfied with it. It is designed for earlier generations of iPads so it does not have the hole for the forward facing camera and in order to adjust the volume you have to fight the elastic that holds the iPad in.

I see some people saying they received adapters that were not metal but the one I got was metal. When I connected headphones to an extension cord I had to reseat the cable the first time due to static but then it cleared up. No static but the sound was impaired. You get what you pay for.

The mouse works good but the case was tinny. For Logitech it was a surprise. If you are going to use it as your main mouse I would recommend spending a couple of bucks more. For a spare or traveling mouse its ok but the plastic is hard and it doesn't have a soft feel in your hand.
Let me be clear, I'm sure these cost Apple less than a buck to make -- but since I don't trust any of the off-brands; this is the only one I'll buy.

I was very happy with my first smart TV until I tried the Amazon Prime App.  It must have been designed by the same people that designed the Obama-care wed site, or by someone that has never accessed Prime movies on a computer.The Vizio 29" (e291i-A1) is a five star TV for the price. I'm thinking the $80 per year for Prime prepaid (free?) streaming video is not a good buy.

It protects like any other. Maybe it's me but even though I clean everything I still can't apply these thingswithout at least one piece of dust which shows up like a bubble.It's definitely reflective, but also enhances glare and shows fingerprints and smudges vividly.Sticks well and feels good, interaction with unit is great.

We got this radio about 4 years ago and loved it when it was alive. It played everything and it's small. But it didn't live long, I think the on/off button or the switch between radio and CD just stopped working after about two years.

This product is OK but it has a few issues. First, my USB didn't work at all! It never would even recognize anything at all, even another iPhone! And it is very cheaply made. But the SD card a lot works perfectly, you might have to tool around win the SD card on the computer to make it work though.

Any radio rat will tell you that antennas are challenging.  One guy might get great results, the other nothing.  This antenna did not help me much; I was much better off with a single longwire.  But, that's just me.  If you buy this antenna, be very careful about the telescoping part that spreads the quadrangle.  I snapped mine after a few weeks.  Get a decent radio, expect to spend a few hundred.  Good luck, and 73's. Phil Avery, KD0SCJ
I GOT THESE AS PARTOF A VALENTINE GIFT PROJECT. VERY DISAPPOINTING. ADDED BETTER HIGH PASS FILTER 12DB/OCT AND DID LITTLE OR NO GOOD. GOOD BOX, JUST CRAPPY SPEAKERS.

I love the idea and the size of these umbrellas are great. The rear opening isn't quite large enough which makes changing settings on a speedlight a little cumbersome, but overall it's a decent product.

Pros:I got this for ~$6 (refurb)gives you two usb ports that are faster than USB2, but not USB3 speeds reallyCons:the first one that arrived not only didnt work, but fried my external usb sound card. They sent me a replacement card but did not replace the soundcardFloppy pin plug in is crappy (but isn't required)Works, but not for heavy use.

I have two power-sucking devices, my Droid X and Lepan tablet.  The X likes an amp to charge, and the Lepan likes 2 amps.  If I have both of them plugged in they don't charge well.  However, the multiple outlets are convenient.

Did not work on my Droid Incredible 2.  I gave it to a friend with a Droid X and he said it worked well.  Apparently the product works well, IF you can find a device it fits.  Write up of what it fits should be more clear.  I will say, it was very inexpensive.
The battery does not have a long life, so i ordered this extra one, so am always ready to take a photo

Warning: this lens cap does not fit on micro-four thirds Olympus lenses. I'm not sure what it fits. However I should mention that I went to return the cap to Amazon and, happily, they gave me a refund without requiring the lens cap in return! I am very impressed with Amazon, best market place in the world!

i bought this product for use with an 20GB ipod video. i am now using it with a sansa e280. it has not fallen out nor threatened to fall out. it also stays on my arm.it is an ok product not sure how an arm-band would ever blow anyone away.decent buy. the case is also relatively thickly padded so you'll be challenge to find your buttons with your player inside the case.

I bought this to replace a previous bubble level that broke recently. My main issue with this level is that the base was too thick to fit in the hotshoe of my Panasonic G3. I contemplated returning it, but less than 5 minutes with a file solved the problem.

I got this Item, worked great. But after just a month it stopped working. I sent it back for an exchange. Was waiting a month to get a new one back. Didn't get a chance to test it yet. I hope it will not break in a month as previous one.
Charger gets somewhat hot. Don't set it in your pocket unless it's freezing in your house.Works properly, charged the laptop. Bought it to sell the HP TX1000 as a 'bundle' to a good friend.
Ad says three items included: Adapter, power cord and a USB drive.  I received the adapter and powercord but NO USB Drive.  false advertising?  Or oversight?

In the description of this product it mentions that it will accept up to 8 gauge wire, that is not true. I couldn't get my 8 gauge wire even close to fitting in these terminals without eventually having to shave half the copper off of each wire, reducing it by approximately by 1/2. I was pretty disappointed by these terminals. However, if you are running speaker wire SMALLER than 8 gauge, these terminals would be real nice.

This gizmo is sensitive to the surface it is on... much more than other optical mice I've used.  I notice it uses a blue laser... not the common red type... so I'm apt to attribute this weakness to the laser type.  It seems to work best on monochromatic or plain / dull surfaces.  On more reflective surfaces like marble tops and things like cloth tabletops with patterns, the Wedge just doesn't track well.

The drive ocasionally drops off line and I get a cryptic warning saying It wasn't put away properly and that my data is in danger. I have a dozen 3T Seagate drives that have all worked flawlessly for years. This 4T drive does not inspire confidence.  Don't think any data has been compromised, but I am careful to backup anything important on another drive.

I read all the reviews & purchased this product because I wanted to protect the Kindle Fire I received as a gift. It wasn't the easiest thing to install even after cleaning the face good and carefully aligning the screen. I still ended up with bubbles that will not come out. Thankfully they are on the sides of the screen so (shrug)....it's better than having nothing at all.

The quality is ok for the money spent.  Its on par with most other cameras at this price range.  Did not come with software or even link to download drivers.  Not sure if this was missed from packaging or if its standard.  However, it was worth getting for just a cheap webcam.  The mic on it does not appear to work on mine though.
It's OK product but not very good. I do not feel any improvement after using of 2 months. I do not recommend to my friends

The pouch is cheap and I could definitely do without it.The cleaner does it's job.I'd rather have no pouch and more cleaner/swabs for my money.Also, there's no way I'll use that entire bottle of cleaning solution with those 4 swabs.
to find where a signal is coming from and if it is moved then you have to move it again is jus dumb. I prefer omni directional from trendnet. but it seems of nice quality

This is a decent line conditioner. It filters out a lot of noise from my power, including all of my appliances. The one thing it can't seem to filter out completely, however, is the Dimmers on the torchier lamps. I can always hear when one of those darn things is on. Otherwise its a decent unit.

The computer I recently built a computer that had an exceptionally noisy stock fan. I bought this fan and its quieter, but still quite noisy. I'm not sure if all of them are noisy, or just something with my motherboard makes them noisy. Other than that it secures itself well, and and it cools well.

I purchased the item was as described but did not help me locate any satellite. I must have done something wrong tried to seek help installing my dish and purchased everything recommended. I still don't have satellite!  . I ended up putting it back in the box and putting it in the pile of items I wish I never purchased.
Got these to replace some speakers that I had that broke.  Sounds is alright, but not particularly loud.  Good for the price.

this thing is flimsy cheap plastic...i would NOT use it to cool a laptop...unless the laptop is stationary and sitting on a flat surface...however...i use it to cool my router which goes berserk when it get hot...for that...it does a very good job...i could do without the blue lights which are pointless imho...  well...they do make a good nightlight...

I would have given this five stars, because it looks really cool and works great in the car when it works, but sometimes it freezes, and other times it just doesn't work.  Definitely long on features and looks, short on quality and reliability.  Would I buy it again?  Maybe. I would take a closer look at alternatives.
Purchased this for my system but had conflicts with the software.  Quick delivery (as always) and arrived in good condition.Oh well, better luck next time.
This isn't the best looking case on the market, but it works as advertised.It's heavier than the Apple case and a little raggedy, but you get what you payfor sometimes.

I've never had any trouble with the mouse portion working, but consistently the keyboard portion seems to lag. I've even gotten locked out of a server because I typed the password too quickly and the keystrokes didn't register. When I slowly type, it works fine but it's a bummer that I have to type slower because the adapter can't keep up.

Crank this bad boy to max and it is loud. Blue LED's glow brighter with higher RPM's.For some reason, at max or min speeds, there is no whining noise, but when I adjust the RPM speed to medium or anything that is not minimum or maximum speeds, it makes this loud whining noise that is annoying. Not sure if mine is defective or if that is just the fan build itself.

This does replace the one that came with my Nikon D300s but it too scratches easily and I found them hard to look through.I found something betterGGS DSLR LCD Optical Glass Screen Protector for Nikon D300 cameras. It actually sticks to your camera, is flat and it never scratched at all.So while this does replace the standard cover, I recomment the GGS.
Worked for less than a year and stopped working...lots of interference, volume was really low on this thing.
The visor is difficult to read, to small, low contrast. However, the product still working after 6 months, which is good since it was cheap.
Amazon has a great selection of ac power adapters.  Unfortunantly  I picked the wrong ac power adapter for my tablet.
It works well, albeit quite overpriced for what it is. One could certainly rig a similar device with parts from a lanyard and some zip ties, but it wouldn't look as professional.

Purchased this item from Amazon for $26.42, that's the good part. Followed everyone's advice about NOT turning the radio on until this device had found an adequate signal. Not impressed with sound quality, may be do the fact the car antenna is located on the rear fender, a substantial distance from this unit. Regular radio sounds much better. Would recommend purchasing car stereo with USB or RCA input if you're looking for quality sound.
works like it's supposed to. I don't like the format, Flash cards are much better, but I needed it for this application...

When removing the paper tabs please make sure they come off without sticking to the screen protector.  The paper tabs stuck to one side of the item.  I would recommend this item but be careful when removing the paper tabs

I got this so I could watch a movie on my Laptop with my girlfriend while we fly on an airplane.Last time I got some cheapo one for under a buck from Hong Kong. It didn't work.This one looks and feels nicer. Although when I first plugged in both sets, hers didn't work again... but when I pulled it out slightly, it works. I guess that's better than nothing. It was pretty cheap after all.

It works. But I took some time to figure out where the battery goes? The top and bottom cover seems not too tightly sealed. But it works though there is little noise. There is no way to power it off when using with battery.

Great little case. Fits well though yes it is hard to get the headphone jack plugged in, but not too hard. I actually really liked it until the spring setup broke. I still don't know what did it. It is truly a funky little spring assembly. Other than the spring setup, I loved it. Though I only got about a week out of it before it died.

Scratch Screen Protector are very good but pointer stylus is not so good. Some time I have to press very stron in order to work. Of course it's a very cheap item but really I was expectng for a bettter performance.

This thing is very good, but it breaks so easily that I wasted my money twice. at least the price was 45$ before! now is 69$ and I would absolutely not recommend it.in the first, the cable broke after 2 months of use where they attach. in the second the right ear broke after a week of use for no reason.I would really like this product if didn't broke. it's a shame that the price went so up though.
Does as well as anything for what it's intended to do as far as I can tell.  I particularly like the pen.
I been using this mouse for a few months now.... less than 3 months and the battery indicator is already lighting up red! hope this thing doesn't keep drowning the battery this quick!

The Software install on my windows 7 computer did not go well.  I could probably uninstall and re-install it.  The install on the windows 8.1 computer went better but I knew by that point to run the install disk before plunging in the device.
I liked the price I paid better $51.00 but since went up over $60.00. I wanted to order more ram for my other PC and can't now.

The range wasn't near as good as I hoped.  My wife tried calling me on her bike ride home.  I didn't get a signal until she was about a mile away.  Yes, there were homes - as it was a residential area - but I had hoped for better than a mile (technically it was less than a mile).  I'm sure on an open field, they'll work great.  Now to find that open field.
Not as good as my JBL but  good enough.
works great, wifi alittle tricky and doesn't always work the first time attempt. Battery life is horrible though. Very useful front screen for self taking couple pictures.
Okay, be aware of "Black Corners", if you fit it to the camera. Check out how to install it, to avoid "Black corners"
Good case, fits great. I wish it was a little more sturdier, but it works for now. Arrived quicker than expected.

The sound quality is great, probably a bit overrated though.  I think my old set of Altec Lansing computer speakers are slightly better for music.  The build quality is also questionable, I had to get a replacement satellite speaker sent which took an agonizing 10 days.

I'm having tons of trouble with this unit right now. It worked great at first, their customer service has been excellent, hence the 3 star, but I will have to update upon final decision to keep the product or return as defective.
What can you say about a screen protector, if it sticks its ok, these ones are very easy to apply.And they stay quite invisible so I am a happy camper!!!!

Everyone else has outlined all the reasons not to buy this.I liked the blue color and the feel of the material was fine, I didn't like how it attracted dust, etc.More than that, though, was how I found extracting my Kindle from it an arduous task.

if you just want something that will play music and mp3s then this will work. its not overly complicated and doesnt have a lot of settings. its not a competition grade or even show off grade stereo, just basic but it gets the job done!

At first I was pretty happy with this and thought it was all I needed and wanted.  Then I compared my shot with my friends who use L lens. What a difference. I returned this and bought Canon L lenses. This is good for beginer, I am not a pro, but I still think the quality of L lens justified the extra money.
Its OK, but the radio FM hardly picks up a station.  I would not buy this radio if FM stations were not local.  Well built, but its local reception only.

These are actually pretty good monitor earphones for their price. They have all the appeal of more expensive models such as the Shure SE215 but for a fraction of the cost. I've used these as monitors for live performances and was really impressed.
Very cheaply made and has some fairly confusing instructions on it. I don't know if mine works or not simce I connected it to possibly broken psu

This is a decent backup drive with a nifty web interface and a good mobile app support.However, the transfer speed over wireless network is just so~~~~slow.Other than that, it's a good value for the money.

Easy to set-up, great look and sound. We didn't use the JAMBOX more than 75 times before the battery life began to shorten even after charging overnight.  Unfortunately there is no replacement battery.
It's durable and great to have for on the go. I use it for my LED lights.  The only thing is it's hard to bend and a bit clunky.  other than that it does the job and was a great deal- that matters.
pros: bright(40% brightness is sufficient), lightweight, ultra thin (LED)cons: out-of-box gamma value is too high? viewing angle is not greatoverall a good monitor for the money

Yes, I looked at the measurements.  I was looking for a novel camera case for my "little" camera, but unfortunately, this case was even smaller.  Nice concept but it didn't work for me - reminds me of a "micro" patent leather pocketbook.  It now resides in a drawer until I can find something to put in it.

Its a nice case, soft and i've dropped it on the table a couple of times, No breaks or anything so I guess it works. But the black soft skin case is flimsy and doesn't stay on securely. But, it works. so... you get what you pay for :-)

I have been given instructions, off the internet, that would have me cut wires and re-solder some.
