I expected instructions, a manual or SOMETHING to come with this product.  So far, it's worked OK since I installed it.
Es un tripode básico a un buen precio. No es una herramienta profesional. Es liviano y facil de cargar. Se desarma con facilidad. Se desajunsta muy facil.
This is just a controller,and it works just fine. I would always want to by one from here because thats key.

This unit will NOT connect to a Mac. Creative's support states that future support for the Mac is unlikely. Therefore if you are a Mac user looking for an alternative to the iPod, look elsewhere. A pity, because the Zen is such a nice unit...
Pretty good normal head phone. It's not too great or bad just normal product.One positive comment on the product, it's for sure that quiet head phone.
Pro: Easy to install with no bubbleCon: Unable to cover the whole screen, leaving rather large area unprotected.  Need 1mm more each side.  Not a good fit.

This is a great laptop except for the fact that the screen absolutely sucks. The color appear weird, the screen responds slowly; not good for gaming, watching movies, or anything the involves the monitor for that matter. I ended up buying a samsung with similar specs and a very good screen. The speaker on the other hand are VERY good. The sound quality is by far the best I've ever hear on a laptop.
Good folio case but i don't recommend because he don't stay on any part because the leather is too soft. Other way is very nice and he fit perfect.

One seemingly nice feature is the built in DLNA media server -- but beware -- the firmware limit on number of media items is set to 8000 and is not apparently modifiable.The embedded Twonky server is configured (licensed?) by Linksys to support 8000 files then scanning stops.
I purchased this to get pictures off of CF cards and into my laptop computer. The card reader is slow, but it transferred pictures without an issue. For under $5 it works OK.

The hover bar does hold an iPad to the side of my Mac.  But in the image, the iPad appears to be placed RIGHT NEXT to the iMac display.  I'm unable to duplicate this, as the hover bar moves too much when I try and set it.  If I were to do this over again, I might look for a more stable solution.

Screen protector is awful, too thick and you have to mash on it to get it to work. I popped the screen protector out and used a protector that seals to the screen. Rest of the case is great and I feel a lot more at ease now with my ipad mini cause I know it's safe from falls and drops now

Mouse is more of an nostalgic piece.  It does function, but its cheaply made.  What do you get for the price paid, so can't complain.  I love the headlights and taillights.  Mine came corded.  Some stated that theirs were cordless.  I'm kinda glad mine isn't, because I'm sure it would go through batteries.

I was looking for a right angle finder, and looking at it you would think it was a right angle finder, but it isn't.  It's also very long, which was surprising.  Since it wasn't what I was looking for I haven't used it.If you can get by with a straight through finder that's very long, then it looks like it would work pretty well.
Good for the price. Not the best sound.
Once you get it to fit the player tightly enough to make the contacts,it works well.  getting it to fit took me a few tries..

Me and my wife both had these on our iPhone 4s and loved it. Unfortunately this one does not provide near as much privacy as the old ones did. I am disappointed in this filter, all it seems to do it make the screen dimmer, but it is still easily read form the sides.
Bought this with my new mac and never opened it, registered it or tried to use it. Hope it works if that time comes.

It's a tempermental bugger! Occationally turns itself off-So when you hit the camera on button-No signal sent! Hard to see small panel(especially during activities). Can never be sure that it turned on/off camera without looking at screen--Hitting red button often has to be done several times.

This is a must have if you own the MacBook Air and/or the Mac Mini. I have both. It lives up to expectations and it's fast can it is NOT the best option.Pro's: Mac compatible and Apple QualityCon's: Expensive and NO Blu-Ray drive (it's 2013)

I didn't realize how short 3 feet was.. its really short.. they barely make it to the highest placed device in my entertainment system. I really think u should go with 6 feet.. but they are good cables..

This camera is pretty ok. It takes terrible shots of my daughter because she it always moving. It smears with even the slightest movement. It is really only good for still photos and it is awesome at that, so keep that in mind. I bought it on a lightning deal so I don't feel screwed.
The sound quality these give out is distance and not all the music. You would need to plug in hafe way for the sound to be corrected.

Fit on my desk. It was not immediately clear how that would work - but after some pushing and pulling on things it became clear. I do like the build quality. I think for the price maybe they could have added something to help with the cabling on the headset as well.

I bought this for my MBP with retina display (late 2013 version). It fits very well. I like its minimalist design. It's water resistant and has a little flap inside for extra protection. It's not ugly.However, if you're looking for something with a little padding, look elsewhere. This is not padded at all. The case is essentially the outer plasticy layer and an inner fleecy layer.

I bought these speakers for size alone as my wife teaches and she has limited space on her AV cart.I received them promptly and they were shipped and packaged well.They do get an a+ for size....They offer sound equivalent to their price point.My only complaint is they are not loud enough. Even in a quiet classroom, the students in the back have trouble hearing them.I have since ordered a pair of Logitech X140's to replace them.
Didn't come with wires, instructions, proper box nor did it barely fit in my computer.I haven't turned it on yet so not sure if it's alive.

The N-150 can be good with a couple of tweaks. First, upgrade to Windows 7 Home Premium (Windows 7 Starter STINKS!!!!) Then, upgrade the memory to 2GB. And last, get Trend Micro Titanium Security for Netbooks (It will not take up much hard drive space, and runs quietly in the background). Also get rid of as much pre-installed crapware you can find. Do this, and you got a really fine Netbook.

Nice product, but don't expect premium sound. My only real complaint about this headset is that when I'm stretching, doing Yoga, etc. and laying on my back, the headset falls off of my neck. It needs a little rubber clip to hold the two ends of the necklace together so when you are prone it doesn't fall off. Voice quality is good, not great.
This works quite well, but the blue light is very light and at night you either have to unplug it, or live with a bright nightlight in the room in which you use it.

Its maybe a couple bucks too expensive but it will work. Fits kinda loose but will provide some protection. I was under the impression that it would be a 2 piece protector with hard plastic bumpers on the corners and back but it isn't. All it is, is a piece of very soft, grippy rubber or silicone. My kid doesn't really like it but until I find something reasonably priced and durable it is gonna do.
it doesn't fit on a mac very nicely...It's visible and looks kinda sloppy...I was expecting something more rubbery, but this was more plasticy

This is really just a sleeve for your iPod. It doesn't have much in the way of protection other than to keep it from being scratched. Which is fine if that is what you are looking for. Once you get it on don't expect to get it off. I had to cut mine off when I went to a case with more of a solid feel.

The silicon case does fit the Flip HD Ultra, however, the area where the tripod would be attached is covered by silicon thus making it a requirement to remove the silicon case before using a tripod with the Ultra.
Product worked well for a year then just completely quit, had to be replaced by an MP3 player.

I'm quite unhappy that after paying near a hundred bucks for this unit that the screen has a banner add consuming almost half the screen!  $90 for this and they claim the ads help keep the price down.  Ha!  Greed is what it is.Over all the unit is nice, lots of aps/channels.  But come on?  An ad window on the desktop?  Booo.

Well, mine failed after about 2 months, but getting a replacement under the warranty was simple enough. Just called the number on the website. I've had Kingstons before with no issues, so the replacement should do the trick.

This works to connect my laptop with HDMI output to a VGA monitor. The picture quality isn't very good, as would be expected. It failed connecting a Netgear PushToTV to a VGA Monitor. I originally purchased it to connect the latter device to a projector, but that's a no-go. So, beware what you buy it for.
The bottom of this case is very thin just in front of the recharge plug. I expect it to break soon. Otherwise, it works as stated.
not bad, it nothing amazing about this set.  great to have around to work on your sealed tech gear, iPod/iPhone/iPad or Mac Mini.

I'm a Sony fan, own 5 Sony Cameras or camcorders at present (1 for me, 1 for the wife, one Sony High-end Camcorder for the practice, one for the family, and one older Camera that the kids use now).  Bought this case for the w170 - fits, if a bit snug.  Only issue is that it has open sides at the top which allow weather in and that's not ok in a case for a $250 camera IMHO.
Bought this for my FAT ps3 and it did not work. Had to give it away to my brother who has the ps3 slim.
This card requires 2 PCI slots.  Make sure you have the room to install it in your machine before you buy.

These headphones are great for my workouts, but inevitably after about 3 months I have to start fiddling with the connector in my MP3 player in order to get sound to come out. Usually after 6 months they are completely useless. I've probably gone through 3 pairs of these things now, but I think it's impossible to find sport headphones that actually last. Someone please correct me if I'm wrong.
The battery works great. I understand it is Sony, but compare to its competitor brands such as Maxwell, it is overpriced.
It is a little to slippery for my taste, but others who I shared it with think it is fine.  Just personal taste I guess.

Seller offers this as a "new" and a "refurbished" item.  I purchased New, but received Refurbished.  Amazon offers a money back guarantee, but I'm going to keep it anyhow.  It doesn't make sense to pack up and return and order another one, just to save a dollar or two.  Still, I'm a little disappointed I didn't get what I ordered.Who refurbishes a mouse?

This cover works extremely well to protect this device, but when the whole package is put together it is pretty heavy. I use it in my lap in a chair, so that keeps the weight from being too much of an issue. if you are going to be using this device on the run, I suggest finding a lighter weight way to protect the kindle.
Had it on the Xmas tree as it was hard to get to the plug. It stopped working with the remote. It is probably the battery but it was only hooked up a week- not good.
A nice bag, but too big for small point&shoot and not quite enough for my latest mirror-less interchangeable lens camera.

If you are going sons you have to have a bridge. Plug your ethernet cable from your internet control box into your bridge and add sons components. This case works for the most part.  It fits the Samsung tablet but one of the USB ports is difficult to access when the cover is on.
Buttons are small and sound is not very loud.It's a good idea but we have not gotten muchvalue from this purchase.

This is simply okay. It technically does charge my phone. It technically does what it says it does. Unfortunately, it does not charge quickly and the fold away prongs are annoying because they tend to fold away when I'm plugging this in.

The quality isn't like from built-in CD player or mp3 player. It does the job, sometimes the station won't pick up because interfere with radio station, so you have to switch and match the channel. Its save me some money rather spend $300 to install mp3 player in the car. :D

I purchased this hoping to use it on the inside of an aircraft canopy.  It doesn't stick very well on places where the glass is more than just slightly curved.  My camera fell off a few times before I gave up on it.  I have, however had nothing but success attaching it to the inside of car windows.
Well, they are almost giving these away now, but hey they still do the job.
For the price it is a good product. Does not have good finishes, but fits well. Unfortunately tabler supported to maintain is a bit flimsy, it can look but not touch because of the risk of falling.

Try the Samsung DA-F60, it is smaller, has better sound, has better bass, has the same features, and it is cheaper.

definitely can understand why people aren't pleased with it.It does seem like it makes the ambient sound more noisy in the left while working perfectly on the right. Got it for my Nexus 10 and does not work at all.  It does work for my Galaxy SIII.  Too bad but not a total loss.
This Apple Lightning USB Cable charges quickly but the price is really high because it's Apple. If it was a little cheaper, I would have rated it higher.
AS expected, Cowboy Studio products is the line of things I want to use as I am confident that it works well.Havent used the umbrella yet as I have the white one to it, so i am sure it works well.

Got these because I tend to listen to audiobooks, so I didn't mind the cheapness for this usage.  Problem?  I can't keep them in for too long because I've experienced discomfort.  You'll have to buy earbud foam covers because they didn't have any.  Other than that they have good sound.

This remote was worth it when selling for $40. But now it is apparently a discontinued model that some merchants hope you will pay 3x for.Also, after initially liking it, we used it less and less because the interaction with TiVo was flaky at times.

Not great, but better than the "dead" battery I just replaced!  Now, let's see how long this one lasts (the 1st replacement I purchased lasted about 18 months).
Just what you'd expect for $3. This is a necessity so you don't scratch your screen. This is OK. Takes forever to get from China.
This was a gift I gave over the Xmas holiday, so I don't really know how well it did, but I got no complaints.

This is a great cheap 802.11n card, but it only works with the most recent drivers, which are NOT included on the CD or on Sabrent's website.For Windows users, this means that you MUST go to the website for Ralink (the manufacturer of the chipset) and download the drivers for the RT2860. Without those, the card will have very low signal strength, stop working after standby, etc...

Everything is good except for this one cable. This one cable is sending the signal but it just won't deliver the sound so I had to use another cable for this one cable not working. I wish the return window is wider range but too bad that I found out the problem after about a month.

Pros:1) Great price2) Looks good3) The grey one is sexy4) Has essential pockets for sunglasses, pens, flash drives, books, charger, portable hard drive etc.Cons:1) No proper padding at all, the part against the back, neighter the straps.2) Inside is a light grey which can easily get dirty3) That innovative strap holder is a WARNING, it can bruise your hands badly
Easy to pair, and produce decent sound.  Controls are easy to use.  They are fairly comfortable, but not so good when wearing glasses.
I haven't been able to connect to Wi-Fi yet. I'm not a tech geek but have never had trouble with any other Wi-Fi equipment.

Worked great for me for many years. I really loved that this unit was waterproof. I only gave it 3 stars because the signal reception was VERY weak. It would go in and out under the slightest tree cover. I recently cracked the screen on this unit and upgraded to the new Etrex models, which are of course much better. Wasn't the GPS's fault, but rather mine as I put it in a checked bag at the airport.

We purchased a few of these and upon taking them out of the package we noticed that one was already broken. We have rigged it to make it work but it still is a pain as it occasionally falls apart and we have to put it back together - when this happens the alarm very audibly beeps. Kind of a pain but it gets the job done once rigged. Not sure I would buy again unless it was reinforced/redesigned.

Many love their high-end Otterbox smart phone cases. Phones are basically wrapped in a capsule like case, total protection.Not this one. This is a better cut and fit silicone case (compared to those cheap ones), that is all. The screen part is not protected, what a let down.
This was a very inexpensive mount, however it's not the best I have come across.  The TV basically sits on two turn screws.  I think there should be better support to hold the TV.

Please be mindful that output is (only) 6 watt and the lowest frequency response is 80Hz. Compared to cheap & non-premium-brand 2.1 system s(with subwoofer), this product generates weak sound. I understand it is by design. I know I am giving up something for the ability to carry around the speakers. For this price, hmm, I'm not sure if I can really recommend.
No integration with Windows 7 without additional software = -1 starStupid track managemet = -1 star.Very complicated to use.
I bought two of these cables to work with my Galaxy S4 but the design of the cable end does not allow it to fully insert into the Galaxy S4 port.

This thing is awkward. this cable was very well described came on time and I was very pleased with it would recommend it to anyone
Why not go with refurbished if it's going to work? That was my take with this and it served my purpose in my small apartment.

I bought this so I can use headphones I already have to dj with.I was working great until one day I tried plugging in my headphones &it didn't fit... Idk what happened but it was disappointing.3 stars I wish it lasted longer. Will be buying a better quality adapter.

....but falls short in my opinion unless you're an iPhone owner. I purchased this lens because I really wanted something for really low light shooting. Problem is that this lens is soft when used wide open which kinda defeats the purpose of having a f/1.4 lens. It might work for you but I will just stick to using my 24-70L.

Not that easy to use as expected, I had to threw one away on my first attempt and the second attempt was not flawless either. It has a sticker that requires some effort to remove. I would buy it again though since once it is placed on the screen it looks absolutely clear.

i had known about the stupid design of the different legnths of the cable/wire to each ear....one wire is 6 inches the other 14 inches,this flaws the overall comfort of the buds when u are moving or working out one earbud is constantly being tugged out your earthe sound reproduction is great...but whos idea was the cable,come on sennheiser wake up..silly silly design

Things fit ok, however I am very disappointed at the cheap quality of the product. The zipper pull tabs come off easily and get lost.

But I really only bought it for the sub, as I already have two near-field studio monitors.As a system, the output is pretty weak. As the other reviewer mentioned, there is a real lack of midrange. This is probably fine if all you listen to is hip-hop, but with any other style of music, it really suffers.Should also work fine for gamers, but it's not a surround system, so why bother?
Works okay as long as you get around the front of the camera and not to far away. A good buy for the money.

3 stars because although it says it fits two drives, it would be near impossible for the cables to fit nicely right next to each other. That pain in the butt alone is why 3 stars vs 4 or 5. Otherwise its great.
I'm not a professional and I don't use the flash that often so this product wouldn't work for me.  I have tested it and it's alright though it's only designed to fit on their own product.
Good write speeds, but not earth shattering. Unit gets hot while transferring large files. Overall, somewhat disappointed. Is actually quite large. Would not buy another

The product is only a 750mAh. It was my mistake to assume that "1500" in the title, "Sanyo NEW 1500 eneloop 4 Pack AAA Ni-MH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries" meant 1500mAh.Though eneloop batteries are pretty good in terms of long life, it cannot sustain the power when used inside devices like camera flash, shavers, etc. which draw a lot of power. You will end up charging your battery very often.
The wires worked as directed and there isn't much to say about them other than they worked as designed - they are okay.

These headphones have pretty good detail, and good bass, but the trebles are extrememely hot and the mids are almost missing. I like the Otterbox, but it is just to bulky and has a plasticky feel.  It offers good protection, but for waterproof-ness you need the Life Proof case

quality of the microphone is 5 starsquality of the sound is 5 starsbut you cannot have it over your ears more than 5 minutes cause it's not comfortable. it is great for a short call with skype, but if you are going into a conference call, you will need to move it away from your ears after a while

Ever since I plugged this in the first time to my Win 7 PC and it self-installed its drivers, my computer keeps emitting the USB connect (disconnect) sound randomly, several times a day.  Other than that annoyance, it does work. Also the USB sockets are pretty stiff to plug in and out like someone else mentioned.

None of my devices (camera, headset, webcam) work on any of the ports.  How hard can it be to make this thing?Update March 2013: the nice people sent me another unit and it is better. Can't beat the price, so give it a try.

Development is lacking some. Interface is not up to par with today's touchscreen standards. I had the intention of plugging my phone in and forgetting it. works gud i can only see so far.. guess its wat a few bucks will buy u anyway. i like it

I think that this remote has the advantage of the menu button, but this is only to lock the cradle with the remote. The functios are teh same like another controls that cost 10 dollars. The unique difference is that has the apple design (a little more quiality of the remote)

interesting but I think the space on the main tablet is perhaps just a bit smaller than idea.  It is well constructed but the useable area I do think compromises what you can draw and create.

Easy to hook up and use. The only thing is I tried everything to have the person I was speaking to hear my words clearly. They said it had hissing and distortion. I ordered a different speakerphone so I will see how that works.
Works fine, however the layout of the socket, switch, etc., did not match the cutout of my HP case.  I had to notch some sheet metal with tin snips.  That might be an HP thing.

This is my 2nd cloth back drop. They work fine but since I am not able to leave it up, it sucks having to steam it everytime I use it. I fold it and hang it on a hanger but it doesn't matter. If you aren't able to leave it up 100% of the time, I would recommend looking at a vinyl instead.

I purchased two of these at two different times.  It works and has a pretty good sound, it is just cannot get very loud (a lot of background noise will easily drown it our). I had some old 1950's slides that had mold (?) spots. I read good reviews on this product and ordered it. I tested it first on some unimportant film and it worked fine. Unfortunately on one of my important slides it scratched it. I was also using the "tiger cloth" so not sure what could have scratched.  I still recommend it but be very careful and test first.

I use this for one of my two monitors and it works good.  It was hard to install since the hand screws are small and don't have slots to use a screwdriver to tighten them.  Wished they had a larger hand screws on them, then this would be a great product. Other than that it works well.

Very weird feeling the first time i wore em. Slightly uncomfortable but it does keep out sound. Not for me.
This one is small.  But ventilation is poor for this and I end up buying an extra case fan for this.  Also the hard drive bay's screw position is a little funny.
Looks good, and it works. But you still need a separate case or bag for the cable and other parts.
Works just as well the OEM battery did, and looks like it as well. Although neither of the batteries last very long on a single charge.

Super build quality and great look but difficult to mod for practical use.  This will require some time to fit all hardware appropriately as well as a few tools and little muscle.  Be careful with the face though its super fragile.
Very hard to put on and get all the bubbles out.I finally had to take it off and throw it away.

The camera keeps showing - please change battery pack after every 6-7 snaps. When you switch on and off it gets fine. Really annoying. Used the original NB-6L and the problem went away. Quite annoying. Though if you are fine doing the switch on-off, this does last forever.
But the lcd screen was to small.  I  kept this one for my wife and ordered one with a larger display screen.

As others have indicated:- Plug layout only works well with standard plugs that aren't bricks/transformers; too compact for those.- USB output, even with one connected -- much less two -- seems a little low.

Antenna does give better reception than the two rabbit ears digital antennas I tried but still must be turned a little this way and that to bring in the same persistently annoying channels we originally were having problems. Clearly an outside antenna is what is needed, but the Terk has made most of our viewing a little easier.
This will come in handy if I lose my original cord or if a visiting family member forgets their cord, but it is bulkier than I thought it would be.
Nice little hub. True USB 2.0 technology. Suggested improvements would include better apacing between sockets to accomodate larger USB plugs, indicator light to signify power availability to unit.

The keys on the retina macbook pro are slightly shorter than the keys on the old macbook pro so there is a slight ridge around every key. I don't find the cover especially difficult to type on, but I haven't been doing a huge amount of typing yet. The color is beautiful and the keys don't leave residue on my screen.

I bought and returned these for only one reason, they are not true over the ear headphones, but rather, a hybrid of over the ear with an "In the ear" ear bud.  I did not catch this detail in the product description, and I really don't like ear buds.  Other than that, they were everything other reviewers said they were; very light with great sound !If the ear bud feature doesn't bother you, then these would be great !
this radios don't have the range with the small antenna that come with it, I will have to try difference ant with this radios
It is certainly worth every cent Price tan other brands. It is excellent for boats of all sizes and types

to start it is not 3000 watt more like 1800. i can make it hit like my old 2000 watt xplore amp with a crossover, but by itself it pounds slightly better than my 1600 watt pyramid artic amp that i run on my pyramid 400+400 each 6x9's.i am thinking of running this 3000 to my 6x9's and getting another 1600 artic to pair up with my subs.
I bought two variations of this type of strap and ended up returning this one because it seemed like it would cut into my hand with prolonged holding.

Does what it is supposed to do but the housing at the mini plug end is a little too big to fit through my iPhone's Otter box case, which means I have to take the iPhone out of the case in order to connect the iPhone to my stereo receiver.
its ok, it wont hold all the accessories and the charger for my click, it does fit my click, but bought a replacement case that has handles and a bigger storage area

Radio has lots of nice features and generally works quite well. I live in a hilly area and reception is at times spotty. Also use at a local harbour and the reception is great. Location will dictate reception. Have been unable to get any SW reception. Nice size and great battery life.

Bought this December 2011.  It gave more cordless time for the laptop.  The computer is messaging that the battery does not have much time left.  Definitely does not last as long as the original.  At $34 each, just buying the Dell original may be worth it.

These are not terrible speakers by any means. But they definitely aren't great speakers either. I know they are mostly meant for highs but i really feel i could have gotten more for my money. If you really want to crank up your systems i would not recommend these speakers.

Traffic features are allright... I don't think they will ever be able to "perfect" that.Be careful buying a refurbished model.  I wasn't able to update the maps and I had to explain that the original owner didn't' own it anymore and that I bought it off Amazon.  Mine was registered under someone else's name and it took a few minutes for the to register through the thick skull of the "support" person at TomTom.

This works well for my home media center and when I want to use a separate keyboard for a laptop quickly, but it's still wireless and runs on batteries so it's not perfect, but probably about as close to it as they can get.  Could be a security risk if you're worried about people snooping on your key entries over the air.
had 4 sets returned to get a set that wasnt DOA, it was never both sticks just one. hand tested i think not. other than that good memory if you get one that works.

This speaker worked really well for about 1-2 months. After that it seems like every time it was used, the sound quality gradually got worse and worse. However, it did sound pretty good at first, and it's plenty loud. Good compact size, but somewhat cheaply made.
It changes the thickness of the tablet. I wish it were slimmer and less heavy.They could also incorporate some pockets for accessories.

The case fits perfectly on the new iPad, everything is fine, the sleep/wake function works perfectly fine. It's just the viewing angle, it's too high. There is only ONE angle. You have to sit quite low if you wanna use it comfortably. I regret that I bought this item because the most important thing is if you can use your iPad comfortably for playing and typing, not only for viewing pictures.
perfect fit. but a little bit thick and i expect  kind of thiner one I used in my another laptop.

It is a nice tripod and worth the money. My son uses it with a Nikon Coolpix P510 camera and it is sturdy enough. However, I do not recommend this tripod for DSLR cameras specially if you use one of the heavier telephoto lenses.
Same old player. Not worth the additional money.The web browser is a joke. Thats why I took it back. It is pretty much useless.
Easy to,install and configure.  But, it really didn't add much capability as I had hoped.  Didn't interface with my NAS very well.  Doesn't interface with DVR (thanks Directv).

Extremely sharp imaging.  Too bright by twice for matching monitor to color printer.  Not able to adjust brightness to the level recommended by Datacolor Spyder4Pro.  Photographers beware  -------  NO BUILT-IN GAMMA ADJUSTMENT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!This monitor throws a lot of heat.  If you are a "pixel peeper" or otherwise place this monitor closer than about 18 inches from your face it is like looking into a blast furnace!

Got it to use with a lav mic for webcam videos. It hums -- probably not shielded. Should be fine for headphones, though. The jacks are nice and tight, and the cable isn't kinky-stiff like those pvc-jacketed cables.Get it for headphones, but not for computer microphone.

What do you expect.  It is a $40 dollar router.  I use for my home network and haven't had really any problems at all.  This review is based on those facts and those facts alone.  I don't do any manual configuring besides using EasyLink advisor.

I mean, it does the job so I can't complain. But it's super sensitive: a little wiggle can mean the difference between no signal detected and a great connection. But since I got it only for 99 cents, I aint got no problems with dat xD
This is a nice idea if you must have a waterproof case for your phone. It would not make it as a routine case though as it is way too bulky.
This plug may be polarized but it DOES NOT HAVE a grounding prong, making it useless for all but the most trivial appliances.

I purchased these speakers to replaced a 12 year old set of Lansing Altecs with woofer. These speakers were not an improvement. The volume isn't very loud on either computer and the the quality isn't that great for such an expensive setup.

This filter is working fine for me now. Only complaint is it was very difficult to thread on my Nikkor lens.  Recently got a new lens and spent more for B&W. Difference was night and day.  I have not tried adding a color filter but expect the B&W will be superior

So far so good. This was a presemt for my wife. She has a nice I-pod classic but it does not have FM radio built in. The FM is needed at the gym so she can watch the various televisions while working out. The gym broadcasts the audio on various FM frequencies.Very light weight and battery life is excellent.I was surprised to learn though that the organization of music is very limited.

I have Bose products and many other speaker systems and know what good things sound like. I am really disappointed. They feel great! and look great! And do have decent sound, just nothing that impressive. You can hear everything, the cancel out nothing. So that makes them terrible for mowing the lawn or air plains or to drown out a baby crying.
The plugs are a bit loose and could fit better, but otherwise it succeeds in it's mission, which is to extend the length of my USB connection.
Maybe I just did not read the fine print. The product is OK but it is plastic. I thought it was more stronger material. Let's see how long it lasts.
Works great in the US, a big waste of time in France.  In France, it didn't work at all.  Wasted my time sending me in circles.

This cover offered basic protection in that it covered the back of the iPod, but really offered nothing else. I have a screen protector on the front, but this case seemed like a strong wind could make it fall off the the mp3 player. It didn't provide the protection I really wanted for my iPod, but it did make it look pretty. :)
Last much longer, twice the size and it too will eventually not hold a full charge.  That's just the was batteries work.
3 star I got this for my grandson, it was ok to me now well sturdy. I would recommend it for a girl better than a boy
the cam is little small but for that much I can not complain about this cam thank you amazon if need get it it is worth the money

I bought this for my mom's Samsung Galaxy Tab3 7" and the case is cute, love the colors & patterns however, I gave it three stars because its somewhat flimsy and basically cheap material. Well, it cleans smudges but leaves fiber on the glass. I tried to wash it. It become better, but still leaves fiber on the glass.

No problem getting it setup and ready, but it frequently looses connection and using it for streaming to the other end of the house is difficult with this device. Should have stayed with the Netgear for this and upgraded to AV.

got the adapter and it would not work.  I kept looking and trying to figure out why and low and behold there was something deep inside it that was in the way of the light.  It looked like a piece of the plastic or something.  must not have been totally shaved off or something.  got a pen and was able to get rid of the blockage.  works great now.used on an apple airport express for streaming itunes

This little gizmo seems to work ok, although I'm sure if I used a "real" level to check if it was truly level, I'm guessing it would be a bit off. The problem is that it doesn't fit as snugly in the hot shoe as I would have hoped. For what I do, it's just a rough guide and that's fine. If you're looking for a precision instrument, this isn't it.

I used this to amplify music during my Christmas eve gathering, but found at the highest volume levels on any setting there was some distortion. At lower levels the sound is actually quite good. As of yet, I'm hard pressed to find a regular use for this speaker, but have thought about how it might come in handy when I'm camping or completely away from other methods of music amplification.
This short extension cords are great when you need one for plugging in the chunky power power packs in the last outlet.

The large number of false alarms with this unit limits its usefullness. The display is also difficult to see so one has to rely on the sound for warnings. The compass is so difficult to see against a bright background that it is also useless.
they have made better

I already own a great collection of closed can , such as Bose Q3 , Shure 840 , ATM-50 , so I decided to add an open back one and I chose this due to user reviews , The reason I gave it  3 stars is because they get distorted at high volume especially id used with the FiIo E12 , but at low volume the sound pretty nice but have to admit the Shure wins.
the product its great but it really has a big problem with the zipper! i have fix it like 4 times but it breaks again! I hate it!!
did not hold up to my rough handling.  cracked within weeks.  worked as a protective filter. bought new one for lens

Had to send this one back. It does not have a headphone jack. The description didn't say it did but pretty much thought that would be included. If you don't need the headphone jack then this would be a good unit for the price.

I bought these because I wanted something that kept the headphones in my ears. They do a very good job at that. But I stopped using them because the sound quality is not very good. Bass is acceptable, but it changes the mids and highs a bit and I don't care for it.
Works well enough, although I should have expected a limited broadcast range due to the size. The Toshiba stack drivers work better than the included drivers.

This battery doesn't last very long but if you are looking for something cheap that'll do the trick by giving you an extra LITTLE boost, this is your battery pack.It isn't very expensive so if you wan't something cheap and will give you a little boost of battery this is the product for you!

the packaging was very good. It protected the memory well I never expected that amount of protection. I place the memory into my computer and it read up I now have 3gb of memory it is working so good so far. thank you

Hi i bought this item for linux mint 16 and it does not work with it but i used it on my laptop and it looked great!

This is a great product and hard to find online. I paid $9 for that but just found out there is a similar cheaper product for $5 at Home Depot store.

Fits correctly. Does not seem to want to hold a charge very well. When un plugged and mac book asleep the next day little if any charge left. The original battery held the charge while asleep for days.

I bought two of those. It works ok when the distance between it and the source is almost nothing.I would buy it again, only in short range distance scenarios.It takes sometime for it to self configure, compared to others I own.

limited number of apps. No direct support for Amazon Prime and with tab casting video quality sucks. I am returning this.However if you are going to play using the apps I think quality will be very good.It does not work for my situation.

this is a nice fast chip but really not worthwhile at this point. Most applications aren't going to use the chip fully and only a few people who do the intensive rendering etc. will even notice the difference. So for 3x the price, better off spending the extra money on better graphics card, video and storage. I'm glad people are buying it to help subsidize the rest of their chips though.

This replacement cap is not as good a fit as my original Nikon cap, but it works well enough and for less money. It would make for a good backup if you (like me) frequently loose thing like this. No big complaints.

I ordered these for my son who was into the whole walkie-talkie thing, these did the job but the button to "talk" was too hard for his little fingers, i would hear him in the other room trying to talk to me, just NOT over the walkie-talkie. I primarily chose this cover because it was under $20. The cover was factory sealed, but was nicked on the front edge. Also, it has a bump that extends into the viewing area. I will shave it off with an X-acto, but it's irritating.

This happened a few months prior. Card lasted 5-6 months, tops. -3 stars.

I have 3 computers and use this to color correct the monitors. On 2 of my computers, the software is a constant source of trouble when there is an update. Don't know why either. This camera works great on Windows with the drivers but its biggest drawback is not supporting the same software for Mac OSX. That means you cant adjust anything or zoom on any Macintosh. That's why the 3 stars. If you are just windows its a great and very nice camera.

I really like this monopod. I didn't use the head because I don't need to pan, I'm more interested in using it outside for taking shots and if I wanted to pan, I'd bring my tripod. My only complaint is that the foot comes off, easily without any effort. Under the foot is just a tiny ball, which will easily be damaged after a hike or a day out on the town.

I use this to hook up my Macbook Pro to my 42" TV.  It is nice that it carries audio on the cable, so the sound comes out of my TV, too.  This lasted about a year before it stopped working.  Not sure if that is an acceptable lifespan.

Well-constructed, and classy looking. May be a bit of overkill, as GPS units normally(?) come with their own small cases that can be dropped in one's pocket/purse. This certainly provides enhanced protection but is too large to be carried easily on a routine basis.

Fast "enough" better than netbook, the right price, keyboard is quite good for my use, screen pretty good, The only gripes I have is the display does not go back far enough, and fingerprints really show up on the surface since its got a gloss finish.
The plastic case is cheap and the connection with the cable detaches very easily, I'm the fence about it, kind of so-so.
I'm neither thrilled nor disappointed with this purchase.  For the price, it seems to work well.  Plug it in, press the button, and talk.  People sometimes talk back.  It works.
It's okay if you use the full length, otherwise the line doesn't hold weight of wet clothes. Small garments are fine, but anything larger like a shirt or trouser can take the line down.

This strap would be great, if it was a bit longer. The strap is quick release and easy to install. Extended to it's full length it only sits in the upper-middle chest, which is pretty awkward. Unless this sounds good to you, avoid it.

This thing would not hold a small camera in place when wrapped around a small tree branch, it is ok if you want to sit it down some place to take a picture. I wanted some thing to wrap around  small branches to take pictures and Video of birds.
The cables work as intended.  One of the cables, I occasionally had to shake to get to work.  I took it apart and fixed it(easy fix).  Now it works just fine.

I bought this because it seemed to have more consistent reviews than the really cheap chargers, but was much less expensive than the high-priced chargers. The connector to the iPod is a bit stiff, but it works fine.

Our big ol' attic antenna needed some help so I added this to the loop.  It has an optional power injector/amplifier that actually degraded the signal when I plugged it in.I cannot explain it, but at this point, if it ain't broke I ain't going back up in the attic to fix it.
I purchased two Nikon Coolpix L18 years ago and found the product to be average for the price.  It has a pretty good zoom for a point-and-shoot camera.

I bought this from the Play Store, and while it does fit the Chromebook perfectly, it is very thin and would do nothing to protect the Chromebook in the event of a drop.  There are more durable alternatives available for 1/3 of the price.

The monitror matches the clients other NEC monitor and was good for multiple screens.  They didn't care whether the monitor was used or not.
I put this on and it protect my tablet fine. the only issue is that it does not line up to the screen. it is too big for the tablet. that is why i gave 3 stars

I have just change camera and I am trying to reassemble to fit my new one.  I am sure it will be fine.

The cable works fine (no compatibility issues with iOS 7), so I ended up using my grinder to shave off some of the plastic. It's not pretty but the connector fits now.

I bought the Westinghouse TX-42F430S 1080p television and this HD-DVD unit.  But, the two hate each other and I could not get any video.  This is also well documented in the AVS forums.  I don't know which to blame.  Probably the TV.  But I wanted to warn everyone.
Not as soft as original equipment.  Ok for the money.  Will probably buy again instead of spending money on original equipment.

Replacement for a Craig branded digital converter.  This one doesn't hold the stations as well.  Still have a Craig converter in the front room and it pulls more stations and more importantly holds them better. This iView has many more features but fails at its primary function of tuning.
I've used one of the protectors but it seems to collect finger prints worse than the screen so I've decided to go without the protector for now.
Overall works good. Worth the price definitely. Wish it had more wire so I could hook it up so it's  on whenever the car is on, but I suppose I'll have to just buy more wire.
I suppose this is worth it if you cannot get any wireless reception whatsoever but I get a strong 13mbps through wireless and a weak 6mbps when using this.

I did not realize the stand is not made for a Kindle Fire HD and ordered the wrong thing, but I gave it to my grandson who has a standard Kindle. I received this cleaning set for my camera and lenses and thought its cool. Not much to say about this at the moment.

There were some things we liked about this, but more things we didn't. After using PCs for years, we found the sparse screens and options a little confusing. The Pogo Radio Your Way is a brilliant idea. Sort of like Tivo for radio. The unfortunate problem is...the radio has poor reception. Even the 50,000 watt stations on AM were filled with static. Probably over-priced but I had gift cards and needed something for my wireless keyboard and mouse. It works so what else can I say?

I bought this for my work. I use it as package scanning system for my office. This thing runs out of power in two days with just slighly use. I have to charge it almost every other day with light usage. I would recommend Asus or Sony.

Fairly easy to setup, mainly creating an account on TrendNets site and register the camera under your login. Makes access from anywhere-easy. Good camera lens but the mounting bracket is poorly thought out.

When this flash works, it works well. I can't always count on it to fire even when I force that option. I purchased it mainly as an inexpensive external flash so it's still useful to me. My Canon speedlight far out performs the Yongnuo.

The adapter worked fine but was quite slow. Even after connecting at 150Mb to the router I would still only get 600KB in transfers between my server and my PC. The adapter would work fine for basic internet use but not for LAN traffic.

I bought these in order to play online multi-player games as well as for VOIP.  For their price the set works fine though it's important to keep the audio lower than expected otherwise what you hear is perceptible to the microphone.  I am still using them and find them sufficient at a good price.  They will certainly do until I have found a set that is less susceptible to the ear phones conducting into the microphone.

The hardware is absolutely wonderful, built extremely well. The software is the issue with this device. It is SO buggy and SLOW. There are a decent amount of services available but it is SO slow. The only reason I keep it is because you can plug a USB stick in and watch basically any format of video on it. It does have great video and sound quality but like I said the software is bad.

Side was quite small for the 8x21 and cool, but the quality of the picture wasn't as good and crisp as I was expecting.I give it a 3 stars out of 5 because I thought it could have been better.I'll try some other to see if it worst than this, and if they worst, I'll boost this to 4 stars.

pliers are magical! I used mine to connect my dslt to my monitor. the plus+ sign portion did not fit correctly I just matched up what was used on my monitor receptacle and pulled the extra teeth from this adapter. 3 weeks delivery time from China but it works great now.

that's a great product, but the volumen level is poor, and it's an battery eater, so, you have to buy a Ni batterys.

Wish i look around more instead of purchasing this. A year later and its still going strong but i paid too much for this.

This little speaker is easy to pack, and does work as advertised. it was easy to sync to multiple devices. The battery life is good, at least so far. I was able to pick up some stations but only in one room of the house which wasn't the room I needed. So I returned it. Looking at a couple other options but in Alaska, an outdoor antenna might be the only option that works.

This is my fault for not reading all the find details...if they were there. Pros: These are great if you have difficulty finding ear buds that fit your ears (even one ear as opposed to the other).Cons: They pop off the headphones far too easily.  I have had to dig through my bag to chase down a rogue earbud more often than not.

The image quality, especially around the edges suffers, but because of there small size compared to carrying a lens, leave them in the back pack, and if the need is there, better than nothing.

they are jumpers not much to say here, they are made fine and should last me for the duration of the projects I have planned.

The product is awesome, sounds great, connects easy and the two alarms are perfect. The condition of the clock/Radeo was not as described and not shown in a photo which would have given me a better idea of exactly what I was buying. Not 100% happy since it was a Christmas pressent for my wife.

works as well as a SD card can i guess, but its not 64gb its (59.45GB) not like it really is all that big a deal but i just found it strange.

Just like my title says, it helps with focus a little bit.  But it's nothing compared to the good old split focusing screens.  Why can't someone make one for Canon 5d?  I would buy that thing in an instant.

The picture shows a chip density of 16 chips.  The actual density is 8 chips.  That's an important distinction in an HP laptop.  It won't work in a Pavilion if the original SODIMM's have a chip density of 16 chips.  It's not a problem with the memory, just the product picture is fatally misleading.  Had to return and get Kingston 16-chip modules.

I used this to hook up DVD player with my old SANYO TV. Cable signal also go through it to TV. Before I use it, the TV signal is clear. After I used it, signal of some, not all, channels became noisy with rolling stripes.
It works wonderfully. The only thing that disappointed me was the usb able that it came with is quite short. Only about a 1 foot long.

My old dell dimension 4300 finally gave up the ghost. I used it as a network file server with 3 old ide hard disk drives. New PC's only have SATA connections so I bought this to transfer my old data to a new 3tb external drive. It works as expected and I was able to save the data from all three drives.

I purchased this walkman to listen to talk radio and some music while I putz around or workout.  Don't bother with this Sony if you plan on moving around. Lightweight and easy to apply, non-intrusive, fits the iPod like a glove. Nothing fancy or anything, I actually like cases that have a little more bulk to them, but most people like to keep their media players as light and compact as possible. This works for those purposes.

I was very pleased with the sound quality of these speakers, and found that they indeed captured the music very well. As far as musical quality goes, they indeed enhanced my listening. Nonetheless, there are headsets with equally good or better quality available for considerably less, and I did not see a degree of performance which would justify the high price.

After first, these headphones are superb. They are clean as hell, and seem to have a wide range. After a month or so, the bass driver of the left channel totally died. It caused an annoying imbalance in the sound, and I had to get rid of them.

This unit has really nice sound, but I need to keep the volume down to keep from disturbing others. Performed fine for one year after purchase, used about 5 times a week.  Failed in service:  snow on 1080p display, then quickly degraded to only 1080i would work, then no signal.  My guess is flexing at the DisplayPort end was the cause of failure, since that's the end that moved around.

It comes as a long wait since it is shipped off shore. Simple and effective for those with a laptop and need to work in the dark, or night time in bed. Gives potentially enough lighting to work a mall keyboard while drawing very little resources.

Pros:  Easy to setup.  Who doesn't love a touch screen.Cons:  Range, the range is about 30 feet for good strong signal.  I lose about 50% of the signal beyond that and this is a straight shot, no walls or anything.  I was expecting it to have better range.

a professional looking lens.outstanding quality metal construction.saved,and waited for this lens a long time.it was going to be my all around most used keeper.then heartbreak!,soft at all settings,poor image quality with a d3.very dissapointed,im so sorry i sold the old 35-70 2.8d.
I was very used to the apple keyboard and bought this to try and save some money. Typing is pretty loud and the size of the keys are a bit tall, otherwise for the price it's really not a bad buy.
Haven't used it to date.  It was ordered so I could stream movies from the MAC to my HD TV.
Good Product.. Came on time.. I wouldn't call it very very good.. The plastic wears out when you use it a lot.. I would buy a better one in the future..

Bought this as a gift to go with my daughter's camera. Was not at all happy with the shipping method.  You pay for shipping and they send it to "or resident" so that they can claim it is "marketing material".  The is nothing special about this, just average.We bought her a different grip from somewhere else that she is much happier with.

For the price it is just OK.  It is very lightly made and I doubt it can handle frequent business travel.  I use it to carry my 17 inch laptop from home to office occassionally.  It has a small amount of storage space in the front section with some pockets and slots, but clearly not for heavy use.
The mic quality is very good for the price, but the batteries run out quickly without any power indicator. You'd need a fistful of batteries to run this mic continuously in a work environment.
I charge mine over night but the max the LED goes is around 2-3  lights.. It DOES charge the phone really well though.. I wish I know forsure I'm paying for 10000mAh battery..

This set would have been worth the money if all of the cross-bar sections would have coupled properly. I put one section together and it took me almost 30 minutes to pry it apart. So only 3 of the 4 sections are useable. I wrote the company to tell them about the issue, but didn't hear a word back from them.
Decent case for any discman. It also has pockets for CDs that can be used for other stuff like headphones. For the price I would recommend buying unless you can find it cheaper somewhere else.
The velcro kept poking my skin and it felt uncomfortable to me. I had also ordered a much cheaper armband here on Amazon that might not look as cool but doesn't feel as uncomfortable. Go figure..
They arrived and looked like they had been through around pretty hard, Very cheap mailing sack did not protect the plugs inside very well. They need to rethink their packaging methods.

The cables did work for most items i used then with but the one thingthat would not work was my apple products. I tried a mac mini and a macbook pro and both would freeze or not boot up using this cable.

I have only attained a speed of 144.5 Mbps on any computer I have put it on. I even had it connected to a Netgear 6300 which runs a 2.4 and 5 Ghz connection with speeds of up to 750Mbps and 1750Mbps. Still only 144.5Mbps. Try another 300 because this one might disappoint you.

It is a solid product to do the job. I bought this one and a Tivax. Tivax is much better in terms of build quality, finding channels. Tivax remote is better in layout. In addition, Tivax has three bottons on the unit that you can operate in case you miss the remote. I would spend the extra $5 to get the Tivax.

I bought this for a Christmas present for my daughter and it worked for 2 days and then the music got distorted. Very easy return to Amazon and a prompt replacement which is still working. Otherwise it is very easy to use and a good value for the price.
I needed to drive 4 monitors from my Shuttle SK41G. This and a 9500 series card are doing the trick. This card is not fast playing video, but it is satisfactory for office work.

This is an average camera - the only thing I really can say is outstanding is the optical zoom.  The rest of the features and functionality are pretty standard.  That's what you get at this pricepoint.  Overall I wouldn't recommend for or against this product, it is overwhelmingly average.  The good thing is that I never had an issue with it.

Depending on how you plan to use this should determine if you buy.  If you are planning on being a heavy typer this is not for you.  This is more for the person that occasional plans on using the full functionality
As a mouse the small size is great for traveling. However please note that the scrolling function of this mouse is bad.

Item was installed in an older PC that needed a higher speed connection for online backups.  This item installed easy enough and has worked for about 1 year with only occasionally dropping connections.
When I buy the 50 pack size they seem okay, but in the 100 packs many skip and some refuse to play entirely.  I'll just stick to buying two 50 packs from now on.
This was listed under full size mouse. I don't have big hands, but I find this mouse too small !
This looks really cool but has a crazy bad smell that just won't go away.  I've had it for months and it still stinks.

Not a tablet for the inexperienced, we found it very hard to use so we sent it back.  There also were few applications that worked with it.  My friend found it easy to use because she had many smart phones and was familiar with the operating system.
Retractable cord works very well.  Only issue I have is mouse is much smaller then expected making it difficult to use.
It's a really cheap product but it does what's supposed to. The only problem I have with it is that it loses video quality on the computer screen.
but  I guess that does not say a lot as most lenses are pretty bad for this system...I am looking forward to the 35 mm 1.8...I hear it is 2nd only to the Zeiss

It's good, not as good as my other senheiser ones, but for the price it's really good, it compares with headphones that cost 2-3 times more, if the size does not matter. well isolated from outside world sound.
This product is still not working the way I want it to - and the way it should. I probably should have kept my old harmony remote. At least it worked.

The product works and is not hard to set up, But I was a little disappointed with the range. I was hoping if would add more range to my laptop from my router but only really gave me 10 more feet of reach. But the product does work.
Once again, If I could find it, I would rate it. I've got a wife and teenage kids who think everything I buy belongs to them or where they want it to be.

Buy cheap, buy often. So far I have been unable to see a clear picture with this camera.The pan/tilt are not smooth but jerky. The IR LEDs don't appear to be working.No instruction come with the camera, Kaicong sends the buyer an EMail with very basic instructions. Customer support was not at all helpful.I haven't found an IP camera software that supports Kaicong camera and  the KaiCong software doesn't work, PERIOD!Is it worth $29, yes

Nice feel, precise tip is great for writing.  However the rubber tip cracks very easily, which is disappointing for the $30 price.I was happily using mine with notetaking apps on my IPad,and the tip cracked only a few weeks after purchase, and i was not applying heavy pressure.
got this some years ago...was good value for the price at the time. not as user friendly as a Nuvi.

IMO this should not be advertised as an 11.6 case.  It is such a tight fit it takes both hands with force getting in to the case, same goes for the removal.  I rarely put it in the case as is intended.  I turn it sideways and lean it up against the back of a chair.  I'm rather disappointed.
The range is not that impressive. I dont really have anything to recommend instead of these but they only get a few blocks in town and do ok when we go camping.

It charges quickly enough via USB cable and has enough capacity to charge my phone back up 2.5 times.  However, even with the additional solar panel add on, it recharges PAINFULLY slowly in the sun.  After three days of full sun it finally reached 50%.  I did "condition" the battery by charging and fully draining several times, and I did remove the film from both the base unit and the solar panel add on.
You can't really complain at this price, however as far as a web cam goes it's pretty bad. But then again, most web cams are.

This timer will do what I need for the most part. There is no adjustment for the 5 second delay mode. A more expensive unit will be needed for more flexibility. The side button is poorly designed and not very solid. Works as advertised.

It is what it is.  A nice cover for my Kindle.  I would have liked it better if it had a pocket for storing credit cards and such for when I travel and take it with me so I don't have to also carry a wallet down to the beach.
these increase reflection, especially when on direct sunlight. When applied on screen, protector makes moving of your finger over the screen a bit harder...

the tips get destroyed easily if kids are using them, but they are very sensitive if you're careful. I had to set 1 aside for my use only and it has lasted a while. the ones the kids use, however, had a more tragic ending. So cheap. So, worth the risk!
The product will do the job but needed additional support because of the weight of the ipad.I am satisfied with my purchase.

This device will not charge new devices that require 2.1a.  This did not work with an ipad or a kindle fire.  This device does do an adequate job of charging my old iPhone 3gs but I don't believe the power output is quite right.  My phone will freeze while it is on the charger and it will sometimes say that this product is not supported.I would not recommend this product.  I have heard good things about the Trent brand

I tried to use this to remove a hum in my speakers connected to two different PCs through a mixer and small amp. It didn't remove the hum, which I later found to be caused by the amp itself. I'm not faulting the isolator but it didn't fix my problem.

This seemed like it would have been a great case.  But it arrived with a broken front paney "easy release" nub broken.  I returned the case for credit since they were out of stock and got a different case from Thermaltake (which I am uber happy with).
Product as described but had problems with it working with Windows 7.

Well, this one is a puzzle.  I've been working with routers since they developed routers and usually have no problems getting them set up.  This one took some trial and error.  Recommended for old pros but not for someone who doesn't have an intuitive feel for networking.
a pain to get on without air bubbles but does the jobI hate that reviews have to be a certain length. So I will just add filler.
the sound is good but if you listen to your music for long periods the in-ear rubber parts start to hurt

Overclocks well and gives pretty decent framerates. This chip is personally not too impressive in my opinion and you're better off getting a more expensive FX chip or just going all the way intel to get good frames. That being said, this is still a great budget chip contender for many.

I was excited to get a softbox, but should have kept digging through Amazon. This item did not come with assembly instructions, and the image shows a diffuser on it...and it came with 2 diffusers that didn't fit it....and then was told that it doesn't come with one. Well, mine came with 2 that can't be used. I'll look deeper next time. You get what you pay for I guess.

I had bought some Skullcandy headphones about 5 years ago that were on-the-ear and I loved them. I wore them until they broke recently. They no longer sold that model, so I went for these. If I wear these for more than an hour or so they make my ears hurt. Not good for use at work, but they do look pretty cool. I'm hoping they'll loosen up eventually.
It is good , but low of low pixel. Also it will be good if it is made of one whole piece rather than pieces you  have to put together.
Took me almost a month to get it. Luckily it was a spare. It good value for the money as long as you don't mind waiting on the shipping.

Very good CD player if you are not anal about non-skipping or other bells and whistles. It serves my purpose(s) perfectly .... even though the 1st one I received was broken. Amazon always makes good on their promises.
a couple of these had pins that were not locked in and pushed out the back when I inserted them. but that's why I always order extra's.

The sound is decent on these earbuds but for my use (mountain biking) they dont stay put in your ears.  I have some soft pads I will add to the buds to see if that helps but if you are looking for earbuds for active use dont get these.  The sound is decent but seems to be lacking in the midrange.  Bass and high end come through decent but the midrange gets washed out with my ipod shuffle.

The A300 sits between the featureless A200 and the A350. It's a good camera, with excellent dynamic range and one of the best Live View implementations out there. However, the kit lens is mediocre to say the least and as a result, the camera's performance is compromised. My camera was defective and even though the problem was not a serious one, I returned it and went for a refund, which I used to buy the new Olympus E520.

My son has this on his 4 wheeler and it sounds great! However he was carrying it and dropped it on the ground, one of the speaker magnets broke off and now only plays through one. Treat with care and don't expect to ride hard with this mounted on ATV.

I received this product in February, installed it with no problem and it worked fine for a while. Then on June 24th, the unit just died and the green LED no longer lights up. I contacted the seller DBRoth on June 26th but received no response. I recontacted DBRoth on July 5th and got a response that their guarantee policy is only good for 30 days. I replied asking for assistance with the manufacturer but received total silence.

These headphones were purchased because they were cheap. And they proved to be just that. They lasted about six months. Then they broke apart and we used the microphone for skype. Then after another six months the microphone ripped off. These aren't built for durability. They worked well enough for us. We're clearly NOT very picky though.

Product is too small for the Snoy RX100 11 as you have to squeeze it in the pouch and hopefully not scratch the LCD screen or the camera lens.  I could not us it as I wanted to however am keeping it house a smaller camera its attachments, wires, extra battery and flash card

The Bushnell powerview 10x32 binoculars are decent for the size/price.  For reference you can read a registration plate clearly from about 50 yards away.  Youre not going to be able to see craters on the moon but they do work well for a cheap little pair of binoculars. They are fully adjustable width wise and have the focus knob that is easy to use.  Sometimes I find it easier to use just one eye with the binoculars.
Had to apply 4 firmware updates before it would work, image quality is just ok. It's worth $75, but not much more. Ended up returning it.

The Slimbook really is nice, love the way it can stand up but the 9.7 Lenovo tablet is smaller than the case.  It keeps it protected but I must remove it from the case to charge it.  For the price it works but not as well as expected.
Unfortunately for the sender, this remote wasn't so great.  It's in need of batteries already and only after riding with it 2 times.  When it works though, it works great.

the netflix 3D movies are not plying as the LG .. i think this TV has an issue with the 3Dnot happy with it

but was so cheap I purchased it for testing.  It won't make it through the commericals but returns to the start (probably why it is a refurb). ... but on-ear wasn't for me. These are quite comfortable initially, but I found that they pinched my ears after about 30 minutes of use. Since I intended these for work use, this was a problem.
