My title sums it up.  The device works OK.  It doesn't have a lot of range and a few times I found myself pushing it again and again.

Pros: a 8GB microSDHC class 4 (instead of class 2 as advertised)Cons:- does not have the SD adapter as advertised (it has a reader instead)- the bulk package consists of 1 microSDHC card and 1 microSD reader. The reader is unusable on win 7 (can not detect the device's driver)
Big storage space and proper price. However it cannot reach 40MB/s. Only about SDHC Class 10 speed. I'd recommend cards made by Sandisk instead.

Nice remote that worked nicely with some of my components. However, I have an older high end mitsubishi TV with no remote. Unfortunately I was not able to find any codes within the remote that could control my TV.

This drive is quick as can be, but it does not like to be found by motherboards as a bootable device. It shows up as a hard drive instead. I formatted with the program Rufus as a workaround, but this could be a pain for some users.If you are just buying this to transfer files and hold your documents, it is a great drive at a great price. Super quick!

I bought this OTG to use with my Dell Venue 8 Pro but it doesn't work, I guess it's my fault because the description didn't say it would.Any buddy know of one that will work with the Dell Venue 8 Pro? After some thought I guess the one star wasn't fair so I changed to 3 star.
This is good for budget follow focus. setup is clunky and bothersome, with no instructions. Will do in a pinch. Handle with care. Seems fragile.
This protective shield gives superior clarity, but it took me two to get one on straight.  Makes them pretty expensive.

Decent quality case for my Kindle Fire HD 7".  They keys have good tactile response.  The only downside is the case is fairly loose for the Kindle Fire HD and one of the keys broke off after just a couple weeks of use.  Worth the money though.

Amazon states a list price of  $474.95 but this is wrong. The Polk Audio site states a list price of $799.90 per pair, which when divided by two is $399.95, exactly the price that Amazon is offering for one speaker.

I don't know it if it's worth 250. It's good. I may consider some others; I think it needs a subwoofer. In fact, the Vizio soundbar that kept blowing out sounded better and it was only 100, so like I said, it's good, not great, but good. 3.5 half stars.
Sound, comfort and portability are good.  One of the earcups broke off. I don't think I'd buy again unless it was $3 or less.

Worked well and couldn't beat the price. I was just a bit put off by an odorous smell that the chemicals in the case put off. It works great though, and has stood up to regular use for over 6 months. The feature built into it that shuts down the bad when the cover closes on it, stopped working after a couple months. But the case still is easy to hold and protects the pad.

have not ran this through real testing, but my impression using it in the house mounted on a tall metal lamp was just so so. not a lot better than stock rubber duck ant. for receiving. might work better on car where it can get a big ground plane to transmit off of. it was cheap though.

I ordered 2 of these.  One quit working after about an hour the other has been working for a week.  We'll see how customer service handles the replacement.The device is a nice concept, maybe I just got unlucky.

I purchased two of these because of the low price.  I am glad I did because with one of them the plastic shell split into two pieces. The unit still works, it is just no longer shielded from something touching it.  It works great on my Dell laptop.
The batteries come in handy in a pinch, but they don't last very long. I do however love the charger that came with it.

I bought this when it first came out, and as I usually do, I did some video testing with Spears and Munsil and DVE. A few problems were recognized on simple patterns, that were not the case with the Oppo 93 in the same system. My conclusion was while it looks nice, was fast and is well built, for the money stick with Oppo.

Product was delivered with version .0002 software installed while the current version of the software is .0007.Difficult to understand why more recent software was not installed - or at least a cd with the later software was not included.
Just a replacement, and it works fine, even though it would be helpful to be a dwarf with tiny fingers.

Wish this was mentioned on the product description, but the canister itself mentions this.I have other uses for this, so won't rate it poorly. If you only need it for blowing dust around this will do just fine.For the price it is not worth the hassle of sending it back.

This case doesn't fit for Kindle Touch. Sure I can shove it into the bottom holder, but there is no way to use the rubber bands on top. In the end, the top of the kindle Touch will stick out.That being said, it is a very nice case. I like both the exterior and interior material.

My old monitor, an HP that came with my latest desktop died, so I replaced it with this unit because it had an HDMI input which allowed me to diagnose the problem with the previous one.  While this works fine for everyday use, when viewing less that adequately illuminated videos this monitor is just not as bright as the old one.  My only complaint.Probably not for those reqiring exemplary graphics display.

I have not used my Bamboo as of yet. I just wanted to share how quickly I received my order. I ordered this item on Friday and received it Tuesday.When I get a chance to use this product I will be sure to update my review.

Works most of the time allowing for better than tablet keyboard when typing is needed.  DOESN'T allow Koolpad Qi Wireless Charger Pad to charge the keyboard OR Nexus 7 2013 7" tablet because the padding is too thick, but it certainly protects the tablet!

I actually bought these to replace a TV's speakers (it has a headphone audio out) and given how much I like my Z623s I thought these would be an acceptable replacement. Frankly, that's all that they are - "acceptable." They are every bit a a PC desktop speaker and nothing more. Well, I guess they're mildly better than my TV's built-in speakers...

It's pretty much what I expected BUT the touch screen is not very sensative.  Sometimes I have to sit there and tap on it about 5 to 10 times in the same spot before it recognizes that Im even trying to do something.
Easy setup...  Works well for $100.00  - did whait i needed it to...  i.e. watch my puppies while I was at work...  also allows my extended family world wide to watch too!!  Thandi Cam rocks...!!!

It does what it says, it's a USB hub.  On note though, it doesn't like working with old X58 based motherboards.  The copying and reading from X58 system will work good if the file copy is less than 20GB.  Greater than than, the USB connection is lost.Tested device:Seagate Go FlexPopcorn hour A400DiabloTek USB dock

These cords are 6 feet long, which is great.  They charge my iPhone 4 and iPad 1 using either a wall wart, or directly into my iMac.  They will not sync my iPad1, but will sync my iPhone 4.For the price, I still like them.  With a wall wart, I use them to charge my devices at work so I don't need them to sync anyway, but if you want them to sync your devices, you might be disappointed.
I received the items quickly but were not as shown.  The items were made of cheap plastic Made in China low quality.
It's not the products fault I don't guess, but I was hoping to run two monitors off my computer like I have at work.  This cable did not accomplish that for me.  Not sure why, but whatever.
Sometimes these Linksys routers flake out. Whatever you do, DO NOT upgrade the firmware, it seems to break them.

Well as a power wire, I doubt this will be any good at all. It is very heavily insulated, and there is not much wire for 8 gauge. I will be using this wire as speaker wire for my subs. I'm sure this will be better than 16 gauge.. I hope.0 stars for power wire; 3or4 stars for speaker wire.
Fine fulfillment. Excellent price: about $8.00. My complaint: requires the user to plug in an audio cord for the microphone.

Pro:Camera is small & compact,  lenses are small, quick focusing, heavy duty built, sharp detail pics when right on, Image Stabalizing is great. LCD is good & detailed.Cons: Interface controls slow, battery life too short, flash stopped working after 3 days.

I purchased this for my Samsung NX210 mirror-less with two lenses (no way can I carry my Canon 5D mk11).  It just barely fits my accessories, spare battery, one additional lens, remote cable release and instruction book.  Forget my camera mounted flash or battery charger. I see the 203 would be a better choice, but at double the price?
These are ok earbuds.  they are a little slick so if you start to sweat they will want to slide out of your ears

Overall love this product. Can't say the same for the build quality. Used it for several weeks before the corner broke off. No longer holds the smart case securely so can't hold it by just the Smart Cover without risking dropping it. The feel and texture of this case is nice. I guarantee it will break under normal usage conditions.
great for your money if you don't need the digital audio cable... but good audio sound for the money... yay

I bought this because it looked very think and stylish. I was dissipointed because the touchpad would act up. The charger broke in a month. The keyboard is very flimsy. The performance is good and the battery life is moderate. I never really liked VIZIO, their electronics are below average.
It does the job, but it's way too thick for my taste. I tried it for a day, but scrapped it.

Filter is okay.  Made with a cheap aluminum ring and low quality glass, but it does protect my lens.  Picture quality is slightly better without it so I'll use my lens hood as protection until I can buy a B +W multi-coated filter.

For the price they are great, but the audio quality is not good, still acceptable though. The thing that annoyed me was a very small high pitched ringing when the volume was turned down or no sound was playing.
These work as advertised -  nice and compact and the retractable part works well and makes it easy to travel.
But then it was pretty cheap -- and if you like to change it up now and then (new colors), then this works perfectly for that.  For the price, you can have several colors.

I have tried two of these units with two types of 9V batteries (Radio Shack and Tenergy brands) and I didn't succeed with either.  I was able to charge AAA and AA just fine. The customer service of the company is good.

So I had last year's version, and it worked quite well. This year's model has the new UI. I'm not sure if it's the UI or the hardware, but this year's model is significantly more buggy than last year's. Sometimes I'll catch it turning on out of the corner of my eye. It'll turn on for an hour then turn itself off. Very annoying because the remote is IR, so you can't hide it behind other things.

The thing works fine. It does come with cables. The wrong kind. I had to go out and buy an HDMI cable. I had to spend a few hours online trying to research why the picture quality looked so bad - I needed a cable. The manufacturer should put an HD cable in with the DVD player, which is intended to be plugged into an HDTV.
If you just have to have a keyboard then OK. I find that the keyboard on the Ipad mini is sufficient. This just makes a really compact device more bulky to set up. I'd just rather use the ipad alone.

The watch itself is great... however the syncing software sucks.  It rarely syncs properly... sits and stalls... But when it works it is fantastic.  Also it was very difficult to initially set up the sync software.... especially the part where it syncs to other web sites.the battery drains quickly... has to be charged every day, even if turned off.
I ordered the wrong cable so I can not tell you one way or the other. Igave it to a friend who said that it works great.

This is a quality battery and it is much better than the one i replaced it with for my Samsung computer, but it occasionally pops out of place and restarts my computer without my knowledge. This is a real drag.

Purchased to install Pioneer FH-X700BT stereo in 2004 Toyota 4Runner.  The Adapter could not be used without purchasing an additional adapter for the small antenna lead.  Installed the stereo without the second antenna and tuning was terribly weak.  Removed and reinstalled with adapter and problem was solved.

If you're not trying to do too much with it or use really big lenses for a long time.....or if you want something that'll survive 1 maybe 2 camping/hiking trips this works.  Nothing this light weight can be that durable, so all in all it was an ok purchase.

Overall, this is a pretty good product.  The small size of this mouse is both its prime benefit and makes it a bit difficult to use.  The touch/scroll area on the mouse is nice, but dosn't work all that well.  This mouse is ideal for someone who wants to have a mouse on hand, but dosn't like to have to carry one around with their laptop.
good keyboard but my only issue is where it sits and where i sit i can't see the back-light keys. i wish the keys were angled just a little so that when it is laying on a desk you can see them.
I have not used all the functions, but wanted a unit I could connect and save recordings. This seems easy to use and based on my research, would recommend if this is still available.
We haven't had a chance to use this yet.  It's supposed to allow my family to use a headset for both our cordless phone as well as the cell phone.
This item is badly overpriced..as it is the exact same cable as the TF101.Save yourself money and return it like I did and go get another one.

This battery works better than the old battery I pulled out of my E6410 (must be 2.5 years old by now).  It lasts maybe 2 hours.  The battery looks like OEM although the "battery tester" feature does not work.  The casing is not new - it's got scuffed edges.  I think these units have been disassembled and rebuilt with new innards. For the price, it's okay but you're not getting a new battery from Dell.

These speakers crapped out on me- sound got scratchy and then later it just produced static sound at 20% of the original volume. It's not very practical or convenient either. It was bulky to carry around and too easy to break. It was never really that loud, and the sound produced was never very good- it always sounded a bit scratchy.

Decent kit and has everything you need to start. My problem was with the provided power supply, it says 1 amp but when I plug in a  keyboard and the wireless module, the pi shuts down and restarts with either one of the components not functioning. I used a different 1amp Belkin supply that I use for charging a tablet, this had absolutely no problems. First time users can get a serious headache with the underpowered supply.
I expected a bit more from Shure. The cord is way too long and the mic is only so so. If I had to choose over again I'd probably look for other options.

The price was great o i gave it three stars, however the micro sd card is a class 2, which is the slowest end card, their is class (2,4,6,8,10, u1) with u1 being the fastest, and class 2 being the slowest, cameras tipicly require a minimum of a class 4 to 6, and tablets require a class 6-u1. I love SanDisk, but I just don't like this particular product.

This case did not fit the Lumix LF1 camera even though Amazon said it would fit slim Lumix cameras.  It arrived on time and was genuine Panasonic merchandise - just dissapointing that the camera is too big for the case snap to work properly.

I received this item very quickly and the length of the cable was great for the price.  However this cable is seemingly not shielded and had awful interference when trying to use it.  It may work for you but YMMV.
I also had the same problem where I got a brand new one, and it doesn't hold a charge well. Unfortunately, I don't see a clearly better alternative. I ordered another and I'll return the first one...

Once I can get my Touch 4 in the armband it is okay. However, the screen protector is clouded and hard to see. Also, the touch does not work very well through the "shield". I was expecting more from Belkin!
I bought & rarely use it but my internet stinks it's not the tablets fault but might be ok if I'm on the road,,
Everything is good about this keyboard except the fact that it does not work well with VLC media player. You lose function controls, it's weird.
I bought this protection plan for my fujitsu high-speed scanner. Of course I won't know how this works until (fingers crossed) my scanner craps the bed. So hopefully I will never need it.

Bought it to go with a new radio that did not have a CD player but with the ability to plug one in.  It worked very well and probably still does but I now use the free Pandora feature on the radio. My husband, more of an expert, said it was good as well.

Looks kind of goofy, dosen't really protect anything much, bulky, a little cheesy really.  But, I MUST accessorize so this was it for me.  @ least it fits my Pioneer TS-W308D2.  Might rattle but I cranked 'er down hard and it's in the trunk, so, whatevs.  I dunno, it's not bad.
Moshi iVisor XT (HD clear) No-Bubble Screen Protector for Kindle Fire HD is an OK item. Love the ease that it installed with. The only thing that could make this better would be if it were non-glare.

Flimsy and not protective enough for me to trust only having this as a lens hood for my better lenses. It also can be seen in the corners of the pictures when zoomed out all the way. To stop the vignette in the photo, one myst back off of the zoom.
It is smaller than other brand. Nice looking adopter but my internet phone has static when it connected to the adopter.

This hood is decent for the price.  I am using it on my Canon 75-300mm telephoto kit lens.  It doesn't fit as securely as I would like (meaning that if you turn it too far, it clicks) but it won't fall off.  It does feel a bit flimsy, but for 5 bucks, you can't go wrong with this product.

As with all electronic products, they get trumped every 60 days.... I have used lots of these type cameras and the Image Quality is just OK on this, but then again, so is the price, so you get what you pay for in this product line....  at least there is a big name behind it...
This product worked okay, however the fit and finish was not at all like the OEM.  I had trouble getting it to mate with the connector the first time.  The battery itself is okay.
#1 it is slower than a USB 1.1 synch.#2 it eats battery fast.#3 not for a pro photographer or digital point and shoot cameras over 7 megapixel.#4 does not synch to nano 1st or 2nd generation.
good picture..lot of light leak..no furhter improvement over previous models except menu. Media player very bad quality and slow. Nothing spl about this tv. cheap build qulaity. Passive 3D nice.
Works pretty good.
It's a nice ultrabook cover, it's classic. It's what I was expecting and arrived on time. Is a good option to choose.
Using a BT mouse can be annoying, but with a good BT adapter may be adequate. Was trying to use with an Acer Iconica W4, was useful in a pinch, but I an rf mouse is always better is available.

Does an adequate job. The cord is long and the charger works, however for the LG G2 it will advise that it is not a reccomended charger and the charge will be slow. I suspect that this will be similar to other new android phones.

I like our system but there is something missing in the sound.  Watching TV shows versus movies.  Either the conversations are too loud and the background noise isn't (doesn't match) or vice versa.  It's hard to get it to work right for me and the auto tuning feature is all but useless IMHO.They're cheap and maybe that was my mistake.  I don't trust CNET anymore after they're review.
This case offers a wealth of protection, but that is overshadowed by the fact that it simply weighs too much.

Does what it advertises...only thing that was annoying was the remote stopped working after 2 days...as my title says, what do you expect for $6?  Short term solution before I upgrade my stock stereoSound quality is like your native radio stations, not great but not bad...again...$6, whatcha expect?

The sound quality isn't very good, they sound like a less expensive set of headphones, very muffled sounding. Though they are convenient, the volume does not get loud enough for my personal taste, but still better than cords getting tangled up from my iPod while working out.  I would not buy a second pair!
Like I said, needed a cleaning before I could use it. Normally not the case when buying filters but who knows.

Like most protectors of this nature, they're very hard to install without getting bubbles beneath them from the smallest of dust particles.  I can see there is a great need for an invention to remove the dust while installing these.

I bought these new stereo head unit because it was the cheapest one out there and seemed to have everything I was looking for. The unit is actually quite large.  Does not display time when turned on. It is not IOS 7 compatible.

I have a surface 2 and the build quality of this device leaves a lot to be desired but at the price it was, I cant complain. Unfortunately my device had a defect in the screen where a pea size area on the screen was bleeding tons of light. Had to return. The lenovo 8" windows 8.1 tablet seems better built but also costs more.
Wall charger works with no problem.  Car charger doesn't work at all.  Price got it 3 stars.  Probably should have returned, but honestly it just wasn't worth the time.
I made a mistake and got the wrong part.  It is beautifully made and I am sure would work just fine. It is now in my parts bin.
Used it for a couple of months and replaced it with an Otterbox. The case is better than nothing. It just didn't feel like it would offer any protection in the event of a drop.

For this price, design could be improved by providing a fitting cap at the negative end instead of having a majority of users resort to aluminum foils etc.  Otherwise, it is too short - I almost feel like returning it because it does not really do what it is supposed to do - a D spacer.  I think the C-spacers are still reasonable but for a proper D-spacer,  you need a proper protruding cap at the negative end.
Not that I expected too too much, but they are what they are expected to be. Decent little headphones with ok sound for an ok price.

I bought this product to eliminate having to turn my iMac to insert a USB cable in the back but it was built too light and moves all over the place, I used double stick tape to keep it from moving, works very well and I would recommend this product to my friends.

I'm sure it's due to atmospheric conditions, but in the morning I can get stations over-the-air that I can't in the evening. I'm still working on it's placement. I want reception but don't want to have to look at it.It's made in the USA.

I haven't had to utilize this warranty yet, but already I'm not happy about the fact that the warranty begins the day of purchase before the laptop has even arrived.  To me it seems this cuts into the warranty coverage time.  I think the customer should at least receive the item that's being covered before the warranty begins.  slight rip-off.

Im a bit disappointed. The "built in screen protector" was loose inside the package and not glued ito position when it arrived. I was able to line it back up and press it back into place. Not bad, but not perfect. Cheaper than the name brand one. I would buy one again, but I hope that they improve the overall quality of the product.
I think it works pretty well... I guess my only complaint is it's kind of bulky.  Takes up a lot of counter or shelf space.

I have been using this camera for about 1 year.  Some of the problems with this camera is1) Lens cap doesn't stay on the lens, it always falls down. There is no grip.2) View finder doesn't show the actual picture that the camera will capture.  i.e what you see in the view finder is not what you get.  The good news is, the picture that is captured is better than what you see in the view finder.
I bought a refurbished unit and it didn't work.Thanks to everyone that takes the time to review products. It is a big help.

But having some difficulty getting it to work via Bluetooth to my Windows 7 (Dell) laptop.  It will work when plugged in via USB, but not via Bluetooth.  Works via Bluetooth for everything else I have tried (phones, Macs, etc.)

this was my first used purchase on Amazon.  it was simple and easy.  I paid way low and I def got what I paid for.  it was missing screws and the cover was beat up but the unit works just fine.  great amp and I will def get another one.  maybe the re-maned next time.

It worked perfectly fine with my Dj software when i used the sound card. it comes in handy and its small and compact. i would recommend to handle the sound card with care because it's made by no so durable plastic.

Pros:1) Nice look2) Fix tablet in 3 different angles3) Easy access to all ports and cameraCons:1) No pockets at all2) Its hard to close and open it - I'm afraid to brake the tablet since it very stiff

It has a good display. The design could be better. It has a very basic menu for configuration. When setting the language to spanish, it really displays messages in both spanish and french. Doesn't autoscale pics. Good option if you just want a basic frame with a big screen. If you want more than that, you should consider another frame.
You get what you pay for. I got it for my son because he keeps messing on my iPad. This is not a product I would use but it works for him.

Sound quality is okay but not great. These are great for the stationary listener. If you run in these, walk in these, move at all they will fall off. I traded these in for earbuds when those became a thing.

I wish these things had a 90 degree connector.  It is a bit of a press fit inside the wall with these.  I wonder how long the cable that I laboriously ran through the wall will last with so much force keeping it bent.  For now though, it is working.

Provides a lot of protection for a kid.  Makes it almost impossible to plug in the charger or head phones while in the case.  I probably would have gone for something a little less bulky.  Pretty much doubles the size of your Kindle.  However, it may survive being thrown out of a moving car.
The fit isn't as good as other Stofen units I have and I find it comes off to easily but the quality of the light is worth the effort.

This is a knockoff of the Manfrotto and is not up to their standards, but works adequately. I particularly like the various plastic inserts that change the jaws to fit different shapes. Very handy. The 5/8" stud is reversible so that either a 1/4-20 or 3/8-16 thread is exposed.Though not precise, it is strong and reliable.

I bought this to pair with my desk phone and my iPhone.  Setup was easy.  The device works perfectly.  My only complaint is comfort.  If you're on a call for longer than 10 minutes, this thing is rough on your ear.  I've tried all of the supplied eargels and both earhooks, but it still hurts.  The over the head style holder is comfortable, but is not a very portable or subtle option.

It's really just okay. I'm a case-junkie (I love to change my cases depending on my mood) so I mainly got this one because of the bright blue, but when it arrived, it wasn't that bright of a blue. Still pretty but not exactly what I was hoping for. The card slots are nice but there are other cases with card slots for a third of the price so not sure this one's worth it.
I will give a product review when I take my camera out in the rain, but so far it seems to be a good product
Works pretty nicely and is of decent quality.A little difficult to use if you were to use them on small-screen devices.
The adapter for my granddaughters tablet stopped working so we got this adapter to remedy the situation, worked like a charm.

It's a well made camera, lots of ruggedized plastic so you can be sure it'll withstand anything. But it's not the greatest quality as far as video goes. Many other cameras out there better for the money.

I enjoy using the Canon Wireless Remote Control RC1. The only drawback is that it is a line-of-sight controller and it needs to be in front of the camera to operate properly. The Canon radio control remote is more handy and can operate from behind the camera and for greater distances... but the radio control remote cost more.

Have been looking for this for a long time.  It's really convenient but it takes up up another USB port.  It would have been great if this could be attached to their keyboard charger.  Also would have been great if you could actually use the mouse while on top of the charger itself.

don't know whether i got a lemon, but the transfer rate is very low, much slower than advertised. but it doesn't bother me that much, i don't do lots of file tranfering. and when i do, i just let it work in the background.

It works and it was really, really cheap. I guess this is one of those moments where the statement " You get what you pay for" is entirely accurate. For the money you can't go wrong but be warned that the ipad is only held in at the corners and I've already had multiple incidents where the Ipad fell out of the case!

I have been using this mouse for about 2 months.  My laptop is Yogo 13 2 Pro.  The most features are worked excepting horizontal move by using wheel.  It stopped mouse function twice and I have to reinstall bluetooth drive to get it function again.  Overall, it is a mouse for a play. but can not rely on it for serious performance.
Nice card to free up some memory if you have ddr2 ram and dont want to spend a fortune for memory.. quiet and efficient  the ati ccc just don't keep working..
This drive was slower than indicated but it has been very reliable.  I've since moved on to mostly using USB 3.0 drives because they're significantly faster even in USB 2.0 sockets.
It fits and protects my tablet but the case somewhat covers the camera. I dont use the camera much so I'm okay with it, but if you do then just skip this and buy a nicer case

I bought this MP3 player in replacement of my old loved one when I stepped on it. This one has a capacity adequate for me. But within 6 months I used it, the screen beging to malfunction. the player is still working but I sometimes dont see anything on the screen and sometimes it flashes or other days it works perfectly. I also want to add that the menu is really not intuitive on this model
The unit has a hard time picking up the signal from the router.  I had a Linksys WRE54G that worked excellent till it locked up on me. The Hawking just dosen't work for me.

This product is working fine for me...but I have seen other products that my friends are using that are more cheaper and meet the purpose. I cannot comment on the durability as it is just 2 months since I am using it...Fixing is easy with the glue/gel provided...no hassles...but you should look for cheaper options that are 10 times cheaper....
Purchased this charger for my D3100 Camera because I misplaced my older one. Works just like the other one. No complaints.

This one is for the 3700 series, even thought when you purchase a garmin and it shows other accessories.  It doesn't fit, can't make it fit...won't ever fit.  Frustrated with description.  I'm returning today.
It was great until the antenna separated on inside. I had to keep moving it, then keep it in place to make it work. Just be careful not to drop it
You can do way much better for the money. Plus maps are not upgradable for this item.Trust me buy something else.

These do not fit as comfortably as I would like - the right piece won't stay in my ear no matter which cover I put on it.  The left piece fits fine.  Since only one side fits the resulting sound is awkward and too much outside noise infiltrates the set.

I bought this cool looking case to hold my Seagate Portable with a Thunderbolt plate on it...1 1/2 inches thick....needless to say it was at least a half inch too narrow....Case Logic it does not hold it!

My wireless mouse doesn't like this switch so I have to have two.  Flips between the two computers and helps keep the desk a little cleaner by not having two keyboards, and two monitors.  Straight forward piece of tech.
Cheap but does the job.  All of these DVD-CD-VCR units are in their final years, and are already obsolete.  Good enough for mom or dads few shows on the bedroom TV.
I hate it if it didn't work.  But it does work and was just the right length that I needed.
I have purchased this brand 3 times because I need the microphone. They are cheap and don't last more than six months. You might just spend the money and get a better pair that lasts  longer
For my sons kindle. Hard to get bubbles out but easy to install. If you make a mistake it is easy to peel up and retry. Its cheap enough to buy again. Price is right.
This case fits the Kindle Fire perfectly however is just a little too bulky. I imagine it could be great for folks with young kids as it's great protection against drops.
the manual is not clear for operation.LCD display is poor and good only on certain angle.needs some improvement.

Although product seems to work fine, accompaning software lacked some features and actually stopped system from booting. Still using and appears to be doing the job. I would have liked to see some indication of probable run time after interuption.

The boom head is awful on this  it makes it unusable  it will swivel it wont stay in place and just horrible. So unless you plan on buying it and replacing the boom head I don't recommend. I do love the stand and the casters  as they seem to be made of good quality but the boom head has to go.

These are way too expensive, however they are awesome, possibilities are endless,Can be used with a lighting stand and the actual clamp can be used to hold an external battery pack, Don't leave home without one of these or a magic arm.
Should have been included wtih Hero3. Cap was too lose, came off and lost within a month, seems expensive for so little
The speaker blew out.We like the sound of the bigger model but on that speaker you have to turn the top to turn it on. And the big problem is that The wires always break. That's a big down fall.

This thing is made so you must completely unwrap the cord every time you use it.  I have a 50 foot 16 gauge cord and it fits comfortably.  It is made almost entirely out of plastic and you must keep weight in it during the roll/unroll process.  can't beat the price and it is easier than rolling the cord around my arm every time.

Ah, it's just okay. Decent picture and refresh rate, good for Xbox or when I'm bored of my Holodeck.  I use it in the spare bedroom on the east wing while i'm in that area. I'm really waiting for the 100 inch with 240Hz refresh rate. That my friend will go right in my theater room.

it doesn't fit on a mini itx motherboard. Even though it is low profile and should be perect for a mini itx motherboard it blocks one of the ram slots. However, it is quieter than the intel stock and cools better.
Good Mount only did not work for me. I ended up getting a magnetic mount so it would hold the unit close, right on the dash and not stick out.

This piece of plastic is... Well a piece of plastic. You get what you pay for, and for only five bucks or so that's the kind of quality you get. It works and does its job, but it definitely is a pain to take on and off. It screws on to the inside of the lens, not the outside which is difficult. But for the price it's a good resource.
The quality is good, but the switch isn't in too good a position.  If the release were on the end,,,,, it would be easier to use.

I am using this with a bamboo capture and Macbook Air running 10.8.4.  I cannot get the tablet to connect with the wireless kit. However, the kit works great with my older Macbook Pro. Beware. Only plays Channel A. Does not play Channel B or has no settings to change it. If you have two DVD players in the minivan then it will not work for one of the players.

I called Amazon to complain about the description of the item.  It does not have the "Up Conversion and Memory Slot" described in the product listing.  There used to be a picture of the product, which showed the memory slot, and I was frankly surprised that the unit lacked it.  So clearly they had a picture of another unit, as the model number is correct.P.S.  The machine completely died after about a year of very light use.

I have these mouse for about a year now. This is a sleek-looking small mouse which can fit anywhere. Wireless range is also good. But two things I don't like about:1. The resolution of mouse is very poor. It really takes an effort to click small links, or select texts. This increases as you go further away from your computer.2. It drains batteries! I useSanyo Eneloop AAA Batteries, and they only last couple of days.

I did not realize this only had the two prongs where the cord hooks to the power box, not three like the original.  It hooked into my laptop and powered it up, but got much warmer than the original.  I have a new laptop now, so I only used this for a few months...it got me through, but would not have been good enough if the laptop were newer.

I saw this and was very happy someone finally created what I thought was an obvious need in the industry. I ordered it and realized it would not work on my F mount cameras. It accepts my lenses but the description of this item is misleading because it will not work on a DSLR. I wish they would make one for DSLR's!!!

These are for the casual gamer. If you really enjoy gaming, i'd suggest getting a custom controller like the one woodys gamer tag. Kids get into these and the buttons get sticky. They use batteries up, you should probably get rechargeable batteries. Not the cheap ones, they're too big and don't fit the case right. If you use the xbox for netflix more than gaming, then you should get the remote control style controller.

I bought this last June.  The case fits my IPad 2 well, looks good and stands up both horizontally and vertically.  My problem is that the edge banding has failed and the cover is coming off.  I know that it's inexpensive but I thought I might last longer than seven months.

not sure if it's the kit lenses that came with my d5100 or if it's the camera, but the viewfinder seems awful dark to me.  exposures seem to be good,

There are hundreds of models in flash drives but I picked Sandisk because it is the most trusted name in flash memory. I have an older 8gb hp flash drive which is faster than that. was expecting a lot but I guess you get what you pay for.
Not much to say for this other than it fits the tablet well. Good protection. Can be better if there are specific pockets to put the stylus and other accessories.

Good deal on batteries and charger. The car charger cable is VERY cheap. I just hope it lasts. That is one of the main reasons I purchased this item. The cord is the actual size as the photo in the add but the thickness of the cable seems thinner than the photo. Not impressed with the quality of this product.
Sorry, but I would not recommend this radio to anyone other than a beginning novice. It is slightly above a toy.

i bought this Cisco Linksys Refurbished E1000 Wireless-N Router i am please with it, but the only thing that i was dissatisfied about is that it didn't come with the installation disc, so therefore i had to go online and torrent the software to istall the router, but it works just fine.

receiver does the job, don't think it's amazing.bought it for a budget airplay receiver, and it works for the most part. but sometimes Airplay will just stops playing. overheats? The ends of this cable are giant. I thought some people were exaggerating when they said the ends were big, they aren't.... not sure if I like the product, I ideally I'd like to have one with a 90 degree end...

This cost me a lot of money!!! Reason: I made a mistake with shipment. Cost me a lot. I learnt my lesson!! All in all; this is the most expensive USB stick I own. Period!! Cost me R900.00 ZAR!!! Lot of money in this part of town!! A whole bottle of Johnnie Walker Platinum!!

Get the manual from their web site before you add this power supply to their commercial quality sensor (you will need it).  You may not be able to do it yourself.  Well made and works well when combined with one of their sensors.  Once I got an electrician to install it it works very well.

i was able to use most of the features but to get from one screen to the next or to switch from one app to another is painstakingly slow and gets to a point where i don't even want to use it anymore. if they somehow made this faster, it would be a very good product to have and extremely useful.
I like this product, I gave them away as give to family members. Wish they enjoy having for their shuffles

If you've got a Nano, forget about it, you'll have to dock it using one of the snap-ins for a larger iPod. It works, Nothing special. Fans stop if not on totally flat surface, Better than nothing and Price is Low so not the worst deal.

This cable works fine as long as you get it in just right. It seems a little loose.

This radio has good sound for a radio this small with verylittle overload on FM. Not quite as selective as the Yacht Boy 400, but good. For Mac, I would love to see an archival tool. Think about this: Time Machine only does snapshots of data, so what about users who have many more GB of data than what a Mac Air is capable of storing? love the size on this camera and the video quality is fair but had one before and it had time / date stamp ,was suprised when this one arrived and it did not have time/date stamp ;i felt that was a negative for a product that you may wish to keep a record of events that you were involved in on certain days of a certain year

This will not light up your desk - it doesn't even light up the whole keyboard that well. Okay for when twilight falls and you only have a bit more work to do and can't be bothered to put the light on......

good combination between old and new school computer equipment works as required. Nothing great but I have seen worse.  Nothing to write home to mom about.

From the description and Sony's reputation I had expected an excellent product. I compared it with several other ear buds and there was a marked difference in the sound quality. These ear buds had a tinny sound. I ended up returning these.

I was all excited to get this Router with its better range and features but It kept dropping out and sometimes I couldn't connect to web sites - strange - I've been a computer enthusiast since before PC's and was a network Admin for a few years, so It's not that I was doing something stupid. This is a great portable blu-ray/dvd burner that needs minimal setup ( none, if you use mac...it works right out of the box). This is not an audio device that a true audiophile would love.  It produces slightly above average sound, but does offer great features and is easy to use.  For the price, it is a good value. For the money, this is an OK computer.  It isn't fast, but it is relatively responsive. It is ok I have only uses a couple of times

My canon 35-80 and 70-300 swim in these bags. 3* because it barely holds 100'. It does keep the cord from tangling, but must be hand held while awkwardly turning SMALL knob, while holding the center hand grip.

Seems that it is good the case but the quality of the retainers, specially the top one, I just tried to insert the tablet and become loose (ripped). But the idea it is ok.

Every time I review an anti-glare screen protector I have the same issue: It seems to reduce overall clarity. this system isn't the worst but definitively not the best. if you upgrade the center speakers and the sub woofer it would be ok.

They hit each other, so they do not seat, and you cannot use them.This is probably not the case with all video cards, but be sure you have plenty of space between ports on your video card before trying these.

did njot tighten well, was pretty sturdy and provided plenty of movement for my 32" TV but did not tighten well and is easily tilted.

These were relatively easy to install and cheaper than buying a new set. However, they're overpriced and I'm not getting the same noise-cancelling performance as I did before. Was hoping for better.

TV is fine, but I was NOT aware (my fault?) that this model does not have the universal wall mounting holes and thus cannot be mounted on a wall.  The view angle is thus fixed vertically. This is not a mount for a large TV would be great for a small TV, I have a 46 LED and the mount is not really stable, spend a bit more and get a better mount for use with a larger over 32 inch TV

This is not in description, but the cable comes with a sticker attached that says 10A. Be careful when using this extension cord as you must stay below 10 amps! I ordered one for my external hard drive.This first one was/is ok (nice shell for protection). I ordered another one and it's shell is kind of soft. That is, it is quite worthless for protection. I just did not send it back since the effort is not worth the money.

I bought this hard drive to replace an 80 GB Western Digital Drive. I had no difficulty installing it, and the drive performed fine except for the noise. It is perfectly quiet while idle but very noisy when accessing the drive. I returned it and bought a Seagate drive with comparable specs. The Seagate is whisper quiet.

I don't use this drive that often, it is just for backup purposes. The build quality is decent but it does make rather noticeable clicking noises even when I am not accessing the drive. I have it on my desk, and I could feel slight vibration on my desk when the drive is clicking...so I just unplug the AC power when not in use.Choose a better external drive if you want to keep it constantly hooked up
The case is nothing great but it was not bad. I do not have much experience with external cases. The material did not feel cheap and it was easy to assemble with optic reader.

This thing is hard to assemble. The others have covered the various aspects of this. But I need to say that this has been one of the hardest things I have assembled. It worked finally took 2 hrs. and its still not very stable. Wobbles when touched.

The camera is as expected. No miracles & no disappointing. GPS generally works. But it's so not sensitive and slow. Overall just 50%-70% of pictures get GPS tags.

Great product. works well. If you over AMP this product, it will shut off but will probably never work again. I have two surge protectors that got overloaded and never worked again. This is one of the few sleeves I could find to fit my big ASUS G73JW series laptop. It's not very padded and doesn't offer much protection, but I suppose for the price you can't expect more. I haven't used it it enough to comment on it's durability yet.

The color is good, but difficult to calibrate.

This is a hard case, it is not soft or flexible.. Makes me feel like it might easily break if the iPod is ever dropped, even onto a table or carpet. It also feels very slick in my hands since my hands naturally stay oily.. It does allow the blue of iPod to be shown off though.

This is a decent router for the money. It works well for boosting wireless signal once connected. Setup can be a bit difficult but tech support is great, they will walk you through every step. This is a great router for traveling and boosting your signal in areas where your wireless signal is weak. For the price it is great. Very easy to use with no wires. Does have good and bad reception spots.
it does the job, just remember, theres no internal memory...youre going to need to get an sd card to go with it.

I bought this amp because it was cheap and compact. It worked okay, but I thought the sound it produced was rather dull – seemed to be missing some of the high frequencies or something. When I no longer needed it, I just threw it out because it was cheap. If you need a cheap amplifier, here it is.
it has rejected a few dvds I've put inside it. I have no idea why either. I like how slick it looks and that it is a quick react time when I want it on or to eject.
It works well to do its job but to change any settings it's almost impossible to do as you use the little button it should work with projector menu to program any changes

Works almost as well as the more expensive ones, though it feels much lighter. If you are the kind of person who loses their stylus frequently, I'd highly recommend this product. Strange, it just decided to die after owning it for a year.  I went ahead and bought the original Lenovo power cord and everything is fine now.  For that one year, I never had an issue with this, but for some reason it just suddenly stoped working.
Had trouble with usb identifying it and didn't like the password usage so had to delete the software from it and just run it as a simple flashdrive.  Just OK but pricy!

The product is okay. Since the gel case is soft; so the end lines on the sides, specially where the adaptor goes in, slips out. It also collects dust and lint sticking to it. Finally I switched to rubberized hardcase.

I bought this coupler to extend the cable for a kids video game.  Coupler quailty is good but the color order on mine was not the same order as the cables...no big deal, just cross your cables or ignore the coupler colors and make sure the cable colors match.

I had several issues with this camera. I didn't like the results when shooting through the windshield. The problem could be shooting through the plastic weather cover and the windshield did not produce high quality video and the battery life seemed to be less than half the recording time advertised. I didn't like the results when shooting at night and bad weather.
all in all the recorder is pretty decent, but it doesnt help when the headphones fall apart right away.  It seems to get the job done pretty well thought so 3 stars

Three stars because, at the $88 price I paid almost a year ago, it is okay. But I see the price is much higher now and it is not worth it.  At maximum volume for outdoor use, sound distorts and speakers rattle.

Would have rated 5-Star, but they didn't fit my truck.  I didn't open up the door panel before I bought them, so it was my own fault.  I snipped the plugs off and used the leader wires to hard-wire.  Worked like a charm.

Will I still get a good shot with half the price cut down? I know buying the real deal will get me the best withoutgiving me problems but at this moment I don't have the budget for this right now but will like the same or even close to the quality I could get.whats the best solution I can aim for?

Adjusting the fan can be difficult since it is constantly on and there is no off switch.2. i much rather buy a pocket mirror because this the ipod has to bee in full brightness for me to see the screen well enough in a bright room or outside in the day. and this drains my battery really fast. and when you lower the brightness in a dark place and did not change the setting before coming out in the sun it is imposible to see the screen making it imposible to increase the brightness

I bought this because of the unique angles one can achieve which I thought might be useful for close ups of plants. Unfortunately, since it does not allow for angling upward or downward, I find it very limiting for more general shots of taller objects like buildings and statuary. I do not get the advertised speed of 30MB/s, more like a 200-300KB/s on my Galaxy S4. At least it gives me a lot of extra storage space, for a phone it works nicely if you don't need to transfer big files.
the fan is loud not controllable, but does its job2 of the 4 push pin latches broke off due to them being cheap plastic but is still strong and latched on

This cable is short (18"?)and expensive. It is long enough for use in my truck since I have a center console but it would not be in my car. Haven't had much need for watching videos but it is necessary for that.
I'm not sure if the speed was wrong or the memory was faulty, but this memory didn't work in my machine.  Had to return it.  No hassle and easy to do business with.

A nice cheap case, however the from USB ports are upside down.Nearly a year after owning this case my front USB ports have become extremely loose when I plug something into them, often causing them to disconnect or have problems. I would recommend spending slightly more getting a better case.

This mouse is definitely ergonomic and functional.  However, it has a couple flaws.  The adapter is very big, which can be an issue if you're in a crammed conference room.  It also doesn't have the back and forward buttons on the thumb, very nice additions to modern mice.  It is a great, cost-effective option if the previously mentioned issues don't apply to you.
This case arrived just fine and on time as advertised, It turns out that it a lot thicker than I thougt - even a little thicker than my las poetic case for my older Nexus 7. Quality seems fine.

This is a nice size and perfectly OK. But I like being able to store all my photos on one drive. So, I have replaced this drive with a 1T.

As the title states, the sound is decent. Not great but not bad (also considering they were $20). Unfortunately, they will not work for me while using my motorcycle helmet (Shoei RF-1100). For my imac: bought this to replace my LaCie that died. I use this hard drive for back up and when it runs, it is loud. We have this in our tv room, and we can hear it run while watching a movie. It has been reliable the last 6 months, but I believe it will be replaced soon.

I have several of these tuners on my WMC7 HTPC, and in general they perform well on most channels, but I have a couple channels that have multi-path distortion on the signal, and these tuners don't handle those stations very well. Love the looks, the compactness as it folds into its own pouch for transport. The full richness of the audio quality can only be perceived at more than quarter volume. OK for for the price, I guess.

you need a normal straight, all-in-a line surge protector to use this. mine has 3 rows with the outter to able to adjust angle. it just doesn't work with this thing. good concept and would work for others. way to expensive.

This rubber frame fits around the various diopteric adjustments for the viewfinder of the Digital Rebel / Digital Rebel XT cameras.Do note that it is NOT the "Eyecup EF"; it is the rubber frame from that eyecup, but without the plastic bit that attaches to the camera's viewfinder.
