In fact I'm leaving them together rather than breaking them down, there's so much tension it seems like they'll rip at any moment but I don't want to stress them again installing the rods. The stands are better than I expected. You'll want to use sand bags or weights to hold the stands if you elevate these to the full 8 feet.

I needed a Cat 6 splitter for my PC and Xbox.  This splitter worked great.Now you can only use one at a time (Xbox or PC) but not both.  This splitter just makes it convenient so you don't have to keep unplugging and re-plugging the cable between the two platforms.*update*Get what you pay for... it sometimes doesn't work when plugging and unplugging the line.

I bought this set of batteries mostly for the battery pack.. Unfortunately like most other battery chargers of the same type, it broke very quickly (within a matter of 2 days).  If you are looking for a battery charger, i would suggest getting one of the $30 + ones, they are of better quality and come with a cord you can plug into the wall so you don't have the same technical issues
I needed some extra outlets in one section of my room and this fit the bill.  Good price and works as expected.

I wanted to attach a small quick release plate on this so I can slip it on a Manfrotto MKC3 tripod. The tripod hole is too shallow, so you will never get it snug. I will have to look for a washer spacer.  It probably works great with tabletop tripod that fits directly to the iStabilizer.

I don't mind the loss of the numeric keypad but the key sizes are very non-standard.  You will have to get used to these keys.  The software only allows you to customize a few of the keys, but not the windows media center button (in case you don't have a media center) or channel slider.  I kept hitting Save As while typing and that's when I decided that this was not going to work for me.

These are very small, but ok if your situation calls for them. These do not produce much bass at all. If you are looking for bass look to other Logitech's with a subwoofer or larger drivers and enclosures. Don't expect big sound from these.
You really have to be careful with this cap. it's very delicate. if you're a patient person who has time to take on and off I would not recommend this plastic cap.
Auto sleep on iPad 3 doesn't work!Works as expected.... Except for the smart function of sleeping when closing lid!

i was very disappointed with the dark small viewfinder. also the door for sd media was toylike & very flimsy. the "stats " looked great on paper but i have buyers remorse now and should have paid more for the G-11

Didn't realized it was the older version so I returned it for the Anker 2nd Gen Astro2 9000mAh. The 15000mAh was too bulky for me even though I read the dimensions at first and though it would be okay.The Anker 2nd Gen Astro2 9000mAh charges almost just as well as the E5 15000mAh but is much smaller!
Software is no good have to reload it everytime use it not too happy with it. This product really no good BAD BAD BAD!!!!!!!!.
This lens works for long distances, but the image is not perfect clear.... Good Price and amplification, but regular focus.....

my D7100 with a battery grip fits very very tight, hard to get out. inner sling I never use, lens hoods catch on it.pockets on the side are small and only fit memory cards. you can put a extra battery it the front pocket.as long as you don't have a long zoom (200mm) or over it works fine.

Before you use this. Hard drives have metal outsides. When you put this on it shorts on the metal and fries the adapter board. Put electrical tape on the solder points on the back. But it worked fine before that happened.

The sound of these is pretty good, better than my last crappy logitech set i thought i had upgraded to. But man, the cords to the speakers are pretty short and if your like me and want surround sound its kindof hard to do with limited cord length

This case fits the Nexus 10 quite well.  My only problem with this case is that it doesnt fold backwards (against itself well).  As a result, it can make the tablet uncomfortable to hold over long periods of time.

I finally got this applied, although it's not that easy. The trackpad cover was a huge pain. It is doing the job, just not that pretty. My trackpad cover had wrinkles on it and I believe this is what caused the hard install.

Nice camera eye cup, but pops off WAY to easily.  Put the camera in the storage bag, it pops off.  Put the camera in the truck console, it pops off.  Works like a charm when it is attached, but we will inevitably lose this due to the poor design.
not bad but I dont think it can make the sound better but it dose can make the sound lounder

Bought this for my HX-9V Sony Cybershot.  Looks very good and stylish like a leather case; but, will not protect your camera from rain/splashing water as it doesn't completely cover the camera like a pouch.  Also, it doesn't have space to carry any spare battery, memory card etc.  Go for Sony LCSCSW/B DSC Carrying Case if you want protection from rain/splashing water.

The chrome sticker on the microphone started coming off after the first day, and I hadn't even used it yet.  It seems to work alright.  I hooked it up to my PC and there have not been any issues.  It is a little large for a desktop microphone, but the price is right.
did not work on win 8. Breaking the connection. Something with drivers. Have spent some time on it and not getting to work the way it should. As seller inform item is working but for older systems.

It's cheap enough and it does provide the protection of my Mac wireless keyboard so I'm not returning it.  The cover is a perfect fit on some keys and too big on others but it still lays flat.  The cover has a couple of holes - not a tear, but one that looks like the silicone was poured into a mold and 2 spots were missed.
Build quality only just acceptable.  Works OK but I think I may be losing some picture qualityStupid word limit!

Good feature set for the money with lifetime maps. I did have an issue with my unit, but I believe Garmin makes quality products and my issue was the exception, not the rule. I'd get a Garmin again, and likely off Amazon due to the nice prices.
This unit is perfectly adequate as a "soft cover" for the Garmin GPS unit I own.  It is nothing special.  It just works.

Well, I only paid $30 for mines but you get what you pay for. I have a Logitech Z-2300 and it's super awesome with lots of base and volume. But for the LS21, it's really average to slightly below average.I had better bass is none existent but there's good clarity. Not much distortion. Loudlness is none existence even at max volume.

I bought it to replace my G5 that I had for 5 years and I can only say that I miss my G5, this MX518 feels a little cheap, its not as accurate as my old G5, maybe I am just used to a better quality mouse.It works fine, just does not feel expensive in any way shape or form.

The battery I purchased is the correct battery for my laptop but it doesn't fit the same way the original battery does. It seems to be a slightly different size/shape which causes it to not install easily. Once it is installed correctly it does work well and charge well. I realize the battery will not be removed often, but my experience is just something I would suggest being aware of for other customers.

I have used it to adapt three Nikon lenses to the OM-d, E-M5. It works well with two, but it is hard to fit to the third one. The stop-down ring seems to be marked backward. The direction indicated to open will stop the lens down.

When the product you want to work isn't on the list it is very hard to get the remote to work.  I bought two of these units and placed one in the living room and one in the family room.In the family room we never could get the TV to work with the Harmony so we still use two remotes.If I had it to do over again i would have just purchased one.

Apple rips off its customers with these products.  How much does it cost them to make this thing?  $1?  I like Apple computers and IPODS, but they really stink when it comes to buying extras for their products.
This looks to be adequate, though unremarkable.  Once mounted, the camera becomes substantially larger, removiimg the small size advantage of the Veho.
Works but you have to figure it out all by yourself as there are no instructions.  No on/off switch either.
Well bought these but as month bass by one by one I gave it to my little sister and the durable didn't last long that it doesn't work anymore so it is worth it to buy it to my little sister.
Very practical and fuctional, I hope it doesn't have the same problem as the last one I bought for my ipad 3, that afyer only a few months the leather imitation skin of the corners started to peal.

There are some noise isolating qualities, which is nice.  Comfort is so-so, even though I tried varying sizes of the little plastic ear things that came with the headphones.  sound quality is not as good as the earphones that came with my ipod.  Overall fine, but I wish I hadn't spent this much money on them.
It just fits my ASUS Q200 laptop but it is a tight fit.  I decide to purchase the next size larger.

If you're not really interested in good sound quality and just need something somewhat discreet to use while on the subway or exercising, these are great. I've been using this model or similar for about 3 years now, and they've done the trick. I've been through about 3 pair as they usually crap out within a year or so of heavy daily use, but at $10ish, that's expected and not really a hassle.

I replaced a several year old OEM battery that came with the laptop.  My experience has been that it lasts about 90 mins.  This is an improvement from the current state of the OEM battery but not as good as it was when it was new (about 2.5 hrs).

The cameras are great. Lots of movement and clear pictures. The hardest part was setting them up. The instructions are limited.The best setup is to reserve an IP address within your router so that a power failure won't reset the camers. I also bought the App called uFOSCAM for Internet control. Power leads could do with being longer, but they are sufficient.

Well, they're not that fragile but after installing this cable to my computer so I can listen to music at work without slouching, I ran over it with my office chair. The female side split and the connection was damaged. In hindsight, I should have gotten a longer cable so I could run it behind my monitor and on top of my desk or just bought a new set of headphones with a longer cord in the first place.
The drive works no complaints there. Speed is ok not what i expected for a 3.0 drive but in reality not that bad for a usb one. Overall if you need the space and don't mind the speed it's great.

This has many of the basic features required for protecting your external hard drive.  For a couple dollars more, the Case Logic PHDC-1 Small works better.  It's slightly bigger and slightly wider in all the right places.  The Case Logic is more sturdy.

I purchased this connector so I would not have to cut the main wire for when I plan to purchase theOPTIMA 3 Port Music Controller with IR Remote.The wires come barely stripped so you will have to restrip them yourself.Also, one of the wires were soldered together, and the connection part does not seem tight on any of them.I believe they would accomplish what I am trying to do, but you get what you pay for.
you cant set it up to NOT PROMPT YOU IN WINDOWS 7 UNLESS YOU DROP YOUR PRIVACY SETTINGS TO UNCOMFORTABLE LEVEL.
The supplied hardware is definitely good but I do not understand why they put metal bulb housing in a plastic mount. Right after installation, the bulb survived a total of 20 minutes. What a waste.
Suction does not stay long on the mount, keeps falling off.  Other than that the product is pretty good for the value.

It gets the job done, but as just about all other reviewers have said:- The keyboard is mediocre but functional- The trackpad is terrible but can get the job done if you have a lot of patience- Looks nice (the main advantage for a living room fixture, assuming you use this as a media PC remote)

The case fits snugly with my u-Tough 8000 camera but does not provide the amount of protective cushioning that I would have liked. I guess the u-Tough was designed to withstand heavy wear and tear but I'd say at best, this case helps to protect the screen and camera body from scratches. I wouldn't have much confidence in the case from protecting the camera from drops.

This is a fun little color gel set to play with and expirement. There are SO Many of them. You do not know what you are getting yourself into. To get them back into the holder and keep the paper that describes what they are is almost impossible

After all the excellent reviews, I'm sad to say that I'm not in love with this case...::PROS::+Great Color (denim and grey)+Not Heavy+Fits the iPad Mini perfectly+Hole in the back for camera is adequate+Hand Strap on back::CONS::-Sewing fraying after 2 months-Rubbery lining coming undone revealing the hard plastic underneath-Prop notch for stand is losing rubbery lining-When opened, and hand in hand strap, the flails around and bends weirdly-Magnetic Closure doesn't always put the screen to "sleep"

Picked one up as a gift at Sams club yesterday for a friend, and it was selling for 3 half century bills, so he can have a speakerphone in his bedroom for his Galaxy S3. He likes the loud volume level.Now we have to figure out how to get Pandora music to play from it.Paired using BT, although we could have tried the NFC, since both the Deck and the S3 have that capability.

I like the USB drive, but for some reason it is FAT formatted and windows does not let me format it to NTFS. This should only be an issue if you have files larger than 2G; unfortunately for me, I do. I bet it should be easy to reformat it using a linux box, but I just haven't got around to get to it.

I wear size large gloves.  The texture rubber portion is too small for me to comfortably grip for extended periods.  Last time I buy something without first trying it out just because it's on sale.  The wheel is irritating having to spin it more to get where I need to be on the page than I would a normal mouse.
Its an ok mouse, but when I think of programmable buttons, I've been spoiled by Logitech and the ability to program keystrokes for the other buttons (like Alt-W to close tabs, etc).
I like the design, but the iPod kept slipping out of the top, so I bought a tight fitting synthetic cover for about 99 cents and use the bottom to make it snug. Now it works great.

For $6 you really can't go wrong, they play sound. But Honestly they produce some good sound out of a cell phone or MP3 player. Like a lot of ear buds they don't stick in the ear all that great especially when they get wet, so go for cycling but not running.

Used it for a couple months and keeps my phone safe when I drop it... Which is a lot... But it got a dark stain around the edges. Maybe it was from stuffing into pockets of my jeans, but either way, it doesn't come off so it just looks gross now. Might get a black one.

I still have not gotten this piece to install and work properly. I will probably have to have a professional IT person come and see why it won't work. Doesn't mean it is bad, only that I can't get it to work properly.

Pros: CheapCons: Must use laptop IDE cable or extra cost adapter if using in desktop machine.  You will only get Ultra IDE xfer speeds w/ultra IDE (266X or Extreme IV) CF card AND ultra IDE - rated cable

If you want to protect your iPod it's a great case, however, if you expect a Belkin case to fit a Belkin FM transmitter you are mistaken. You'll have to look around a bit more to find a case that doesn't have the front lip going further down than the back and causing the bottom to not fit on the docks of a transmitter or any kind of stereo system.
Like one reviewer said,sometimes these might be useless unless there is a Power Supply.Six more words to type.Good and not so good.
The male terminal on this adapter is very small, and easily broken. The cord has a decent length, but it would be nice if it were a bit longer.
They are good enough for the price.I mean, I wasn't expecting anything fantastic, and gave one to my sister and one to my dad and they use it without any issues so...yeah. Nice enough colours.

I purchased my first Moust MX two years ago and I loved it. Then I bought a second one for work. The new mouse does not work as well as the first one did, even after a replacement. The center button does not register middle clicks consistently. Logitech, what did you change on this mouse????? Why does it function differently from the first one that I bought???? This is really frustrating.
I expected this to work seemlesly and it did, so I do not have any complains. Amazon had a great price compared to the local staples., worked well for me.

Keeps GPS safe but can easily slide off the dash even with "non-skid" bottom. Better to set on far side of dash in corner and adjust for optimum viewing. Much less likely to slide there. Overall pretty good and much better than suction mounts which will eventually fail and don't stick to cold windshields well.

I've had these for over a year they have great sound quality. Unfortunately, when I was working out, the button panel fell off. They are cheaply made and the battery does not hold a charge longer than a couple days without use. So, if you're not using them, plug them in. They really do sound great though. For the money, these are good headphones.

Este indicador es una especie de tester que al acercar al cable de bujia emite una luz al pasar la chispa que enciende la bujia. lamentablemente deberia tener un indicador de intensidad para saber si la chispa es debil u optima.  es algo simple solo para saber si hay chispa o no circulando por el cable.
I was looking for the stem but this didn't fit the original mount that came with the older Garmin product. It will function as designed. It just didn't fit what I was looking for.
used to feed an stereo in my backyard, connect it to the ipod and its working, it is outside so i hope the rain does not kill it. so far is ok.

Nice looking router. Unfortunately it simply does not work with VPNs so do not purchase for remote work use (telecommuting etc.). I spent days reconfiguring this, upgrading firmware etc. and could not get it to work with my VPN. Research on the web suggests this is a known issue [...]Otherwise it's a nice looking and decent product.
Plastic clamps intended to be used to clamp a roll of photo background paper. They work just fine for that.

Although it's advertised as for the 3G and 3GS, the cradle fits an iPhone 4 or 4S nicely when you're using a thin case like theelago S4 Slim Fit Case.I did not use the suction cup mount, but instead removed the cradle and screwed it in to Pro.Fit's custom mount for my Subaru Forester.  That worked well, but the only downside was I lost the ability to adjust the angle.
Fitting the HD I have didn't work they way I'd expected, and I can't figure it out. This may not be the product's problem but mine. Therefore: not for the novice.

The HDMI cable is a nice standard cable, the PTC mini DVI was for the wrong macbook, so It did not work. The newer macbooks finally have HDMI so there is no need to purchase any of these multiple other adapters. Be absolutely sure this will fit your computer before you buy.

The GPS is excellent. The screen is a good size, very readable. I chose this unit, in part, because of the Bluetooth which works fine, but the microphone is pretty poor making it almost useless as a speaker phone. Magellan Maestro 4040 Portable car navigation system with Bluetooth

The pack only includes 4 sets of heat shrink tubes, but it includes 8 total connectors. Assuming you don't make any mistakes, you are short 4 heat shrink tubes (half the number needed). Kind of ridiculous.Some other reviews have said these deans connectors seem too tight, and while they do seem to be snug, they don't seem to be any tighter than my other connectors and I would rather it to be too tight than too loose.

Where you live and your surroundings are just as much of a factor as the antenna you choose. Period.Google 'antenna web' and click on the first result. Here you can type in your address and it will show you where your stations are and what kind of antenna you'll need to get those stations in. If most of your stations are in the yellow or green, then this will probably work for you.
I was expecting it to be sturdy and not soft. Attracts dirt and dust easily. All in all it does the job of keeping the iPad protected.

Pros:It hold my Air with a Spec (thin) hard case on it.  Yes, it's a touch tight, but it hasn't hurt the zipper.I can stuff maybe 30-50 papers in the inside pocket, my iPad in the outside pocket and still zip it with no problem.I don't worry if it falls off the seat when I'm driving to work.Cons:After two months of daily use, one of the handles and a spot on the shoulder strap have started to fray.

Support is flaky, the Kernel sources have not been provided. I wanted this to run XBMC exclusively, it ran but very poorly. The rom development community for this is very loosely knit, and fragmented. If you all you want is netflix, pandora, plex, ect get a Roku.
Polarizing effect works as advertised.  It does cause significant vignetting when used on a tamron 17-50mm on an a700.  May work better for telephoto lenses.
I have a sports camera and shoot many 1080P video click. I try to use Eye-Fi wirelessly transfer video file to my PC or iPhone but speed is too slow. I think maybe technology is not here yet.
I bought two of these, one works fine, the other one sucks. As in, the case that sucks, doesn't work at all.

Arrived when it was supposed to and installed without a hitch. Don't remember if it even came with installation instruction because it was so easy. Only complaint is some plastic tabs inside the tray. They interfer with putting larger items in and they werent in my staock dash tray. If I had known they were there I wouldn't complain, but they aren't visible in the picture and I don't remember them being listed in any description.
I bought the bowling ball for our wii, but we haven't quite figured it out just yet. It looks like more of a pain to put together and use, than it is worth.

Good quality headphones but after more than 6 months the microphone doesn't stay in place. The sound also seemed to deteriorate over time which is odd as I haven't had an issue with longevity using Razer products.Grab them if you need good headphones for light use. May look to some higher end headphones for heavy use.

This suction cup wore out even faster than the one that came with the GPS.  I have since moved onto using my smartphone and a mount.  I'm using a jelly suction cup mount that never gets taken off my dash.  That has been holding up great for years and cost me $12. My cellphone has never slid at all.
The case is not made of the most durable material but it will work in a pinch if you need it. I ordered it because I thought the new tripod I bought didn't come with a case but it did.
The original protector has lasted so far nearly 4 years.  I need the keypad to be covered.  It's getting a bit curled at the edges, and I'll be sorry when I have to replace it with one of these

These worked fine with my Uniden TRU8885-2 PowerMax 5.8GHz Handsets, but never seemed to last quite as long as the original Uniden BT-446 batteries.  After two years, only one of them still holds a reasonable charge (a bit over an hour).  The other lasts for less than 20 minutes, even when fully charged.  At $12.20 apiece (currently), these are half the price of the Uniden batteries.  There are even cheaper alternatives available, but who knows how reliable...
Good set of cans to leave on the desk at work. Acceptable highs/mids. Zero bass response. Comfy. Loose fit. Go bargain cans.
This device works part of the time and it was too much trouble to request a refund.  When it does work - everything is OK.  I had to use another person's device to give me consistent results.
Very simple and easy to put on. Fits well. In hindsight, I do regret the color choice. But, aside from that, it's spot on.
The remote doesn't work very well.  The cord from the box to the IR receiver could be longer.  That would be nice.
These are Ok but the Skullcandys are way better when it comes to sound quality and comfort.

Buyer Beware: This lasted in it's good shiny white condition for about a month, then it deteriorated and looked like, well, utter crap. Any and all lint in your pocket and the slightest hints of color made this case unbearable after 2 months, and had to trash it. However, considering it was only $4, can't complain too much. Be careful though, as I did take good care of it, but it still gave up on me.
there other ones that can move from side to side, or make sure you get the side that you really need,
This worked well. It wasn't as bright as the lamp that was in the TV previously. But, the price was good and it lasted longer than some other brands I have purchased in the past.

You bought this device because of it's size and weight. Unfortunately this case is too thick and weighs half the size of the tablet. Returned it due to the add bulk. It turns a sleek Nexus into the thickness of a small book. The quality though was excellent if you don't care about added size/weight, if you prefer the IPads thin and light look go for the Poetic case.
Bought this as an extra floppy disk drive for one of my laptops as it didn't have a floppy drive, and only a CD/ROM. It works well albeit a little noisy. Otherwise its a decent add-on.
Not bad for the money.  Worked good at first, but gradually stretched and tore after eight months, wearing 2-4 times/week.
Product performs as expected. I have no complaints about this product. I plugged it in, Windows 7 detected it, installed the drivers / software, and it just works.

It works fine and charges as it should, but the round area at the back of the charger is an overly bright blue light. You could read by it. I don't need to be distracted by a giant glowing Motorola "M" when I'm driving at night. My wife covered it with nail polish and it's still bright.
As indicated by others it does an ok job. Anything that will help cool down a drive these days has to help.

the router works fine and faster than the cheaper version with single band. the problem is advertised readydlna which won't be able to read through all files and be streamed to video box. very disappointed. have to buy another cloud storage to compensate this lacking function.
i thought i would like this over my garmin but i dont.  great display but it has steered me wrong to many times

Good value.  Actually used by assistant but she seems to like it except the position of the screen once inserted into the base is angled downward.  It would be better is it was straight up and down.  May have to shim it a bit.

I spent hours on the phone with Western Digital support to get this working. I couldn't connect to the private shares. I had changed the name of the admin account. Lesson learned: leave the "admin" account alone. That account will let you login into the web interface. Create another user account with a different password with permissions to the private shares.

Bought this to use with a samsung cell phone but the adapter was a micro USB.  After trial and error, I discovered I needed a 20 pin adapter.  Sent it back for a refund; I received a refund for the purchase price AND they even refunded my shipping!  Now that's nice!

It works for what we needed it for and with care, it can last for awhile. We've been able to keep the least active ones as long as two years. It works well as a folio to protect the screen and then as a stand -- but the rotation makes it heavy so hard to hold on when reading.

USE AT YOUR OWN RISK.I prefer not to use the swabs it came with, as it is rough and can easily harm the sensor as it did to my canon rebel xti.I use the liquid by itself with a lens cleaning cloth to clean my sensor.And the liquid, it leaves a light greasy residue behind, not really recommended.
The batter works, but it's hard to rate a battery, because I am looking for something with a long life and I've just had this battery for a little over a week.
ok

When you spend $2000 on a TV you would expect to get at least one pair of 3d glasses. That is the reason for losing out to Samsung & LG. I sent a mail to Panasonic but they did not respond. I had to buy 4 active shutter glasses at $50 a piece. I am holding back my complete review until they respond.

I purchased this cable to work with my alfa awus036h antenna,but when i tried to connect the cable to it,it does not work with it at all.It made my windows xp PC restart when it was connected.IT did work with everything else that i connected to it.
Value for price is low.Does it's job.It fits my H4N perfectly without issues.If there are more inexpensive options, try those first.
Product is quality and installs correctly, but is not sized for the Asus netbooks, as advertised. Measure first, then you decide.

I have been using these speakers at my computer station for about a month now. they look nice. The most important thing, though, is the sound, and I am not impressed.I know these are just small speakers for your computer, but the sound is muffled. I tried changing the equalizer settings, but always get a "distant" sound. the subwoofer is not impressive either.

Yes it does fold like a wallet which keeps your filters safe, however when you open it in the field you need to be careful not to drop them as they can come flying out.  It does what it was advertised to do, but the wallet idea is not as secure as other similar non-wallet filter cases/carriers.
I got these promptly but just needed more bass. Construction is good with Metal housings and decent cords. Mic feels a bit bulky though. Sound is clear.

This bag looks hip and funky, and it could be functional except for 2 flaws.  1.  The back-pack straps are much too long.  Even at their smallest adjustment, the pack didn't fit right and hung on my back-side.  2.  The large top area that sits on top of the camera is too large and floppy.  It got in the way of getting the camera in and out.  I returned the bag,

I just wanted a cheap radio for my bathroom. And while this fills the bill I'm a little troubled about it. The box was very worn and crushed. The interior packaging had been removed and replaced with bubble wrap. It makes me think this is a used item. And while it seems to work fine and I don't need anything fancy for this application, when I order something new, I expect it to be new.
Fan connection short circuited after 1 week's use. It is not a big deal, I bought it for the storage. I will hard wire it.

The product, at best, gives a mediocre return for the money.  The signal strength for high definition is a bit stronger than when I had an analog antenna on it.  I expected a stronger signal that would be stable.  At times, however, the strength seems to weaken.  I don't know if it's the weather conditions or not since it is being used indoors.
They are easy to use and have good range... BUT... they did not last long in our work environment. We ended up scrapping them and buying different radios.

This converter is handy, but it's a very tiny piece and therefore a choke hazard for babies/toddlers and can be easy to lose. If it ever falls off the end of the charger it would be pretty hard to find. It's an inexpensive alternative to buying a whole new charger, but just know there are some tradeoffs.

These are solid mid-grade headphones.  They look a little cheap with the plastic "chrome" looking fasteners above each ear, but they have a solid feel for their price.  The cord is not particularly high grade/quality.  It does not come with a stereo to mini jack adapter like the Sony headphones at this price point.  Overall: not bad, but not great.  Just good throw around headphones.
What can you say about batteries?  They were exactly what we ordered.  They fit the camera they were purchased for.
Great build quality but wished the jacks were oriented 180 degrees from each other so that they point in opposite direction when laid flat.  Otherwise a solid performer

its plastic for cryin' out loud.  i wasted one because as soon as the film is peeled off the ipad side everything near statically attracted to it and then it was bubble city.  Mind you, i purchased this item and applied it without taking the ipad's factory plastic prior.

This is really necessary if you are farsighted - price the viewfinder in to the price of the camera to judge whether you need this + GF1/2 or a G3. All the capabilities of the LCD on the back (minus touch screen obviously), uses a little less power, too. Not high quality VF like higher prices DSLRs but good enough.
These cords tend to wear out after maybe 4-8 months so expect to have to buy another.  They work well but are not very durable.
I did not get a USB to micro USB like I thought I would get. I mini USB one. Luckily I had a use for it, but since I did not get the actual cord I was hoping for, three stars it gets
Rubber cups are a little stiff and when its cold out it doesnt stick to the windshield very well.Probably wouldnt buy again .
Over all it will do the job I needed it for but it is not as strong or well balanced as I expected.
Extremely lightweight to the point of feeling a bit cheap.  It serves the purpose, but next time I think I'd spend a bit more money.

The case is attractive, well constructed, and I would have loved it except that it continually put my Kindle fire to sleep! Something about the construction near the buttons must set off the power button on the Kindle fire. When I removed the Kindle fire from this case, it stopped spontaneously going to sleep.

I like the case since it provides protection for my ipad. I also like the "kickstand" approach. I just wish it had a 360 degree rotating capability within the case. I like being able to view my ipad vertically while doing certain things but I can't use the stand in such a position.
The product does as advertised it is a little ackward to use most of other len hood twist on, on this on you squeeze the tabs to put on.

Good product.  Cheaper than the original Nikon adaptor by a long shot.  But only useful when using the D3100 to record/play home movies while mounted on a stationary tripod.  Other than this... The adaptor was more of a bother to install rather than use 2 batteries installed in a battery grip.  On a DSLR the video had to be interrupted every 10 minutes anyway.

I suppose this is a great product for cheap IF you have the right setup. I have an Apple TV, PS4, and a WiiU. This is very picky of HDMI cables. It liked some and would not work with others. I almost had it working with the right combination but couldn't get sound for my WiiU. I had to return and buy one from radio shack. Their customer service was great and they refunded my money quickly.
Seeing as I go thru headphones like candy, these do just fine by me. While not as good as the Sony brand, these are a good set of earbuds. Earbuds seem to work better for me than regular headhpones.

youre not paying much so dont expect much. This filter does flare with bright lights, its kinda cool sometimes and other times it sucks. if youre broke but still want to protect your lens, get this. otherwise, get something a little more expensive and better quality.

The case is cute and thecolor (fuchsia) is great. The holes all line up and you can charge the tablet while its in the case. Cons, the stand portion...aka the cover is pretty useless. It hold the tablet almost perfectly upright...not really useful. And if you try to lay the tablet downat an angle while using the stand it bounces when you type or tap the screen.Overall, as a light protective case...I like it. As a stand...not at all.
Offer some protection but still have room for improvement on the back especially,could also fit the TF201T a little snugger...

+ Commercial advance works great+ Had no problems with DVD+R media- Was able to record only once on +RW, but would not finalize nor playback.- Fast forward if painfully slow. Maybe 4x max. or you can manually skip forward 30 seconds with a button. But press the button very often.

Purchased this with the Digital Converters hoping it would pull in at least on channel.  However, living in the rural area I live in, this antenna does not do the job.  I was told that the old rabbit ears will do a better job.

I just replaced the battery on my Gateway NV53 for the third of fourth time.  (It's been a great machine and won't die!).  I am somewhat concerned that after three charging cycles that's it's only lasting about 1.5 hours before the charge is gone.  If it gets better, I'll report.

After about 5 months of testing, I think I figured out why this router is so finicky. Sometimes I would only see half of my 7 devices. The problem seems goes away when you set it to single band 20mhz mode. Half the speed, but more reliable.
Its a piece of plastic that says Nikon on it and fits the back of a Nikon Lens.  The best part is .. it doesn't say Canon on it.  Ha!
The cord is long enough that I am not having any issues with it falling off the desktop when I move the keyboard around.

Like the title says, my brother ordered 2 of these fans for his PC and only one is quiet. They both work, but one makes a sort of clicking noise as it spins, which is distracting and defeats the entire point of getting quieter fans. Three stars because one fan deserves 5 stars and the other deserves 2 stars.

Nice item but if you sweat allot like I do, this is not for you.  The straps to hold on your arm get very slick and the plastic holder for the strap turns and goes the long way instead of staying put. The protective screen get wet and the nano doesn't respond to your touch any more. I am a runner so am continuing looking for a better holder.

The headphones worked.  Maybe I used it too much; but they fell apart a month of use.  Especially the part that fit inside the ear.  Won't be buying it again.  I did like the fact that the fit was not too tight around ear and I can hear outside noises.
you have to make sure when you are screwing through the adapter that the screws from the speaker do not interfere with the 6x9 opening. otherwise they fit fine on most vehicles and work.
The case holds my IPAD and Logitech keyboard together with plenty of room to spare.  Actually, there is too much room:  It is too loose.  I would not recommend it for carrying an IPAD alone.
Protects the screen as any of them do but finger prints are slightly harder to wipe off than naked screen. Easy to install with minimal bubbling.

I received my cable in a genuine Apple retail box but the quality is poor like my old genuine Apple 4 iPhone cable was. The white rubber gets brittle and starts to wear off then eventually comes apart after only a couple of months.
This cable works as expected but if I knew it had the big lump that some cables have I would have bought something else

Had two of these AC66u routers fail on me.One or the other would continually drop the wireless and wired connections.Eventually had to swap them for the wireless N 66u routers which was a huge benefit.I feel as if that the AC66u needs a bit more work, however the N66u work great.

I bought this to replace a roswill eSata express card because my Retina MBP does not have an express port.  It works fine when attaching a single drive.  However, I discovered today that if you attach an eSATA enclosure with multiple drives, it will only recognize the first drive.If you are going to attach an eSATA chassis, this may not work for you.
I love the product, but wish it was made out of metal, as it is an aluminum casing on the thin side.but the product looks Great!!! Its tiny, fast, and the key chain band they are using is genius.

I used few times, but not really happy. The cable is too thin and the ear plugs keep falling. I bought a bluetooth earphone and I am very pleased. Also the price is very expensive for the performance offered.
decent piece, but with my ipod touch it is a bit too sensitive and fickle unless kept still it will crackle and or lose one side. so im pretty bummed
It is a nice looking but it also very basicIt has a flaw, and sometime it won't recognize 2/5 of my hard drivesThe power cord is very short.

I went from a GoPro2 (which died on me) to a GoPro3 which instead of the standard 3.5mm audio jack uses a mini-USB connection. Surprisingly, there is no competition that I could see, so I was forced to pay for something that should be included with the product.

My zen does not recognize this but it does charge. My daughter's zen doesn't recognize it and it does not charge at all for hers. It is probably a crap shoot as to whether or not it will work for you but it does work on the one. The only problem is that I am afraid it will over charge it.
1 - slide opening is awkward2 - touch screen results in LOTS of unintended pictures3 - does not comes with a separate battery charger - have to use the camera to charge the batteries

The piece that fits into the device is very large and I've had two break so far. They are so large the can easily torque and break if you like to use the device while it charges. They are quite cheap and they do work, they are just a bit too fragile for my use.If you just charge your devices, I'd recommend this. If you use the device while charging I'd look elsewhere; probably for one from Apple.

I bought this camera strap before going on vacation. About a week into vacation the bolt came unscrewed and I dropped an $1100.00 camera, I was lucky no damage. Sling Strap is easy to use. Fast shipping from seller. Just keep the screw tight!!!
Works fine, could be a bit smaller footprint. It's deep as a unit, kinda clunky. Otherwise works ok. Surge protector a good bonus.

... except a major design flaw.The zooming/focusing motor sound is loudly audible when recording video. If not for this, I'd give this camera a five-star rating.Putting the mics inside the camera body, come on Nikon - of course it was going to pick up motor sounds.I am not returning this camera for the unprecedented 42x optical zoom only.Panasonic Lumix FZ150 is a MUCH better choice - and its mics are actually in the flash popup.

We purchased this, but ss another consumer pointed out, we " felk" for the ARC model; otyerwise the same save for the 'endorsement' from the ARC on the unit.The primary issue, initially, was that we solar-charged the unit, and that virtually melted the red "cushiony" rubberized case such that it is gummy to the touch, and useless.  And, it worked sporadically, in spite of consulting a battery manufacturer.I would not try this product again.

I got this speaker to use with my iPhone because my phones speaker was broken. Once I figured out how to work it- too many buttons that have different features, the volume once up at a decent level the sound crackles depending on what surface it is sitting on. It needs to sit on a completely level and flat surface for the sound to be heard clearly.

This cable works as intended. The other smaller adapter port is so that you can charge your iPad while using the VGA connection.  I think the price is to high on this cable, just like other Apple cables. However, the Apple build quality is great, so that makes the pain a bit less.
Keep the lint off of this cover because it is challenging to get off. So be careful of wrapping the camera in a towel or anything like that while carrying it in a bag.

The zoom is jerky and is so touchy it is frustrating. Seems to over zoom and quickly and jerk back the same. Takes good pictures, but would not have purchased this had I known that the zoom feature was so bad.

I travel quite a bit and am a gadget person with cell phones, iPads, etc.  I was hoping I could charge it all with this one usb port but no such luck...this doesn't charge and iPad and that's a bummer!  However, it's great for my Mac because they place the two ports so close together you could only ever use one.

I guess I should have not expected a BMW for a Ford price.  The keyboard works ok but it is really light and the feel of the keys is not good.  May want to spend a bit more and get a better quality product

works well. pairs easily. could use more functionality such as scrolling within apps etc. it does the minimum that i expected.good product support by manufacturer/distributor that answered all questions. some strange behaviorlike hitting pause moves out of netflix to iTunes. despite what others have said only okangle of acceptance. you DO need to point the remote accurately. on the other hand i find bluetooth in general a very limited protocol.

This seemed like the perfect solution to watch movies, etc. but I found the instructions to be somewhat unclear for those of us who are somewhat "technically challenged".  After numerous attempts to get this set up, I gave up and returned the product.
The battery is easy to install, and saved me money.  Don't fall for the hi-cap designation, it doesn't last any longer than the original battery.  That said, it's worth the price.

I wanted a case that would let me stand the Tab up in either portrait or landscape position. It does the job, but it's just way too bulky and adds a lot of weight. I'll be looking for a different case.

IT"S OK WHEN ON A TABLE WITH PREFECT ANGLE OF THE MIRROR AND PERFECT DISTANCE TO IT BUT AS SOON AS THE KEYBOARD MOVES AWAY TOO FAR TO THE RIGHT OF TO THE LEFT OR TOO FAR FROM THE PDA AND IT DOESN"T WORK ANYMORE.
This adapter works good, it supports audio over HDMI, but it isn't a Tripp Lite adapter, it's just a generic one. Hopefully this adapter doesn't go out, I'll update my review if it does.

Put this on my Nikon D600,PRO: more comfortable and useful then the stock eyepieceCons: blocks part of the screen & it is a pain to have to always be turning the eyepieceThe circle rubber eyehood on my D700 is much more comfortable.Only reason this product even got 3 stars is because its better then the original eye piece (most of the time)
Not a bad inexpensive flash. Must set most cameras on Manual to use. Wish my camera had commander mode for flashes.

Pros:It doesn't show up at the edges when I zoom all the way out like full size filters.Cons:Supplied lens cap is junk and does NOT stay on.Filter is very hard to turn.Subjectively I don't think I'm getting as good a range of polarizing effects with this filter as compared to my old filters.

I bought this to play with recording the electric guitar (Fender stratocaster) using the effects pedals in GarageBand. It works fine when plugged into the microphone input on the Mac. There is no static or hum. This was just the cheapest cable I found for doing this. I didn't want to invest in an Apogee, though they look nice. I'm not a professional musician, just like to hack at it.
Its ok. Gives some good close-ups. Not great clarity but its cheap and gets you some close shots. For the price its good :-).

Pay attention to be sure it will work with your model.  I made the mistake of assuming that Garmin has a standard mount.  Not so.  I could have returned it because Amazon is always there for us.  However, it was my mistake and not worth the time or return postage to exchange it.  Good Luck!

I did return the item and the plan but have purchased  smart guard before. just read the not covered items first to see if it is actually worth it for you...some items that have software are not covered....just loook carefully before buying

The speed control works, but there seems to be a big "dead zone" to where the fans won't control.  It may be the fault of the fans, I do not know for sure at this point, but they are some of the higher quality computer fans.

This USB 3.0 hub worked fine for about a week, then stopped powering my portable USB 3.0 hard drive. Memory sticks and my card reader still worked fine, but it wouldn't power the drive anymore. Returned for a unit with a heftier power supply.

The case was a little loose around the edges and often came off when taking iPod Touch out of a bag.  It provides very firm grip and does not slide off any smooth surface so no chance of accidentally knocking it off a table.

This really is not a good tripod. It's so lightweight that it could blow over in the wind, and it's not very easy to maneuver. I wouldn't put a professional camera on there, and I'm not sure I would put a light camera on there for fear that it will blow over. It would work fine for casual indoor use, though.

I bought this product based on its Amazon review, but was disappointed after used it for 1 day. The sound was a bit on the thin side, and it has too much bells and whistles for a product at this price range. If you are looking for a solid amp, take a look at [...], it is not a lot more expensive.
These ear buds do the job adequately.  They don't fit my ears as well as iPod ones but you get what you pay for.
I don't really use this because it's not as useful as I thought it would be. I think it's smarter to own a decent pair of earbuds than to try to turn your iPod into something it's not.

Nice quality leather.  Case was missing the sewn-on strap needed to hold it closed.Case was no longer in stock, so Amazon was wonderful in giving me a small credit back because of the part that was missing.

I concur with most of the reviewers.  Unfortunately, my router/server is a 2-wire from AT&T and therefore it does not allow for UpNuP set up.  Hence, can only record but not accessible via the internet.

I have an Xperia SE x10 and the item functions fine within the phone. The ONLY reason I knocked points off this review, the card takes forever to transfer files/music. What might take a few minutes on a computer, this card might take a half hour to perform several GBs of music transfer. I don't even know if there is a better alternative, but it is worth researching further.

I got this product about a week ago, and for the price ($43) it's not too bad...Except the SD Card slot won't hold/read the card. When I load something on the internal drive it plays back fine. I am hoping that when I get the converters (Mini USB to USB) I will be able to expand my storage space.
Needed to see this out of a second floor window - the lights were not bright enough to see from the outside of the house.
Headphone are a bit thin an flimsy, the have ok sound, but I've heard better for cheaper. I would not buy them again.

Got this at a reduced price. The picture is fantastic, the sound is not. My understanding is that that is to be expected for modern flat screen television sets.My biggest beef is that I cannot connect R-L audio output cables to the TV. It has only optical digital audio or stereo headphone plug-ins in the back, which makes connection to a sound bar very difficult.

Seems to work just fine, but it does fit a little snug in the connector. Apparently other reviewers say it isn't Apple OEM... This one charges and sync's fine to my iMac/iTunes. Haven't checked it out on a PC.

This screen protector is fine, but I didn't feel confident about putting it on myself. I had my engineer boyfriend with the rock steady hands do it and it took him A WHILE. These are not inexpensive, and there isn't anything very special about them...I think you might as well go someplace local where they can put it on FOR you.
My last 5 CD player did not need a receiver, but this one did.  It works very well,k but it is more equipment to have sitting around.
This product functions but the range of the receiver in not very far and it very difficult to adjust properly. I probably will not buy this product again.
It is a good fan, quiet, but its just not as purple as I thought, its a really light shade of purple.

It's a solid good sturdy piece.  With that said, I HATE their packaging.  What is this?  Adult proof?  It's one of those super hard plastic encased package that you need a box cutter to open.  Ugghhh!

The drive was easy to setup and the software installed without problems. My issue is with the interface. I am fairly experienced in software and have done coding but it took an hour to understand how to set up regular scheduled backups and understand what the program wanted when it was asking for "Scripts." It is working well but this in not for the beginner. I am sure there are easier programs that do the job just as well.

I purchased  two of these Ctech cases. They  looked great online. However, once they arrived I was disappointed. The cases smelled awful when opened. it took about 2 days for the smell to dissipate. After getting over the smell, I thought the case looked cheaply made. It  lasted for about a year because the rotating area broke. I won't be getting another.
Very cheap protection for your tablet, but the fit interferes with the edges of the touch screen.  Overall, OK, and good for the price.
This is a very NICE camera,BUT it is way too SMALL it would be nice if they were bigger so you could see it better!

This is a great little MONO mic.  Adding a stereo adapter in an item this small adds a lot of bulk to a small video setup.  I'd give it five stars if it were stereo.  Be sure to buy a stock of those small batteries, though.
It really doesn't fit the IPad 1 to good when you have it propped up with the stand.  It's just okay

To wake up the keyboard, you have to either press the RF key, which is hard to find in the dark, or turn the device off and on. The key arrangement is very inconvenient, although there is some logic in it. What attracted me was the large touchpad, but it is not worth it. I got this keyboard instead, and it's much more convenient:ProMini 2.4GHz Tiny Wireless Keyboard (Built-in TouchPad/Laser Pointer) - Black

Inside of this case is awesome lots of drive options. Its fairly small. Lots of Fan options. But the feet are so flimsy that when you get all of your gear into the case, the case actually rocks back and forth on the feet if bumped. Im acutally considering removing the bottem "feet" and replaciing with something a little stronger. Or removing them all together and just propping it up off of its bottom somehow.
Big and Clunky, don't really like it too much.  When I have the extra cash, I'm going to replace it with something much nicer.

Did not play m4v and some of mkv files so farRemote Control is responding very slowInterface is slow and uglyWhen you connect your external hard drive it takes along time to read the filesLacks many appsBut after all for this low price I give it 3 star

I have the HBS-700 as well and the 730 does cut out more often when I have my phone in my pocket and am walking. I'm using a Samsung Galaxy S3 phone.  It seems from the reviews that the phone you have makes a big difference in whether you will have problems or not.

Bought these for myself and a couple of other family members and they actually do a pretty good job. But, the bad thing about these is the rubber tips can break off very easily. Mine broke off in about 3 days after light use.
Streams video programming well if you have adequate download speed.  However, if you want 5.1 audio for Netflix movies and TV, forget it, you only get two channel stereo.
When I bought the rubber ear plugs for my daughter have said to me, too small. Then I gave it to somebody have it.
Pros:its Googleeasy to set upCons:Chromecastvery slowwill not stream Amazoni will use a $20 RCA WiFi Streaming Media Player can do more or my Smart Tv

So I but this 1 year from the past march. It's been a year and a half and all of a sudden the left speaker started cracking even when turned off.now it just crackles randomly... and you can hear it from across the room. crackle...fizzzzz... hisssssss...worked great for that year.. but.. now... it's obvious I have to buy a new one.. is that Motorola's plan?under warrantee? well, not after a year.

Once you set up your camera for remote, make sure you dont go back and try to take a shot using the camera button, it takes it out of remote mode (D80).  Why cant they both work in unison?  I dont know.  Aside from that small issue, works as expected, first press is focus, second is shutter.  They could have implemented a two stage button to have some sort of consistancy, but they chose to keep the remote slim.
Average sound, not much bass and they fell out of my ears while I was at the gym all the time. Not bad for a backup set for the price.

I've owned all popular trackball mice and this unfortunately not that great for extended use, despite the reviews. The ball is small and thumb gets tired after a while. I also game a lot in FPS multiplayer a games and the response time using thumb isn't as great as I thought it would be. I can game much better using either Microsoft Explorer or Logitech Trackman.

I bought this product to tape the radio into the mp3.  Its the only one of it's kind that tapes right off the radio without an "in-line" option.  The sound quality is terrible.  Not only that, but the buttons seem to be completely random as to what they do.  It was hard to figure out and I actually threw it away.  I bought the Coby mp3 player and love it.

I have a hard time keeping track of it.  You need to buy the string to put on the loop.  If you attach it directly to a key chain the loop breaks off and then you have to try and keep up with it.  Works great - be sure to buy the string.
this is ok for a kid. cheap plastic. plays android games. quality is lacking but you get what you pay for

These covers are as advertised.  They are your generic iPad cover that is of the disposable type.  You get three in a package, so when one gets scratched up, jut put on another.  I did have some trouble applying these to the screen.  It was not the easiest thing to do.  I got a couple bubbles, and I also have some dust under the screen.  Overall though, not a bad product for what is expected.

I bought this as an upgrade from my much loved Panasonic FZ28. Seduced by the possibilities of a x24 zoom. Sadly the image quality was not as good and I have returned the camera using Amazon's excellent return policy. The images has a sort of 'soft focus' quality, a decided red tinge and a nasty glare on photos taken into the sun. Very disappointing after the superb images I have been able to consistently produce with my older camera.

* Pros- Nice design and fold in to a compact position.- Comfortable, on ear design that doesn't cause strain even after a few hours of use.* Cons- Requires battery power for bass and without the battery, the bass is as good a $5 set of earphones.- Even with the battery in, the bass isn't too great.

the fan doesn't seem as powerfull as the last cooler i had and the usb cable that came with it had a short in it so i had to replace it before i could even start to use it. the thing i like is that my laptop grips it and it does not slide when moving around.
considering how little I use this type of product it works just fine, however if you play to use it on a daily basis I wouldn't recommend it is very cheaply made.

The quality of memorex CD-R's has been going slightly downhill for years. (As soon as they were outsourced to china)I got lucky with this batch, only 3 disks were bad. It varies though, some of them have zero, and others have had as meny as 20 bad disks. Sad, but memorex is still one of the best brands out there.

I listened to a few ear buds and in my opinion these aren't much a a improvement to the standard sansa ones I got with both my MP3's. The bass is not deep at all. There was even a slight rattle in some songs at high volume. I sent them back and can't say I would recommend. I actually bought JVC's at target for half the price that I like better.

Very comfortable to wear. Heavy-duty construction. Sound quality good playing mp3's using bluetooth connection. Had problems connecting to my android phone - seeks but does not find earphones. No problems connecting to ipod. Range is poor - 15ft at most.Connection breaks-up out of line of sight. Not bad for the price
It's a good bag, but it's pretty bulky and uncomfortable to carry around. I'll probably get a backpack instead next time, but the bag works and does everything it's suppose to.

This unit does the job of playing Blu-ray and the included apps are great, but the unit is noisy and slow. You can hear the unit's internal parts moving when playing movies. I've seen this is a common problem with this model and may have been corrected in newer models.

This looks like it would be a bit thicker in the pictures,,,,it's not,,,,it works,,,,but its not a TRUE Stubby. I don't regret the purchase, but I think that the thicker one would look better on the Jeep.
Good product, is good for its intended purpose.  The only difference that I would like is for it to be longer, but not much you can do about that unless you buy the longer kind.
It wasn't able to turn to a position that was right for my camera on the sloping windshield but It's a good quality and worthwhile accessory.
It offers a nice option to share your data among different devices; therefore, it contributes to the distribution and protection of your data.
I don't even thing they make this anymore,good when I bought it and lasted for 2 years before it "died:.

I had a hard time getting this on without any bubbles (took so long that a small piece of dust got on it and I couldn't get all the bubbles out).  Looks OK.  When touching it, the screen doesn't slide as nicely as some other covers.

Its a good size, just what I was looking for.  Some difficulty in using it to do a lot of typing but its to be expected for an inexpensive keyboard.  I was able to use it for a year and half before it stopped working and it was disappointing since it was not a keyboard for work but use with casual Internet surfing.
A product that is quite good for as far as the technology has progressed in the Tablet relm. Samsung seems to have a great line of products.
So far I haven't had any problems.  It does fine switching between signals as one is turned on and the other is turned off.
The title said it, hardly any bass no matter how I put them in and I tried different devices. Back in the box/give to someone that has less descriminating ears.
It's OK I guess, if its job is protection.The fit definitely is not great, but it's just OK I guess

The quality of the lens is good. The problems are the following:1. When in full zoom IN, the photo became blurred and dull;2. When in full zoom OUT, the telephoto lens covers the edge of the image therefore your output image has a round border3. The lens is heavy
It works quite well, but needs something more to hold it in the caseRotation is good and lots of positions allowed
What I received was the elbow jointed connector - that being said, so far it works - this is a cheap chinese replacement though, certainly not even remotely OEM.
Then the motor that loads disks must have frayed the windings.  The thing lost all power.  Would try to move very slowly.  Chucked it.

This may be an "It's not you, it's me" problem, but neither my wife nor I could get one of these on my MemoPad without a whole bunch of air bubbles. I've had good luck with Anker products in general, so I dunno. Maybe I just got a defective one.
I used these cable ties to hang a banner around pvc pipe.  They worked okay, but went through several before I got one to hold well and tight.  I bought some heavier ones for the future.

These work better for Audio than for video. For use for video thy could really use some amplification. The picture is darker than it should be. (Presumably less signal strength.) I have no issues with using these for audio.

I use this to update my playstation from time to time because it is faster than wireless.  Putting it in is a breeze but It is always a struggle to pull the terminal off.  The only good thing is for the very inexpensive price it does the job.
Does the job.This has a sticker on hit that permanent attached to whatever thing you are attaching it to.

I really like this product, but when "up to 7 hours" of use is advertised and the fully charged transmitter gives out in under an hour, I am not happy.  The headphones seem to have good staying power on a full charge, but I need at least two hours of use in order to walk my dog about 4-5 miles.  It never made it halfway!
This product is quite useful, but not too comfortable. The quality of the sound is remarkable superior than other handsets, but I knew all of that!
The fan is perfect not to loud and efficient, but the red led light was not as bright as i was anticipating. Overall it is a descent fan.

Product does do what it says it will do, and seems pretty well made, but I don't care for the hand in strap feature, as I can't use thumb on same hand to turn pages....probably not a big deal to some, but is to me...also wasn't all that inpressed with prop up feature for hands free reading....not unhappy I bought it, but would look for different design next time.

I bought 4 of these. the results:#1. all 3 fans work, but only 2 blue lights work#2. all 3 fans work, all 3 blue lights work#3. only 2 fans work, but all 3 blue lights work#4. only 2 fans work, only 2 blue lights work (the working blue light is on the fan that does not work)

Good product, works well and uses a regular AA battery unlike most mice that require AAA. However, the on button for my mouse isn't very accurate. It doesn't work if you switch it on or off. The only way it works is if you move the switch between the on & off labels (put it in the middle), but that doesn't bother me that much.

I chose this particular model of the Lowepro line due to recommendations (from another site, not Amazon) that this was the perfect fit for my new camera; a Canon SX50.  However, the camera would not fit.  I had to return it for a larger version.  As for the construction of this product, it was just okay.  I expected more from Lowepro based on previous purchases.  It seems they my now be cutting corners in padding/construction to reduce costs.

Still a good value for the price.
