Very good price and arrived as described, but the screen protector was folded and did not work very well.The color is not the one I likedthe keyboard protector makes typing very hard, but if use it long time you get used to it. I'm just using the bottom part to protect the bottom of the device and I'm not using other parts

Took me from two bars to three in my office with the antenna placed in the window.  So I'm not blown away.  It's an improvement, but not much of one.  No noticeable improvement in 4G speed.  Connections seem a little bit more stable.
Does not live up to the majority of reviews I read. Sounds just a little mushy which says something about the amp inside it. It's good but not great.
Bought this to be able to hook up cell phones, Ipods etc. to stereos. Works just fine but it wont fit my iphone with an otterbox on it. The housing is too large to fit in the gap of the otterbox.
The RJ45 jack is too small which suggests poor QA.The unit run very hot which suggests poor power management.Client mode grew more and more unreliable over time.

The basic functionality is there, but the trackball is constantly sticking.  It seems to be a design flaw, due to the inside where the ball area not being smooth.  This sounds like only a minor issue, but after months of fighting it, holding it upside down to try to get the ball to move the cursor, I'm about to throw it out the window and find a better keyboard.

Meh.  It's not any better than the piece of crap OEM keyboard HP stuck in the original laptop but it's not any worse.  If your keyboard is broke this will do for now.  But maybe you should hold off and save your money for a real laptop like Asus, Dell or Lenovo?
Wish i could transfer my files via usb, but, I you get what you pay for. Its not an expensive device. It works.
They are ok, misplaced somewhere not great, but ok, good for 4 to 5 not for 7 or 10 OK
No problem with the actual mobo, but it came with a missing pin. Not a big deal, but had to use another old mobo to replace that missing part. Nevertheless, good board.

I am planning on purchasing this item soon and found the following helpful forum discussion: [...]  There is a very in depth review of the converter box and the manufacturers also respond including the news that the next iteration will have a larger and better remote. I will be editing this review once this item is purchased. Initially I had been going back and forth on the Tivax STB T8/9 and the Zinwell ZAT970A ZAT-970A

A litttle heavy, takes pictures really slow, has a pretty long flash recharge time.  so it takes a while for the camera to get ready for your next shot, Battery life is short.  Doesnt zoom in as much as other digital cameras do in this category,  Try a camera where the lens actually telescopes away from the camera.

I first bought another 700 line vandalism proof out door dome camera, I liked them so much I wanted more but they were no longer available at the great low price I got them at so I settled for this camera. It is not as the dome ones I got. I feel the picture quality is a bit off especially at night. The dome camera had a button on the cable to make some adjustments, this one does not.
Well constructed, lite, keep surface cool but made no difference in cooling my processor, even after moving the fan around.

It isn't what I thought it would be, but that is not the seller's fault.  I just didn't know the difference between DVI-D and DVI-I.  I'll keep it.  The price was low enough, so it doesn't pay to return.  I bought myself an education for a low price.
Very uncomfortable to carry, straps are not padded and not quite long enough to fit over the shoulder once the bag is full.  I ended up returning it.

the different tips at the beginning feel a bit weird but I got used to them very fast and the sound is fair to good. the position of the microphone makes it sometimes hard to be understood which is a pity. Overal a good price-quality ratio.

I like the feel of this product, Like some of the other postings. it is tight. but I was hopeing it would work for me,I wish they would provide more lenght in the strap. I will continue to use it and see if it will stretch out. if not then I will use it on my 35mm canon camera.

These buds are great for the price.  I am not an audiophile, but the sound isn't great.  They fit nicely in my ear hole, usually a problem.  They don't fall out very easily and they do isolate some outside sound.  I have used very expensive ear buds and i can tell the difference, but these will do for listening to music whil mowing the lawn or working out
It is really good looking but the fitment is not perfect.The webcam holes are not fitting properly resulting to blind half of it.
Reception was going in and out sitting right in front of the dvd player. If you move your head it seems to drop easily. Also had some static at all times when turned on.
I am not sure about the quality of the chargin case, the battery seems to work well sometimes and some others not.
Not bad. Protects Kindle. I suppose the hardness is good as a stand for the Kindle. Opening is hard...should be easier.

First off, the wii has two video modes: lousy standard definition and a bare minimum "enhanced definition" mode that requires this cable.  The video quality improvement is frankly negligible unless you have a huge tv that does a better job of scaling the component inputs than the composite ones.Either way, this cable is inexpensive and as good as any other.  My tv doesnt have composite ports and this is a lot cheaper than the 'hdmi converters' for the wii.

I bought this for my daughters computer. It was fairly inexpensive and the camera does not move easily. Don't be fooled by how the camera is mounted on the bracket. Be careful because it does not swivel. I tried to move it down and it broke off between the mounting bracket and camera. I did fix it by putting in an oversized screw.

This is our second screen, purchased because we moved to a new home.  While color and contrast seems to be quite good, it was a bit of a pain in the rear to mount and there is a definite ripple in the fabric of the screen.  It has been there since the beginning.  I'm hoping it will smooth out, but if it doesn't we'll have to find another.

The case design is good but it has a metal ring around the front that seem to diminish Bluetooth performance. My Bluetooth headphones keep stuttering with the case on, although they still work within 3 feet. Without the case they work without stuttering for 10 feet. The metal ring does make for a tight fitting solid case but the Bluetooth issue drops my rating to three stars.

I won't write any lengthy review here.  These headphones are solid, but not awesome.  I got mine at a significant discount which made them worth it, but if they were full retail I'd recommend the SOUL SL 150s instead.Pros- Great sound containment with minimal sound leakage- Great looking- Good sound qualityCons- The cord is integrated and not removable- The volume slider on the cord isn't great
cheap design but it works if youre close enough to your pc. even then the mouse pad likes to glitch. turning it on and off seem to fix it for a minute. still beats getting off the couch though.
I expected a class 6 card, but what I got could only be called class 4 at best.  Writes are SLOW for a class 6, 3.4MB/sec write was the best I could get with 3/5 tests showing < 3MB/sec.
Bought this used, Unfortunately on arrival the internal inverter was likely dead as it would only work in 1 second bursts.
This tablet works exactly as you would expect for the price.  Applications run a bit slow and the battery life is very poor.  Great starter tablet for a tween.

These are pretty expensive, I've seen the same single piece of plastic sold for $25!!  Unbelievable.  But I just found a place that sells 2 for $10... still outrageously expensive I think, but cheaper than a lot of these.  Check out ClariVue at the same name with dot com on the end.  clarivue.com

What a good idea? Does it matter if the camera is real or fake as long as it dissuades potential burglars?Look wise, these camera play the part. Feel wise, no... Touch them and you'll scream fake.So the trick is to mount them where they cannot be touched.Now I checked the price for a real one to go with my real system: $140... Compared to $25 for 4... What to expect?

Very easy to use and compatible with the device I had purchased it for. I no longer have the product nor the phone but I figured I would complete the review since I forget to when I had purchased the item a couple years back.

I actually originally scored it 1 star, but it turns out the problem was with my iPhone iCam app.  I haven't tried the mic because I'm just using it to detect motion in my house.  There's nothing spectacular about the product, but it does what it's supposed to do.  And that's what I bought it for.  I would like to have one with wifi so I can put one downstairs.
The roll performs well and gives me the flexibility to cut my own size cable organizer strips.  However, there was a 2 inch section that was deformed and unusable.  Can't beat the price though.
I needed one to replace Arduino header that had a wire broken off inside the header.  Worked great for my needs.
Great version of Yongnuo not bad at all for the price and the performance is fair can't complain at all. Fast shipping.
I like this little bag but my Macbook Pro adaptor doesn't fit the slots. Not the fault of the bag! I will be finding a use for it. I love Built NY stuff!
It gets the job done.  It is not comfortable to wear. The covering came off after two weeks of used.For the price it does work.

buy this cover for use in a computer IMAC. The features at a glance are as universal or size keyboard that comes with the computer, but to put it on my keyboard was not exactly on the keys. the measure is to another keyboard layout. beware of the version, model and serial taclado to avoid problems and not waste money buying because they have a high value cover market and not be happy econ purchase.

I get good sound, but the volume control is a little flaky. it goes from full blast to nothing with very little in between. But since I mostly use it for music, and I like it loud, it's not a problem for me.

Issue #1. The white cover over the USB plug is weak and jams sometimes.Issue #2. Transfer rates for a 1.3 GIG zip file ends up at 10.4 MBs speeds.I have a USB2 external 1TB drive that moves that 1.3 GIG file at 26 MBs.For the price this flash drive is "OK".
This keyboard makes it easy to type documents.  Sometimes it loses i. connection when sitting idle for a few minutes.  Improvements in connectivity would make this an awesome tool for Android tables.

I understand if this was easy to put on that it would also be easy to come off, I get that.  I tried to put it on my phone but I couldn't get it to snap all the way on some of the holders.  I'm sure it would protect very well once it was all snapped into place.  It's not as bulky as the otter box I had for my iphone.

Mouse was smaller than expected.  Size is the most important feature of a mouse.  This was not given in the description.  Why is it always left out?Size:  3.75 X 2.5 X 1.5I would consider this somewhere between Medium and SmallIt is cheap and no big loss if it is lost.
I keeps your keyboard clean, I bought this for my wife and she loves it. It works well but watch your computer as it will get noticeably hotter due to the cover blocking the computer fan intake
Fan definitely moves air nicely. But it is also very noisy. If that is not an issue for you, then this fan, at this price point is pretty good.

This is a good charging system. Does what it intended to do and the charge last for a good while. Only bad thing about it is you have too remove the wrist strap in order for the wii remote to fit on the charger which really sucks.

At $10 these are not a good buy. I know these cost 20 cents to manufacture. They don't hold to the Sony headphones very well. I used a couple small pieces of electricity tape to hold them in place which worked but looks kind of ghetto.

For what it is, it's okay. It's not an OEM cord. It's not made here. It doesn't charge the tablet as fast as the OEM cord does. Over time the plastic on the tip of the cord starts separating from the metal but it still works. If you need to charge quickly, don't buy this cord. The length is very convenient for overnight charging and using it while it's plugged in in bed.
It works.Didn`t came with a battery. Is a basic mouse. Using it in a Win 7 old AMD desktop.

I have had 2 Onkyo AV receivers go bad on me shortly after the 2-year warranty expired.  Both receivers had HDMI board problems, which is a very common problem.  Apparently Onkyo uses cheap capacitors that don't last long.  Many people have been burned, just Google 'onkyo bad hdmi'.I will never buy Onkyo again, and will tell all my friends, coworkers, and church members about this.From now on it's Denon or Yamaha for me.

It's speaker wire, 16-gauge.  If you need it, the price is among the best you'll find on Amazon.  The package arrives fast (if you're Prime), slow if you're using the Free Super-Saver Shipping option.  The wire and packaging are the same as you will find in practically every other spooled speaker wire packaging: it does the job.

The "contract" was emailed next day after order.  It seems to cover most potential issues.  However, there is no way to judge how good or bad this will be until it's used.  Hope I never need to use it.
** warning **Does not work with iPhonesI'm not sure why, but this worked just fine with my ipod in my car but would not work with my iphone.

The slim design of this stylus matches well when carried with the Transformer Prime but it does not perform as well as I would hope. I frequently resort to using my fingers on the touchscreen to get it to do what I want.

Perhaps I just got a bad unit, but my iPad 2 has crummy WiFi reception.  If I get more than 20 feet from the access point, the connection randomly drops out.I've heard others complain about this as well, but your results may vary. Just keep in mind that other tablets have multiple antennas to avoid this issue.
I think I paid $50 for this card, but that was a long, long time ago.

I've had this case for almost 2 years. It does not fit like it used to at first. Now its loose all the way around. I still have it on my tablet for some kind of protection and keeping it from sliding off my hand. Some protection is better than none.

Great build, very nice cable. not flimsy at all. HOWEVER - Sound is just decent. It sounds kinda like you're listening to your music through a tube - not great. Go with Panasonic ear drops - 6$, solid build, very comfortable, light, sound much better.
Not the best thing in the world, but it does the trick. Colors are a bit strong, so I have to set my WB to the color cap rather than anything else. But not bad at all.
this is a replacement plan....  can;t tell you much about the plan as I did not need to use it

This Mini keyboard works fine on my Windows XP computer.  The quality is suspect because on my unit the keyboard base plate is warped.  There is at least a .25 inch gap from left to right when it should be flat.  I do minimal typing on this computer (mostly web surfing and playing movies and music)otherwise I would return it.

For the relatively small size (to fit a Kindle) I'm struggling to justify the price that Amazon charges for this product.  I would rate the product as "meets expectations" and from a durability/manufacturing standpoint I'd rate it a "5-stars" though I don't think it's worth the price charged, thus my "3-star" rating.

This product is not self powered and draws power from the computer. It would have been better if it had it's own power supply. Also the USB and Firewire ports should have been divided equally. Otherwise, not a bad product.

I'm not a professional. And I suppose if you bump up your ISO and aperture you maybe able to use these lights however I found them under powered. Also being fluorescent lights they gave off a bluish hue to my pictures. I guess for the price you can't complain and I figured out a way to use 1 light stand and 1 umbrella with all 3 light fixtures to provide ample lighting.

Its okay. I like the lighted key, but don't like how the features work. CTL this, Function that, I don't like having to remember what does what. I use it as a backup keyboard in can my other one malfunctions.

I guess I underestimated the measurements because this case is considerable bigger than I thought. I was hoping for a smaller case that I could pack and carry in a small backpack. It's a little too big for that... It would be best for just putting it away in a drawer with all of the cables and extras in the same place.

The problem is that the iPad mini is "too thin". Because the case does wrap around be base adequately it has nothing to hold onto when placed in your hands. Not really Incipio's fault but not an easy case to use on a regular basis.
I just threw it in a drawer.  I guess sometime I'll find a camera I want that it will work in.

Perhaps I misunderstood but I thought these were the same size as the $19.99 pads.These are longer and narrower  and don't fill out the ear canal as much as the other model. I guess if you have long narrow ear canals these will work but I've got big one (ear canals).
Works well, the cover looks ok and I thought it would be clear. The pad protection is no good. Does not allow to use your fingers well for different functions. Removed it.

i think it wouldve been good, but its confusing to put the dang thing on. Its hard to Reuse. I think it's good for a one time thing, not reusable. And the pieces of paper on the corners leave glue that is annoying ti clean off.
Not as universal as it claims. It was pain in behind to get it all right.Quality is high tho , i screwed the speaker screw in and out quite a bit, not damage to the plastic.
Not the greatest sound. It "clicks" a little at certain frequencies. Feel plastic. But it's a cheap headset, so it's kind of expected.
It took forever to get it set up and connect reliably to the network. Error messages were misleading.  It works well now except the Volume Control needs side pressure to work. Not a quality product.

I have two 5-yr olds who use this multiple times per day. Within a month the ends started to fray and within 3 months, the covering on the lighting connector came off, exposing the wires underneath.Amazon quickly replaced it once I called them directly so I'm thankful for that. Maybe the new one will last longer...

I use this at work every week and everything was great until the plastic tube started to malfunction :( I was so upset because my boss was trying to get hold of me during an emergency and I couldn't hear him. I bought two of the black tubes that come with the black plastic end fittings and boom it worked!
very slow recycling time.  short battery life.  great for small cameras requiring stronger flash. good slave flash despite slow recycling for added effects. great for the price.
If you want an ssd upgrade this does work as it should, but it is far from the fastest SSd on the market, and with prices dropping i would not recommend it.
First day of use and the headphone were hitting there limit and causing a horribly staticy noise. I'm no pro so it may be my settings or the way the songs were recorded, but it is very annoying.

The only problem I have with these HDMI cables is they are too stiff. If you need some flexibility, buy a different cable. The Mediabridge HDMI cables and especially the Flex Series are very flexibility. Of course the Mediabridge cables do cost a little more. You get what you pay for.

I had read and later after delivery reread the advertised listing using such terms as "antenna booster, Powered....", and was very disappointed that there is no powered amplification.  If such claims are made about design gain, then a comparison in db difference should be clearly delineated.  It is not.
It's held up ok but I haven't been rough on it yet. My SD cards keep falling out of the foam cut out.
I have reviewed numerous routers. This one did not do too hot. I noticed serious slowdowns and my cell phone kept getting tossed off the connection. Back in the box it went.
it works okay,the price is also okay,what i don't like is too big.but other than that it does the job.
I'm late on reviewing this product but if I were to buy an e-reader again, I would go with a name brand.
it's nice to have a pack of these around just in case you need it. never know, and it's cheap enough to get a few packs.
If you think in protection, this is perfect.But the trackpad lost sensibility.And the edge of the sticker are too sharpened.It's like it hurts the wrists.
Great price for a display but it is rather small, very tight viewing angle, and the image quality is not very good. Also, the build quality is quite poor.
Battery did not last more than 9 months!
Device seems to be a little flimsy, but it works.  Would have rated it higher if it were not for the flimsiness...

Feels good, but the magnet, to my dismay, only serves to turn on and off the screen. When folded back into the familiar triangle shape, it does NOT hold in place because there is no second magnet (or it is very weak).Otherwise, it's not bad for the price.
This tripod is very light but, it work well.But the holding case is not easy to use because of its poor design.

Title says it all - first one was detected by Windows but would not pass any traffic nor could it obtain a DHCP address.  Hard set IP was no go as well, updated driver, etc.  Returned and ordered a new one, this one works fine.  Unfortunately in the time messing around with all of this I noticed they released an updated USB 3.0 version of the adapter which I would have preferred.

One of the zippers on this fell off right away. Not that I cared because it has two zippers on each side, but the quality isn't the greatest. It does leak sand if it is flipped on it's end. I plan on filling it with sand stored in ziplocked bags. I also might try throwing a couple free weight plates inside to avoid the spillage.

Welp, This protector is still on my Galaxy tab however, it didn't fit well for some reason.  Can't remember what the problem was but I had to cut it down.  Even cut down though I was able to apply it with no dust bubbles.

This is a big upgrade from the MS Natural 4000, fixing many of its flaws. One of the big issues I have with the Sculpt is the F keys – they are not keys, but buttons. There's no feedback as to when it's been triggered, and without looking, you can't tell what one is what. There are no bumps or gaps, so everything from Esc to Calculator blend together.

This lens is pretty alright, but the zoom can get stuck.  I took it apart, fixed it, and it is fine most of the time, but it can still get hung up sometimes.Images are very crisp and good quality.  Way better than the lens the EOS series cameras come with.  I just wish it wouldn't stick.

I was best off just going with the basic version of this, which was dissappointing. So overall the idea and the product I recommend, the higher amplified versions of these didn't do anything beyond the basic one. Guess what for the money I'll stick with the basic one. Point of reference about 10 miles directly west of Boston.

But it did work. The problem with this keyboard is that the battery runs down too fast for my wife. I'm not all that pleased with the function key labels either. Doesn't match up with an Apple keyboard.
theres really not much to say about a cable. it does its job connecting my motherboard to my dvd drive. no issues.

As the other reviews state, nothing of extra-ordinary quality in this package. However, with my needs being very small and my system weak, these cables were enough to get everything wired and working.
This sleeve I bought so my silver IPod would be black. It serves that purpose and it does protect but one major drawback is the click wheel is not as responsive but not a deal breaker.

I bought this and the tele lens to improve my video options. It takes time to screw it on, and it adds a fair amount of weight. It's a lot more glass to pass light through the camera, too. Image quality seems okay, though.

For some reason it will only play through the drivers side speakers and there was a little hissing noise.  I called the customer service number given on their website and they were ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!!!! They did everything they could to help me troubleshoot the problem and even sent me a new one overnight.  It just was not compatible with my car and I am truly bummed. :-(

The light is handy, lightweight and well-balanced. It fits nicely over the cover I have for my Kindle. It's easy to position and unobtrusive...BUT...the nice brightness when the batteries are brand new fades to something a bit frustrating. It's better than no light, but I wish it stayed bright longer.
Good for the transformer.  Makes a heavy combination with tablet.one two three four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen to fulfill required number of words.

While this processor is great for the money, the stock heat sink/fan is practically a leafblower in both noise level and tone. It's essentially unusable. I would rather this be $10+ less and have spent that money towards an aftermarket solution

It was Dead when it arrived (maybe a fuse); It a nice Sleek look and the specs are great, Pity it didn't work. Some Amazon employee didn't check it, and just tagged it good, this will cost Amazon some shipping both ways. Amazon had UPS pick it up the next day and 2 days latter I got a full refund.
It wouldn't fit in the charger hole for a Lifeproof case. Otherwise it works and charges my iPhone5 just fine, but the case is just to much of a pain to remove to deal with it.Be sure you measure!
i don't understand the difference on having this filter and not having it on at all... so, this is just because others simply recommend it.it fits just as they offer into my canon ef 50mm lens.

i needed this so i could watch thing from my PC on my TV  it was exactly what i needed
We installed this in our car with a GEN 6 LOCKPICK. It worked OK but the quality wasn't great. The down conversion is very grainy compared to native RCA signals.

The case itself is fine, but the keyboard just isn't a great typing experience. My ? key is sticky, the individual keys are small, and it's just not very responsive. I suspect this is probably okay for limited typing purposes, but I'm a writer, and I use my iPad to write while traveling. This keyboard's just not pleasant to type on for longer than a couple of minutes. Battery life is good, though.
Compared to the stock ones provides by Garmin, quality wise these fall short, but that aside it works as expected and it was cheap, so.
The Bluetooth doesn't really work. The call features don't really work. It works great as a wireless headset and for skype calls. The sound quality is fine.
I found these cables to be very useful to have on hand since I am always mislaying them. I can even carry an extra in my purse for use with my portable charger.
Good sturdy little notebook stand. Fits all means it kind of fits OK but it could be better. For what I need it is just fine.

I thought this would mount in my 5.25 opening. However it did not come with mounting rails.I was lucky I found one from that worked.  The mounting does fit perfectly however no wayto hold it in place unless you have the matching hardware to hold it in place
Good product but my macbook air doesnt fit properly when it has it's hard cover case on... :( Just a sleeve, doesnt protect much

I've been a Feather user since the iPhone 4, and love the overall design. I wanted a case that was as slim as possible, and this certainly fits that bill. My only gripe, however, is that the finish does wear off rather easily, as most others have noticed. Unfortunately, I have yet to find another case that I like more, so I'll continue with the Feather for now.

Not the best audio but for the price you can't beat it. comes with a mount to stabilize the TV, but the mount is not very sturdy so hope you can bolt it down to something or you might wake up with the TV face down.
I have an Inspiron 6000 and the keyboard that shipped was not as pictured. It did not fit my computer the vendor was GREAT about the return and I would not hesitate to buy from them again

Certainly work and are as described, but not really any better than my old cheap ones (my old ones that I lost were around $15). Wont be returning them or anything but I also am not impressed, just content.
There is nothing too amazing about this webcam, standard features with reasonable frame rate. I've bounced it around since having it and it still works fine.

These headphones are great sounding, but they are very uncomfortable on your head. If you are looking for some basic wireless head phones, then these are the ones you should buy simply because of the price.
This unit works great only I found that I needed a DOCSIS 3. It is however getting some great speeds in my area. Better than the Time Warner issued! Already paid for itself!

I bought this to protect my ipad2 but the anti-glare defeats the purpose of having a retina screen. It also makes the touch screen less sensitive.  I ordered other screen protectors and will not order this again.

hardly looks like the original Apple battery, but works, for the price paid is ok, right now i'm investigating an issue, before installing the new battery the macbook shutdowns at 35% now shutdown at 10%, yes shutdowns instead hibernation, seems to be an Apple issue. no answers. using a battery health application the battery shows one charging cycle and 95,8% health status, weird for a brand new item.
Used last time for holiday pictures of family so everyone could be in the photo.  Was a little hard to use, connected easy just has to be in the right spot to activate camera
It works for the sound, but will not charge my Ipod, which isn't a surprise.  Most after market charger don't.  Seller provided quick delivery.

This is a good case. the quality is good but this is so small. I can not put my lens in. I bought a new one and feel OKAY with that. It's more expensive but it is up to you. you can not doubt with that.B001TZWNF0

This is a nice background but if I did it over again, I'd get something larger.  It does not show up as brown in the photos under a studio lighting setting, it shows up as grey.

I liked this case ok.  My only thing I would change is the zipper.  It would rub on my device and I could see where over time it would cause scratches.

I bought this for my daughter because I let her use my Nuvi 350 one time and she really liked it - particularly the voice directions. Probably works well for intended purpose.  BUT, I wanted an adapter that would plug into the 3.5mm mono port on my radio and take 3.5mm (male) stereo ear buds, so I could listen from either ear bud. I purchased this cover for my Samsung Galaxy 3, and it is ok.  The material is just ok.  It does stand well, it covers the tablet well.  The openings are perfect and allows to charge while closed or open.  What I don't like is that the tablet feels a bit lose (I know it will not fall out at all, but it is not so snug in place).

There are two small screws on either side of the end with the usb adapter that connects the end to the rest of the case. On the inside of the case, the screws bite into the circuit board and can't be screwed in flush with the outer casing.

For the price, I think this unit produces some great sound. Klipsch is reputable, and this product falls in line w/ that. However, my remote will onlychoose to work when it wants. Sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. Not a battery issue, b/c it happened w/ a new battery. This simple IR remoteis built on simple & sound technology, not sure why mine fails to work, but disappointed for sure.

I like that its a swing away, but not so sure I like the build.  It's pretty heavy, carbon fiber may be a better way to go. It seems too heavy for it's own swing arm.  it sags a litte on the arm.  Everything works ok, the filter treys are a little wonky, but usable after some modifications.

This stand is smaller than it looked in the photos accompanying the listing. Due to its size it's not a stable as I had hoped for. Pushing the iPad screen anywhere near the top or edges cause the tablet to wiggle. This is true whether the tablet is in the portrait or landscape orientation. On the plus side, it is small and light making it very portable.

this is a case good finished, good material, but its too small for portable upper 15", if you have a 15,4" this case not is for you, perhaps for other portables its good, but it has a just price, my portable is a toshiba A75-209 and in to the case is a baggel whit a lot jam & cheese.
I purchased this to use with the stereo in my truck. Once formatted to FAT32 (I used my wife's Mac), it has worked great in that application.

I bought these speakers about three years ago.  I like everything about them that the other positive reviews have to say, but the right speaker just blew.  It still produces some sound, but it's barely a shadow of the left speaker.  I have to seriously overbalance, and will have to get new speakers if I really want to appreciate music while working at my computer.  Oh well...

I love everything about this monitor, except that when looking at it straight on, things get lighter as you descend the screen. If I stand up or shift my head, this goes away, but when sitting in front of it like I normally would, it can't be avoided. This is real annoying when working with photos that look different depending where they are placed on the screen.

Be cautious with this enclosure.  It's not exactly sturdy-built.  The 2 screws that attach the SATA-USB connection/conversion to the enclosure are maybe 3mm long.  Not exactly sturdy.  I also experience random connection drops solved by re-inserting the usb cable into the enclosure.  However, I don't think that should be a requirement for a valid product.  So I would not recommend storing anything of vital importance on whatever drive you put in this enclosure.

This case is pretty good for the money. However, the cut-out for the headphone jack is off center. It is difficult to get on and off. I would not recommend buying this case if you would like drop protection, but it is good for light use and protecting the ipad from scratches.

For some reason it looks stronger  online. When I received had to fix one leg which was connected. The legs as well does not hold up when extended, which was disappointing for me. The bag as well is of a cheap quality, before I went any where with it I noticed a tear inside. The quality not all that. The other products were fine,

I have two of these but recently one on a frequently used lens , just began coming off . I was at a site on an incline and it it was not for the help of a nearby tourist , it would have been gone. Solution use a better glue not paper glue.

I am annoyed that the price of this item was reduced from $20.17 to $11.75. I purchased at the higher price just about three weeks ago and now it is a lot cheaper. The shipping costs to Australia were quite high so it is not worth returning it.The new price better reflects the quality of the product.Disappointing that Amazon has done this.
This is a decent speaker system for this price point. I did not get any distortion at loud volumes. And it is loud enough to fill up a small hall.

I just wanted something that I could swap from bag to bag and this works fine. It's a nylon wallet with velcro. My only issue is that over time it puts an odd film on the filters. Not sure what it's from but I might be looking for something different if I can't figure it out.

I wanted to connect multiple USB devices and some of them need charge but I was sadly faced with the fact that this device needs a power source in order to charge any device that is connected. It wasn't in the description wether or not this was needed. I would recommend looking for another one like this that comes with the charger.
They're okay if you are looking for a set of casual earbuds and they are very good for the value but if you care even a little about the sound quality, they'd probably disappoint you.
I found it difficult to get this thing working with Windows 7 and 8.  I would always have to reset it to wake up.

Works well when it connects. Won't reach on the power outlet in my wife's Chrysler Concord LXI or my brothers 70's Ford truck. Works well in my Jeep Cherokee but hard to remove, nothing to grab onto when it is plugged in. I just leave it, don't need to power anything else. Powers my iPod and my cell no problem.

I wanted to use this card with my Canon 6D but it does not quite work.  It works fine for still photography but falls flat is with video.  The write speed is too slow to shot video.  When I put an Extreme card in the camera, I could shoot as long as I like. Fortunately, we also own a Canon PowerShot S110 and it works fine for video and stills in that camera.
the sound in both headphones is ok .... but i must turn the plug many times to adjust the volume
Not bad for the price. I think they confused the gauge of the jacket with the gauge of the copper wire.It's a cheap kit. If you are just looking for something cheap that will work, then go for it.
the cord works fine. No problems. Cord does look old might have been used once before.

This product is okay for what you pay for. i had to use my own rubber parts to get it to fit my sb-800's or sb-700. Light will leak from the top part because it is made of paper inside and it will cause a color shift for which you will need to w/b for. Dont expect miracles.

The plastic piece on the adapter is obviously made from cheap materials and it feels like it can break any minute. It was shaky when I inserted my US charger in it but it did hold up the connection well and charged my phone without any problems. Good cheap fix to charging when traveling overseas. But I'm not really sure how safe it is.
not bluetooth mouse otherwise works okay.  You'll need USB port for this device, if you have limit number of USB port during travel then this product is not for you.
I'm sure that there are better products on the market for reviewing your old 35mm slides. This one is okay, but cheaply made and truly not worth the money.

This unite is a great addition to anyone's photography equipment. It works great for standard portrait photography. I would give it 5 stars if I could set the unite for A/P in the flash measuring mode. I often use a set aputure and wish to know the  shutter speed.

Drive worked fine, then started clicking after 1 week. I didn't lose any data, but decided not to take a chance & sent it back. Amazon was great about taking it back...I exchanged it for a Seagate which is working fine so far.

Pros:Easy to assemble.Not too heavy.Sturdy construction.Cons:Bulky.Instructions are garbage.bolts are not long enough to accommodate larger wood posts.Very frustrating in tight spots.Overall this is a decent mount. It is somewhat frustrating in tighter spots and I had to use longer u-bolts in order to make it fit where i wanted it to go. All in all it got the job done and is a decent price.

I didn't expect much from a lens that is not much more than a pin hole.  The picture quality is marginal.  It is better than no lens if you need to grab the body and take a picture but don't expect a shap picture.  My cell phone does much better.  I will keep it because it was not that expensive but my use will be in emergancies only.

Hey there, I bought this keyboard to surf the web in bed with our mounted monitor. Its nice to have a small wireless unit but the mouse pad isn't very responsive and the keys themself are not the nicest. It works ok but there has to be a better model out there somewhere!

One of the reasons I bought this was that the pictures showed it holding a tablet in portrait orientation. I have a Tab2 (P5113) and it will only hold the tablet in landscape. Other than that, it seems fine. It paired easily and, as a screen cover, it fits well.
it works but doesn't support alternate operating systems.  it was purchased for use with the raspberry pi but doesn't provide support for linux.

I didn't rate it any lower as it might be fine some someone else but there was no way it would fit on the back of my Samsung.  I was not about to make holes in the wall to mount it when I had already found it was an unnecessary accessory as the Roku 3 is a small box I hardly notice under the TV.  I sent the mounting kit back to Amazon for refund.
The protector will last about 3 months.  Mine is already peeling off after about 2.5 months.  Price is right...even those costing 10x more start to peel after a short while.

I have seen a lot of reviews online of ppl using this for in car go pro recording so I purchased it. While it is better than the hero2 built in mic it still sucks with all the interference from the car. Turn the car off cuts the noise down but still a lot of white noise on mine. I am going to try shielding the wire.
Not the greatest but not the worse head phones out there. The rubber part always falls off. I would say buy it if you don't have much money to spend.

The quality of the material is pretty good, but it's too big for the Kindle HDx. The kindle slides around inside and doesn't feel very secure. I suppose if you're just looking for protection from dings and scratches, it works fine. Still, there has to be a sleeve that fits better.
Looks are nice. Handling is easy. Results are not that impressive. Video does not have that great HD quality. wont recommend it.

The software that comes with this device is horrendous -- but I have a Mac with Garage Band, so I used the audio output instead of the USB output, recorded into Garage Band, then exported to iTunes.  This way, the quality is surprisingly good, and I am having a ball transferring old vinyl (that never showed up on CD) to my Mac.  But if I had to used the included software, I would have sent the thing back.

I bought this bag and while I do like the compartments and pockets and straps for all of the tripods etc. I find it is very big, but I don't have much gear. I use it more for storage. I am not sure I would it for transport as it looks like a camera bag.

This device was already on the 'obsolete' list when purchased.  I bought it to replace an earlier D-Link Server that had failed.  It has now failed (afer more than a year) and is virtually unavailable anywhere.

Overall customer service was great as they allowed me to return the Surface RT. The tablet is just a little bit slow for me and freezes sometimes.  I think the Surface RT 2 will be a much improvement over this. This current gen isn't up there yet with the other high-end tablets.

it's a hard drive so not much to say.  it works.  but why do they have to put into ita blinking light that you can't turn off?  if you're going to put this in a bedroom by any chance,be prepared to block the very bright light with something on the desk, so you can sleep.

I got this to supplement the airflow in my case since I was going to be doing some 24/7 cryptocoin mining. I wasn't worried about noise so much but got this since it was advertised as silent. It's actually fairly loud. But for the airflow I would say its fine. The airflow is great and keeps the temps really low even while mining.

The Sony DVD player has a very good picture, but the buttons on the top are terrible. They are stiff and hard to push.  The tray takes it's time opening and closing. I am using it to play CD's at the moment until I find a better model w/time, etc. on the front.  The only thing I really like about it is that it cuts itself off after a while.
Don't know why I bought this, I had all of the pieces already but thought I needed it for a second bag.
I bought this thinking I would need it, but I didn't.  Since I didn't need it, I haven't tried it, but the provider was good and got it to me rather quickly and the price was very good.
This case is good, its sturdy but I broke the zipper because of the little pieces of cloth inside.  I cut them off, it works better now.  This was very reasonably priced.
The Samsung 19" LCD LN9A450 was a good price. However, I find the picture to not be as bright as I would like.

I returned this lens hood because I wanted it to accompany the use of a polarizing filter. This was unsat because it unscrewed from the lense when I turned the filter to get the correct effects. Works fine as a protective device for the end of the lens.

I use this with my NEX to shoot video with my Dad's old Pentax lenses.  Works well but is heavy. It is permanently attached to my 50mm 1.4, however, I have used it with my 134mm and 35mm lenses, and it worked well on all of them.

FM radio and transmitter don't work at all... Voice recorder works, but has a very very bad quality. Actually useless...Anyway I set 3 stars because it plays mp3 files and it does this job very well. If you need it for only playing mp3 files you will not go wrong.

i bought a set... and at first loved them,... i had them setup grabbing a muslin to the stand and suddenly, out of nowhere... one of them collapsed and broke into pieces...i may buy another set anyway, but still one broke by itself,i guess thats alright for the price paid. that must of been a defective one, i hope the rest will last longer.

Dear sir/madame:your product looks line it would preform as stated, how ever, I did not have to use them as the antenna I ordered came with a cable already attached and the radio came with a mounting bracked in the box.  this was not noted in the product discription.  I thank you for the timely service and will keep your products in case I need them in the future.

Very reliable Garmin navigation and easy to use with just the right amount of menus and features to not make it cumbersome, BUT the traffic feature does not work hardly ever.  I've been sitting in hours of Jersey shore traffic and the GPS says all clear and I've seen delays noted on the screen with not a brake light in sight.

this was a good case and it works just fine I just wish it was made of better quality materials and a bit more sturdy around the edges in case of drops, still a goood case but gave it to my dad and switched to the i-Blason case which is much sturdier and made with better quality material
It worked ok but the main problem was it would not stay connected with the wifi. Daughter broke it so it is now in trash
Big enough. for 15.6inch laptop.cooling ability, I am not sure.Not that noisy. and looks good.Fan isn't good enough.need more good one. sigh..
I expected the color to be a little darker shade. I'm not sure I will use it much but for lens protection.
Works as promised, gave three stars because in batteries longevity is king and I have no data as yet as to whether this will last as long as the original.

I usually use Apple-branded accessories with my Mac, but had to choose something new because Apple doesn't currently offer a bluetooth keyboard with numpad. While connected, they keyboard works flawlessly. However, when I come back to the computer in the morning it takes a long time to reconnect and sometimes I even need to redo the pairing process.

I went to the Lowepro web site and used their bagfinder for my lens.  It recommended this lens case.  It is too small, even without the hood it wouldn't fit.  Get out your ruler before ordering.  Sorry I had to rate 3 stars because of this major problem, but otherwise this is a good case.  Maybe I'll try another manufacturer for its replacement.

The packege arrived well. The procedure to apply the film is easy but the problem is the condition. The surface need to be clean, VERY clean. It is tough to have this condition. When you think it is clean and start to apply, some Dusty will appears. In my case, a end with 3 in my screen.

I am rating the two pack at three stars because what is pictured here is not what you get. You get a single carry case instead of two as listed. I returned it and ordered two individual sets because we wanted each to have their own case, as was shown in the product page. I cannot rate the performance because I did not unpack them. I did not want to render them un-sell-able.
Comfortable but do not cancel outside noises.

Its ok, could be louder. The rotary volume knob is nice. Kinda always have to take it easy with the music, which stinks. Even with the bass turned down it still gets bogged down and choppy. Cant remember what I paid but $20 bucks seems like a appropriate price point, no more - too many other options that might not cut out at anything other than unreasonably low volumes.

Pretty good product. Worked for about 3 months until I accidentally bumped it with my coffee table and the cheap screw-on connector broke off. About the same quality you'd find for a little more expensive at Wal-mart. I'll probably just go to Wal-mart next time.

The charger quit charging shortly after purchase. The batteries are charged with another Canon charger I own. Unfortunately, I purchased this for the back up charger. The batteries do not last as long after charging compared to the original batteries.
Not quite what I was looking for.

I was expecting more on these, cause of the reviws, but i was disapointed because i have a maxell cheap headphones that sound much better than these JVC's, but they are not bad specially for the price.

The box itself does have a place for all the USB cards I use but the USB cord is just to short.  The cord needs to be at least 10 inches longer.  It barely can reach sitting on top of a PC to the USB port.

Nice camcorder, but it malfunctioned two years after purchase - even though it was used very little during that period of time. It began zooming in on its own without the operator touching the zoom control. Canon replaced the zoom control and charged a flat fee of $250 for the repair. Only paid $650 for the camcorder, so it was a large percentage of the purchase price. Pretty disappointing.
looks great and is nice but does not make anychange in your picture or sound system as advertise same as a regular surge protector but for the price it s worth it
My problem with it is that it doesn't fit my apple express with the AC port on the side. Otherwise it seems like a good solution.

Those are basic headsets for your IP phone. They sound OK but unless you put the mike right in front of your mouth other have trouble understanding you.If you spend most of your day on a headset, I recommend buying better ones. They are good for the occasional drawn out conference call.
I ordered it but it was the wrong one for what I needed it for. I am sure that it is a good product.

This card works fine for my media center computer connected to a 55in 1080p HDTV via HDMI.  Video and audio quality are good with HDTV in windows media center.  The fan however is VERY loud and quite noticable even when sitting clear across the room.  It seems like it runs at full speed all the time.  I'm considering replacing the card simply for that reason.
while the cutter is great both adapters came bent and i could only manage to shove one in my 3g. overall would buy just for the converter.
Work fine,  sound good,  and I had no issues getting the blue tooth connected. That being said,  moving around too much and these fall out.
Its cheap but what do you expect for the cost. It will eat 9v batteries so use the power supply.It transmits about 30 ft or so but doesn't do well between walls.You get what you pay for.

Sound is great, but for some reason the right earbud does not fit and continues to fall out with mov't.  The left is secure.  Makes me feel lopsided or something :(  Have used the nike version in the past with good success.  Sound is not as good as the phillips, but at least they stay on BOTH ears!
Had to return it.  Did not turn on.  Hopefully, defective, but found cheaper else where.  Amazon took care of everything.

In short, this car power charger works just fine with my old iphone4 and my MP3 player, and it even will charge my Garmin GPS.  The cable is recognized just fine by the iphone 4.  They can be fussy with any aftermarket cable.Trouble is, when I attach my stock droid cable, it simply will not charge my Droid Razr Maxx HD.  That phone is fussy as all getout with various chargers.  So it's a mixed bag here.
The cable is exactly as described. Its of very good quality but the price is a little steep for what it is. A cheaper alternative would get you by but this I can use with confidence for my customers.

I only bought this radio to use as a cost effective police scanner after Amazon listed it in scanner results.  It's pitiful at that task and so I had little use for it.  Don't buy one to use as a scanner, it's a waste of time.  I gave it away.  Perhaps used for it's original intent as a HAM radio it's great .. I have not a clue about that.

What I really don't like about this sleeve is that you have put the ipad in under a little pocket on the inside. I would have rather had a sleeve where it was specifically designed to protect the ipad (from the zipper) without the pocket. It's a snug fit for the ipad, but I have a small case over it at all time, so that's probably my fault.
This is a nice beginner system for somone who wants to keep an eye on a particular area. Rection can be good depending on where the Cam and recevier are located from each other.
I guess I was expecting miraculous speeds, but if there is a speed increase you won't notice it.  If you really need or want increased speed SSDs are probably the way to go.

OK it’s a alright mini tripod but the only thing I do not like about it is that it’s to light weight which means it’s more easier for your camera to fall and get smashed, I just wish it was metal and heavy so that it can’t fall down.
I've found that MEMPHIS makes a better flat woofer but for the money these Pioneer speakers are okay. Not too much more to get a better brand though.

I was looking forward to this unit. Have had lots of Sony devices over the years and they usually pack a lot punch in small packages. But I was disappointed with this unit. The Bass was anemic. When you enabled their synthetic bass boost. The Midrange disappeared !! The Bose Sound Link II blew it away.
But too small even for my Nikon L820.  There is like a drawer/cradle inside which makes the case smaller than it really is.
The life of the battery is similar to the life of my 8-10 year old batteries I intended to replace.  Disappointing.

Although the case does not have any noticeable flaws at the same time there isn't anything so amazing about it either.  I have a few other laptop case that is just as good as this one yet priced at least 30% less.
Has two switches, to power off half of the ports or all if you want to. Works USB2. Has a short extension USB cord with it.

This fit my Verizon V3M Razr, fit on my person comfortably while driving and would be a great gadget if it were not for the HUGE ear bud.  I have large earcanals and this earbud does not even come close to fitting in it.  Rediculous!Most reputable earbud companies (V-Moda, Bose and Shure) have different size earbuds for each individual.  I am disappointed in this product...
Ordered these for a friend at a small newspaper. Only time will tell at how long these will last. They felt that the value for the money was great. We will see.

I bought this device because I had a previous device from Anker that was flawless. This iteration makes a shrill erratic sound when a device is plugged in and charging. It's not particularly loud unless you sleep near it in which case it drives you nuts slowly. Charges damned well but there are quieter units that make zero noise.
This drive is recognized by my ASUS board bios, and partially by Windows 8.1 - need to figure out how to get this straightened out.

This is a highly rated case from Amazon and while I agree that this is a nice case, there are shortcomings.  The cover arrived slightly warped and the hard case did not exactly fit.  There are very limited placement and folding options with this case.  There are a lot other better choices for much less.

These headphones have the most bass compared to any other wired, workout-designed earbuds for the price. No complaints on the sound.They do stay in place, but the feel leaves a lot to be desired. To sum it up, it feels uncomfortable.Here's a youtube review I did on em: [...]

Don't think this will ever get read, but here goes anyway.Bought this for school. I'm going for programming & needed something that could hold a fair amount of data.This Flash drive works great on "Most" computers. It ocastionly throws a fit and goes "unrecognized"So I bought a replacement that is more reliable & backed up my photos & game saves with it.

This memory stick was great at first. It holds many photos from my camera and does it's job well. However, it was only a few months after I started using it that the plastic started breaking. This sometimes made it difficult to insert it in to my camera or computer. It is a design flaw in the memory stick. Otherwise, it works well.
Good sound while you have the subwoofer on, but awful when its off. Difficult to fold and put on, not good to wear around your neck.

Everything you want in an ipod that is new and slick- except there is no small speaker built in which was one of the coolest features the 5th gen had. it would be perfect for easy quiet listening if it had a built in speaker like the bolder older generation. Why downgrade?

This product has a metal finish and is shinny.  I thought this would be more polished/muted color. No, it is a metal finish.  The stand is a bit flimsy and you need the short version of the 30 pin dock connector to work with this unit.  Having said that, I still use with both my iphone and ipad.  I just need to make sure they are balanced before I walk away.

Well - as always, you get what you pay for... this is a $70 Blue-ray player and it works about how you would expect a $70 player to work... it does play Blue-rays fine, but when you go to the web 'experience', this is when the player breaks down... it locked up on me twice and isn't the best internet player. If all you need is a Blue-ray player, then this is fine, just don't expect too much else.
Built very cheap. Irritating when pins keep popping out. But hey it works, but it will take a while to connect it.

This protector is not completely transparent at all angles. There is a noticeable film when looking at it slightly from the side. It scratches easily but it is not terribly difficult to get on and serves its intended purpose, to keep the screen from getting scratched.

This is quite portable, and appears sufficiently sturdy, but do be aware that it is a small-size tripod. An adult cannot stand at full height and look straight at the viewfinder. It's neither fish nor fowl, as they say. Think of a use where you need portability and a sturdy tripod, but you don't mind then getting down on your knees to look through your camera. Can't think of a situation like that? Me, either.

its a great mp3 player I bought for my son and he likes it he told me he cannot get videos on it though and it also doesn't support mp4 players I didn't know to even look for that? for in the car use through the headphones plug in with the cassette tape player it does very well playing music and for music with any head phones use it works great!

I bought this 2 use at work. it sucks becuase they didnt expense me back and then the IT guy came and ended up running new cable anyway. Don't buy one of these 4 your job unless u kno they will pay u back
Does this work? Yes it does, but we had better success in applying different protectors to the Kindle Fire.  This had several bubbles compared to the other that we tried.

I tested these and found that the Sanyo Eneloop batteries and charger work better. These Sony batts, in my equipment, last about six hours. The Sanyo about eight hours. The Sony also got hotter during charging.

Do not forget it is only mirrorless camera with Aps-c sensor.I feel the Fuji is a bit overpriced and should have come in at around $1200 just like SONY NEX-7.Autofocus struggles in low light condition, Not as solid as i thought it would be.Watch this before you buy it.[...]

I find that I don't use the keyboard all that much so every time I do I have to tap on a key several times to get its attention. Once it is connected it works fine and has all the capabilities to manage the tablet

I puchased this for 2012 Chevrolet Traverse and it works fairly well. The product quality isn't very good, but for the price it's hard to complain. The major flaw of this camera is that it allows moisture between the lense and the camera. I would buy this product again.

I bought this cord but I'm NOT 100% please with it, everytime I hit a bump it triggers the radar on & off, it has become annoyed and I'm planning to buy an additional plug and use it the way it is supposed to be used.

I had problems with mine freezing on start up right from the get go.  I updated to the newest firmware 2.0, unplugged it over night, reset the clock numerous times and every other trick I could find in the forums.  Had it worked I would have kept it just for the beautiful job it did upgrading regular DVDs.  After a week of trying everything I returned it for a refund.Like any electronic device occasionally you get a bad one.

This isnt a true jet black like it shows in the picture.. it is more of a gray when you have your sessions.. with the right editing tools you can change it to a jet black.. so if you don't mind the extra edits, then this is the muslin for you! Its very big and durable though!

i intended to use this unit on a new home theather set with with plasma vt and several components. i ended up returning this unit and getting a more robust panamax line conditioner. however, i have used a number of tripp lite products in the past and have always been happy with them. i do hear of people having difficulty making loss claims with tripp lite.
The sound of this unit was not up to Bose standards, certainly not the SoundDock.  I was hoping for more; I sent it back.

I didn't see a big difference in my photos. Granted, I'm not taking water pictures...mostly family photography. I had hoped for more vivid colors and don't see that much of a difference. Still having to post-process. Not the best $50 spent :(

Does the job. The router is in the basement and most of my wireless devices are on the second floor. Other routers from adjacent homes produce a better signal than this one.  While it does a basic job, I am far from impressed on its day to day operation.
This is a great case for those who have the right filters. Sadly I did not have the correct filters and although this case is great, it is a bit larger than I would have liked.

This unit when coupled to the computer, would play the tape, and it said that it was downloading it. Upon completion I have not yet found out where it sent it and I have definitely not been able to burn a CD of this tape. Therefore I must say that it is far from easy to use.

I can just barely fit a Nikon D4 with a non AFS Nikon 80-200mm f/2.8 lens along with a 85mm f/1.8 and 20mm f/2.8 lens  in this bag. The top compartment is somewhat wasted space but for a minimalist travel bag, this does the trick.
This product is amazing for the price you are paying, yet a sleeve is supposed to be snug, and i would be happier if it fit my macbook pro better like advertised
Why would anyone consider buying a 4MP camera for $300 in 2009?  I bought it in 2005 and it wasn't that good even then.  Now, is a paperweight.
Projector works ok. Negatives for me are that it comes with no carrying case. Secondly the power cable is really short - like 4-5ft. I have to carry an extension cable around with me.

It is a nice little system, It makes the house function and gives me great control of the entire system. If it is just outputting signal, why can it output more then one channel? I really wish it could output 4 channels of signal and control them independently out of one box. If I want that functionality I have to buy 4 of these? Eh . . . . That is highway robbery.

these sound great but dont expect earth shaking sounds, they are nice for rear fill or for replacing stock speakers with something a little better, there are better options out there for a little less money.
It did great when It was hooked up in my car but the cord was not long enough. The sides didn't hold my cell phone in hardly at all. My phone kept falling out.
I thought this was a great deal. how ever it is to good to be true. Sorry, This is no longer available.

Within one day I was on the phone with Samsung Service.  That in itself was not an easy task.  The TV was down for almost two weeks.  As for Amazon purchase and shipping. That was great. Received the TV sooner that I expected.

It works, but I feel the price point is a bit too high for what you get. Also the specific adapters are not tagged as to what region they are from. I'm not going to be bringing the box and the picture of where it is used whenever I travel.

I bought this for the Western Digital My Passport Essential SE.  It is slightly too wide for that drive.  I would have preferred something that is custom fitting - especially if it is sold by Western Digital.  I assume that if you bought the larger My Passport that it would fit perfectly.
It's cheap...but so is the price.  It does what it needs to do...protect my computer from scratches, and I like that it was cheap enough I can replace it whenever I want.

...But the one I got only lasted a little over a month or so. It may be OK if you only use it from time to time.I went ahead and spent the money on the Apple OEM version. It was less than $10 and well worth it.
They have not been as durable as they were a year ago. I have been buying the same ones and some of them are shielded lighter than others.

Bought these to give them a try for my trips Plus side is the price and small size comfortable on the head. Bad side is they don't cancel out noise that much tried them with my computer playing mpg and television on at same time. No case as in the others I've triedI would go with the over the ears version of this they are much better canceling noise out

was very nice for the first few month of owning it. Felt great in the hand and buttons were nice to use. but after a few month the single middle click would register as three or four, and the left and right clicks were unresponsive at times. ultimately had to replace with a wired mouse.

this is like the 4orth battery I've had to get to keep this wireless phone working. I use my phone a lot and batteries dont' last long. so far, this one has out performed the rest. Great value, great product.
great and very useful addition. the temp of the drive does run a bit hot compare to regular mounted drives. great for cloning and backing up storage.would be better to have drive activity indicator.
Product functions bot DOES NOT work with the eyefi card. It will save pictures, but it prevents the EYEFI card from connecting to a wireless network

Good lens but it's over-priced.  Don't buy the warranty from Amazon.  They sell a ripoff drop warranty.  Get the warranty from Adorama or directly from Mack, or better yet, buy the lens from Adorama.  I'm increasingly getting defective merchandise from Amazon.The last two cameras I bought from Amazon were both defective.  Triple check what you get.
Still playing around with my settings.  Am pleased with the power output and it easily drives my 12" sub-woofer.  However, very distinctive low-end hum from this amp is annoying.

I was hoping for more options for motion detection like actually recording video instead of just snapping 5 pictures.  Seems like a substantial delay between the time the motion is detected and the pictures are taken.  The viewing angle is less than I expected.  It seems to otherwise measure up to the stated specifications.

The batteries work perfectly when they're charged, but they don't hold said charge for very long. The stock Lumix battery will still show 100% even after sitting idly for two weeks, but these Wasabi batteries will be all but dead.When I charged all three (stock plus these two) and let them sit for a week, the Wasabi batteries were already half way dead while the stock was fully charged,I guess that's why they included the car charger ;)
Works on one machine doesn't on another.  Sound only works with input not on mixer.  Works well on one machine, though.

Most bubbles went away, except one which bugged me forever. To be honest, I soon realised that the asus screen is so much better unprotected. I say ditch the protector. Unless you are dragging your tablet across the dirt and gravel, it'll be okay.

Purched this player solely for divx playback. Some of my movies are not being recognized at all, some play audio only and some have sluggish performance and are unwatchable.It plays most of my movies however but not the ones I like the most.I have yet to test out the usb functionality or the its region free capability.I couldn't find any firmware updates for it so no hope of a software fix here...

Just plug in the USB connector and switch the sound from internal to external speakers. But the resulting sound is the same as I get from my Imac desktop speakers. I had hoped for more to listen to classical music.
Not worth the price.$150 is the maximum I'd pay again.Too bulky and uncomfortable.Sound is below it's price range, but that's the limit of bluetooth.

Ordered this as a contingency for a live video shoot.  The cable works with guitars and mic's, but experienced some problems with signal delays.  Not sure if was the computer or cable.  Never the less, the cable works and is simple to use.
You get what you paid for. tons of false positive. Not sure if i am going to use it again.

The box is thick on the front, looks like 1 inch particle board, and the rest of the box is all 3/4 inch mdf. What sucks about this box is the off-gassing. This box literally stinks, every time this sub hits you will smell the glue they used to hold the box together. and it has a little port noise..
The keys/space bar sticks on this little keyboard and because of it's size you end up pressing the wrong keys a lot with prolonged typing.
You can tell it's 2.0 compatible. But not bad for the price. It seems good but I guess I'll find out after owning it for more than a year.
The retractable mechanism works some of the time. Not consistent. It's also a little large, otherwise the connection for charging works OK

Although the Amazon listing said the battery fits AT&T SL82558, it doesn't. I had to file down (vertically) the phone's battery compartment due to excessive battery/casing length; we have 5 phones which translate to too much filing. The batteries work but as the saying goes, "size does matter.
Acceptable sound quality. I bought them for my girl and she has no problem with the way they sound. (Until she lost them that is)

Router works fine, except that I have had to reset it too frequently due to loss of Internet connection.  Reconnects without a problem when powered off and back on, but it is aggravating to have to do so at least once a week.  I bought it hoping that I might gain a bit of wireless-G range, but that hope was squelched.  There is NO improvement whatsoever in connections other than wireless-N.
For its use it's great. If you want a cheep camera for 1080p outdoor daytime videos I'd reccomend this. If you're not shooting in ideal lighting conditions you may want to pay extra.
Bought this to use with my iPod 5th generation and my MacBook Pro 13 (early 2011). Works fine in both. Sound is good and microphone does a good job on Skype.
these earphones are great for the price. they sound decent. However, they tend to break very easily. I recommend buying a different set that has a hassle free warranty policy
Not really strong in picking up wifi signals but ones that it picks up works well. I've had it for a little over 2 years now and it rarely dropped signals while in use.
I believe that this is the second time I've bought a battery for my aging Toshiba laptop. I like that it does add an extra hour to the battery life, but it does get drained quickly.

Do the folks at Canon not have thumbs? Why do all of the PowerShots have a record button RIGHT where the thumb would rest? Smarter designs have a no-button area there, and maybe even a nice patch of rubber for your thumb to rest comfortably.Canon, don't you do any R&D; with actual people holding the dang camera?
its ok. but its been discontinued. even if its cheaper theres no more support for this product. an ok product for back up but if it breaks then you've wasted your money. go for go pro 3
For some reason I was unable to power my Zyxel with this injector... not sure why. others seems to have good luck with this and the reviews made me but it, but didn't work for me.
The product is well made and precisely fits the iPad Air. My principal complaint is the apparent inability to position the iPad other than in portrait mode, and then at one angle.

hii reacently received my Sony 3D blu-ray playeri have updated it with the latest software and still it shows a MSG thateither the player or the Tv are not 3D capable(both are 3D capable)and by the way once i did go through the options and it worked fine but i cant rememberwhat i have done to play the 3D movieplz help

This card is the only 8 GB SDHC card that is faster than 20 MB/s.  I need a read/write speed at least 24 MB/s, yet I only want a capacity size of 8 GB (43 min of HD video per shoot).  This card is perfect for the video photographer who wants to store a small amount of high quality HD video.
This item has been bought as a spare and has not yet been taken into use or tested, therefore cannot yet be critically reviewed

In the brief time I used this adapter, it worked just fine. It's good looking, convenient to use and delivers as advertised.I can find no downside. Since I have not compared it to other similar power adapters, I give the unit 3 stars, essentially a neutral satisfactory rating.
Good field of view and magnification.  They were a little heavy and awkward to hold for a long period of time, I ended up returning.
Seams kinda dumb not to have the a/c adapter with this item. it requires a special one since it is for 8 cameras.
Very flimsy and light weight. For the price, you cannot ask for more, but I thought it was better quality.
I thought this would be something I could throw in my briefcase... they are too big, envision about a 5 inch diameter ball.They do have a very good sound... for what they are.
It's hard to get used it to it and easy to lose it but it works very well. I didn't have to pair it at all.
Aftar reding so menney great reviews on this headset decided on getting one for my self. Don't like it all incoming calls sounds low maybe it's just the Panasonic  Kxtg1032s not the headset.

This Incipio Firetruck Kids Case for the All New Kindle Fire HD is certainly cute and colorful but it does not hold the Kindle well and could easily be removed by small children. Unfortunately, this makes it unusable for the intended purpose.CFH
very cool but also very clunky and huge.  No way my six year old can learn to type on it - keys are so bit I can't even stretch my fingers that far.  Probably best for very very young kids.

I bought this product based upon reviews from many websites and while the product seemed to be very good for technical oriented people, but the wireless range of this router was not any better than cheaper NetGear routers that I own.  The management interface was also slow to respond on multiple occasions.  I purchased the 9dbi antennas to enhance the wireless coverage, but no change was noticed so I sent the router back based upon these issues.

The cables work just fine if you can use them.I CAN'T.The cables were described as being 18" long of which I needed.The cables I received are only 15" long SO I HAD TO ORDER DIFFERANT ONES.They won't reach to my motherboard.

everything works.  The wires seems a little thin and I wish there were more connectors for IDE devices.  But that's my own careless not to read the spec more carefully. They can add a little more description to the cables for MB connetion but a call to the support fix that.Other then that, it's been working fine, hope it last, only time can tell.

These cans look great.  They sound good and the buttons are easy to find by feel but the fact that the batteries are not replaceable, did hold charge but 4-5 hours and could not be used when charging turned me off.  Returned them and went to Sennheisers.

The design itself is great. I love that it turns any laptop/desktop hard drive (even cd drives including blu-ray) into a usb unit. This item will also let you swap between other units as well.The only issue i had was after a few uses the power converter for the sata drives broke but the people at vantec helped me out a lot and sent me a replacement within a few days.

Not for everyday use for me. Were I travelling and wanted to use my iPad as an alternative to a laptop then I'll pull it out of storage. Not real happy about the keys being a rubbery one piece mat with the keys raised. Doesn't have a very good feel to it. On the bright side, if it were like a laptop keyboard one might be more prone to have individual keys being lost/broken off.

You increase the DBI you increase the Electricity that you use.So,remember that Pass that along.Watch that Electric Bill.I'm not so Comfortable.Hardly eat,well.But,do eat.I live in a room and have no Electric or Water Bill.Ahhhhh.Straight room,Everybody stays up late.Plays T.V. loud.Got my computer on Twenty four seven.Ahhhh

I wear these headphones eight hours a day at work. They are very comfortable, however they don't last long. Now that the price has risen significantly, I certainly won,t be buying these again. Instead I bought Jabari's revo headphones which are very comfortable and meant to last.
Works fine, instructions are very small.  Have trouble getting the sound right but when I do it is great, but it resets itself when the TV is turned off.
it handles calls as any bluetooth device does with the least sound clarity, however if you can avoid this item do so by all means. try to purchase a stereo with built-in bluetooth adapter.
This thing works as it should.  It's not that comfortable and the sound leaves something to be desired...  The microphone seems to be better than any I've had before. :)

My SD card showed only a little more than 29 GB available for my 32 GB card.  That's the bare minimum I'll accept without sending it back.  I'm normally happy with the brand name SD cards I buy on Amazon, though.  For the price I paid for this particular card, my expectations were higher.
I use this at work so I have a little more cord if I need to move around a bit.  Nothing spectacular but it does the job.

Dismayed by the battery drain design flaw (read the other reviews), but sound quality is quite good and the unit packs well for travel.If only Phillips had fixed the battery drain problem before they released it.
originally I had problems trying to get working on win 8.1 but after multiple uninstall/installs it just worked.. last software update version seems OLD how about a update?!?
