This sub is pretty but hollow sounding. It produces resonance and boomy bass even at moderate volume. It may be sufficient for mini system but not adequate for serious home theater surround fit for a living room. I have since replaced mine with a Yamaha:Yamaha YST-SW315 10-Inch Digital Pro Series Subwoofer (Black).
If you want to replace your factory speakers these are ok.but if you wants them for a system these are not for you.they cant handle 150 watts rms like they claim.

This microphone / speaker works but has two large shortcomings.  First, the gain on the speaker is too low to be heard if there is much backgroud noise. Second, the modulation on the microphone could stand to be stronger.
It is made for small laptops, but the fans would quit spinning often and they made lots of noise.  Very annoying.

It works good but the outer rim is to thin and if it isn't super flush it seems to rub on its own frame. My Azza case has dust guards and this throws the frame out a little and it rubs very annoyingly.
I wanted a pink cover for my friend that loves pink.  This fit the bill, it wasn't a "great" case; however, it protects well and has withstood my two kids abusing it.

I bought this for my Lenovo X201 Laptop. It works great with fast performance. There are two major issues. First, when i turn my computer on or restart it, I have to install the driver every time before using these. It takes about 30 seconds, but its a hastle. Also I can't use both ports at the same time. Only works when one is free.
The quality was good, my only drawback is that it didn't accept files from the PC.  It will send files TO the PC, but not accept them FROM the PC.  Therefore I sent mine back and upgraded
although it was very neat with the finger print one that I had. The internet on it failed to load after only 30 days and I had to return it.

Bought this to replace a broken "car tunes" fm mod. This one sounds thick and dull by comparison. ( the old one still plays , it just won't charge the devices ) This one required me to download an app before I could use it . I don't love it but its not the worst one I've ever used. I'm still looking for another cartunes brand mod. They sound the best of any I've heard .

This was just what I needed to hook up my stereo headphone-microphone to my phone without using battery consuming Bluetooth.  It could be better made.  The tip of the plug came off and I was concerned about what would have happened if it came of inside the phone.  A little super glue seemed to fix the problem, but I am still not 100% confident that it will hold up.
Nice little gadget to have. The only improvement I heard is the bass boost function. Other then that, not much sound improvement really.
It worked for about 3 months then broke. But you can't beat the price. I don't see anything but a SD card fitting in it but I didn't try.
There are certainly faster USB drives out there than this.  But its pretty cheap and gets the job done.  I use it primarily for home use.

It's nice, however it does skip letters on the keyboard.  and has no lanyard for convenient obtaining out of pocket. I am still comparing it to the older one I have, so, check with me in a month or so.

I bought this battery for my 60D. The package was nice and it arrived promptly. However it is not compatible with my charger. My OEM canon charger will not charge this battery. I have tried several times to no avail. There is a good possibility that I just got a bad battery, but I think I will stick to OEM batteries from here on out.
Lightweight but inexpensive for this size. Not very good for horizontal ceiling applications. Tends to sag downwards. Would only use again if I need to use on a vertical wall application.

Item works as advertised, but it is cheaply made and very light/top heavy.  The fan is 'soft blade' and thus pushes very little air.  The light works fine. Depending on where you intend to use, it may be just what you're looking for, but keep your expectations in line.
But magnets in cover are a bit too powerful. If you flip cover case to the back, your tablet will pick up the magnetic field and turn off automatically. Love the color and the autonomy

I was hoping for better. I've had pretty good luck with Coby products before including a DVD player that I've used for years. The main problem with the radio is a lack of selectivity-stations bleed on top of one another. Also, the radio has poor filtering allowing extraneous noise to come through. If the station is strong neither of these flaws is a problem. The tuning mechanism works great, and the sound quality (of strong stations) is fine.
Yesterday I went to charge a Canon LP-E8 with this charger.  I could have charged two batteries with my Canon charger in the time one LP-E8 was on this knock off.  It's very slow.

VideoSecu Articulating TV Wall Mount, Full Motion Tilt Swivel and Rotate Articulating Arm for Most 15" 17" 19" 20" 22" 24" 26" 27" LCD LED TV Monitor Flat Panel Screen with VESA 100 A63:A little flimzy,but does the job.

I decided to return it.  I liked how it looked.  I liked how it felt in my hand but it would not put the music I downloaded from my macbook into the right folder--therefore no music.  Perhaps I just didn't do it right.  But why be bothered when I can find something more efficient for me.  Plus I found the touch pad to be a little too sensitive.  I really liked that it had a radio though.
Today, you seem to needs these kind of cords less and less, but if you need this configuration: here it is.

I love the practicity of this product but it does have a chime in the background you some times hear. To bad, otherwise I would have rated it 5 stars.UPDATE: I changed the audio wire and works great. It even works with my new Ipod touch newest generation!!! Thats a bonus!!
I have had no drop outs and the speed is very good.  However, this thing burns like the sun.  Who woulda thought a USB device could get this hot.
I am only giving this three stars because the SATA LEDs do not illuminate to indicate proper operation of the power supply.

LOVED THIS COMPUTER THE MINUTE I TOOK IT OUT OF THE BOX,  THEN AFTER 5 MINUTES IT GOT SOOO HOT, I HAD TO TURN OFF.  I THEN PUT IT ON A COMPUTER COOLER PAD AND IT HELPED ALITTLE...GUESS I WILL HAVE TO RETURN.  THE CASE IT SO BEAUTIFUL, THE COLOR INSIDE SO RICH AND A GREAT GREAT VIDEO, SO FAST ETC, BUT CAN ONLY USE WITH COOLER PLUGGED IN...SO SAD. WISH I KNEW HOW TO FIX THIS PROBLEM???
My rabbit ears still get but channels, but I will still use it. Not impressed at all with this product.Frost....out
It's a one-for-one replacement for the original OEM charger.  There's not much to like or dislike.  It works.  It is what it is.

Pros:1. Nice looking.2. Hides cables well.Cons:1. Front of shelf tilts noticeably toward floor. Had to put some washers in the bottom of shelf to level it up.2. Unstable. Tilts side-to-side after installation.3. Shelf could be a little larger. My components sit on or very near the edge.4. Poor instructions.It's too bad that the mechanical design of the shelf doesn't match the aesthetic quality. A few minor changes and this would be a 5 star item.

As this is an Apple product, I assumed this was going to be the same case as one previously purchased, just a different color.  I was wrong.  This case is slightly larger-but, does fit the iPad.  Secondly, the cover is no longer a separate piece and removable; it is a single piece with back and cover attached.  Not as convenient.  Too bad for me.

It's possible that my apartment is just in some sort of dead zone. I couldn't get it to pick up anything. I even had a flashback from the sixties and tried putting aluminium foil on the ends of.the antenna. (Silly me) Anyway, if you suspect that you live in an area that is too remote, or just in a black hole, like my apartment, you may want to explore other options, or maybe just a stronger antenna.
For the price it's not bad.  The graphics are nice and the sound is good.  Wish it were a little more finger print resistant.
Sturdy, does what it needs.My DX is old and this cover still protects it quite well. I use an updated Kindle at the moment or the app for my phone most of the time though.
Compared to other manufacture's product that I have of similar capacity, this one makes more noise and you can hear the spinning thing pretty loud. Beware! I have the 3 Terabyte one.

Works really well, but I think a plastic omni cap would be much better, this thing is a little inconvenient to put on the flash...then again, it folds flat when not using it and weighs very little so works well in a camera bag.I'm happy with it, and give it a thumbs up, haven't had any problems other than it takes a moment or two to attach it.

I like the player; it has good sound and lots of features. Battery life is decent. The Media Go software created by Sony is flashy but I found it to be very slow in synchronizing the device. Other options (like winamp or wmp are much faster).  After about a year the volume buttons on the side stopped working though.

The seller is great - very fast ship.The transmitter itself is very cheaply made and the power adapter plug breaks after the first use. As a FM transmitter, it is the same as any other - passable as best, but no complaints there. Do not expect audiophile sound because none of these units can deliver that..
Yes would recommend if you don't mind it being in the hot shoe of your camera, I'am just not sure if it interferes with the contacts of the camera and what effect it will have on the camera.
Sound is OK.  Does its job.  I would rather has spent the money on the zKicker.  Remote is ok and has everything to run output to tv.

Not having much experience with nice cameras, I just bought this on a whim, and it's ok but doesn't really do much shielding. It's pretty short, and I didn't know how well it would fit, so it was kind of a waste of money, but better than nothing I suppose.

Bought this bulb in August of 2012 and it went out five months later.  It worked well when we had it, I just wish that it lasted longer than five months!  It does not come with a warranty.  I will not buy this bulb again and I will buy one that comes with a warranty!
The wide angle will not work on an G12, Canon dosn't even offer a wide lens that will work on this camera, no one at this time does. The telephoto and hood work great and are worth the price.
The only draw back is size.  It takes up camera bag space. It has a good out put of air and can be useful.

This probably depends a lot on your paint type but mine kind of comes "unstuck" sometimes. I think it might be when I am messing with the cords and give it a little tug on accident. It definitely isn't a very firm hold on my walls. It looks nice though and I painted it the same color as my wall so "hides" nicely.

this leather case looks cheaply made but it is very good for protecting your viper remote control.  Those remotes costs over $80 and should protect it.  The remote control is very fraigile, I already notice a small crack on the tip of the remote where it is exposed even with the leather case.
Cute, but typically Chinese with a little struggle to learn to operate with minimal instructions, etc.

Although this unit is easy to set up, and has a lot of good features, its performance degrades very quickly such that only a reboot will bring the performance back to accecptable.  No permutation of the settings will have a long-lasting effect on the degradation of the data flow.
This is nice and blends right into the computer however the bottom piece hangs over and the volume keys are in the wrong spots.

You're going to get what you paid for - watch out for the low resolution and the widescreen format, doesn't match camera format.  Chops off if you lower the res, takes forever and chops the other way if you don't.  for the money, a good one though!

I was hoping for something a little more solid.  My bad for not reading through more reviews.  The keys feel mushy and don't provide great feedback.  3-stars instead of 1 for the low price (for a wireless keyboard that is).  So if you're not picky it's probably a decent buy.
worked as well as original, I fixed this tv and gave it to charity, cheap fix for a tax write off. new owners are loving the picture.

I bought these because for some reason I thought it would be better to have a durable lining.  Chances are, and in my case I didn't, need such a strong cable.  It just makes it very difficult to snake around in tight spaces.  Unless it is an application that will really demand such overbuild; stick with the cheaper, more flexible stuff.  Picture, of course, was cumpletely fine.
It turns out that my little brother had his own cables around and I ended up with the extra one as simply a replacement.
It was okay. It doesn't have dedicated power so it can't do many things at once. It's data transfer rate is good since its USB3, it just doesn't have much power for larger things.

i was looking for a way to mount a cable box on the wall.  the description gives the arm lengths, but no way to measure the between the arms distance except at the end.  it is far too big for a cable box.  i sent it back.
It is a cheap addition to my now enormous remote control collection, but it does not really do much over and above the PS3 6-axis controller. No back-lighting, cant even turn on / off the console :(

it's allright but can't hold candle to GoPro I'm assuming as I don't own a GoPro yet. The underwater kit that it came with works but the screw on lens is crap and doesn't screw on at all totally suks. Can't fault the seller as they just sell it and it does what it says it does but just not quite the quality I would have liked.

Certainly better than the FM transmitters since this one links directly between the antenna & the radio but it still requires you tune to a FM station. Is not bad for a low cost solution but I found the gain adjustment was barely adequate and sound quality was just okay. Of course the advantage of having the stock radio is less likely to be a victim of car theft.
The price on these is really good.  It arrived in a reasonable amount of time.But, I find that about half of the BD I've burned are corrupted.  So, I end up throwing a lot of them away.

Pros:  The case is very thin, and fits the iPad mini very well.  Very slick.Cons:  On the case that I received there appears to be a bubble or something on the front.  This has caused the pattern on the front to not print correctly on a portion of it.  While this will not effect how it works, it is noticeable.  Belkin may want to look into their quality control, so that marred ones like this don't get through.
These work but I wish that they were a little bit larger otherwise no complaints.
I'll tell only the bad which is the unit gets very hot to the point you need to set it down and if you want to use the blue tooth don't buy it because it does not work.

not playing well with a new 3TSATA drive,  WD30EFRXGoogling around, this may be due to the JMicron chip used in the device.Basically some how the OS's read the block size as 512 bytes instead of 4096, so they read the drive as smaller than it is, like 800 odd GBSo I urge caution is the goal is to use with drives in that size range.
Difficult to tighten down but it does a respectable job for what it is. Just a simple bracket, hopefully it will hold up.
Dont remember purchasing it and have never had one.  Could have been one my daughter had and if that is the case it is a great camera.  The pics from it were real good and she took a lot ot them
Honestly, I bought this thinking I would need it for the Kindle, but there isn't any way to hook it to the Kindle cover, so I never use it.
Bought this for new Sony DSC-WX50. Fit too snug. My fault for not comparing sizes.Would buy again for smaller camera.

The image quality is ok - what really bugs me about this player is it's flimsy design, slow loading of discs, slow starting up from sleep, and very basic remote. I would not buy it again. Also sometimes when you pause and play multiple times, the sound and image are not synched.

Good fit for the galaxy note 10.1, looks good also, does the job... HOWEVER, mine took more than two weeks to be delivered, came directly from China, rough packaging, weird superglue marks on the edge rubber pads, which were loose anyway,  seemed used and little fake to me... look out for that.

Just got this NAS so this not a full review.  I'll do a complete review when I have a chance to play with it more.  I do want to point out one disappointing feature: when I move pictures from my wife's iPhone via the WD app, the names of the photo files were rename and no longer sorted in the correct chronological order.

I purchased this camera, which came highly rated, when my old one wore out. It works well, but not exceptionally. It is quite slow on the rebound between pictures, even with an upgraded high speed photo disk. The pictures are average or better. This camera works reasonably and has decent ergonomics, but I think there are better choices available.

It works great, but it seems to have an issue if I have more than hard drives (that have external power) plugged into it at a time.  It also never powers down the ports, which is a good and bad thing.
It serves it's purpose. But I wish I had done my research and bought the one that was smaller and didn't have the extra price of cord in the middle.

The charger is nice enough- it feels solidly made, not flimsly, and the swivel plug means that it'll fit easily in most power strips. The cable, however, had something wrong with it- it wouldn't charge my iPhone 4. It was thick, stiff, and cheap-feeling. Still, I've got an extra cable and the charger is nice enough that I didn't return the order.
is well constructed, but also too heavy and bulky if you want a stand, and can put up with the bulkyness then this is for you

I purchased the 15 Feet cable and didn't pay attention to the specs.  Apparently the 15foot cable uses a 24awg wire vs a 28awg wire used in the shorter cables.  The cable works fine for my Samsung Note3, however the stiffness of the cable makes me wary of using it.  If you want a more flexible cable, don't get longer then 10 feet.
It's okay, but never could log on to my Picasa. We returned it in order to get one with a touch screen.

Bought six JJC lens hoods for m.zuiko lenses.Happy with all of them except for this one : 60mm f2.8.It does not fit perfectly and it's hard to feel that distinct click when the hood snap into place.Not sure how good is the OEM hood but my first impression is that it is faulty.Not sure if it worth asking for replacement and have to return this one.
Purchased this unit by mistake.  I kept it as a spare as I had another unit that it did fit.

Hey, systems engineer, the reason you can't burn a DVD-R is because this burner only burns DVD+R/RW.  You should know to read the specs on hardware you buy.  The reason this product is priced $... below it's dual format brother, is because many DVD players won't play back the DVD+R format.
Does the job for the price but it feels very plastic like, cheap, and not sure how long it will hold up.

I bought these things hoping to get a decent ear bud for cheap. That is exactly what these are, they worked great, I used them almost everyday last year walking to class.  They have a loose connection or two in them now so only one side works.  I was hoping to get more like 2 years our of these, but you get what you pay for.
Yes, this is a flat cable but I was expecting flat, thin, and lightweight. This is flat, thick, and heavy, more like a round cable run through a heavy press.

these were loud!worked fine...... UUUuuntil the amp gave out? \also had buzzing feedback from piggyback fuse block(purchased separately)?Amp gave out inside of 30 day return policy, I contemplated exchange but opted for refund, the Harley optional device holder was a nice option! still without music on my bike?!?!  still debating on purchasing this again??
Has three pockets, but no room for any additional lenses, only small, flat things. Good deal, though, in the package I bought.

After reading the reviews , I;m wondering how long this will last. Install wont be for awile as I'm waiting on a truck. Will let you know how it goes. Also the remote is listed wireless THAT IS NOT TRUE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's wired like a phone jack with about a 20 ft. cord that you have to hide and srew the adjuster into your dash or elsewere. So beware of that Lie!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Quality isn't sterling but acceptable as it is analog, often the only option for older equipment. If you need a low cost a to dthis will do the job

The main reason I bought these earbuds was because of the Kevlar reinforced cables and stress points. I guess they are more durable than other earbuds, but still not sturdy enough to use them in bed. I listen to the radio during the night and sometimes end up laying on one or the other cable. Right now, only one earbud is working. I'm going to return them under the warranty.

I like the quality but have come to find out that unless you're going to plug it in and leave it alone the heaviness of the cable shifts just enough in the ports on both ends to disconnect the device.  Not sure I would recommend it.

Very useful lens with good price. However, my copy has MANY dust specks inside the front and back of lens elements. It is not the brand new NIKON lens should be. The dusts probably won't effect image quality, but it definitely would reduce the re-sell value of the lens. Nikon really needs to improve its quality control on this lens' production.

A very sturdy case but the case when closed does not automatically put the tablet into sleep mode.  When opened to the standing as shown in picture, it topples over sometimes but the velcro in the slot keeps the tablet from sliding out.  It's OK for the price.

Buena, bonita y barata...Obtuve lo que viene por su precio..hay que tener cuidado algunas vienen con la bateria malaGood, nice and cheap ...I got what I come for your money ..beware some come with bad battery
Low res, pixelated, small, doesn't have an HDMI or any high res cable, but it's cheap and does the trick!

A bit disappointed that this doesn't support the digital phone line. Everything else was set up easily enough, but I couldn't replace my old box from TimeWarner because it doesn't support digital phone service. So I will have to keep looking.

This remote is great as long as you go easy with it. If your like me and you toss remotes around this one will NOT hold up. First one I ordered was a dud as well and I had to have amazon send a new one

It seems like a great camera but the previous reviewer is right about the lens. I liked the feature of the f 1.8 lens for low light situations. The barrel distortion however is awful. I rejected this camera. I was ready to order one and went to Circuit City to look at one. I checked out a post in the viewscreen and it was bowed as I panned to each extreme.I am back looking at other cameras.
I have not used this product. I thought i had ordered usb b male to usb a female, but I was mistaken
I've had more sturdy pieces of equipment but the price is right.  Good for the money.  I don't use all of the different ports but the drive bays have worked fine.

The friction pad is good to use in your car.  The weight allows the GPS to sit in one place without sliding around when you make a turn.  Its not to heavy so if you make a hard turn, it will slide around.
Body cap slips onto the body OK but is too snug when rotating it closed.  I won't turn it to full closed position for fear of damaging something on the camera.  It will do as a back up.
Unable to rate as it was a gift and did not hear what they though of it  It looked like a nice product

This worked for the most part on my 2001 Nissan Sentra when my CD player started going berserk.  This gave me about another 2 months of use out of the CD player before it was not usable. So, I guess it worked.

I got mine on ebay from SHUEIDO CAMERA in Taiwan for $550.  I was a little disappointed.I thought I would see 3D pictures on my Samsung 3D LED tv, but nothing.  And the camera'sdisplay is to small for anything.  And the battery life was less than an hour.  Nothing you wouldwant to take away from a plug in.  A good attempt if you into 3D, but for beginners, I wouldrecommend you wait for the next upgrade.

the seals, screws, and lens cover are great.  however, the little screwdriver that comes with the kit is garbage.  If you work with this kind of thing on a regular basis, do yourself a favor and grab a multi screwdriver kit from radioshack for working on computers, small electronics, and glasses.  a kit can be had for about $15 and it will save your bacon more than you would imagine.
Since the ipad 2 ios update which added 1080p, this no longer works with my 1080i tv.  Sad.  It was fantastic before that.
The bag is very attractive but just too small to hold my camera and two lenses.  Perfect for a little digital camera but not the Canon Rebel.  Should have purchased the bigger one, for sure.
I tried this case and went back to my old one as this one just didn't feel good to hold while reading.  It fit looser than I would have prefered.

Three stars. I don't care about the LED lights, only how well the unit cools. When my October 2013 MacBook Pro is running a graphic intensive game, the fan simply doesn't spin fast enough to keep it as cool as I'd like. It's not bad...just not good enough.
I would not buy the white band if you're using for exercise and running.  White band required more maintenance because the sweat can easily yellow or stain the band.

This webcam provided a poor video quality, and it didn't clip onto my monitor.  I was a somewhat disappointed and had to return it for a refund.  Instead, I order the model C920 which was pretty much double the price of this webcam but it was worth the investment.  If you're looking for a great webcam to video recording or a chat, I'd highly recommend this product.
So far, it is getting the job done; Hopefully, it will last longer than its' predecessor, which lacked any longevity to speak of.

First, expect NOTHING from the recharging base. It crapped out on the mouse I bought for my girlfriend and I within three months each, failing to charge the included batteries and ruining our others. I now just use standard AA's, but when battery charge falls below ~30%, the mouse starts freezing and skipping. All in all, you can probably do better for the price.

Its a basic inexpensive player, so obviously you get what you pay for.  The remote control response is slow when turning on or off, which is why I gave it 3 stars, but its actually made of good quality materials.  One thing to note is that this does NOT have an HDMI port, so the resolution does suffer quite a bit.

For unknown reasons, GARMIN discontinued this model some time ago. No reference was made to this in the 350 description. While performance on a recent 1,200 mile trip was satisfactory, it was unacceptable NOT to be told that the unit is, in fact, obsolete. Caveat emptor !

These are comfortable and are supposed to sound better as they "break in." Problem for me is that they do not have much on the high end of the spectrum, mostly mid and bass which is how they are described. Unfortunately for me, guitar rock sounds better with lots of high end frequencies....
I bought this camera for my mother. It doesn't feel as solid as my other Kodak EasyShare. It takes nice pictures and is easy to use. If I were to do it again, I'd buy a Nikkon CoolPix.

For the money, it's hard to complain. not as well built as the apple branded cases, but it's 1/3 the price.My only real complaint is that the ipad mini doesn't stand up well in the case, which makes watching movies a bit of a pain.

I like the fact that it is compatible with my laptop.The only reason why I bought it was because the competition and OEM suppliers wanted over 100 dollars.It doesn't hold a charge that well but it does it fine.Not the greatest but  not the worst.Good price however and that's what makes it good.
This battery brought new life to my old Panasonic wireless phones. had to replace the old original ones after few years of service. Hope these maintain that life or better.
Actually not everything is built to last, but I'm glad I was able to have something temporary to keep my beats occupied, for cheap too.

This router seems to work OK, but the documentation is poorly written, even more poorly translated, and difficult to follow.If you're a fairly sophisticated user who can infer missing/confusing information in the documentation, go for it.  If you better documentation and support, look for something else.

I have horizontal hum bars in the video which looks like a bad power supply. Will update review based on outcome of a replacement power supply. The video is watchable so I am not sending it back as the alternative is not to be able to use my NTSC tv overseas.
Threading could be better.  I would imagine a product with these many number of positive reviews should not have had any quality issues... but it did.  Since I only needed 10 pairs, i was ok,
I don't really like the feel of the film, it is not as smooth as some others I have used in the past.
Keyboard is missing key button functions that are commonly found on PC keyboards, but perfect for a tablet. DO not get this if you are looking for a smaller bluetooth keyboard for a computer!!!

The WOWee One Powerbass Speaker is OK. For the best results play it at a low to medium volume. Its not for a party. The best part of it is that it has a fairly good bass response. I thought it was going to be better than what it was but at this price who was I kidding.

I ended up keeping this item - in spite of the fact that the plastic lever for the mechanism locking the bottom of the screen broke off after two uses. The screen is ok - and it is stable enough to be used outdoors (with no or light wind). I'm hoping I don't regret my decision to keep it - the locking mechanism is still usable.

Can not give any positive review due to it not fitting my G5, it did seem to be able to by the description. with Amazon's GREAT RETURN POLICY I had nothing to lose to give it a try.  Otherwise I would give it 1 star!
After two weeks, I still have some bubbles. They are on the outside white edge so I don't notice them as much. For all the high reviews I expected something better.

These cables seem to work fine from the video and audio side. The cord used is rather stiff, I do have a problem in routing them behind the various components(TV, DVD/VHS, DVD burner, Roku, Free Agent Player, STB). Price does make these an attractive cable compared with the "other name brand" and I do recommend.
it's not that much high quality as i imagine, but it's working properly and transfer data as usb 2, charging is accepted also.

This light puts out a good amount of bright white light. The clamping mechanism really didn't seem to work on the Kindle. It may be designed for the Kindle but that does not mean it fits well. My wife just stopped using it so I never bought one for myself.
Works pretty good for the price. Had an issue with it locking up when getting to a certain song; deleted son and have had no further issue.

It's a really pricey cable, even if you consider the electronics required (it is an active cable, with the electronics in each connector). However the connection is a little fiddly at times, which isn't the greatest.Protip: if you have 2 thunderbolt-endabled macs, start one up in target mode (hold T) and use the thunderbolt cable to connect them, and transfers are super fast.

This stand is a great value for the price. It is easy to set up and use. It's only major fault is that when you go to pan, the pivot point where the camera attaches to the stand is very stiff and hard to move with a smooth sweeping motion. Instead, when you go to pan, the stiff pivot causes the users to exert extra pressure often leading to a jerky motion in the video playback mode.
It's a bit big to fit inside my slim desktop, I thought it would fit but I was wrong. Was going to return it but it would cost more then I paid for the item to ship it back.

I tested the tripod with CANON S400 and Digital Rebel. It holds both cameras firmly. With Kodak's brand name, I gave it three stars. It is light weight and comes with a bag. This tripod can do anything that it supposes to for a twenty-dollar tripod.

Plugged right into my old CY-25 laptop BUT it only reads DL's, Won't write them. I checked on Google, it is NOT a dual layer writer. I don't use the light scribe function so I can't coment on it. (I have a DVD printer) I guess I need to read the fine print more carefully.

No complaints worth mentioning at this price, didn't expect much.  But if you are particular about perfect fits do look elsewhere and be ready to pay for what you get.  This one has a nice snug fit on the keyboard, not to thick so just a little extra effort to type, and scissor trimming helps the rest fit.  The cover actually fit better on my unibody pro than on the old white macbook.

It may be my location, but I can only receive about half of the stations in my area. I am in a steel and concrete building about 5 miles from the TV towers, but my office window faces south and most of the TV towers are northwest of my location.
There is more to this bundle than really needed.  I  guess more is better than not enough and costs are more reasonable when buying the whole bundle.  Equipment seems to be ok.
Fits camera fine but doesn't last as long as the canon version.  I'll try a different generic battery next time.

This not quite what I had hope for in size of umbrellas and cast of light but neither is it a pro kit. It helped but was a bit too weak for late afternoon sun backlighting my set, more an unfortunate happenstance than the fault of the kit. Just be aware of the lumens you need for your shoot.
Case is okay. Purchased for the chargers which okay. Case made well but not as functional as previous stand case.

Works somewhat on my HD TV with HDMI cable. Aspect ratio is off. Some movies will not play, but ppt. presentations are OK. There are no buttons on this thing, so all adjustments are via computer or TV.  And no helpful hints via the manual.
Hey, it is a little hard to get enthusiastic about an adapter cable. It does what it is supposed to do. The price was right.

There is no way to adjust the headset, and it is very uncomfortable.  The sound is great, if you can stand wearing something that tight on your head.  I bought this so I could listen to TV in bed while my husband sleeps, but I found them so uncomfortable they have become a dust collector!

The earbuds themselves are comfortable and sound good. I haven't had any issues with signal loss either.  My big complaint though is that they put the ON button exactly where your thumb goes when clipping it onto something. It's almost impossible to open the clip without putting your thumb on that button and turning off your music. If only they would have moved it up about a half inch it would be no problem.

I needed a smaller wireless mouse to use with a laptop. I am not happy with the M525. The scrolling is horrible. It will not scroll slow only fast. I am using a G700 with my desktop computer, and that maybe the problem. The M525 is  nice product considering the price of about $25.00.

Yeah, we had to send this one back (thank you return policy!)For some strange reason we never could get this television to communicate properly with all of our boxes in regard to screen ratios and presentation (?)

This antenna is too short. It only expands to 12 inches. It works better than the short whip which comes with mu small TV. If it expanded to 24 inches it would work much better. The rod can be replaced with a longer rod. The big plus is the coax connector which connects to the antenna input on the TV.

These are not the quality I was expecting.  I've had several "coasters" and  have had to slow my burning down to 8x.  Even at 8x I've had a few coasters in my two Sony DVD burners. I've used over a thousand TY brand and had maybe 10 coaster in that many discs.  I'll stick with T Y brand.

Controls and key mappings were good for connecting to an android mini-pc.  The mouse pointer was a little choppy without good line of sight and my mini-PC has a specialized cable so it couldn't be easily extended.  Works well with a phone to Tv converter.

I installed the device and it shows as COM 22 while my digitizer will address either COM 1 or COM 2.  So right now I cannot get the digitizer to work.  I have looked at the Device Manager and cannot find anything about COM 1 through COM 21 although I suspect there is a way.  But I have not figured out how to find them just yet.

Installed this on my antenna out of the box (no adjustments) and noticed I am now able to pick up channels better in our far bedroom, than before the amplifier was installed.  I live in a marginal area (about 30 mi. from most stations) so I wasn't expecting much unless I raised my antenna.

These were very good earphones for about 2 months, but then one of the ears stopped working. The cord is very strong and good, and thin, and while it worked, didn't cause any problems. Overall, nice quality, but crappy earphones.
It's a good fit, but it's pretty expensive just for this little thing. If I would have found a knockoff brand, I would've purchased that instead; 3 stars for over pricing.
The case is a very rubbery and soft. Not quite a soft as a nerf ball. Nothing to brag about.

Not much to say it works well it fits flush in my express card slot. The only issue I have with it is not really a problem with the device itself. usb plugs connect very snug and you have to hold the card in when you disconnect or it comes out.

Tried to improve the radio in the basement. Still didn't fix the problems with the local stations until I had to install it outside. This antenna is better than all the other power FM antennas I tried in the past. But I still think the old $3 wire FM antennas work the best.
One of the batteries died after a year-and-a-half or so of light use. As such, I would not recommend these batteries.
Throw away the lag bolts and replace them with hardened steel bolts. I twisted the heads off of one just tightening it to the wall stud. Otherwise, it works just fine.

Followed the instructions and waited for a few days until the screen had time to dry and set itself properly. After two weeks it still had some sort of texture under the screen. It wasn't bubbles but something else, needles to say I took it off and threw it away. I'm sure it works for others, not me though.

This router served its purpose dutily, but because technology advances so fast this device isn't operable with any of our new devices. If you're looking for a router, make sure you have the 802.11 standard your devices run on... AC is the newest and fastest, N is the prior (and still fast). Most AC/N routers can backtrack, too, making this an obsolete purchase.

I have an old television set which is much larger than my pc monitor and thought this device would have given me the output I was expecting. It works but the graphic output was nothing close to what I had expected.
For the cover, it wasn't a 100% exact fit but I was able to make it work.  Its a good way to refresh the exterior of your key fab but not exactly like the OEM.

It's sturdy and does a good job of protecting the pad in normal usage. However it's a tiny bit too big to hold the iPad firmly so it moves around and you have to constantly realign it to take pics or you'll have he case blocking the camera hole.
Xmass gift, it was fine. one of the remotes did not work, the other two broke after just a couple of months of usage.They were fun to have in the meantime.

This clock was smaller than I was anticipating and the different attachments didn't fit my ipod classic. Though it came with eight attachments, it looks like it was made for the nano. As for the size, I didn't like how small the buttons were and how close they were together. "Turn off" and "snooze" were just too close for comfort.
My Kindle 2 came with the charger but this one is an option. It really should have come with the Kindle instead of being an optional item.
Just okay

I watched the video (twice) and then installed it. Appeared to go as it said in the video although it is slightly messy to install. The next day there were marble streaks all though it, apparently on the back side. I removed it and completed the process again. Still the same. Product is ok, but really didn't impress me.

Bought it to run a 5050 LED strip as did a previous reviewer, and it does work for that. The plugs are the right size (2.5/5.5mm) and the amps are great (6A). However, mine is a 3 prong power cord (grounded). Not as pictured, but it works. I will have to do some fiddling to get this to work for my exact needs.

I bought this for my phone - to keep it plugged in when I was sitting in my living room quite a distance from the wall plug...it is a great USB cable but will not stay in my phone - the little grippers are either too short or the tip is a little too long or some of both.

I was expecting a little bigger mp3 player than what i received. The reason i gave it 3 stars is just because it plays my music, what it was made for, and it was cheaply made but oh well...you wouldn't be expecting an ipod level build for something that cheap. Over all it's quite decent for the performance, so thumbs up for that.

I got the 10 feet of cable - it came in a bag.  It says CAT6 and is 10 feet long and has the CTG 'snagless' feature.  However, I thought these cables are made in the USA?  The bag I have doesn't say cables-to-go anywhere and it says 'made in china.' This is a Christmas gift - hope the thing works!  Go to CTG's website and they state all products made in the USA.PROS:ColorSnagless featureCAT6CONS:Authentic?

Home theater components usually provide more than one connection option.  Whenever HDMI is available on both components to be connected, it is the best option.  These cables can be plugged-in and forgotten.
The worst thing is that it takes just one AAA battery.  So the it needs to be replaced too frequently.  The reception is adequate.  The overall quality is on the cheap side.

NOTE: I have a 13" MacBook Pro so this review is based on that.These things are pieces of silicone that you use to plug up the ports in a MacBook.Downside is: they don't fit perfectly and it is very easy for them to come loose.The SD Card and headphone port covers fit perfectly.However, the other port covers (FireWire, Thunderbolt, Ethernet, USB and charger) don't fit too well.In the end, they're not a necessity but they're interesting to have.Overall,3/5

I'm still in the process of learning the in's and out's of this streaming device. I'm coming from a different vendors product prior to this western digital and unsure if I like the user interface, I purchased on advertised capability.
I think the only problem I have is that the suction cup falls off sometimes but in fact I blame that on the design of the Garmin unit that it is meant to hold, wherein it is too heavy.
It is what it says it is however if you want better grade filters, you'll have to spend more money.

I'm having constant problem logging in to my shared folder which I don't have when I do it wired.. I do have a older version which is wdtv live I was happy with that device. I don't know if it's worth to pay more for this new version. So far I have not found one.

This memory is like putting that massive wing on your Honda Accord. The fancy heatsink is completely unnecessary, and only increases your risk of interfering with your heatsink or other components. Adding mass to your memory modules only increases your risk during moves / shipping as well. So back to the analogy of the win on the Honda Accord-- it's only there to add punk-like pizazz to mom's family car. It serves no real purpose.
i bought these to run in and they only lasted maybe 20 miles. they can't handle the sweat but both sides still work (unlike really cheap models that only one side works after a couple weeks).

I didn't know it's size by looking at the picture. It is a small mouse and suit only for ladies or any hand size that of ladies. I bought this on 2008 and I used it only for month and it was not quite ergo for me, atleast.

The photo box was ok but it did not reduce the shadows as we had hoped. We still needed to Photoshop the images to get them cleaned up. The kit comes in a nice case which is good because you have everything together.

This is a simple case that will protect your iPad against scratches.  There is practically no shock absorbing value to it.  The iPad fits just fine.  I find this works well as a folder, especially since there is a elastic strap to help hold papers against the inside cover.  The iPad, like most tablets, is pretty good about scratch resistance on it's screen.  So I don't find a need to protect the screen itself.
This lens does not get you as close to the subject as I thought it would. But for the price, it is a fair value.

Using my Plasma in my living room AND using the TV in the kitchen I have had to use the Cable Box coax out for the kitchen TV. I wanted better resolution so I got this splitter. With both TV's on I don't have any sound in the Living room unless I UNPLUG and reset the splitter...It got so annoying I returned it.

When applied on the Iphone it is OK.  However, when we put the phone in the case, the case pushes against the screen protector and the protector comes off.  I wish the protector had a little bit more stickiness to it.
Nice design. Compact and seems very solid. Sadly, on the down side, they are one of the slowest I have ever had.
I had to cut off the edges of this bracket for it to even fit. Even after fitting it laterally, it projects too much from the console.
i use a different lens more than this one. this is sort of my back up lens. it has a weird loose part that i don't really understand :(
My computer monitor sits next to a Wireless G router which uses 2.4 G Hz frequency.  It is annoying that the wave from the router is converted to an audiable noise through the headphone.
I liked the size and the style.It was not compatible with my Galaxy Tab, so I returned it.I had no problems with  the return

Once the maps become old, it plays tricks on you (wonder if it is a ploy to get you update the maps). I can understand your maps may not be up-to-date with new roads added; but why confuse you with the old places. Once it attempted to send me to the wrong "home". The fee for a map update is outrageously high. No more GPS for me; I use my android phone.
works great for transferring movies from your computer to your Blue-ray player. Apparently I need more words for this to be submitted.

I bought this to use with my MK808b Android stick. To start with I ordered a k400 but the Seller sent me the newer k400r - and this is not working for me. I had to install the 'Easy' software to get this to run on Windows 8 (64 bit) - but sure enough it did work.I think this is pretty stupid considering this was a recommended purchase by Amazon with the MK808b.Disappointed

I finally gave up trying to use this mouse as a wireless mouse due to the dismal battery life.  I have the smaller Logitech Anywhere MX mouse and it's awesome with great battery life.  Not sure why it's bigger brother performs so poorly.  You are better off just buying a wired mouse as this one has to stay plugged in most of the time anyway.

I like the sound from Jbuds - I don't need amazing sound - just good - since I listen to audiobooks with them. My problem with these and other Jbuds I have purchased is their apparent fragility. I am not that hard on these things but they have all quit working on one side. In the future I will spend less and feel better when I have to toss them.

For some reason my Alpine head unit stopped charging my iphone 4, so I bought this as a supplemental power source. About 30% of the time when I connect it, the phone says that it is unable to charge with this accessory. Plugging and unplugging a few times usually resolves the issue, but it is pretty annoying. Not 100% sure wether to blame Griffin or Apple though.

It is ok for the price you pay. I bought it for my fitness center. Works fine. Fits on my 27 inch Samsung LCD tv, moves freely. If I had to buy for my bedroom, I would probably have bought a litte better (and a little expensive one)!But for this price you can't complain.
dont get me wrong, its a lot cheaper than the original, but its a bit loose when fits to the lens, anyway, gets the job done and for a cheap glass like this, wouldn't expend a lot of money for a hood

These are great for the price.The removable covers come off easy.I bought these because a co-worker ripped off my other sony's, witht the retractable cord when I was on vacation....left them in the office.Anyway, these have decent sound, but the cord from earphone to earphone is a bit short.Get the retractable sony headset, it's much more comfortable.

I use these on my iPad and iPhone.  Work as expected.  One of the tips is not attached properly, but. Still works.If I would have known they were comming from hong kong I probably would not have ordered them.
returned  to purchase 18-250mm lens for Nikon D5300, and Nikon 1V1.  the 18-250 works well with both cameras, and is easy to use .

I don't understand why these speakers are getting such high reviews from people.  They're ok, but definitely not great.  They get loud without distorting, there's a decent amount of bass for their price and they're cheap.  But I think anyone would be much better off getting a slightly more expensive but better set of speakers.
Not as good as the original, but for the price it was worth it.  The orignal battery only lasted 30 min at the end of it's life and this lasts around 1hr 30 min.

not much to say here, I needed one since my monitor came with only a vga and hdmi. somehow the manufactures decided those two were enough.....it wasent.as for the quality again its a cable it works fine, the little plastic locks are annoying but that's inherent with its design
This thing is much bigger than I thought from the picture and got some weight to it.  They should put this next to pop can so you can see.

As with any screen protector, it's time-consuming and frustrating to apply so that it's in just the right position -- I suspect that's why the package includes three, so you can waste one or even two in your attempt to get everything aligned -- a great advantage! An Apple Store genius told me that the protector can make the touch screen a tad less touch sensitive, and I may have noticed that. Still, all in all, it's just fine.

I wish these use some kind of detachable fastening mechanism instead of adhesive.  As it is, I have DSLR and 4 different lenses I use regularly and to have 4 different lens caps on the camera is simply not an option.  But if you mostly shoot with one lens, this is a good solution.

This is a nice bag but it's a bit ambitious to think you can fit all of the items listed in the website description comfortably. I would say you can fit one small, ungripped DSLR with kit lens or small prime attached, a second lens, and a water bottle (or a flash.) Or just a second and third lens, nothing else. Anything else and you'd be really jamming it in there and probably not able to clip it closed.

The price on these is good, and it spite of the seemingly flimsy cord, it seems to be holding up to my daily use so far. I was disappointed to find that the microphone only had an on/off button, which means I have to adjust the volume from the iPhone itself. They don't seal out the outside sound as well as some other headsets I have used, but for a backup set, these are okay.
this is okay but I wish it was more minimal.  It could be less obtrusive and still provide plenty of support

I suspect I did something wrong and for the price, I just ate the cost instead of returning it. You won't get any support on it. It did record quite well but I messed up when trying to delete my test recording and it wouldn't work any more.

Buy this for the charger and get the sanyo eneloop rechargeable they are the best on the market This charger allow's charging even though the battery is not completely dead so it is a great combination with the eneloops.

I purchased two of these IDE enclosures. The power supply did not work on one of my enclosures. I swapped power supply and then my computer (Win 7) would not recognize the USB connection.  Just move over to SATA already.

Have a curved dashboard. This does not stick well, so always have trouble keeping it in place. Besides that, very few items can stay on this, w/o addition suction cups/holders. This mostly defeats the purpose, just another dust collector on the dashbard. May take it out soon
Good for the price. Not too sturdy construction. Handle with care as it feels plasticky and fragile. I bought a few to have in my bag as spare.

This is the same spy camera as the "Moultrie Game Spy Plot Stalker". You can search it in Amazon site, or google it. Better yet, the Moultrie Game Spy Plot Stalker comes with 8-meg resolution, but at 1/3 of the price. See my product review for Moutrie Game Spy Plot Stalker in Amazon site.

I bought this to extend the USB connection to my camera (Nikon D5100) for use with tethering software (Control My Nikon). With this cable in the path the software recognized the camera, and could read from it, but got an error when trying to take a picture. I suspect the cable introduced a lag the software wasn't prepared for. Other software may have better luck. I have other uses for it, though so this is only a minor disappointment.

some reflections. when i glued it to the camera it was very fast, so better watch out an dbe careful because it was difficult to adjust. it obviously is not a professional viewfinder, but i also only have a low budget. so it is ok.

I've had one of these for about two years. I bought it because it had the dual purpose of card reader and flash drive. The build quality is cheap at best but if you're careful it seems to be fine. One nice feature is that both Windows XP and Mac (Snow Leopard) have read it without problem.

It is the best of the FM transmitters I've tried but it still comes up short when used in my car with a fairly good audio system. You can't turn volume up without static coming up (Tried every Freq). But on a plain old radio at normal volume you'd probably won't notice anything wrong.

It works fine in terms of charging my phone but my win xp PC starts complaining of power surge at the USB port. I have to reset the port after the charging has finished..but havent seen any issues witht he phone or the usb port because of this.
Like most Chinsee stuff there's a few flaws. The band Is slightly too wide for the watch. It's not easy to see, but the watch face is a goat vomit green. The buckle pin to too short  Keeps good time

On mine once I pair the keyboard with the bluetooth it really lagged out my OS. I couldn't even load a video, I've since got an Ipad with a similar case and no lag. But remember the sam. tab 2 only has a single core 1 gig snap dragon. the new galaxy tabs have quad core I think. should work find on the newer tabs.

They work and do there job, and for $6.00 you can't really complain but I have had a little difficulty inserting filters and getting them to go from collapsed to extended with ease. Perhaps it is a case of use or storage may change my rating after I have used more.

This AC adapter for my HP Pavilion delivers the correct voltage my machine needs.  My only complaint is that the cords are overly long and very stiff, making them difficult to wrap and causing them to take up a lot of space in my briefcase.
I bought this without looking into the connectors. These have the wrong connectors than what I needed, so I returned the item.

tried it with 3 lenses, no AF on VG30 camcorder.build is greatI think you lose a stop of light also because all my 2.8 lenses are showing up as 3.5.will do more testing but this is what it looks like so far.I don't have any reason to believe AF won't work on a still camera.Not sure about the aperture issue..
Fit was ok but made the iPad seem heavier. Good protection but in the end I did not use it.

First of all, this thing thinks it is a Kingston UR drive.  It is listed as such on every OS I have tried, from XP to 8.1.  Then it goes in and out, that is to mean it mounts, then unmounts, the remounts.... if i try to copy too much data (over 9GB) it stops before it is complete and I usually have to cancel.  I hope the other brands do better.

Bought this camera for my daughter.  My sister had a Casio but the 5 mp and the 10mp is truly a better quality picture. My daughter carrys it with you at all times.  The picture quality and zoom is great.  The only quality we do not like is when you snap the picture there is a delay before the flash leaving you with a different picture then anticipated.
I cannot honestly evaluate this item, as I have not had to use it. In the event I need to use it, I will return and evaluate at that time.

The case is light, slim, and has the right amount of pockets for my laptop, papers and a book.  The problem is it looks kind of cheap.  It's got kind of a shiny vinyl appearance to it that I don't really care for.  Too bad it seems to be put together ok.

Due to the "slim" nature, this cable does work with the Skullycandy S6HSDZ-072 Hesh 2.0 as a replacement cable (sacrificing the microphone and control-button features) - something that's been kind of hard to find for me. However, the cable is kind of short for a headphone cable: 4 ft. would have been a better length.

I can see what the makers were trying for here, a simple wall unit that you can dock your iphone or ipod at work or on the road. There are a few flaws tho, you don't just slide the ipod or iphone into the unit - you have to press it down hard and that's a bit of a problem. It takes me a few tries each time to get it docked right. Otherwise its pretty handy.

Overall it's a nice looking keyboard. However, the space bar is not very responsive and unless I press hard it doesn't work. This is the second Logitech Edge I have hadthis (oops) problem with.The general build quality is also decent. But with my experience (and many others) with the space bar I would not buy or recommend this keyboard. It is simply not worth the price.

The roll comes with lots of pros and a con...Pros:Very light-weight. Makes carrying it w/ all the other equipment easy.Length is small enough to fit in the trunk of any vehicle.It's thick so light/flash doesn't go thru it.Cons:It's not the color of the picture. In fact, I wouldn't even call it white. It's more of a light cream color.All in all, I really like it. Just wish I had known it wasn't white-white.

At first I thought this was a great mouse, worked very well while gaming and normal computing tasks.  BUT as the games became more intense there is a tendency, if you have big hands, to bump the dpi button while in the middle of a fight and change the mouse characteristics when you least expect it.  I gave the mouse to my wife and she likes the lights but her gaming is limited.
While this product is useful, it is too little for your buck i felt it was a bit overpriced, however it is of good material.

With newest firmware on touch or iphone (unless jailbroken) it will not work for video, and constantly displays "accessory not supported".  but does work as a USB cable fine still.  Also looks nothing like photo, just feels cheap, like the ends will fall of the cables at any time.

This is a medium price medium quality case. It serves the purpose....period. If you are like me and refuse to spend big $$$ for a case than this one is for you. Is does have the nice sleep/wake feature.

If you're looking for speakers that will boost the beeps that computers make ... &/or a nice source of background music audio while you work, these will be fine.  If you need something more ... Something w/ real presence & volume, these will not be your choice.

This thing works, but it destroys batteries. This won't make you a better photographer, but it is a cheap way to experiment with new light techniques. I find the synching a little slow with my Nikon D7100, but for such a low price as a beginner...why not? This isn't going to hurt you, and I thing working with cheap equipment forces you to learn a lot of important skills. Go ahead and buy it on an impulse.

This cooling pad used to work well. However, it has not been working well for the last month. Today I believe I tracked down the problem.The USB plug is odd. It has to be turned before being plugged into the hub. Today I noticed that the wires are exposed. I put duct tape on it, but that doesn't seem to help. Perhaps one or more of the wires has snapped. Now I'm looking for a replacement.

If you are really into printing images and you have a top notch photo printer, mine is an Epson R3000, then I would pass on it.  That to say, that it does a good job, but you get what you pay for.  A better choice would be a Color Munki that will calibrate the printer output to the monitor (or visa-versa).
I purchased this speaker for my iPhone so that I could hear my music over my shower. While it works just fine, the music quality is less than desirable.

Believe it or not, some of us still use VHSOnly because we are digitizing them now. Converting an analog tape to digital media takes its toll on a VCR and the heads get dirty beyond recognition. Eventually I'll have to tear down my deck to clean it properly but for now this cleaning tape really helps
The battery works just fine but sure doesn't hold the charge for very long.They are new but old batteries. They are dated
a little plastic that opens up a whole new range of possibilities in other attachments. Useful. But a bit over priced for a little piece of plastic.
This cooler is too small for any regular sized notebook. Its also very flimsy, the one I have broke withen a few months. Not worth the money.
If you're looking for a decent flash drive, this one's it.  Nice retractable feature and everything works fine.  The speed is a bit slow though.  I have yet to see write speeds over 1.5 MB/S.
We are having problems synching with our mac. Once the blue tooth is connected, it drops and we need to do a resynch every time on the mac after shutting down. Works good with Android.
It's easy to set up and works well enough.  I would rate it four stars rather than three if it gave me the option to have an immediate alarm in addition to the countdown alarm.

The leather case is great, fits well, looks good. The plastic belt clip broke within the first month Though. I was able to salvage it by taking the part that hooks to the case apart and using the 2 screws attached it to a piece of velcro that I wrap around my belt. This works 100 times better than the hard plastic holder it came with, more flexible and forgiving at work while I'm bending and moving!
Arrived well within the time frame. Looks OK. Little tricky to fix. Does not stay fit. Results are not bad. Base line is you get what you paid for.

The light works great. one thing I don't like it that the back of it kept on falling out, now I got a paper covering where the batteries goes do to the fact that I lost it. I would like a replacement back cover. Thank you

I had this connected to my radar detector on my motorcycle and linked it to my sena headset.  The volume output was so low that I could barely hear the radar detector, it was so low that it would not catch your attention.
The price was fair, and it worked well as electrical tape.  At 66 feet I won't need more for some time.

I was a little disappointed with this lens.  It does exactly what it should but it is slow to focus and somehow I don't get the qulaity of shots in close up I was looking for.  Nothing badly wrong with it but it is very unexciting.
this product will not protect the back my ipod touch have many blemiss i was better of buying somthing better but you get what you paid for.

Purchased this to go with my laptop which I had to return but when I used the external drive it worked well and had no problem connecting to the computer.  Good device for the price it's great.  If you  need an inexpensive drive for your laptop buy htis one.
Had to add additional tape to make it fit my flash strobe. works but nothing spectacular.

This is nicely laid out, with the pockets plentiful and easy to access.  I like that the hardware is metal and not cheap plastic, which tends to snap under pressure. The laptop pocket should have a clip to secure the laptop into the bag, but has a velcro strap instead.  I wish the fabric were one that would more easily wipe clean.  Still, for $80, this is a decent product.

this is decent but after a few days(a little more then a week) the plastic covering on the back started peeling off and then the hinge or clip on the top right were the hibernate button is will squeak loudly and it is annoying but over all it is a good cheap case.side note: this case is extremely hard to get off without breaking i almost broke mine so i could put a screen protector on the screen....
The product came in a damage box. The shipper used a padded envelope which was way to small. Their were only images on the box but no instructions.
Problem is. I don't think it interacts very well with other software. But it is strong and responsive to what it's purpose is. Connect you to a Server & move on.
This case is pretty nice, and seems to be built pretty sturdy but it is very small and would not fit my Fujifilm XP200 camera. It is a small case meant for very small/compact cameras.

I'm not sure if i just don't know how to use this, but I sometimes have to point it at certain parts of the camera for it to trigger the shutter. It would have been better if it triggered from any where otherwise I may as well use a cord. Other than that it works.
very low sound output, Battery life in eco mode apx 3.2 hours at best. Black finish showes finger prints bad, keep a soft towel around. heats up a lot. Lap heater. Runs nice. Quick !!
Bought it as a fill light. Works Ok.Great when there is no other light source.Not very spotty , so video looks decent enough.Don't expect too much of this tiny light.

The shade seems adequate for the Nikon kit lenses I purchased with my D40 (18-55mm and 55-200mm).  The only feature I miss (compared to other shades) is the ability to reverse the hood and attach it to the lens body.  Without that feature the hood floats around in my gadget bag and I do fear that I may lose it if I am not careful.

To use this the device that you want to connect it to requires a USB port which my Droid X2 doesn't have. I also was annoyed with the *manual* - not enough information.I am sending it back for a refundThat said, this is probably a nifty accessory for a tablet, I just wish there had been something in the product description that said that it is not suitable for a cell phone.
It extended the cable that I needed it to. Sound quality was tolerable, but not great. Has survived a year now, so it's built to last.

More coordinated people would probably find it easier to use this than I did.  Though it was easier to use than some other screen protectors I have tried, it also wasn't as clear and fingerprint resistant as it ought to be.
Is very small and easy to carry, has a stylish design, and is very light even for the resolution it gives, in some conditions is very poor.

This is a very comfortable mouse.  The only reason I do not like it is because of the scrolling wheel.  The listing did say "Gaming Mouse", and I planned to use it for gaming.  But for FPS', I like to use the scroll wheel to switch weapons, etc.  The wheel is very difficult to spin, it's very tight or something.  Other than that, the mouse was good.

Ordered 2 keyboards for pair of E6500s. Keyboards looks nice, worked without any issues except backlit. White leds are uneven, I almost think that some of the leds does not work at all. Right side of the keyboard is alright, left is almost completely dark. Both keyboards are same so I suspect bad engineering or quality control. Overall disappointed..
Does an okay job.  Tends to leave the last image in the buffer till the next time you connect your computer.

This case does not fit the Garmin window mount. The image shows that it fits the window mount and the cords, that is true, but you can't zipper the case because its not large enough to stay closed. Also it looks to cheaply made. I can see the parts were it was glued together. If I find a better case at Best Buy, I will be returning this. Not happy with purchase :-(
This fit the radio fine and connects to pc just fine If you have one of these radios and need to connect to pc this item is it .

This was my first and last time I will use a wet application for an Ipadmy original one was a peel and stick.... worked like a charmI thought with my new pad I would try something ( based on reviews ) the wet application !!Sorry....There were some glue pieces under the skin and had to remove and replace it.Finally after a week and a half the skin finally dried out

I bought this t use with the Canon 18-135mm Lens. However when using the lens on full zoom the circle of the hood can be seen and therefore photographed through the lens. Not too good! It works OK when not on full zoom.
Despite the three sizes of foam covers, none was small enough for my use.  The smallest size would not fit.  As a result, the sound was muffled.

I use this to control my laptop and desktop pc.  I am constantly having to crawl under my desk to press the buttons to switch computers as the hot buttons do not work if only one computer is on.  It will remember the last computer used.  If you start up the other, you will need to press the button on the unit.  It will not automatically switch to the one that is powered or powering up.

Does what it is supposed to do without problem.Quite a mystery why Onkyo has to jab their customers for extra $$ merely for Wi-Fi....there are $50 Blu-ray players out there with it built in... to gouge you customers extra for this feature is kinda sleazy given the price of the hardware it's made for.

Like everyone else, I'm disappointed at the price, but I want the cable to work so I didn't go with a generic (no good ones were around when i bought this). You'd think they could have at least made it a little longer or something else to lube the deal.If you can find a generic with consistent good reviews then buy it instead, otherwise just buy this, grumble about the "Apple tax" and move on.

The recording quality is better than the original built in mic, however, I felt cheated by the price.  This mic and many mics are not wind proof.  For the price, I would have expected something to cover the mic so that it doesn't pick up wind.  I'm here to complain about the price.
Good price and quality music for old connections for Ipod and Iphone.

i took a chance and this charger works with my 350; i put the first on at a strain and the connector at the garmin end disconnected, but still worked.  I ordered a second one and this time i will better position the charging plug at the garmin end.  would buy again, but at this price, this is the one to buy to replace or put one into the other cars.
Adequate and spacious case but disappointed in how much it cost for I got...I'm sure there are better and less expensive alternatives.
I like this remote but have problems using it. I will work on it and it will get easier, hopefully.

I don't mean it's a bad product. But you know, the price is low. So the quality isn't good, either.The fans are a little bit noisy. The LED parts died quickly. These two parts may not affact your safty. But the USB head part and its connecting wire may leesens soon enough and make you shock.Customers must condider to use it very gentlely to prevent from this situation.

Earhoox are alright. They don't keep my earbuds in as close as I would like, but they prevent them from falling out easily. They come in a pack of 2 pairs - one large, one small. I wish I could have chosen 2 large pairs, because I can't use the small ones.
There are not enough of the larger ties and way too many of the smaller ones.  I've bought this kit more than once because I end up with just a pile of the short ones.  They work as intended though!

This fits fine and protects my Chromebook, but it has no pockets for things like a wireless mouse and the charging cords.  I've used the Case Logic brand for years and have never had any problems with protection and durability.
Purchased the remote for use with my Sony TV and it works very well. Good remote at a good price.
Quality is very good, but I found the highs to be a bit much, so  I returned it. I bought a set from Monoprice for $8.50 that out performs it.
I ordered this for my uncle and he wasnt able to figure out how to program and use is even by using YouTube tutorials, what a waste.
It's probably overpriced but it gets the job done.  I only used it for short amounts of time but I imagine it would become abrasive if used longer.
It was purchased to connect an an earphone set for TV volume.  Worked around the problem with an audio Y-Cable.
The case looks like cheap plastic but is great for travel protection of our device. I have tried a few other cases that I prefer the fell of a leather like case.
Good product. took a month and a half to receive.does what its supposed to and its a good price
Feels a little cheap but works well. So I really can't complain. and it'll serve me well enough for the small stuff I do...and any hum in my recordings I gleefully work on removing in post.

This product is everything its described as being. It works well and does its job protecting my Nook and the sleep function which I don't quite understand works well too. However holding it  in your hand, it feels cheap. Paying only ten dollars for it though, I can't complain. But in this regard you are getting what you paid for.

These monitors work well, but the heat inside the vehicle loosens the joint where the stand attaches to the monitor. Tried to attach it to the windshield, but the sun just loosened the adhesive and it won't stick.
not with all options. it might be nice if nikon updates the software. it just trigger option now, it will be nice if softwares get more options like focussing, exposure et.

I ordered the pink  they sent black..... not worth the trouble to send it back.  I had a leather blouson case but it no longer would stand up. Amazon starting to not care about item quality. this will due.  I think I will look on Overstock.com for the next case

This is a nice hand strap and base for someone using the iPad in an environment where they stand and hold the tablet and then need a place to rest the tablet often.  Off hand I think education and retail are two good starting places.  For me the way this case connects to the tablet makes it NOT usable.  The Swivel end rubs hard against the screen (ruining my screen protector).  So I won't be keeping it.

It's bright.. Large letters.. Easy to install (plug'n play) and the price is reasonable. BUT!! The unit is uber light, it will move at the most inopportune times and the space bar has one prong so don't expect anything more than center bar to actually work. I don't regret buying this, I do like the large print but I'm not all that thrilled either. (maybe I'm just not used to 'new in box')

This does not fit snug with the ipod 4th gen. When i want to change songs or anything while the ipod is in the pouch i have to shift the armband around to position the ipod in the middle to gain access to the button.

While it does work, these batteries or unit are slow to get fully charged and quickly lose that charge even (and especially) when not being used.  If I set the camera aside for a month and pick it up again the batteries are dead even without any use.  I think I'll be investigating and investing in a couple sets of LCD AA's for my Canon next time.
I didn't notice any difference or the extra advantage of the super charger that amazon wants you to believe.you can get something cheaper and get the same results.
Too small, doesn't work well with my glasses. And I would expect this to sell for around $99, not $149. I can't say that I'm completely happy with this purchase.

Excellent sound using digital optical audio output to a receiver. Choice of available stations is fair to O.K. compared to other internet radios. This unit's Achilles heel is the dismal user interface, reminds me of something a bunch of kids developing in their basement. The Apple iPad app helps with the interface, but still the stand alone remote control and unit display is an embarrassment.
I don't have any way to know as yet if this item works.  Unfortunately, it did not come with any instructions for it's use.

I needed to shave the blue liner off where the ports are in order to get it to work with my case.  Probably more of an issue with the case than this product, but I think it would have been better if the "boots" were removable.  Docking one start for that and one because it only comes in blue. Ugh!  How about black StarTech?  I like a clean looking case.
My wife bought this because it is purple...and a nice purple.  However, it took about a week for the strap to pull out.
was not what i was looking for, wouldn't fit in my nikon 5100 so i had to return it to it's owner..
almost impossible to Save stations.battery life is short.stations are pretty clear. and easy to use.  fits in pocket nicely.
Falling asleep with this headset on regularly might have contributed to stress on the wires that caused them to stop working after a few months. I'm not sure.
It's still a little buggy and not to many apps are available for it. Come on Google open this thing up for other developers!
The connector to the iPhone side is really tough to put in and remove. It's like it's a tad bigger than the iPhone's connection.
Works "OK". Not exceptional. Will not pick up all major networks at the same time. Constantly has to be moved.

The buttons are nice and soft-press and it feels good in your hand. Not all functions work with every code, so you'll have to learn plenty of the buttons. I couldn't get the color buttons programmed to my Dish Hopper, even learning from a Dish IR remote. No backlighting is a downside. Okay in a pinch, but I'd just use it in one of the kids' rooms instead of my main remote.

This might be just the right case for those looking for a minimal cover that provides some protection.  The material is shiny and flexible, and looks like it will stay on, but I am not sure how much protection it would provide for a dropped Touch -- see other reviewers comments on this. The customer service is top notch.

Functions well and looks great.  Could use some improvements like rubberized corners, ease of opening, and a little more weather proof.  I had some problems with a couple keys on the keyboard, but got them fixed with my pocket knife.
it stuck nicely for 3 days but tends to slip when i move my finger.  however, it does keep a million fingerprints off the face of the tablet.

These little guys are essential to keeping your Garmin fed with all-important electricity.  Your GPS comes with it already, but unfortunately, they have a tendency to break down too easily.
