The wires get broken inside and you have to replace it.  I've had to replace 2 already on my 3 Garmin C550 GPS's.  And they aren't cheap.
everything is accessible, it fits. but closing is way too tight and it doesnt seem like it will laste long.
They do what I was told as far is scratches and dust butthey stick to the records witch I do not like.Would not recommend them.

had to order it to be sure but this cable ended up being a little short.  If your looking for a tight fit, it might be good for you, but I prefer a little more slack.  Ultimately I went with the 24" version from Valley Enterprises that included molds that keep the audio out of your ear canal.

This strap stays in place well because the bottom screws in to the tripod socket, but in order to get it tight enough to use with my Nikon D7000, it's hard to place my hands like I normally do when I'm taking a picture. Got this to use on vacation, installed the day before we left, and removed at the airport because it was driving me nuts. Was pretty cheap so not out much.
Speakers have great sound, but trying to use in anything other than mono is difficult. The speakers seem to have problems "finding" each other.

I just got it and tested it out. When it works, it works really well. The clarity of the picture blew me away.But occasionally the view gets jumpy and blurry and last for a while. When that happens, even the audio is broken and I cannot tell what is being said. I am wondering if that has to do this converter, or the RCA indoor antenna that I am using...

Honestly this was an impulse buy. I thought it was for photography. Got it and realized it was for light measurement (lux). That said I still use it to measure stage lights when I shoot video productions. "THIS IS NOT A PHOTOGRAPHY LIGHT METER"
The chargers Works just fine In my house and in the car, but the batteries they sent have a life endurance half the time of the originals or less, they work well just for an emergency
Product is OK. What can be said about an audio patch cable??? It is what it is. Three more words required.,

I got this mouse on sale over a year ago and it's workedflawlessly with two different Windows 98SE systems (connectedthrough the mouse port). I've had no problems with it atall. Smooth scrolling, decent with FPS games. All in allit's a good deal.

I needed another charger for my Kindle HD so I would have one at work and one at home. This was really inexpensive. The only thing is that when you use the wall charger, you can't use the Kindle. No problem if you don't intend on using it while it's charging.
It's a good deal it works i use it in a battery gripper and it gets the job done like i said its a good deal
This item is OK. It protects the tablet, but it sometimes hard to keep the tablet stable in the case. It slide out sometimes. Not too happy with it.

If you just need a pair of headphones and aren't really concerned with how they sound, then these will work. However if you're looking for a decent pair that sound good, don't buy these because they are all treble, there is no midrange or bass. So Rap music or Dance music sounds like crap.

I wanted to like this case but in the end I returned it.Pros:-Thinner case compared to others-Magnetic cover-Cutouts allow full functionality-Feels durable-Prevents scratchesMine had an issue where closing the cover would not turn on/off the screen without adjusting the cover when opening/closing.  I probably got a defective one considering all the other reviews but I decided to return it for a different brand.  I'm giving this item an average review since it didn't function correctly.

The shield is tough does a good job of protecting my Galaxy Tab. It is also a good fit with all the holes in the right places.That said, there are several negatives. It is difficult to get installed properly. Biggest negative is the glare. Even on a cloudy day is almost like a mirror when used outside.I would not get this product again preferring to have a protector that doesn't require applying a solution to attach the shield.

Signal is much better than old USB adapter, down load speed has increased. The major flaw with mine is that when I wake up my computer I have to reboot the adapter to get it to maintain a connection, very frustrating. If anyone has a fix please advise

This stylish little device falls short on music quality. The sound is flat with very little bass. The good news is the battery last longer than expected (4+ hours) and overall the product feels well built. If you are looking for an inexpensive speaker to take to the beach or listen to audiobooks this speaker is the perfect choice.  If you are particular about your music, look elsewhere.

For minor to medium scratches, this machine can help you out. For deep scratches, you may be getting a mixed bag as far as results go. If money is an issue, this is probably you best bet, but don't expect too much out of this device. It does work well enough to get scratched discs readable, but may not get them looking brand new.
Looks, works and protects well! Very good, but not so good finishing and the keyboard is not very strong built.
I find I do not need this type of holder much but it works just as described and would be useful when you haven't any pockets.

Fist off, this isn't a horrible bag...it's just not a great one. I bought it because I wanted a cheap backpack for my D80. It's a small bag, so things are cramped inside. But it's lightweight and fairly comfortable. Overall, I'd probably recommend this backpack to someone like me who just wanted something inexpensive.Pros: Cheap, lightweight, small, seems well made, looks pretty good, CHEAP.Cons: Cramped quarters, frustrating zippers

better than my GH2 in camera mic, but not by much.  Also picks up all the same camera noises as the in camera mic so this was pointless to use unless you have it in a shockmount.Video review of my gear on [...]
It is a nice case, but there is no leather at all to be found on this case.  it is all vinyl and nicely built.  but do not think you are getting something that has leather anywhere on it.

This is the one my cable internet provider sent me home with today after I took a gradually failing modem back to them for replacement.  It's sitting next to me blinking as I type this, and it's working fine.  For the current price the used ones are getting, might be a good deal.
Bought this as a gift. The recipient likes it. I thought it was too bulky and makes the tablet seem cumbersome. I suppose if your someone who is accident prone this might be a good choice for you.

Could be my new computer or monitor, but this connects a bit loosely. Even a light touch will either knock out my screen or give it lines. But it does the job, and I don't mess with it much, so average it is.

this case looks pretty but its very flimsy, yea it looks sturdy on the pics but once you buy it and install it on your ipod youll see for yourself, it broke in like 4 months when i took it off a corner piece snapped and thats all it took for this thing to go from to a little bit loose to completely unusable.will not buy this again

Bought in hopes of improving Dell Inspiron case cooling.  Worked OK, but not as good as the original Dell fan (go figure!).  Clever wiring design allowed me to connect both fans to single connection.  Moved this fan to the front intake area and kept original Dell fan in place.  Overall reduced case temps ~ 5 degrees once I got it into a configuration that worked for me so it was worth keeping.

It's cheaply made, the button fell out of the device soon after buying, and I still haven't used the remote control... but it still works.  It automatically switches between the PS3 and Cable box depending which one I turn on... and I can still push my fat fingers into the hole where the button used to be... so it's all good.I wasn't expecting much, and got exactly what I expected.  It still works, so I'm somewhat satisfied.

In short, This adapter didn't cost TOO much but it wasn't cheap either at around $10.00.It holds my LG Optimus G in place on my tripod but I believe my phone almost maxes out theextension of this device. I am worried that with too much mounting and unmounting of my phone; that I willbreak the plastic curves that "clip" my phone in.Overall: B-For $10.00 it could be better.

Works as described. I find mine can carry a lot of things--pens, highlighters, external battery packs, flash drives, cables, scissors, glue, tape, etc. all at once. Unfortunately, the one thing I have against this is that it tends to BEND in my backpack...can be very annoying, and pops some things out of the organizer.
It does not attach well to the arm and cannot stay attached well if placed upside down. There are others like this available through Staples that work much better.

I gave a three star because I bought two pair and the other pair works fine but this one didn't last. They came with several bud caps, fit nicely in the ear and produced good sound. Mysteriously one earbud just stopped working. Didn't return it because they're cheap enough that it's not worth the effort.
....this flash drive is sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo sloooooooooooooooooooooooooooooow! A 2 GB file took me about 10 minutes to transfer. I needed this drive so replace one I lost.
I probably won't buy another package - these are a hassle to place on the screen and make the screen appear dull.  I'll use these since I have them, but I'm not overly impressed.
great when it works. other times it loses connection easily, your chin presses the buttons or it runs out of battery fairly quickly.
BOUGHT AS A GIFT AND THEY SAID IT WORKED VERY WELL

400 is a useful cargo of discs. I hate the so called "jewel cases". But I need room to store the papers and booklets associated with each disc. This is therefore poorly planned and almost useless.It is a cheaply made import which is no surprise, but we are used to such.The third star is only for a reasonable capacity.
I don't like the snap on these cases. They will shut but the snap is weak and some of them don't close at all. Decent price tho.

this is a pretty sturdy cover and does a pretty good job protecting the ipad but it isn;t as good as the smart cover sold by ipadthe top does not conveniently bend over, so you can hold it in 1 handbest thing about this product is its way cheaper than the ipad cover
several of these have lasted 1 to 1.5 years for us. Not nearly as long as the original batteries.
Very brittle but good for the price. It works but intermittently. It needs to be a little more solid in its design

Works okay. it should have an on off switch and even though you may not have any cards in slots they still show up as removable, it's kind of annoying. It does work, I only had a couple of drop outs but when you unplug and plug it back it your device should show up again.

Like other reviewers have said, these are too weak.Pros:1. Very, very cute!2. Light weight3. Don't need external power4. Very portableCons:1. Too weak2. Larger than what I thought they would be3. Sound is tingy4. Cord is very shortI've had these for a while now, and I was excited about them at first. But in the end I didn't use them very much because I couldn't hear anything unless the room was very quiet.

These cables are very cheap but also very cheaply made.  I use them to hook my smartphone to my car stereo and they work fine for that.  The problem is that after a couple of months the wire begins to break on the inside.  It stays in my car and doesn't get pulled a lot.  I am on my third.  I will by a little more expensive one next time.

It is an Ok touchpad. I purchased this product soon after I installed windows 8.  I wish I had waited.  I have learned to use the keyboard and mouse to do everything that I need to do.  I will probably purchase a good touchscreen monitor if the price for one ever becomes reasonable.

The case arrived fairly quickly.  It is very well made and sturdy.  The problem is, it's very very heavy.  I can't lie in bed at night and use it because it's so heavy.  The keys are small, but that is to be expected.  Another thing I noticed was that my Samsung Galaxy 2 Tab does not fit perfectly in the case.  It's off just a bit.  Overall, I probably would not make this purchase again.

It did was supposed to do but it was awkward. It was on the bulky side. I just went back to the keyboard on the tablet. Any serious typing I went to laptop. Great concept but it did not work for me sorry. Not a awful product just did not work for my usage.

The sound is great for such a small speaker.  Don't expect fantastic bass, but do expect this to boost your volume to enjoyable levels with good clarity.  Mine broke within two months of lite usage. I won't buy anymore products made by this company again.

They sound ok. Good bass but distorted on some tracks. My biggest complaint is that they are unusable on the go. The sounds of the wires moving around and rubbing on your close can be heard clearly through the music. Very distracting.That being said they'll be nice to use for sitting on my arse.
I think is good, but I think creative labs product are definetly better choice...

The Marware MicroShell Folio Lightweight Standing Case for the Kindle fire is OK, I was expecting better. My biggest problem is that you have to leave the screen unprotected to charge the kindle with this case! If you don't mind leaving the screen uncovered while charging the kindle Fire then you shouldn't have a problem with this case.

Excellent for back up of important documents. I lost my hard drive a year ago. All my photo's and documents. I have three Flash Drives. One for photos, one for documents and a spare. The only complaint I have is that this flash drive does not have a way to attach a lanyard. Different colored lanyards help me identify what each flash drive contains. It is easy to lose. I rated it three stars because of this.

Raised my rating to three stars from the previously stated one star.The reason being is that this bulb is still going but I get the warning to change the bulb and have since the original review... so still have my replacement in the box.  I didn't give it four or five on the edit because I have had to look at that bulb change dialog since... hope this helps someone.
The audio isn't outstanding, but it's great for the price. I"ve had it for about 2 years now, and the cable is starting to break.

It works for my Evo 4G, taking two starts because it kind of shorts out while watching something from my phone. it would disconnect and i have to reconnect it and my phone doesn't recognize the cable and doesn't say HDMi on my phone, i'm 100% it's not my phone.

Works.  Lapse of several seconds when change input.  "Memory" (switching to last-used/on) doesn't work.  Runs hot so have to turn off when not in use, and select input due to latter "memory" feature not working.  But if you need it, do it anyway.
Bought this for a trip to Costa Rica.  Great price, compact, reasonably good optics.  Next time I would have spent more.

This Belkin 3-outlet charger is one of those things that's always with me. In the car, house,work etc I always have it with me to ensure that i have power anywhere at anytime. The only issue i have is that its a little clunky, but other than that i like it and it works well. Happy shopping!

First it's a kindle charger. It works and charges. Two problems I do have, first why doesn't the kindle just come with one? Second the price is way too much. Come on $20 for a charger, can buy a comparable one for about 1/2
Sigh. I bought this hoping it would boost my 5G signal for my ASUS router. Alas, it did not. Rats.

I gave this 3 stars for one specific reasonI feel that getting a batterypak with a higher milliamp/hour rating should have lasted longerI still get under 2 hours of operation before my laptop shuts down
ok item the keyboard didn't work with my tablet, but  it did work on my laptop. the case i nice wich the keyboard could come out
Caution while buying this product -The product does not work with a Google Nexus 7.The 5 pin male Adapter side is Larger and does not fit either a Google Nexus 7 nor a Samsung Galaxy S2.

I bought this to use with Rosetta Stone. It works fine with my macbook pro,It didn't take long for the stand to lose its ability to hold the microphone up, however. Now, I have to use tape to keep it up so I can use it. It still works though.
They are ok but my ears are small they keep falling out even after I changed the plastic pieces...but they are ok

but it is not for multilined labels, as they just become very small-for single line labels, this Dymo is great.  If you need more "room", check out what Brother offers-I got one of them and it will print out LARGE multilined labels and label stock is priced right and you get a lot for your money (yes, it is self-adhesive).

The date they were  made states 2010, so that would be 2 years down in the batteries general life. Other than that, charger isn't more wonderful than others. The batteries though they are from 2010, still work much better than others.

The sound is good. But not sure how they design this headset, it gives you headache as soon as you put it on for 5 minutes. It's just too tight. I decide still to keep it since I don't use it very often, maybe once a week. If you used it longer, it's a bad choice..

A great little device, the only issue is that Windows 7 doesn't like it.  If I leave it "on" my pc refuses to start.  If I leave it plugged in but both switches off, there's no problem.  It's a little inconvenient but worth it.

I purchased this to work with an Amped Wireless Wireless-N router.  The setup was a bit tedious and the interface was fairly confusing.  It seemed like at any change of a setting, the extender would need to undergo a 6 minute restart process.  Once it was set up, though, it seemed to work pretty solid.  Be sure you keep the firmware up-to-date as older revisions were very problematic.

I wanted a wireless trigger for my D600 that would allow me to do shake-free macro shots and self portraits.  This remote does work with the D600, but not reliably.  I sometimes have the mash the button a few times before it registers.  It is small, which means it can go in the pack, but just about any time I need a remote trigger, I go for the shutter release cable.  It just works.

This product offers a lot for the money.I was interested in installing Ubuntu.  I found the link below providing detailed information of the shortcomings and difficulties in making such an installation.  Has anyone else successfully performed such a test and happy with the installation?[...]

This product smh head.. This product is ok if you want to get this for like your 5 year which I did and expect him or her to loose it or give it way or just break it... Then you have nothing to worry about... The buttons feel cheap the micro was loose and um its cheap. But it did play and the battery life was decent so you get what you pay for...
It delivers a fair amount of light but frankly the length of the cable is too short and it is hard to keep in position.
This ram is great for the price.  For my first build I ain't to worry about it.  Maybe in the future I would probably upgrade to a better one.  But like I said it is a awesome ram for the money.
so so

Well, this item itself is good. I do not complain about it at this price, good enough for me. But I am convinced that I received a used item, this made me very disappointed. I kept it - did not bother to go through the return process.

A major shortcoming of this offering is that you cannot convert your existing MDs into mp3 files.  I wrongly assumed that since you could place MP3s onto MDs that you could perform the reverse operation, BUT you cannot.Therefore, my existing MDs cannot be converted to mp3s, which is exceedingly frustrating.If anyone knows of an offering where this is possible, would you post it here??

It's a little tough to manipulate if you're trying to plug/unplug the power cord.  There is no cutout for the standby/power button, but that may be because we have a 1st gen iPad, later iPads may be ok.
Returned original as it was damaged when I received it. New one works fine. Nice compact shape. Clip needs some teeth for better grip.
The photo in the product shows it is gold ends, and when it arrived it was standard silver metal. The cable works good, but I wanted to see if the gold ends made a difference. But it was not gold.

You always are afraid of power supplies overheating. I don't know if this one will cause problem so I'll have to watch for it. But, if you have it plugged into both the wall and the device, it gets scorching hot. If you unplug from the device, it does stop which is nice. So, I wouldn't leave it connected all the time as we often do these days with laptops.
Didn't know you could do so much with this little gadget, I'm using it on a car computer project. The thing I don't like about it is it has little gain, a bit more gain on the antenna would be nice.

YES, it works as described and the price is about the lowest I found. In use today, still working, but... It has a cheap look and feel. Doesn't seem as hefty or durable as most cables I've used. In the end, it works, and you save money.

I bought these for my mom because this was what she asked for for Christmas.  In her words, these were not that great and not worth the month.  The weird plastic thing on the outside kept falling out of her ears.  On top of that, I couldn't return them.
Simple cable - you could do worse.  Twelve more words required.  Nine more words required.  Read Egger's The Circle. Now

It says its backwards compatible but its really not.  It won't pick up any of my neighbors networks, just N networks. My network happens to be N so not a huge deal but if you need to connect this to an older router it won't work.

I tried this on an older PC with USB 2.0 ports.  There just wasn't enough bandwidth to handle two 22" monitors.  The lag was enough to make me buy a new PC.  If you have a USB 3.0 port it should work fine.
Honestly I don't even use the remote.  I bought this for the transmitter, and the programmed my universal remote to use that as a controller for it.
I purchased this fan as a replacement for a CPU cooling fan that was DOA out of the box.  The fan runs well, and is quiet.  I think that it is a better fan than the original equipment unit.

Works as advertised. Loses two stars because I shouldn't need it! This is just an opportunity for Plantonics to make $30 off of you because they couldn't be bothered to put a MicroUSB charger on the device. I shouldn't need any accessories.
Pro: Good ErgonomicsCon: Requires frequent battery re-charge.Battery NOT replaceable. If it fails you have to buy a new mouse.

It's not a bad little case for what I paid.  HOWEVER, it took all of a week for the strap to pull out on one side with pretty minimal effort.  Other than that, it's held up for months in the wife's purse -- and the kids hands!

Wasted the money on this. Temperature sensors all came unstuck after about a month. doesn't really do anything that software on my computer already did. Only benefit It had was that it helped with my cable management a tad and looks kinda cool in my case.
It looks good and got it soon after order, good service. It just meet my requirement for my new camera.

These were fairly okay screen protectors. It's partly my fault for not wanting to pay such a high amount of money for screen protectors. For the most part, however, it does do the job that it was intended for, so for that I am greatful. It was cut correctly, but installation was actually fairly hard. Lots of bubbles, but that is due to my inexperience I would expect.
If you like modern minimalism, this is certainly hard to find as a good example of that in flash drives!

This is a minimal Palm, with a small and barely readable display, modest memory, no external communication except for a PC link, and no telephone.  But that is what I wanted when I bought it, and it functions quite satisfactorily for my major application (ePocrates in a medical practice).
What can I say about a battery?
Not a great improvement over what came with my device. They work well and I'll keep them. I was really looking for something with noise cancelling, Are they worth the price, probably not.
Great for the price. It has limited apps so it is not that useful yet. Only supports h264 media type so if you have older videos they will need to be converted. Browser playback very limited
This is a fair product.  Coming apart on the corners and delaminating a bit.  Not bad for the money, but you pay for what you get.

as a privacy screen, this didn't prove to be as useful as i had expected. since it makes the screen a bit darker, i have to turn the brightness up. but turning the brightness up on my phone enough to comfortably use the phone makes it bright enough for the person sitting next to me to see what I'm doing (or read what I'm saying), which defeats the purposealso, screen quality took a hit

Very nice amp, plenty of power to drive two 10" woofers in a 14' X 28' room for stereo music, movies & Wii.The only negative is the power switch is on the volume control, so every time you use the amp you must re-adjust the level. Or leave it on all of the time
thank you for refund Tom..I don't know what else to say thanks again....I do not know any thing else to say

The product itself is one of quality, but there are not may quite FM stations in SoCal. It's difficult to keep a clean static free connection between the iTrip and any "clean" frequency; something always leaks in. I wish I had an input jack on my stereo to pipe-in my iPod, but I don't...
Can't rate it any higher because I haven't had to use it yet. If I do I'll be better informed to give a better or worse rating. For now it is a neutral rating only.

Purchased this to use on the airplane but I am a bit disappointed. The battery life is marginal. I have to increase the speed of playback to watch an entire movie of around 2 hours. I decreased the brightness as suggested but then the picture is difficult to view. Other than the battery life, the unit works great!

I really don't know if I can blame this on the product, but it stopped working after a couple of months.I'm suspicious that it was my roommate's installation rather than the product itself that is the problem.

I got this pair because I was going out of the country. I have 2 lenmar batteries that i got from frys and in a battery pack on my T2i I was able to hold a charge for approx 2 days. with these, by the end of the day I had to replace them. I was using my camera for photos with lite video use.

This is a well known company that makes a lot of great products; this one is in the mid-range of those.I use them to listen to content on my iPod while I'm in the shower, and it does a pretty good job at that.The sound is ok, but the tone control has very little effect on the sound. And don't forget the housingsare plastic, so that tends to affect the sound output.You've been warned!

The stylus is designed to be multi-purpose but only the stylus designed for the iPad seemed to work for me.  The iPad stylus also had what seemed to me a lack of rubber on the tip.  When pressing down, you could feel the slight give between the rubber and the nib underneath. It is okay but I think it could be better than as is.

The micro receiver has no docking on the keyboard or mouse and there is no on/off button to turn the mouse off when not in use. So I always have to keep the receiver on my laptop least I might lose it.Other than that it works fine. I even thought of returning it, but have returned or exchanged so many bad items that I didn't want amazon to flag me, so keeps it.

The HD 201 can be purchased for under $20.You get what you pay for. They are light weight, they don't hurt your ears like buds sometimes do, but they are very low volume on both my laptop or my entertainment PC's. But what can you expect? You get what you pay for.2 *

1 stick was bad out of the box, have a replacement on the way. If the second set works fine I will give it 5 stars. The RAM looks good in my computer, and except for being too tall for my cpu cooler's fan, it is perfect. I know RAM has a high failure rate but just hate it when it happens to me!

I also bought this product based on customer reviews of "value for money"...but instead of this I highly recommend AudioTechnica MT40 monitor headphones. Beats Bose anytime...I repeat..beats Bose anytime...all that in 50 bucks...

I've used two of the three I got so far, and I have bubbles everywhere! It still works fine with the bubbles, but the first one I ended up throwing away because it was just too many bubbles. I have tried everything, and just so you know, it's not my first time itch screen protectors. I don't know what it is, I just can't get them to go on without a screen full of bubbles.

Really, reading the things not covered i don't think you'll ever get your moneys worth. But it's one of them things you'll never know if you paid for a service until it's needed.3 stars only because To review this product before you use it seems .....Nothing good, Nothing bad to say about them.

The case is too pliable.  The top cover doesn't hold alignment so the magnets slip out of positon, making the operation of the cover switch unreliable.  In addition,  when the microphone is properly aligned with the case, the rear facing camera is slightly out of alignment and vice-versa.  The leather seems of good quality and probably as good or better than anything you're going to find at this price point.

This is a good entry-level tripod.  I use it in my office and don't need to take the camera off too often, but it is plastic and a little flimsy.  A professional would not be happy with the play in the mount, but OK for me.
My son has to remove it alot of time to use some of the functions. My other son just leaves it off becuz it's an inconvience. When it is on it is protective.

It fits, which is more than I can say for the first 7" case that I purchased.  I don't like that there aren't snaps on the right side, so the tablet can just slide right out.  It is serving it's purpose and it's cute, so 3 stars.
This product is good quality but it is blatantly priced to gouge your wallet. Shame on Sony for being so greedy.

the Cover case is very durable and of good quality. I use it for my kids tablet. The tablet took lot of abuse so far but still working thanks to this cover. I like the multi-angle stand and it's very helpful.

When I purchased this, I knew it was not IPS but I was hoping for better TN quality. The viewing angles are okay, but if you move too far from dead center, then the colors quickly wash out.It's light and thin, the case protects the screen reasonably well while it's nested in my laptop bag.Have questions? Just ask.

I upgraded my Lenovo notebook to Windows 8 Pro and wanted to take advantage of some of the touch screen functions. This touch pad gives this opportunity but the performance is so-so. I am not sure that this is because of the touch pad itself or because of the slowness of the notebook. This being said, I DO recommend the touch pad if you want to get Windows 8 touch functions without a touch screen.

This rf modulator works converts composite sources to rf cable output. As to autoswitching this only applies to the choice between antenna in and ONE video source. You can only attach a maximum of 2 sources. I routed one source to ant. In (game output) and the other source to the composite inputs (DVD) . At first I expected the unit to allow switching between MULTIPLE composite sources. Not so.
Its pretty cheap which was expected but seems to work just fine just seems like they can break easily but nothing has broken yet

The cable itself is good quality and easy to work with. I pulled about 2 feet out of the box before it jammed. I opened the box up removed tangle and got another 2 feet out before it tangled. Upon further inspection, the whole length of the cable was hopelessly tangled. I've used about 300ft of it and I had to take it out of the box so I could use it at all.

Was a decent camera. For the price, I recommend and Canon, Sony, or a Nikon. Casio Z1000 was very fast but the color was a bit distorted. My Z100 lasted one deployment in Iraq, and that was it. Not recommend it.
It does the job but is of low quality. I don't regret this purchase, and for the price you can't go wrong.

It is as advertised, designed a la Apple, which is the main reason I picked it over other ones, but it has a slight flaw, it is not heavy enough to stay flat on the desk... the weight of the cables makes it tip to the front, BUT do not be discouraged from buying it.. it is still nice and serves its purpose. I am definitely ordering another one, I just wish manufacturers pay attention these days to details.

The only problem so far that I can see with this product is the transfer rate from the camera to my computer is way too slow.....I hate to sit and wait for things. The Plus side is it can upload your photos automatically to your computer to a folder It even does videos.... I like that as I do allot of videos.
I was very proud of this cable at first and was recommending it to everyone.  I received it in January and have already had to replace it though, so it went from a 5 to a 3.  Disappointed.

Fast but couple of concerns:1. the cable is too short and stiff.2. the CF socket is too shallow and not much 'guide' for the CF card. Needs to be extra cautious to insert the card or you'll damage the CF socket.
It works, feels good in the hand, with a good weight and well balanced, but still does not feel like a good pen.  My iPad does not always pick up the motion and movement of the pen.

This is an 8 aH battery for an item that normally takes 9aH.  The 8 aH will work, but the up-time in case of power outage will not be as long, nor will the battery life be as long.  Comes with a 2-year warranty though.  There are 9aH batteries available on Amazon for a bit more $.  I'd recommend making choice according to your needs and budget.

This mono speaker puts out good sound for how small and cheep it is.  I love the rechargeable battery and multiple inputs.  The interface is a little hard to read and harder to figure out but works reliably.  The MP3 player does not allow nested folders either so I hope you like random playback, because options are limited.
LED is too bright and always on displaying Motorola logo, didn't find a way to turn it off.Cable is very stiff so can't use with GPS mounted left of the driver.It does works fine as a charger.
Batteries dead on arrival.  We suspect the units experienced extremely cold temperatures in transit, causing battery failure.We were very impressed with Amazon's no hassle return policy.
Hardware is cheap and the entire unit is cumbersome. No room on smaller bikes and I have a wide glide.

I have used previous products. Four of them all surived less than the announced hours - 60 hours. In average I will say about 30 hours of life time. There is no much choice from Amazon. You have to buy more in case they stop working any time. Wish my new ones will last at least 50 hours. I am searching for sprial flurorescent set to save bucks.
My nexus 7 fits well however it does not work for all the site and such that I go on with it
The chromebook was perfectly fine fast and easy to use, the only thing I dont like was the screen resolution..pixels are to big, is not good

the Bamboo stylus is great for surfing and clicking around, but not for writing or drawing.  I also have the Adonit Jot Pro, which is much better for writing, and that's what I use to take notes on my iPad.
Love the products that I received in this camera accessory packet. everything came on time and the filters work great for the price I paid for them
I suspect as many others have said that the length was significantly shorter than stated.  I ran out.  Again, though, I didn't actually measure.

I like the comfort and especially the backlit keys.  But these keys are not standard size; much too small for me to do the "touch typing" I learned how to do in high school and have used since for fast typing.  Since that is what I need it for, I have to return it, hoping I can get a similar keyboard with standard size keys.

Worked for a couple of months, but was cheap and that was expected. The cable was made of a thick material and felt sturdy but that did not stop the connect coming loose and eventually the cord would mess up if jiggled enough. This is the case for almost any audio based cable on earphones, headphones, auxillary cables, etc...Sincerely, iSklcndykid
Out-of-the-box, this unit only gave my 75% capacity. (~4200 mAh instead of ~5600) But it's held that pretty well for almost a year. For the price, it's hard to beat that.

but, it doesn't have mounting brackets on the back and that is a bit disappointing. Everything else about this monitor is superb, though!Buying another, as I don't like to mismatch things. I noticed that the 22" is about $10 more than the 23".

It's fun to play with but unless you are really into photographic, probably you will not use these products that much.The remote died right out of box otherwise I'll give it a 4 star.I used on my T4i and tested with all the filters included. Filters are alright, not great, but OK to see the difference.

Budget board, with budget specs.  Its hard to find, but this board only runs it s PCI-E x16 (the graphics slot) at 1.0 speed.  This kills performance of newer graphics cards.  I really wish this were more documented both on Amazon, and on Asus's site.

it works well, crisp images on my monitor, no flickering, no interference. It is just that the cable looks thin but at the same time not flexible enough that I am afraid that, if I fold it too strong in a U-shape instead of natural spirals without cable tension, then it may break.But it works well and got it quickly and at a very competitive price, so no worries so far!

I thought this screen protector was going to be more sturdy, but it was a bit flimsy and I could not for the life of me get out all the bubbles.  It looks like a stiff thicker screen protector that would be easy to install and not easily bubble, but that is not the case.  Someone with more patience than I could probably like it better.

The card works great in the camera, but I have to use a USB cable to get the pictures into the laptop.  The card is not recognized in my laptop which is more annoying than anything.  Other cards work in my laptop, which are not SanDisk.  Formatting the card per instructions make no difference.

Works great and fully equipped while quality lasts. I loved it but the screen ended up going blue. Eventually found that it was an internal defect from manufacturer but was only out $15 so no big deal just get a different one^^

I was looking for some computer speakers to use temporarily and I took a chance on these.  I wouldn't rate them as highly as the other reviewers.  Playing one video I heard a high pitch squeal sound, so I plugged in a different set of speakers and no longer heard that sound, so I'm returning them.  Maybe I just got a defective set of speakers.
This eyecup piece is may be good for dslr with fix screen, not flip screen, because it will get in the way of the screen when try to open or close it.

This wil not fit flush with an element vapor black ops case. I had to sand a little bit of the top down to get the connector to charge with my case on my iPhone4.If the adapter would stay on, the product would work as described.Shipping USPS was a day late. A bit pricey just for an adapter.

This sleeve is okay.  I prefer the Nixon (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00C10T2EC/) because it has the same slim form-factor plus a zipped pocket, which is good for holding the stylus and Bluetooth Wireless Adapter for the Type Cover (for example).

This is ok, but it will loosen up a lot. Just doesn't lock very well, regardless how hard to try to tighten it up. Might work good for others, but not for me. Maybe another brand might work, but wouldn't recommend this on.
The cord does what it supposed to do, ettl works great, but it is not 10 ft. Long (3 meters). Hopefully I can find another.

My phone doesn't quite fit, and I wasn't quite as careful with it as I should have.I have a Droid Bionic with extended battery, which is a bit larger than the iPhones. So the grip... almost works.The base works quite well, but here's a caveat... Don't drop the base when it's in the open position. Else your base will split apart and it's all over.
a week later it still works... i think it should last a while.Of course you cant hang yourself on the wire but it does hold the cap.I expect it to last 3-6 months at least

Bought it for the price which was a bad idea.  It has a plastic lens mount, which I hate!  The quality of the photo's is pretty good.  I don't use it often in my wedding photography but it serves it's purpose for letting me zoom in close when I need to.
i use it often i have seem to be blog down with extra garage that is not needed so i have try to get ride of them other than that a good computer
Like the speed it gives when your uploading you Videos or Pics to your Computer all you needs is to get a fast Card Reader and you will be good.

If you have used any Logitech Harmony remotes, this is the remote to replace those. It has the SAME functionality as they do and a LOT more. Only one problem (I have 2 of them), the small select button keeps falling off the one, and when you put it back on, it stops working. Other than that, it is a GREAT remote.
I had a hard time configuring it to my network, once I did it It worked fine, but I think it needs work
It works but the sleeve is short of the drive connector and the tiny wires bend wildly and I fear they won't last long.
If you are looking for a super nice MP3 player this is not it. This would be perfect for a teen!

I bought this ($0.99 + $5.00 shippping DOH!) to connect my laptop to my TV.  It worked perfectly  and rendered an image onscreen that was as intended.Then my laptop broke which had nothing to do with the cable.  Now I have a cable.
Disappointed in the finish quality. Black spray paint looks like it was painted with can, not professionally painted. Not near the quality of an old one I have.

I have a Asus EEE 1005HAB. I wanted a snug fit and this is too big. It is made well, and looks nice. If you want a loose fit in order to put other things in such as the power cord, this should do it. Belkin makes a couple of sleeves that fit like a glove.

The headphones provide good sound clarity for the price. Great set of beater headphones...if they had better cables. The microphonics (noise from cables transmitted to your ears) is very loud and happens when you move even a little. Generally unusable because of this.
The earpiece squishes to fit your ear like ear plugs do. They are ok but not super comfortable or secure.  Not bad, not great. The sound is pretty good.  For the price they work.
Ok backup battery

Just FYI for fellow readers, the SACD/DVD-A multichannel audio is provided through its analog outputs - it will only do stereo through its digital outputs.  Therefore it does do multichannel audio, just not through the digital outputs.
Drivers are kinda finicky

I bought 2 of them last year & working absolutely fine, just need to take additional care while moving from one place to another that it shouldn't bend much or else it will break just like a cookie.Note: What I observed is that cooling performance mostly depends on room temperature. This product just enhances the airflow from laptop base to your tabletop-base.
Bought this as a Christmas gift for my dad. He had an old ball mouse. So far it works fine. Mine at home is starting to act up, so if it continues to work, I will be purchasing another one of these.
Easy to use as long as you don't mind dealing with I-tunes to store your music.  Probably best suited for people with small fingers.  My wife is happy with it and that's all that counts!
The unit itself works well, however connection issues are consistent when using mobile devices. Poor or non-existent support for mobile devices. Complicated setup as well.

The sticky part on it doesn't hold well... usually lets go after about 5 minutes. The sound quality really depends on what you connect it to. Overall I can't say I would buy one of these again unless there were some major improvements.
I was hoping this trigger would work to fire an old Starblitz 3800 flash gun, but alas, it did not work.  Looks like I will have to spend money on a new flash.  :(
I think its a bit pricey for what it is... but it does come with a soft case that will fit the EN-EL4a with the cap attached... so whatever that's worth.

This unit was my 5th Garmin product after being introduced to GPS with the Lowrance years a go. I have not used it for a trip yet but will be doing so next month. Right off I did not like the display as well as I do my 1357LMT.  It does not have the contrast nor crispness. I hope my opinion changes as I learn more about using this one.

So my LGE739's internal GPS took a crap, and i was ready to get a new phone. Spending a few hundred is a lot harder than letting go of $25 for this thing, and after 30 mins or so of messing with it, I got it working. Cool beans.
Purchased this power supply for my Dell D410. For the price I was not expecting much. However, after 2 years of infrequent use, the power supply is still operable.
It is a good case, but I'm missing both side pockets. The front zipper pocket coud be deeper. I like to carry the USB cable with the camera, extra batteries, lining for cleaning and some filters.

I had been having problems with not all the characters typing when I typed them. I assumed there was a problem with the keyboard so I  ordered this desktop. I had the same problems with this keyboard. To make a long story short; there was actually a problem with the computer. Once that was fixed, no problems.

I got this TV to use it in my home office next to my PC but the was a problem, I was having a sound delay between the signal I was getting from the cable and antenna (Yes I did try both)...The remote control is great and the TV show great quality but the sound problem forced me to return it and then I got the one below!https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0028QDO0M?tag=thel003-20&camp;=213381&creative;=390973&linkCode;=as4&creativeASIN;=B0028QDO0M&adid;=165219ZYFBM9AMX7FMQ6&I hope everything is better now.

It's great that Logitech put up a database online.  Everything I needed was right there, but I think you should be able to download what you need and then work from your computer instead of a logitech server.  I have to kill my router firewall every time I reconfigure.  The remote does generally work perfectly.  Its definitely nicer than the IR PDA program I was using before.
Unfortunately, the item fails to transmit continuous clear FM signal.  If you want a clear continuous signal as an audiophile, you'll need to spend more than this for it.
A bit hard to attach, but works OK. Was very good value for money.I'd choose a clip version next time.
Not truly the best idea functional not 100 % versatile. Center rib has to go all the way through the center so if you need the case with a wide pocket at one end your screwed

I was anticipating another wonderful product from GreatShield but somehow the USPS could not find my house to deliver this so I reordered from another source that I probably will be pleased enough with because there was no second attempt at delivery so why waste more time.

It does the work as described , but definitely has issues . I used with 2 different softwares : Homeseer and mControl . It constantly crashed the software when tried to learn IR codes. I could learn only 1 at a time and then had to reset my s/w.

Terrific price on a replacement hood.  Fits the lens like a glove.  However, when attaching to the lens with a UV filter it was difficult to align the hood in the reverse mode.  In other words, when in use it fit fine but reversing it on the lens, with the UV filter, made it difficult to align and click into place.  Still a good value.

Honestly I have purchased different cords from different places most were okay one or two stopped working for me so I cannot rate this one in particular because I don't know which one it is.  If it is an Apple cord it was probably fine. Some of the third party cords give a message on the phone that it may not work, but usually does anyway.

It did 95% of the work but I would expect a tool like this to do the job 100% and not leave me having to clean up the edges before I can use the card.The two adapters that come with the card were of no use putting the SIM back into a Nokia handset. I wound up using the remnant of the original SIM to put the card back into a full size SIM slot.
It's nice. but totally uncomfortable.And look weird when I wear it.sound is ok. but I don't believe its real price is that expensive.haha. Just this 100$ enough. Thank you for good deal.
Only .5 amp means it works for small devices, even an iPhone 4S takes a long time to charge.  Works fine for everything else though and the swivel is handy.
it works good and do what they say. my item make noise when I move it, so I open it and found a lose pieze of metal inside, I took away and everything is good.

The case fits the iPod Touch 4th gen and does a good job at protecting it from the occasional drops, but the screen protector scratches easily and sometimes causes interference with the touchscreen.Occasionally, the WiFi would cut out and I would have to take of the case to re-establish the connection.Bottom line: you get what you pay for.

Every time I plug it into any of my family's four PCs, Windows wants to run a scan disk on it for possible corrupted sectors.  The first couple times I did & upon completion it reported no errors.  Ever since I've just ignored the request & it seems to work okay.  Its fairly compact although the metal body does scratch plastic objects in my pocket.  Nice there's no cap to lose.

Works really well, Keeps my 4760k at 38C most of the time. My only complaint is that it does not fit easily in an Asus Z87 deluxe/quad mobo. I has to squeeze the clips past the chipset heat sinks and that made me feel uncomfortable with a new mobo. Recommend a smaller fan if you have this same mobo.

I would not recommend a Netgear router or receiver. I have had 3 Netgear routers and two receivers (all different models) and I have had many problems with the software. When calibrated for the best results, I seem to disconnect from WiFi about twice a month. Had  some problems making an older computer work with this receiver.Verdict: I wouldn't recommend Netgear's WNDA3100v2 but I don't have enough experience with other companies to recommend them.

I don't know if it's specific to the product I got, but the lens is quite shaky and loose. Especially with the auto focus function, the oscillation is tangible. The quality of the picture, however, seems to be quite good. In short, the quality of the lens seems to be quite good despite its substandard build.
Purchased to use with my iPad.. it's already, I'm not flipped over it. I've only used it a few times. You're better off just using a pillow truthfully.
This light works well but the clamp could have been designed much better to fit on the top of a kindle.

I tried using it on my Macbook Air. The tracking speed, even when set to maximum just isn't the as sensitive as my Evoluent mouse. Using this 8 hours a day, this will cause a problem as the idea it to limit the amount of space that I need to move the mouse left and right. However, the size is right and the price was even better, for ~$20 this is steal.
This barely fits my Surface with the real keyboard. It's nicely cushioned, but is kind of hard to get your device in and out of. The Zippers are really cheap as well.
This replaced a more sophisticated keyboard that failed.  I miss features like speaker control and keys for e mail and internet.

I like this car charger. It works for what it is supposed to do however it has this annoying, super bright blue LED. The LED is so bright that I took electrical tape and covered it up and you can still see it seeping from the sides. At night, the light was so distracting that I would have to unplug it.

Ordered this based on another Blackberry Pearl Owner's positive comments.  Did not work in my Pearl.  Spoke to a Blackberry rep who said the maximum media card capacity for the Pearl is a 2 GB.  Don't make the same mistake I did by listening to the Pearl owners who said the 4 GB works because it doesn't!  It did, however, work for my friend's Curve!
It basically just gets the job done. It's not exceptional, but it's worth 20 bucks. Wouldn't buy it again, but I'm still using it 5 months after purchase.
Received 3 but only two worked.  But we really only needed two.  The price was great and the delivery was long but ok.  Not a greatly needed item.

Do not expect this little thing to be as stable as a proper tripod. It is not.For indoor recording, with minimum wind, it should work fine.The tripod is short and flimsy and definitely not good for rough surfaces or even the tarmac.the handheld pod was ok. But cannot support very heavy camera as it will rotate about it's own axis.I would use the handheld pod on a more stable tripod or a gorilla tripod. Will be a better combination.
I don't use this memory card reader often but when I do, everything works fine. It is really simple and easy to use and I haven't had any problems.

Its fits fine, and looks nice. Great for price.The problem I am having with this case is that I can't use this in the standing position with the USB charger or HDMI cable connected, which is very irritating and disappointing experience. I wish something could be done in that area, or an alternative product offering.
I bought this one along with some other HDMI cables. Working fine so far. Not sure whether it is delivering all the data speed to the other end or not. Overall with the price the item is good pick.

Very nice looking case.  Very light.  However, my iPad doesn't properly fit in this case.  I can't get the corners of the case to stay in place.  Not good at all.  Buyers, beware!!!!!(Update - 3/22/2013)After writing my first review, the Supplier contacted me and sent me a replacement at no additional charge.  The second case is a little better, but its still tough to snap on around the edges).

Maybe it's my imagination, but keyboards seem to have gotten smaller in recent years. I bought this thinking it was larger than my old one, but alas, it isn't. This keyboard is somewhat difficult if you have large hands.Another thing: why does EVERYTHING have to be #!@&*ing black?
wire is too thin and easy to break.

Purchased as a stand by for a Baofeng UV-5R+ HT, I cant seem to attach it to the radio with out forcing it more than I want to.  I will take a little more time when I can to see if I can get it to fit.
Worked fine, and very easy to setup. But the site may down once awhile.It will be nice it can do recording, not just live monitoring.
I gave this as a gift to my cousin and it works ok.  It is very light weight and does not seem to be very strong but she has not had an issue with it yet.

turned it inside out and liked it better!  My son bought this at the same time as the plastic case in robin egg blue ... this is more of a seafoam ... and kind of girly ... but we turned it inside out - so it's black with light colored trim and it seems to work for him ...

This case had a tight fit and easily scratched. I would recommend the "IPod Classic Leather Premium Napa Leather case - (80GB / 120GB / 160GB (new model 2009))["http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000Y5Y88G/ref=oh_o01_s00_i00_details] instead. With this item, the exposed buttons left me feeling like the iPod would turn on when carrying it around.

Speaker sound quality good. Terrible plastic buttons on top...they sometimes don't register or get stuck in the casing.cannot press the multi-function button to initiate voice recognition (like siri) on the connected phone. I thought the unit is quite bulky.for some strange reason, Creative does not mention the speaker power output (in watt) - which is a basic spec for any speaker. neither is it mentioned on the website nor on the actual box.but the speaker sound itself is good.
I ordered this to go with a Mini MK802IIIS Android device and it works well. Its just really slow and a little of a pain to use.

Besides my Sony camera and two lenses that I've owned for a couple of years, I was at a yard sale and bought 4 more lenses. I purchase the sling bag to carry all the stuff when I go hiking. The first hike I found that the one and only strap cut across my shoulder and put my arm to sleep. I think Case makes great bags, this type is not for me.

I bought this for my girlfriend, and she loved it while it lasted. After a few weeks of using it, the disc attached to the tip got loose and writing with it became nearly impossible. The newer models address this issue, I believe, so I recommend buying the newer models.
...they are darker then expected; this makes seeing anything very difficult.  If they were lighter (allowing more light through the lenses) I would give them a higher rating.

Great for the price, and offers better focus options than just using the LCD liveview.  It's is however, very hard to clean.  I don't know why they put felt material inside the thing.  Maybe to prevent reflections, but it collects dust like crazy, and it's really hard for me to clean it.

The idea for this product was well intended, however it's just not suitable for me. For example, I have become so use to typing with my Mac book, and once I put the silicone cover skin on the keyboard it made it difficult for me.
For the price. I guess it's a budget cooling pad. The RPM isn't great, but it can keep your laptop a decent amount cooler.
it auto switches to what ever new connection it sees, even if you really dont want that to happen.remote is weak and stopped working after two weeks.

The only reason I haven't returned this is because it DOES work as advertised, and I can't expect to get a good signal from where it's at right now with it's micro housing/antennae. It does provide internet... wirelessly, but I feel like I'm back to 1999 with my speeds. And make sure to use the included CD to install it.

It fits my samsung. But it has extra cut outs in someplaces and Not the right holes for others.Memeory card slot is covered and so is the IR.The picture is misleading (it shows the correct model).Other than that.Seller is Great. Fast service!for the price it is good enough.3 STARS = It's ok2 STARS = I don't like itI would say 2.5 STARS = it is cheap and I didn't spend much.

This card is geart for camera usage and other devices. Very good value for money. I was not sure with capacity of card but found it to be sufficient. I would recommed 2 cards of 4GB each rather then one card of 8GB.

The case looks very nice but the tablet doesn't stay in place very well. It tends to slide out a little which is a little annoying. It never fully slides out of the case but just enough to cover up part of the screen.
This works, but isn't top quality.  It's cheap, and will get you by in a pinch.  Definitely worth a buy if you can get it cheap enough.
I am not overly happy with the purchase.  The fan worked for about a year or so, but the cord that goes into it stopped working on both of them.
The Batttery is probably OK. The Description leaves something to be desired. Can'y say more because I did not use the battery.

Feels very cheap. The USB connector sounded great but it will not lock in place to insert. You have to grip the device very hard to insert and it cant be turned on while trying to connect to the computer because of button mashing in order to connect it. No problems with recording so far. It is easy to use. And the recording quality is good. So far so good.
It is really clunky and bulky. I never really like how it folded up either. In mu opinion, the Moko is much better choice of case.

I've been using this in my camera and haven't had any problems as far as picture-taking speed, even with burst mode.  When uploading to my PC, there have been a couple of videos that were corrupted.  The price for this card is too high; the Amazon Basics 16gb class 10 card is cheaper and more reliable.

It's fairly low quality and the plastic is a little flimsy but you get what you pay for.  It's nice that it comes with a pocket to replace the display of the factory stereo but that's the lowest quality part.  If you're looking for the cheapest possible solution to allow you to install a new stereo this is it.  If you want something that's high quality look elsewhere.
I bought this for a friend of mine.  She says she likes it, but there is no place to put the stylus, which means it will get lost soon.  Sounds like a design flaw...

I needed this item to enable Eyefinity on my 6850 card to power 4 screens. After a lot of tinkering I found out the reason why I was unable to get 4 screens to work was because the two DP adapters must be of the "ACTIVE" type not the passive.There is nothing wrong with this product, however the item description could be better as it should include whether it is active or passive.
Computer was nice. It had a pretty good amount of speed for the price I paid. The DVI port did not work at all upon arrival but that was OK since I am just using VGA on it.
For what it does it's fine, but it wont transfer all programs and files, just selected ones, and not those you get to select your self.
Got it on amazon for a decent price.  I didn't realize it was a Vivatar strap.  Heck, I didn't even know vivatar made a strap.  Works so I am happy.

This cable is exactly what I wanted, shipped fast, and works.  HOWEVER, the black piece on the lightning adapter doesn't fit into my lifeproof case.  This is NOT convenient!  I certainly don't want to pop my lifeproof off every time I need a charge.  Not sure if it fits with an Otterbox.  I guess I'll keep it as a backup.
This product provides some noise reduction, but it isn't dramatic. It mostly cancels white noise, so it helps on airplanes. The built-in volume control is also useful.
This fader nd filter works; however, when you approach the darker stops, the filter leaves a purple color cast on the pictures. This makes it extremely difficult to remove or adjust.
Not my first WD drive. I've had generally good luck with their bare drives. This one had some noticeable vibration when new, but somehow that settled out withing a few hours.
I chipped part of the plug while removing from the camera. I can still use it , but wish the material was stronger.

I like this mount, but I don't love it.  For the way I drive, the mount needs to be 12" taller. I cannot see it very well when driving. I might end up just going back to my window mount for this reason.

Well made, looks great and operates great, BUT...This unit cannot be locked, which is an issue if the SSD is holding your OS.So, nice drive tray, but probably not a good idea for a drive holding your OS.BTW - KingWin does make a locking version

We have been having issues with our computer and haven't wuite figured out what it causing it yet.  From reading other reviews I am nervous that it may be caused by this.  I will update my review when I have a definite answer.
I am starting to see wear at the brick going to the smaller cord. this is due to it being bent all the time and the rubber is starting to stretch. hopefully it does not tear.

Good sound from a very small package. Nice to be able to fill up a memory card full of songs that will go for weeks. The bad - battery was dead out of the box. Would not charge at all. Cell all the way dead. I had to use an old battery out of my very old Nokia cell phone. Worked fine with that. The controls are hard to get used to. Manual just barely helps at all.

I mistakenly bought a camera that uses a micro SD card.  Big mistake.  No computer will take the card.  This card adapts the micro card for use in a computer that takers standard SD cards. Three stars as it's overpriced for what you get. A piece of plactic with a few copper stripes.

Bought this after buying a similar product that arrived broken. This does an excellent job of protecting my skin from the sun-mimicing heat produced by my grizzled war vet of a macbook. However, it doesn't actually cool my laptop off, being that there is a solid barier between the laptop and the fans. It's not terrible, but I wouldn't buy it again.

Cover works well as a protector for the tablet. The stand as shown in the picture is a joke. No way you bend shape or deform the case cover will it stay in place to support the device. I would really like it if the stand worked.
I just didn't have a setup that warrented this safety feature. Looks VERY nice though. Would recommend to a friend.

fits perfect! color is nice, bright and vivid, but the keyboard cover doesn't match, so I had to buy it separately. Other reviewers got theirs that match the keyboard but mine doesn't - just disappointing as it is not consistent

I ordered this to use with my Kindle, but after a long period of not using it it stopped working.  Naturally, I thought that the battery was dead so I replaced them and it still wasn't working.  I then assumed that I had the batteries in upside down, but no help.  I would not buy this again.

Bought unit in October 2008, failed after the 1 year warranty expired, USB interface on the circuit card failed, also switch failed. Costs more to fix than replace. Looks great, but might not last long for you.
Now there is a big difference in the Apple product and the imitation. This works as it should, like the saying "you get what you pay for". Oh well...

It fits the Garmin, power cord and mount, if you leave half the mount hanging outside the zipper.  The case could use some sort of handle or strap to carry it to and from the car when my hands are full. In the end, it is functional but a little unwieldly. .

bought this for my son, thought of returning it because it got stuck the 1st 30 minutes after use. i figured out that there was a reset button on the back. once you pull the model sticker off the screen there is another thick clear sticker you have to pull off in order to use the touch screen... and you must double tap an icon in order to use it.

It's ok, but you do get what you pay for.  It's not as good as the Incase shells.  This one is slippery and the rubber "feet" that come off way too easily.It's not a horrible product, but I'd rather pay a little more money for a better quality shell.

I owned this speaker for about half years. It is adequate, loud enough. Good for listening to music while studying. It can produce loud sound. However, loud sound does not mean great sound. The bass is lacking. I used Windows speaker property's Bass Eq and set it to +9db to enhance the bass. You can only do so much for such a tiny speaker.

The speaker sound quality is not very good--sounds tinny.  It functions great.  I use one as a white noise machine, so it works great for that.  I also use one to play a playlist at a retail store over an amplifier, where it works great (speakers are not an issue with the amplifier).  So--the player is great; the speakers are poor.

I think the "HD" in the name is meant to imply a level of quality.  I can't say I'm impressed with the image from this camera.  Still, the camera works fine and as long as you're not expecting a clear picture it's just fine.

The camera itself is nice. A ton of features packed into a small camera. More options than you will ever use or need.My issue is with the image quality. It is average at best. Artifacts at ISO 100, high iso is basically not even usable.If you are looking for a camera with all of the bells and whistles, this is it.If you are looking for a camera with great image quality, this is not it.

opened it up and did not have all the screws to attach it together came with the 3 for base but did not have the 4 to attach it! so can not use presently:-( live in middle of nowhere so have to wait to get to town to get some.update amazon as always fixed it....thanks amazondane
Could not install without bubbles and wrinkles. Not their fault I guess. Takes a steady hand, which at my age is iffy.
This drive is working well and seems to be fast, however, it is a little noisy - more than I expected.  It also runs a little warm, I'm hoping it has the lifespan I need.  So far, so good though.

It works as advertised and is like pictured.  I only gave it 3 stars because sometimes I have to "adjust" the controller a bit to get it to connect.  Other than that, works great and comes with the rechargeable batteries and new battery covers.
It's okay. I would not purchase another. It has only one position it can be set in. It is made well, but it needed more positions.

PROs:1. It works.2. Good wireless range.  I have no problem using it from 20 ft away.Cons:1. Cheap plastic feel.  Keys feels cheap and track ball isn't smooth.2. Amazon shipped me something that looks like returned item.  The box was beat up and has been opened previously.

I wonder if Backdrop Outlet actually measures their backdrops. The size info is misleading. I've just measured this backdrop and the sizes are as follows: Left vertical: 72.5"  Right vertical: 73.5"  Top horizontal: 57" Bottom horizontal: 57.5". It's still usable and the color is good, but because of this quality issue and misleading info on the size, I can't give it a 5 -star rating.

Item was listed as a "KIT" but in reality it was a "ST1000LM014" drive only'  tHE KIT CONSISTED OF A RETAIL BOXED DRIVE AND A WARRANTY SHEET.  also IT HAD A DIFFERENT PRICE. Neither drive had the small hard drive to motherboard connecting cable.  I think I finally found one made/marketed by  LAPTOPSCREWDIRECT
It's ok... Sound quality is only slightly better than my onboard audio.  Doesn't seem that powerful, can't drive that much volume for my sennheiser over the ear headphones.
The material is not soft rubber as I expected. It wa made of a kind of plastic, but tt is OK for the price.

Not my favorite headset I have ever tried.  Have had less expensive headsets that were more comfortable, & even sounded better.That being said, they are far from awful.  They arrived early, intact, and were exactly as pictured.  I felt I received the best service possible.  Try them for yourself, & decide for yourself.  All opinions are subjective after all.

Wonderful idea and seems like a great product... I got a great deal of use out of mine for a little over a year and then it simply wouldn't charge any longer and now it's a brick. Replaced the battery and it still doesn't charge. Now it's an expensive paper weight.

when i opened the box i was surprised . I thought it is not my package because it is too big .but it is efficient with great zoom .sometimes there is difficulties in image stabilization but still amazing regarding it's pricedo more , spend lessthanks

I compared this with the Logitech Quickcam 4000 Pro.Both are:- Easy to install, plug and play, no issues- Have great software, solid, etc.- Robust, reliable.However:- This one is less expensive- The 4000 pro has CONSIDERABLY better image quality.  I found this one to be very grainy and borderline unacceptable.If price is the primary concern, this one isn't a disaster and it didn't have quality problems.However, if you can afford the added cost, you'll be happier with the pro.

At first it seemed to work fine, but after a few days the video would go in and out, having to adjust between 720p and 1080p. After unhooking it a month later to clean my room and reconnecting it, it failed to work again.
Gran diseño...me gusta. No es lo que esperaba como para reemplazar el sonido de mi tv.Great design ... I like it. Not what I expected to replace the sound of my tv.

I bought this to use with my Favi Smart Stick.  I had lots of issues with the Smart Stick and sent everything back to Amazon for a refund.  It works good once charged fully.  It is a bit difficult to work with if device isn't close by.

Item was well packaged, screen looks good, but there are some wrinkles in the screen that havent gone away. the rolling mechanism doesnt seem to be that solid either. I wouldnt recommend rolling it up and down too much. overall for the price, it is a screen. If not for the wrinkles I would give it 5 stars.
This stylus works but there is nothing special about it. I would have liked it to be a little heavier but in a way i guess that could be a bad thing.

The machine itself is great.  But with a connectivity issue I have had with this, I contacted customer service, technical support.  To date, they have not been able to successfully offer me a useful solution.

Everything is fine till you get to the functions of the keyboard. I didn't expect it to be the best keyboard on the market but there were problems using it. And there were pairing issues from time to time. But once you got it working it was a great setup.As for the seller....Offered a price I couldn't refuse and was shipped and sent to my door in what I would consider record time!So thank you for that!!

The headsets work with my Alpine aftermarket DVD player, but they feel cheap, the battery cover doesn't come off or go back on easily.  I'm glad they were relatively inexpensive, because I don't think that they will last too long with kids using them.

The whole think looks great beautiful clear picture great field of vision.Now for the cons. Uses batteries and is always dead after a few days weather you use it or not. To change the batteries you have to find a little cross head screw driver to remove the cover Oh did I mention the screws are not easy to get to once the unit is installed.I don't think this was a good purchase

Build quality could use some improvement. I had this for around nine months before it just stopped charging. No lights, no indication of anything that went wrong and there's no screws so the unit definitely isn't user serviceable. Sound quality was pretty good, noise canceling was so-so, price compared to other Bluetooth headphones was pretty good so overall 3-stars.
I got it From Amazon,The Sound is Good, But isn`t that confortable.Other than that,sounds good.

This rack fit my needs nicely.  The only complaint is that the package arrived with no hardware to assemble to rack.  The product description says all the hardware is included (even the rack screws for installing hardware).  However, none of it was included.  I wanted to finish my project so I went to Home Depot and purchased all the hardware I needed.

Ships without a memory card. This is not acceptable.I had ordered one, via Amazon, from another vendor,but it did not show up in time. So, we have a very hightech brick, incapable of taking pictures on Christmas.The small cost of including even a minimal memory cardwould vastly outweigh the inconvenience.

Gives a decent punch but nowhere NEAR 2300 watts of performance. I didn't really expect that because of the price, but realistic advertising would be nice. Died after a couple years of use and needed some of the caps replaced.

For the price we're talking about here this adapter is acceptable. This is the second one is purchased and they are only subpar. They don't automatically connect to my router and I continually unplug it and replug it.

I used this product to clone my laptop hdd to a new Samsung SSD 840 pro, and it worked as advertised, Im giving it 3 stars because the Samsung cloning software could not detect the drive if connected to a USB 3 port, I had to used the slow USB 2 instead. I don't know if it Samsung's fault or Apricorn's.

The mic fits my HDSLR and works well. Fidelity is good. There is about a 4DB difference in the volumes of the two stereo capsules. So I need to bias the balance control in my edits slightly to the right to neutralize the effect. I would be curious to hear from others about how well their SG-108s are centered.

This cover is sturdy and has a good feel to it.  The light works OK - doesn't always provide the best lighting for the whole page.  All in all, I think it's too pricey for what it provides.  Might do better with a non-light cover and a little snap on light!

Very high quality bag but it was purchased for a DSLR.  The camera and a normal lens leaves little to no room for much else.  It would be great for a point and shoot camera.  As far as delivery, it was quick and painless.

I read alot of reviews that said it was difficult to set up, I did not have that problem, it was really plug and play. I can't make the two way audio work and that is SUPER frustrating. Still trying. Nice clear picture though. Does not like Internet Explorer

at the beginningits awesome, kept my laptop super cool, bit ot only tales a couple opf months of use and it starts to wear out and the fans start to make this noise that ends bothering u. or at least it did w me. i still have it but i dont really use it anymore. i would rather pay for the replacement of the laptop fan.
Ah it's a bit cheap and a nightmare to put together.  You would think that they could at least put some instructions in there.

Purchased to repace Kingston station that had become unreliable.  This device uses the same drivers and core technology so it was not an improvement.  Call to cutomer support was answered promptly but bottom line is the specifications are "best case scnario". Expect to down grade your screen resolution to get this to work with an external monitor.

I had Moko folio cover for my other Galaxy tabs.  they are wonderfulBut this one is not as good as I expected.it covers the tablet but the workman ship is not good.  the open hole for the camera is not in the center.it protects the tab but it does not cover the tab evenly.
does the job, but seller did not inform me of case and screen scratches, some of which were very deep, will be sending into nintendo for repair when i can

Installation was fairly easy.  Took less time for the solution to dry than reported in the book, but I let it set anyway.  I bought it to protect the screen of the Nexus 7 I gave my 4 year old.  The only issues i have with it is that it is so thick to protect the screen, the fingernail impressions show up really easy.

These ear buds produce pretty good sound. However I find them very delicate and don't expect them to last very long...that's why I'm giving them a rating of only 3. On the basis of quality and durability, I would not recommend the ear buds...but on sound quality I would recommend them.

It's true that you have to reposition it a lot. It's most likely going to break on me one of the times I go to reposition it or take it off due to the cheap brittle plastic. It's worth $3.99.The games did sense my touch, so it works when it works.

Everything about this MS Zune looks good except one thing: Sound System. It has no EQ. It sounds dull n plain. My Klipsch S4 earbuds sound awesome even with a cheap $20 MP3 player, but could not help to improve it with this Zune. Don't waste money on this Zune. I think they did put back EQ on newer model. NOT RECOMMENDED!....
A little bulky with GoPro Hero 3 attached (espessialy with under water case), but it does the gob.Underwater usage can cause rust.
Cannot really fit my Nikon d800.  It is also very heavy for the size it is. Would stick to synthetic fibers in the future.
