A bit hard to attach to the speedlight, but it works. I'd strongly recommend having a Lumiquest Ultra Strap on your light if you're going to try to use this.

Great at cooling my system but makes some gurgling noises - might be because I have the radiator mounted at the bottom of my Silverstone FT03B-Mini and the CPU block at the top.I wish there was speed control for the pump to cut down on the noise.

PROS: Very very comfortable, even for my big head. Sound quality is great. Cord is long and braided, very nice.CONS: Mic is weak. Playing TF2 and L4D, people sometimes tell me I'm not loud enough. This never happened with my previous headsets. Because of this I am thinking about buying a different one sometime in the near future.

As many have said, noisy artifacts of sound.  My 900 Mhz portable phone sounds better.Many have said these are comfortable, but beware!  They are NOT adjustable, so if you don't have the same size head as the other reviewers, you may find loose fitting headphones annoying
Plugged in, fits well.  Not the battery life I had expected from Apple label batteries.  Not sure what the USB cable is for.But it works and the price is good.

After seeing the other reviews on here, I expected that this would be comparable to an Apple keyboard in quality. However, I was sadly disappointed. This is a very plasticky keyboard, and it does not have anywhere near as good of a feel as an actual Apple keyboard. I'm not really sure I'm happy with it.
These earphones have way too much bass.  The high notes get drowned out in the excess bass. They seem durable and have a nice zipper case but the sound is just not optimum.
The antenna does not seem to work any better than the cheapo antenna that comes with the network card.  It is very long and can interfere with other connections from behind your computer.

my segate 3tb backup is way faster that this ... very disappointed! I needed it for travel with macbook pro and it works ... i wish I had real number data but I can tell you mine DOES NOT PREFORM AT USB 3.0 LEVELSI hate that because I have always liked WD better than Segate

I like the slingbox idea but the legal restrictions of HDMI may end up making this device a dead end.  And the app is WAY overpriced.  15 bucks and it was incredibly buggy for months.  Glad to see it eventually was fixed.  No Chromebook support which was a bit disappointing

Once the Hard Drive arrived i tested the drive on one of my devices and it was not reading. I thought it was my hdd device so i did a test run on my PC and same thing happened. It was DOA. I did the return process and amazon was great!! I got my refund back.

While there is faster memory available I purchase this memory for the tablets I plan to give to a niece and nephew. As the title reads it's memory and it works so why does Amazon even asked a person for this to be rated?

This stylus is an average stylus for use on ipad for jotting notes. the tip is rather big, doesnot give the feel of a fine point pen. Downloaded a few apps for writing notes on ipad, so bought this stylus. The reviews seemed good for this product. Used the stylus couple of times.The performance may get better after using/practicing writing with it for a while. But for $15, it's a good buy.

I LIVE under their regular ones. Hours and hours a day.... THOSE are comfortable -- these? Not so much!  They are much stiffer, and so can't be bent or formed to be comfortable. I liked the color -- but not enough to buy again -- ti's back to the plain-old white ones...
Used this on a Palm device. Both are now beyond obsolete, but Sandisk is still my favorite brand of portable storage card.
you can listen to music from ur iphone except for iPhone 5 and higher. can't control music and not a charger . so a not a very exciting product but works out for my need.
Good device but really big to carry, wish it was smaller that would make it better. So over all just OK
The button itself is difficult to press down, however it does what its suppose to do for a good price. Still not sure what to do come the time the battery dies...

I gave this to my shorty at the time and she rocked with it for a year with heavy usage, she then bought another one in a different color. Best case ever. She doesn't even use the keyboard case I got her cuz this is all she needs. I have one for the N7 as well.

Purchased this item for the Superpad - do not know if the pad is defective or the keyboard.  Pad doesn't work properly, constantly freezes so it is hard to tell where the problem is.  The keyboard works intermittantly when trying to access internet sites yet so does the Superpad.  Appreciate the immediate return and refund of this product.

This product "works" well as far as fitting into place and all that jazz. But I bought it because I thought it would improve my graphics over my component cables but it doesn't. My picture looks the same. I'm not sure (and I really don't have the time nor do I care enough to do the research) if the Wii doesn't support HD graphics or what's up, but my picture looks the same with this or with component cables.

I bought these to place on my headboard so I can listen to my Ipod or smart phone at night. The sound is not as rich as i expected for the price,. but OK. These are ok - you might want to find something a little cheaper.

Great look, great sound, but the inline controls don't work with my iPod Classic 80Gb (even though the S4i says it's for the iPod) - that's why it's only 3 stars. Had to return this as I'm not paying $119 for something that I can't really use.FYI - the Comply T100 foam tips are the ones that fit this model.

Great head.  Don't listen to reviewers who say you can't get higher vertical shots.  You just twist the head around and you can go straight up. You just need to not be boxed in by having the pistol grip straight back all the time.Update: after using this for a little while I find there is not enough locking pressure.  For smaller cameras and lenses it would be okay, but my 200mm is easily moved around when fully locked.
I shipped okay and was in great shape. Item installed on iMac easily but is also easily removed. I was hoping it was secure enough to take a tumble. Wouldn't want to chance it. Looks great though.

Mine has solely been used in the sleeper compartment of a tractor trailer, on 12V, and using the built in antenna in the International Prostar I drive.I'm happy with the TV, the picture adequate, ease of use OK.  One shortcoming, the audio output is a little low.  Hard to hear at full volume if some background noise in area.Will be fine in intended use...desktop TV, nightstand, etc.

Great addition to the camera bag, but be sure and keep a spare set of batteries with you. there is no off button, and you never know when it is going to go away on you. Otherwise it worked and functioned exactly as described.
This player is nice because it is easy to use.  Don't remember much else about the features i just know it wasn't loud enough.
Still trying to justify this purchase, I do like the wrist strap but that's about it.  Cannot use the mount and i am not going to wear it around my neck.

It is ok, but dont expect too much reserve power. Charge capacity is weak. I switched from iPhone 4 to 5 shortly after so I do not utilize this unit very often. But I still believe it is worth the price.

I got it from Target back in 2009... it's not working anymore. Well, that last it 2 years.It picked up over 30 channels, displayed signal strength, auto turn-off mode, program guide, add/delete favorite... full/widesceen mode. It got hot fast but it survived 2 summers without any problem.Overall, 7/10

The keyboard was easy to install, but the space bar always sticks forcing me to constantly make corrections. If I intended to be using this particular computer for long it would be going back. I imagine this to be a rare fluke for this one keyboard, and would try another one with confidence if sticking with this pc.
Easy to use and assemble, but the map pocket distorts its shape to non-rectangular and looks chintzy.  Needs a bit more rigidity.
These are cheap w/t but did do what they were advertised to do. The quality is not very good and it would be better to buy up

This product sounds great but there is one serious flaw for me. You cannot listen to fm signals if they are also broacasting an hd station at the same frequency. There should be a switch for this function so you can still listen to the regular fm stations.
The product worked well for what it was purchased for, however I had to return it  because the device wax returned.
Had to return it because of severe artifacting when playing Far Cry 3. The game would be unplayable 20 minutes in. The card was blazing fast for those first 20 minutes of gameplay though...
These are good! The only thing bad for me is my Nikon D200 is too large to fit. So if you order for a smaller camera and you should give 5 stars
works really well just like advertised and whatnot. however, it does not charge an iphone and ipad all through the night. I fall asleep so I dont know what happens, but they just don't.

While this camera does an acceptable job, you can probably do better for the money.  The AUTO setting is very misleading.  It is really more of a manual setting.  I have been using a Milota camera for years and find it took better quality pictures with less need for adjustment.  A friend told me that he has two relatives who actually returned Nikon digital cameras after initial use.
It works as the description says but its very slow when tranfering stuff. It would normally take me 5 min to tranfer a big file normall but 15 min with it plug into this. Wouldnt buy it again.
I like the idea, but the jack is in the wrong place for my ipod video. Had to return it. Wish that the info on this was more complete.

This adapter doesn't automatically connect when I start the car, so I have to go into Settings > General > Bluetooth and select the adapter to connect - that's 4 taps just to connect Bluetooth to the device.  I prefer theBlackBerry Remote Stereo Bluetooth Gateway for BlackBerry 8100, 8110, 8120, 8130, 8300, 8310, 8320, 8330, 8800, 8820, 8830, 9000 (Black)because it automatically connects when the car starts.

I've purchased the same (size) backlights - one a wall, one a table mount - and the table mount is amazing. Lights up great. The wall mount, since it's split into two, gets you about 1/3 less light.Good. But sad that Inspired LED charge the same for less product. :(

This is a good looking case, and for the price it is well made. The only issue I have is that sometimes the auto-shutoff feature does not. I think this has to do with magnets in the case not being as strong as they need to be. Otherwise a nice case.

The talk button is located on top of the Bluetooth and as you walking it moves around because its little loose and you hear a really annoying ticking sound. I gave mine away and the person said its tolerable i couldn't stand it

Seller stated that they are Red/Black.  They are actually Gray/Black.  Not sure if this is a different model than advertised.  I ordered 3 and all of them seem to work just fine.  The seller also stated that they come with lanyards.  Without the lanyards, they are hard to remove from a computers USB port.  They did not come with lanyards even though the description listed them.  Amazon credited me the difference for the missing lanyards...

Sure, I saw my Galaxy S4 on my tv, but only 30hz, which means it is useless for gaming.  Video looked pretty cool though, and sound came through nicely on the HDMI.  Still, it was not what I was hoping for, a way to sneak HDTV Android gaming on the cheap.  As far as I can tell, getting the holy grail of 1080p60 I'm not sure is possible with any cable out there.  Correct me if I'm wrong.

I use this daily and I love it. I have both a laptop dock for my work laptop and my own personal PC hooked up. I switch between the 2 multiple times a day and this makes it so quick and easy! No more unhooking from one to connect to the other.However! There is a huge downside. This little switch will prevent some PCs from properly sleeping including mine.

A bit bigger than I thought, Good Idea in practice but design a bit clunky, Not as space saving as I envisioned. But, it does get the job done and helps me keep all my chargers together when traveling.

I bought a Force GT series SSD because I thought it would rank up there with my OCZ Vertex 4. I was sadly mistaken. While it does run circles around any hard drive, my testing shows only about 280 MB/sec transfer rate out of this drive, where my OCZ pushes 480+.Like I said, it easily outperforms a standard HDD, but for the price, it doesn't perform as well as OTHER SSDs.
This is an ok cheap camera. It was my first camera and I used it for a while. I replaced it with a more expensive one with a mic. I may still use this on my older computer.
I've had this keyboard for about two weeks. It has a similar feel to my laptop, which I like, but there is one thing that's killing me: a creaking spacebar.
Not exactly the texture I was expecting but it's fine.  Thought it would have a slightly more refined grip.If carefully applied it will cover the bottom of your ipad to prevent scratches.
it was a 3 pack with a roll...not as it was featured on the pic...i just hope that rolls of film are in good condition.

The sticky flap doesn't stay stuck for very long but box tape fixes that.The peel tab to open the mailer is weaker than the cardboard so it just breaks off, requiring one to open it with a knife or scissors.Other than that, they are okay.

The specifications show read/write rates in excess of 500MB/second but the reality is that these drives cannot sustain reading/writing about about 120MB/second.  The 500MB+ rating is for very short bursts.

As I think other post says.  This cable does the job but it is very very thin and if you twist it the wrong way I am guessing it might snap.  Because of that I can only give it 3 stars.  But it works great for my sound bar.  The vendor is great and I got the cable in 1 week.

I like the headset. I have 2 complaints about it.After awhile it does get a little tight becuase it is so big.I use mine for Skyping too. There is no side-tone. (you can't hear yourself talk) This is a MAJOR drawback of a multi-purpose headset. OK, if it ISN'T a multi-purpose headset, then it is overpriced for just a gaming headset. Besides that, I love the sound, and the ability to go wireless.

The tent is great. It's a neat setup. The lights, however, are a very underpowered. You can't take pictures with the lights alone. You will need an extra light source to take good pictures. I'm not a pro, but I tired all sorts of positions and camera settings but was unable to make it work with the lights alone.
loved it until it stopped working in about 6 months. guess for the price its ok, but I probably wont buy this brand again.

I really love the style of this camera, appearance and functionality of the menus and buttons, however, it wasn't as good at focusing on close objects as my previous Z1 of the same brand, and on low light photos are grainier than I was hoping for. I've moved on from it and have moved on to two digital cameras since this one.I think there are better options out there today for the money.

The device is not intuitive and the mouse buttons are wacky to use, depending on the orientation of the device. But battery life is good and the device works well.I guess I'm trying to say that if you are using this device to control one of those android TV boxes, this will not improve the experience.

I bought like 5 different versions of this same rca adapter between ordering and receiving this one. Looking at it I think I would have been just as good off taking a knife to an old pair and buying and end piece to just twist on and forget, it looks like that's what they did here. Low quality, but it didn't cost hardly anything at all s why not try it. Maybe you'll get lucky.
It is good because protects but the buttons dont stay at the right place so it is bad to use manual mode and to take movies.
It's cool and looks nice as described however, its a little too slick for me and don't want to risk dropping my giant phone on the ground.

I got these baby beats for their compact size and with everyone claiming the sound would be a,axing. Well I was not amazed and in less than 5 months one of the earbuds went dead. I am not a wearer of headphones daily so in those 5 months I may have wore them a total of 10 times. I am sorry but I expected more.

As others have said, the bolts provided were either too long or too short to mount a set of RC-Micros. Took 2 trips to the hardware store to get what I need for these, but now they are working out just fine. Price is right.

I bought hot pink ones and thought the sound would be small like other mp3 speakers that have disapointed me in the past :-( but was pleasantly surprised..............buying a pair for my neice to put in her room.For the price definately worth it.
I've owned many pair of Skullcandy earbuds. You get what you pay for and these are cheap. One side dies within a year and it simply isn't worth trying to make use of the warranty.

Bought this to improve the sound from a 24" Samsung LCD TV. Does that, but it really is for desktop use since it lacks a remote. I knew that when I bought it. Sound is better, not tinny like the puny Sammy speakers. There may be better options out there--this works, but cheaper computer speakers will probably do the trick as well.

I thought having this zoom was a great addition to my T2i.  But truth is I swear my 50mm prime I got for less than $100 takes sharper photos than this one.  Lately I've been seeing a lack of quality in this thing.  Kind of regret buying it, I should have put the money towards an L series prime...

My wife got this for her iPad mini which it fit well, and was easy to apply. However the packaging we got it in was bent thus the films were bent.So far the product is working well, however it does haze the screen a bit causing you to loose some of the clarity. Compared to other screen protectors i have no doubt this will protect, but the clarity could use some improvement.
Should have known for the price I wasn't getting an Ethernet splitter but unfortunately I was lead wrong, still a good phone line duplex though.
I purchased it for my husband. He decided to send it back without trying it. He said he could do what it does without it.

This is working fine in my shower. It's on the heavy side so I couldn't hang it from my curtain rod. Unfortunately either the antenna is too short or it's in a bad spot in my house, but some days it just doesn't get good reception.

i purchased this one thinking it would be a great buy and useful.... however I have yet to plug this into my home computer. I have instead opted for the reasoning that home is home and work is work. I will not waste what little bit of family time I have logging into business related websites to stay caught up at work..... Hell I am a government employee... I get paid regaurdless of how little work I accomplish.

I ordered this for my iTouch 4G but is really for the iPhone 4G. It works well as a mirror, but as a mirror I can still see my reflection when I run my apps. It allows touch to be responsive but it was difficult to apply and left too many air bubbles that took time to smooth out. Since I carry my iTouch everywhere, it is great as a mirror but don't expect much more.

The iPad2 just fits but the zipper will scratch the corner edges unless you pull the zipper away from the unit when closing.  The should have made the case about 1/4" larger.  Because the material is stretched so tight there is little room to slide things into the storage area -- only a few papers but not cords, etc.  EXCELLENT QUALITY. too bad it is a shy small.
it works with win8, no driver neededbut it's just slow, no way near 150mbps on WLAN (some times I get below 100kbps)

A short two years and this thing burned out after a short two years. I know your suppose to always back up your drives but with models like this its really crazy how undependable this things have come!

I love my Roku player, except for one BIG issue.  It never turns off and doesn't have an on-off button.  It feels warm to the touch so that means it's using electricity 100% of the time.  Not exactly Energy Star!  One other issue: if you buy the HD version, beware it only comes with SD cables.
Tried it out this week, does not seem to hold it's charge as long as the Canon battery(looks better though!).I use it as back up.

Original extended battery that came with my 1501 lasted longer per charge.  Not a complaint as the battery from the manufacturer of the laptop costs twice as much.Not even a year later and the battery is needing to be replaced.  The stock Dell battery at least held a longer charge and lasted almost 2 years.

I don't really care for how cheap the case looks.  I bought it as an add on to the larger case, but it doesn't look very sturdy.  I'm going to keep it because I won't be handling it but so much and don't want to pay the shipping cost to return it.

I've only used it a couple of times and it has been functioning as advertised. My only issue with this tripod is that it feels cheap and somewhat unsturdy. It's kind of like a daddy-long-legs spider.That being said, it is one of the cheaper options and for what I am using it for (in-home videos) it is doing the trick.

The design of this is great in theory, however it seems the fan is lacking in power, even with the speed control all the way up. Overall, its not too bad, based on the selection in this price range, but it is no where near as good as an old swiss army one I bought about 5 years ago for the same price.

I returned mine because it was apparently an opened item.As well, it has a stupid icon of the manufacturer at the bottom of the screen of the bigger one (for 3inch display).Ican't recommend it, unfortunately.

I had a battery exactly like this from a different brand that had a flashlight on the other end. This one looks exactly the same, but has no flash light. Meh. Other then that, the battery seems to work as expected.

NAS works but I had some issues. D-Link offers only paid support and when I asked for help from multiple D-Link webs sites they did not even respond to tell me they only offered paid support. I wondered why they still allowed input from these sites. I did get some assistance from a forum.
What I received was a faulty battery but I was pleased with the way the service request has been handled. Got it rectified and is now working without any interference.

If the touch pad on a mac is all 5 Stars here is how this one compares.Touch Area size: 5 StarsThickness of the device: 2 starts Otherwise it looks elegant.Single touch actions responsiveness: 3 StarsTwo finger touch actions responsiveness: 2 StarsWorks fine with windows and Mac bug occasionally you have to reset the wireless USB connector (unplug and plug it back). Lacks multitouch.
Didn't look all that great, looks cheap on the wall, but at least it did the job of holding upour receiver and DVD player.

Not sure how to review this one but it is 50 ft of Ethernet cable that I was going to use to run a small video player box that hooks to the TV. I thought I would just plug it in whenever I was going to stream video to the TV well I got tired of winding it up and then trying to string it out to use and just ended up buying wireless for the house instead.

I'm very happy with the sound quality of these earbuds.  I typically use Skull Candy earbuds, but thought I'd give these a try.  My only complaint is that the part that remains outside of the ear is big and heavy and the earbud tends to fall out easily if I am moving around.

If you're buyting this product just to listen to music out loud, then don't get it. You can use any speakers for that. Also I have the HTC one s and was confused on how to hook it up bc the micro usb is on the side not bottom. I just returned it cuz I was too lazy to figure it out.
Does what it is supposed to do. A little loose on one lens, but works very good on the factory lens.
Just what I needed! However 1 out of the 5 cables was bad. I didn't bother to return the bad cable, shipping to return would cost more than the cable is worth. The other 4 worked great.
i didnt get it yet but i have another one and its awesome but its takes so long for it to come! =_= more like a month or something. if you want it fast, don't take this one.
These were pretty much as advertised.  They are budget cables and work, but don't come with clips to hold them in.

Didn't have this very long and it pulled apart.  The ring came off.  Was upset with that.  Was ok while it was used.  You can get closer to class with this one, where the hard shell ones you can't.  If it would only have lasted longer.

This works fine for charging the laptop but it gets very hot. Unlike the old one, it did not get very hot like this one. It does the job though so no regrets ordering it, just worry it will burn out quickly.
cuts out sound be careful buying this cheap cable. I would not recommend this cable. You have to spend time twisting and bending the cable to get sound.

The background stand and muslins are quite nice for the price. The umbrellas are very weak and not useful for photography at all. Buying the backdrop separately and getting some nicer lights such as the soft box kit is a better idea.Cowboystudio customer service is great though. They made me a repeat customer.

Lost the original one during one of my travelling. Ordered the replacement and was shocked to see that it doesnt come with gold plated contact anymore and upon checking with BOSE, they said they dont carry gold plated cable anymore so the lesson learnt, dont lose your original one!!
This was not quick to come, but was delivered on time.  It was packaged fine.  The price was fine.  Noting extrordinary about this product.  But definitely nothing wrong with it either.

Bought this as a network backup drive in the office, But because It was so slow we just use it to store small documents and maybe small thumbnails..but never anything large because it would take to long to transfer.

this product works okay, but if you use the security features it significantly reduces both range and speed. One good thing is that you really don't need the security features since you are just using it as a range extender and it is not part of your 'secure' network. I use it so that I can get network access in my detached garage and around most of my backyard (approx 1.5 acres) and it works just fine for that.DS
The battery is working good but the cable is broken when I connect the cable to my cellphone isn't charger but when I change the cable is working good.

At first this device worked perfectly but over about 6 months of infrequent use the connection started getting spotty.  it would produced a fuzzy radio sound then, when I tried it again moments or hours later the connection would either work or not.  If it worked with the stereo all the time this would be a great product but since it doesn't the most I can give is three stars.

I've had two of these screens. Both of them were okay, but I've had two gripes:1) The retraction instructions are a bit unclear. The label on the handle makes it sound like you have to pull the screen all the way down, but in fact it's a fast, sharp pull that causes it to go into retract mode. It's annoying.2) Both screens I received had ripples that caused the image to distort somewhat.
There is also a larger version of this friction mount, and both don't work on my Subaru Forester dash. I havn't found any dash mount that works on my car. This is the 4th type I've purchased.

Got this thing set up and after a week or so it went into protection mode.  Had to cart it back and forth to local service center where they repaired it under warranty (but had it for a long time.)After the repair it works fine.  It was just a hassle to have to take a brand new receiver to service center.

Many good games are not supported.The aiming point in COD shows double points.In some games, special motion blur effect should be disabled.Since these games are not designed for stereo view, the 3D effects are not stunning. Comparing to PS3 3D games, 3D PC games don't have a wow effect.Anyway, the technology works as promised. It is the games that haven't implemented good 3D effects. The installation, calibaration, etc all work fine.

I like the Sansa m250. The price was very good. The sound is good.  I love the fact you can replace the battery yourself.  I am disappointed that I cannot figure out how to have the audiobook I'm listening to start out where I left off.  As soon as I figure out if/how to make the mp3 player do that, I will give it all five stars!

All looks good, except the co-ax is too short for my extended cab Chevvie. Biggest problem is NO INSTRUCTIONS!Will figure it out by to pictures on the box,but a brief explanation of the parts would be helpful.

Well built and sounds fine for the money. Easy to use and portable. I mainly bought this to use during tailgating at football games. It works good except for the ipod adapters which is a shame. I'd hate to have the connector get messed up on my ipod just trying to seat my ipod into this device. So, i will just connect my ipod to the aux input and not worry about it.
Design is good, but it's signal week, so, sometimes, it's hard to listen my mp3 player through my car audio.
It is a decent product for the price.  I ordered from two different companies. This one has choppy video and okay sound quality.

This is great in concept. Directions leave a little to be desired and it is VERY difficult to connect the main connector to the power supply. I have not used it a lot yet and that is why I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt with 3 stars. Preliminary tests indicate it may not be working.
Not sure it does what it claims, but it does add bling to my rig. So if you got a couple of extra $$ go for it!
Didn't work with my set-up

I must have missed something in the description. Either way, it was a let-down on Christmas. The station doesn't dock/charge the new series of I-Phone. Compatibility translates to: It has a an auxillary jack plug.
It is well made and looks good but is amazingly heavy and opening and closing it is so time consuming as to be a real pain.  I sent it back.
seems to make my network unstable sometimes, but works great other times. I also have a TP-link wireless router. Both seem to need a reset every other day or so don't know why.
It's Windows, it's expensive and you know what to expect. The only other alternative is Windows 8. So I went with this.
Awesome and tiny!  The only gripe is that this is just a little slower than I wanted, but it functions for what I use it for.

Bought this little unit with the WDLive Plus as part of a deal.  Unit did work but just wasn't fast enough to maintain or sometimes even connect to network services.150 mbs probably too slow.  I returned this unit and got a Netgear at 300 mbs which works great with my wireless network for streaming.

Packaging for the Fintie Case was adequate.  I was very disappointed with the case itself in that the openings for the 'on' button and the 'charger' were covered by the leather.  I had to cut the areas larger in order for the functions to operate as they were suppose to.  I will not order another Fintie product.

This cover is clearly made for the Fire. It is simple and intuitive.  It fits well and performs as advertised but is pricey for what it is.  Shipped on time, received on time and functions as promised.  I didn't shop around but I am guessing there are equally good covers for a lot less money.
It works. But the cable is short, about 8.5" from end to end. It's not the high quality piece you are looking for.
Strange keyboard configuration. Hot keys not what I expected. Needs numerous key strokes to access things, like eject. Hard to see the black keys in the dark. I'm sending it back.
good picture and sound quality but clip doesn't stay tight and falls off easily. it's not that cheap either. all in all it's okay
PICKED UP 3 TIMES AS MANY CHANNELS AS THE RABBIT EARS I WAS USING BUT I HAD TO KEEP MOVING IT EVERY WEEK TO KEEP CHANNELS CLEAR , SO IF YOU DONT MIND MOVING IT AROUND GO FOR IT

I purchased this case for the New Nexus 7 because it very closely resembles the Blurex case I bought for my 2012 Nexus 7.It's not the same case.  There is not enough slack in the hinge on this case for the cover to fold back flat.  Compounding this problem is the fact that it has no elastic strap to hold the case opened.  This case does the job, but it's not that great.  I've already ordered another one.

Modem was listed as very good condition. It does work ok, but looked like it had been dragged down the road. Not worth returning, but the person that graded this item sure wouldn't be happy if they had bought it. Luckily it will be located out of sight. I would have graded it as well worn but working. I am giving three stars only because it works as it should, but should be one star for it's condition.

I recieved the product two days ago (waited a long time due to international shipping) and almost forgot I ordered these. I plugged them into my computer and all of the covers fit except the SD slot and headphones slot. It's not a huge issue, but I really wanted an SD slot cover mainly but I use the slot enough to not need a cover.
Bought 2 of these one still is working and other one sending to patriot for replacement. The one that still works is very snappy in my HTC Incredible, much faster read and write from stock SD card.
Works good, I really like the free rainfly. On the negative side it doesn't stay straight, you can't disperse the weight to the left side.

I thought we could get away with using this on our tablets to monitor our baby at night, because the WiFi Baby is a lot more expensive.  However, the app quits working intermittently, and in the middle of the night it isn't fun to try to fix it.  The WiFi Baby is worth the much larger price tag if you like your sleep.

I like the case and all, I still have some space to put some other products. Before I bought it, I read other reviews below and I got the same problem with one of the brushes sides, it leaves a black stain on my fingers, I haven't use it with my lenses yet, I'm scared it'll leave a stain or something...
charges everything in the house, tablet iphone, itouch you name it. love the fact i cat find it in my purse being that is white
It picks up most of the local channels, HD included. Our location is a little compromised, because we live by a train. Great for basic home use.

While these are so cheap the "I can use four of these for one original" argument stands, do you want to change your battery 5 times in one wedding? Because that's what I had to do with these. The charger works and having them for emergency backup is not a bad idea, but I'd rather invest in something that's not going to have me missing the cake cutting because the battery randomly dies.

I don't understand why people gave this 5 stars, maybe they had the thing plugged in right where they wanted to use it. If not It won't work good, i have to plug it into a usb extender and put it right near the mouse for it to work good.  But at least it works good when it's like that.

It is very slow. I know, I should have looked for a higher class, but other same class cards in the same devises work faster. I ended up using this one for just data storage, which is always very helpful, so I am fine. But if you are planning to buy it for camera or so, look for 6+ class.

Love the look. Easy to use software. Battery life doesn't last at all if you are watching videos. Can't buy movies at their website. Zune to Zune sent songs only stay on your Zune for (3) days.Still work needs to be done. I hope that the next gen. corrects some of these issues. Zune could be the best on the market if Microsoft choose to fix these problems.
Do not like how long this company takes to settle account and all the things you have to do in order to get your claim processed.  This one is not as user friendly as square trade.

I bought this tv to take with me to the family farm but quickly replaced it with the Toshiba 15 inch.This tv isn't the greatest,but it isn't the worst.I had to mess with the picture controls to even make the picture look decent.Reds still look pink and Godzilla was purple.The sound is tiny and sounds like tin cans.Will probably give away this tv.

I got this because I didn't want to pay for something more expensive, such as a Jambox.  Sound was mediocre, and didn't really last.  After some months, one of the buttons on the circuit board inside broke, and so I lost ability to turn up the volume.I ended up getting a Jambox and its works excellent.  I'd say save your $35 on this, and put it towards the Jambox.
Is ok for windows.  So So for the Mac.  Few features available for the  Mac.  At least in the past, Microsoft had mice that worked well and had numerous features for Mac.

The battery is a backup to my genuine Canon battery.  It seems to work OK, but the exterior black covering is starting to peel away.  I will probablytry to purchase a real Canon battery when this one dies.  It looks like the old saying "You get what you pay for" may be applied here.
This was just a reg pair of headphones.  I could have found something similar locally.  They are cute, but it wasn't worth the effort in s&h.

It's an "official" Nikon lens cap. I've had knock off versions so I'm just happy it says Nikon on it. Though when it arrived it seemed rather cheap. Either way it protects my glass, which is what I paid for.

I bought this to carry around an old Flip Mino camcorder, which unfortunately they don't make anymore.It would also work fine for many compact cameras, and has a pocket in front that you can use to carry a spare battery or an SD card.I have bought similar bags from Case Logic in the past, and the fabric they use for this one is a bit less flexible. I don't prefer that, but this does the job.

This phone is decent for the money but about everyone complains that my voice fades in and out,  I use it 3 feet from the base so it seems that it should not do this.The ear-piece's rubber was not attached and fell off. Without it the ear-piece is worthless, it will not stay in the ear.

The product is awesome in a lot of ways. Small, compact, great flip out memory stick but the batteries last 1 day at most with intermittent video taking. Maybe I just need to remove the batteries in between use. Otherwise I like the quality of the images and recommend it.
But don't expect much for base, The unit is very loud though so you will have no problem hearing it. The remote is convenient.
It is a charging and auxiliary out dock. But you must have your own power cord. Good for the price I paid.

In fact this memory is a 2 x 128MB, meaning you have to switch from "A" to "B" when you get 128MB of photos/video. I bought these to take some underwater photos, so how am I suppose to take this memory stick out of my camera, switch to the other free 128MB and place it back on, all these underwater?!I think LEXAR should advertise that this product is a 2x128MB and not 256MB as they did.
Very small. That is it's own advantage and own disadvantage.  DO NOT USE under a netbook larger than 10" IMHO.

Took some getting use to, because I'm accustomed to a brighter, more detailed sound. But the warmth and creaminess makes for a pleasant listening experience. Older analog recordings sound better with these cans as it masks the imperfections and smoothens everything out. Not really good for the studio where definition and detail are paramount. Good upgrade for those coming out of cheap headsets.

Very cheaply made, the spring on the inside of the spindle broke, and the cord is no longer retractable. The wire itself is VERY thin, I feel like it will probably rip in the near future. All in all, for the price, you get what you pay for.
The cord is too short.  The right angle plug is good but I wish a 1/4" adapter had come with it.

Bought the unit from a local electronics store a week ago.The picture quality of the TV is fine. When it comes to the applications;I already had other streaming devices do the job.The biggest disadvantage of the LW5600 is the lack of Flsh 10 support!Still not sure whether I will keep the TV.
Works as described.  When I  tried to read a flash drive I got the message:  "USB drive requires too much voltage."
So far I have no problem with this product.The plastic feels cheap.  Not sure how long it wouldlast.

The items all came in handy but each of the cases I used on my ipod lasted at most a few days before they broke. Plus the headphone detangler thing didn't seem to do much. If the cases managed to stay in shape the bundle would have been a lot better since they were nice cases.
The kick stand broke, but the case protects well.so if your looking for a case with a good stand, this is not the one.
I needed a tablet that was affordable and functional.  This works fine. My only complaint is that the 7" screen is a little small for my aging eyes.

This is a great wireless keyboard and mouse set EXCEPT the horrible position of the Windows/Apple key in the bottom left corner.  If you're a Windows user, you're going to constantly be hitting it expecting to have a control key there.  If there was a way to disable this key or remap it to a control key, I'd have ranked it a 4 plus.
It's a cable. I connected it between my DSLR and laptop computer but the DSLR didn't have enough power to push the signal through a 15 ft. cable. Oh well!
It is a body cap, it's genuine, and overpriced like most Sony accessories. Still, it fits better than a third-party cap.

Good points:  Easy to setup, works right out of box, good range on wirelessBad points:  It will randomly reboot, dropping all wired and wireless connections.  I have ver C2 with firmware 2.42 and the problem persists.Until they fix this problem, I cannot recommend this product.
These are nothing special they do the job but are slightly big at the tip. There a fine replacement for a finger tip.
Sound qualities aside, it's really not worth it if this is the primary mic.Buy 2 and expect that one will fail so that you can use the spare. That's the only way to use this mic.

set up was a simple but the instructions are s *** and customer support sucks.  Once working i love it.  one thing you can only do 2.4mhz or 5 mhz (one or the other, for some reason I thought it did both at the same time) not the case

Item ordered was 8 GB Sandisk ultra secure digital card, speed of 30MB/S and a Class rating of 10. (As Pictured)Received was 8 GB Sandisk ultra secure digital card, SPEED 15MB/S and CLASS rating of 4.I cannot see how these two cards are equivalent.Does someone have an explanation on this?THANKS

I bought these so I could have a nice pair of over-the-ear headphones to wear outside.  I won't wear these outside.  The band that goes across my head is too wide and boxy, and forms a strange shape.  It doesn't sit flat against my head, but rather arches up awkwardly.That being said, these are nice for indoor use when I want to listen to Netflix or music without waking anyone.
Battery is OK but not as good as original that held a charge for 2 months or longer when new

Bought this to replace my SONY that had a defect until I got another. Says double din, but would not completely close the front face due to it being slightly larger than a double din. Bluetooth and rearview camera worked fine without any issues. Recommended for people looking for somewhat cheap items that work great.

I purchased this 100 ft. ethernet cable at a very good price on amazon.com. The quality doesn't seem to be the best. The wire seems to be kind of flimsy and thin, but it does work and I do get a signal. Not a bad purchase for the price.
Good but expensive

Looks okay and the magnets attach sturdily, but it's not exactly top fit and finish.  The ends of the magnetic attachment are slightly warped on the one I got but given the price, it wasn't worth it to send back and I couldn't truthfully say that it was defective so I'm keeping it for now.

Ok, I can drive my Media Center remotely now! The setup was pretty straightforward.But. There are some hidden costs.Want to watch it on your iPhone? $12.99 for the iPhone app please!Want your wife to be able to watch it too on her Android? Another $12.99 for the Android app please!And what about my new Android tablet?! Luckily it sounds like the tablet app is free.Otherwise this would have been a five star review.

It's made of plastic and worked with my Polk Audio 6750 5.1 HT speakers. I wouldn't hang heavy speakers (over 5 lbs) with these and the adjustment ring needs to be really tight to hold the speakers. The plastic anchors that came with it didn't work, so I used metal ones that screw into the wall. It's a fair deal for the price.

This case protects the Kindle Fire HD just fine and the quality seems up to par.  The stand basically does not work, which is inconvenient.  The price paid was very reasonable compared to other similar quality cases.

The cables do not work well with iPad; charges at 2 AMP rate vice 5 AMP rate so takes too much time.  Works fine on the iPhone.  The company was very quick to respond after I notified them and they replaced all 4 cables immediately but with no performance improvement.  Great seller, but the cables are not designed for iPad as indicated in the discription.
The finaly result is ok, but  When I visualize the recorded images do not look good, I need to edit in order to see them clearly. The running time is fine.

Hey, they are what they are and do what they do. They say they'll pick up a digital signal, and they do. But when someone gets too close, it kind of scrambles the picture momentarily. We used them for a while, but finally upgraded to a better digital antennae. We actually put it in the attic (if you have that option) because we found a storng wind will affect reception. OPTION: Pay for cable :(

It does not come with adhesive which requires some tools and specific work in order to hang it on the wall. That means that not everybody may be capable to do so. Also no instructions are included.Size is acceptable if used to cover speaker cables or similar in size.If needed to cover TV cables (including antenna and power) then definitely look for something else and bigger in volume.Other than that, quality wise is acceptable.

Talk about poor manufacture process.  The ball came stuck with chunks of plastic between the ball and the base of the mouse.  It took me a while to figure I was going to have to dis-assemble the mouse and fix it or return it.  Great experience. NOT!
I just don't trust this thing only a month after I got it I was getting long hangs during periods of I/O access.

These were purchased as a gift.  I have a set of 10 X 42 Bushnells that are a step up from these and they are far superior in image quality and clarity.  This Powerviews are average at best.  Recommend spending the extra $ on something a little nicer.

The range is pretty bad; so bad in fact that I feel like I don't have a choice but to tamper with the device as recommended by some of the other users who have reviewed the product. I wasn't, and still am not, able to find a better alternative, however.

Was a bit skeptical buying a refurb piece and it is proving it self to be right. it has been very flaky at times and now my partners work win7 laptop refuses to even connect to it. Keeps dropping packets and connections during night time and goes into Hibrnate even though setting are set not to hibernate

I bought this cords to have some extra Apple cords for our iPad and iPhones.  They look cool and the length of them is great, but we are now down to 2 of the 4 working.  Not sure what happened but two of them no longer work.  For the price, I guess I got my money's worth but need to stick with my buying philosophy "you get what you pay for".
If you live out of the country, you will not be able to access Hulu! Also, this device does NOT get any local NEWS networks!

I choose this keypad because it was cheep. My exceptions for it were minimal and it worked. Key bounce was an issue and it required hardware and software components to resolve in my project. As a basic interface it wood work for most beginners to the Arduimo.

Neat thing to have for your point&shoot but certainly not a must-have. WARNING the little plastic beads (beans) are NOT inside a secondary containment. They are directly behind the velcro closure so if you make the mistake of opening the closure you are going to have a mess on your hands!
I bought these radios for a job I had delivering trucks. Unfortunatly, I was  let go before I could really use them

Bought this for a kitchen tv to be able to play netflix while cooking or eating in there.  Easily hidden away in the back of the tv and you can't beat the price. If you have a smartphone or tablet this is a no brainer.

Unfortunately this stylus does not work with any Apple products so I was unable to really get a good use out of it. I gave it 3 stars because I didn't want to screw up their rating simply because I wasn't compatible with my device.
If you use this on your motorcycle, all you get is your handlebars the whole time.  Perhaps for hiking or skydiving.  On a bike...worthless.
The price is cheap, but the quality is bad.  The cable is only like 5 inches, the antena disconects easily from the lighter and makes weird noises.

This is an OK remote.  We use it with my wife's Rebel XTI. It gets the job done eventually.  It doesn't always take the shot when you want it to, so you'll end up with some interesting photos.  It's better than setting the timer, and running to you spot though.

I took this thing to Tokyo.  It was basically a waste of space.  I'm not sure if it was the voltage in Tokyo or if I just got a busted piece of equipment.  It would charge my phone with it but it would only last a few minutes so I just plugged it straight into the wall and it worked even better.

I have not yet tested these on UV reactant liquidbut will replay as soon as i experiment with itbest part is they work as dimmer light for night time use :) atm till i can afford water coolingConsOne of the lights, lights slightly dimmerThe cables from the lights to the inverter were not long enough

Within a week of delivery one of the USB ports went dead.  Since there are four ports, the product was so inexpensive, and the hassle of return is problematic I'll keep using it.  I'm disapointed at the poor quality from Amazon.
It fits, it does what it's designed for. It is a rubber wonder! Only 3 Star because it is what it is.
Response of the trackball is precise.  Buttons are easy to reach and also very responsive.  Too bad the body is very large.  It would be nice if it was a little more compact.
Pretty decent. Bought it to fill a gap in my computer case. Feels pretty cheaply made, but for the most part it's ok.

Unfortunately from time to time you come by an inexpensive product that holds up to the saying "You get what you pay for" and this my friends is that product. While it does works and works great actually the build quality is lacking. The base and stem that holds the light upright can never hold a tight grip and slowly allows for the light to droop down.
Great little conversion cable. Very handy for simple conversion.Worked on two monitors I had. Didn't work on another one.

Though Arduino makes its circuits and board layouts available as open source items for anyone to use, this board is a knock-off, made in China, but labeled as "ARDUINO NANO v3.0". This is a violation of Arduino's request that people not use their name.That said, the board works fine, and is nicely made. I will use it and be happy with it, but I am sorry these folks don't observe Arduino's simple rules.
They're 'just okay'. They certainly don't hold a charge anywhere near as long as an alkaline. But, if you have kids or just a lot of electronics, it's worth the investment.

The battery receive works as it should. However, I still need a battery for the previous model of MacBook. I have several models so I can use the one I received. I asked the vender if they has a battery for the previous MacBook. I am disappointed they have not responded.

My son can't put it down, even though the ear buds broke the second day, and I can't seem to find 2.5's anywhere he can't seem to go anywhere without it.  i hope the other side continues to play until I can find ear buds, or an adapter that fits.
I bought these to get my wires off the ground away from my baseboard heaters.  Does the trick but glad that it's hidden for the most part.  Not the best looking raceway

This device is fine except the main cable is less than 7" long.  I use a swing mount for my computer at home abd have to use an extension to keep from having this swing under the computer.  Otherwise, a fine accessory.
if you have small ears this is good for you the sound is fair enouh.  So it's not a bad product, sound is better depending on the source. so again small ears this is good for you.

its light weight and easier to move with, however it feels cheap.Every time you pick up the tripod and relocate, watch your level, because for some odd reason its unbalanced.Be careful with the leg clamps, boy are these things tight, I wouldnt want to pinch my finger in these things.
I USE THIS DVD TO PLAY SOUND SCREEN MP3s THE REPEAT LEAVES A 10 TO 15 SECOND GAP IN THE SOUND SCREEN AND THIS QUITE DISTURBING...OTHERWISE IT FUNCTIONS ADEQUATELY FOR NOW
Can't complain.  A good lens for the price.  A lens is size by Cannon or Nikon would cost tens of thousands of dollars.  For about $260.00 it was worth it to "play" with.

I'm giving this a 3 star rating because the seller was awesome although the product failed to work.  the description stated the cable was able to be used with the Abbott Freedom Lite meter, it didn't work for me.  The seller made several suggestions but none worked.  The seller accepted the item back and refunded my funds plus postage in an expeditious manner.  I would purchase from this seller again without hesitation.

this are a nice small bluetooth headset, not intrusive, easy to pair, sound quality ok. battery life only drawback, if you want them for music & u lisent long periods of time. you will run out of battery quikly. 2'1/2 hours before you start hearing annoying alarm low battery noise.
The picture is a little misleading, from the picture I thought there was space for 6 cards!

The Garmin GLO is a great little 10Hz bluetooth GPS unit except for the fact that it appears to turn itself on & off at random.It is my belief that the Off/On switch itself is EXTREMELY touch & vibration sensitive, and this is the cause of most of the off/on complaints listed here in the reviews section.Frustrating that such a nice product has such an annoying flaw.
one of the clips broke after two days of light usage.. fixed it with glue.. good product for the price but won't last forever
It was nice but it took too long to get & it is the wrong size male plugs for my i-pod & Bose Headphones.  (Too Large)
I received this one.It's very slow charging.It took over night to charge the battery.I also have third party charger, it's faster.

This sleeve bag is quite stylish to me. fits macbook pro 13 perfectly. But there is not much protection. It certainly protects from scratch if you put it in your school bag, but it just doesn't help if you drop it.

This little flash is fine for what it does.  I ordered it without really checking carefully and found it couldn't do bounce flash so I gave it to my son and ordered the 270EX II, which does have a moveable flash head so you can bounce.  If bounce isn't an issue for you, it's a nice, inexpensive little flash.
Pretty powerful speaker despite it's small size, I have a macbook pro and I would say the speaker is stronger than the speakers on this laptop.
The case does what it's supposed to. It looks and feels great. Would be better if there was a pocket to add a pad or a pocket for pens and pencils.
The internal part of the adapter was too short to accomdate the European prongs thus leaving part of the prongs exposed and a potential shock hazard.
Not a bad little drive... but would not recommend it for a hp6000 version pavilion laptop computer. Might fit something else better.

Seems to be a piece of junk. Two of of the four ports would not work. Returned. Will get a d-link or something else.Update 9/19/20Laptopmate sent me a replacement right away. I just received it and am about to test it.  Upgrading to at least a 3 star from 1 star for customer service, but need to see if the product works.

I bought few days ago, and it arrived soon. Everything is ok. The design is very good, also the idea of removable fans is nice.But the "problem" is; it isn't cool at all. when I am not playing a game, my old cooler keep my laptop temperature low enough while this "Cooler Master Notepal U2 Notebook Cooler with Two Fans R9-NBC-8PBK-GP" when I am not playing a game my laptop get hot and hotter...
Easy to setup and the buttons are nice. I would recommend if you lost your remote or just wanted bigger buttons.

The case is nice because it adds extra protection to my notebook, however it does have 2 flaws.  First the corners are not protected very well if you drop it directly on a corner.  Second the case gets in the way of the functionality of the bottom buttons of your screen for the Samsung Notebook
my daughter wanted ear buds vs in ear head phones. she likes these but the cord tangles quite a bit. not sure how they will hold up but for the price you cant beat them.
Not compatible with MacBook Pro w/retina display! Should work fine with regular macbook. Best price for what you are getting.

I purchased a WMP54G for my parents computer to avoid running cable through their house.  The first one worked well for about a year when it suddenly received no signal - acted like the antenna connection was bad - possibly due to rearrangement of cords, etc. behind the computer.  A replacement card has worked flawlessly ever since from a second story office to wireless router in the basement.

Full of little pockets for secreting stuff all over, but really not deep enough to hold everything that came with my camera.  Like the shoulder strap and the handle strap; makes it easy to carry and to secure.Would perhaps be better for a smaller camera, but is well built and easy to use.

This stylus works well enough, however if I had to go back and do it again I would have likely gotten another stylus.  Save your money and check out the new evernote stylus if you've got the cash.  Otherwise go ahead and get one of these.  Just know you're not going to get any insanely awesome results from it.  It works. But it's not awesome.
Just wish it was a tiny bit bigger I love the look but it only fits camera with lens that is on it. If it was a little wider I could have a second lens
The headphone are not that bad, the sound quality is ok, but it's not a very load set of headphone.. But what can I say you get what you pay for. For a first set it would do fine...

quality, fast, will order again /// pro awesome super fast shipping great price to quality ratio. Jazzy Joel Productions will use again ... I found that the wire diagram is not as easy to follow if your not using RJ-45 to RJ 45 IE rj-45 to bare wires... message me for more info...

I like the sound. It works very well. The only issue is that my Itouch and other ipods did not work with the existing adapters which cradle it. Mine works without it, but it was an extra one that i keep in it all the time.

I bought this to replace the sports one that went up in price the sound quality is great for the price but the fit is horrible. You can't see it but this has a wishbone type of curve to the part that fits near your head, it's uncomfortable and slips down. It takes a lot of getting use to would not recommend it since I wear it a lot to listen to videos, and music online.

I am unable to give much of a review because these glasses ended up not being compatible with my tv. I have a new SAMSUNG, but Samsung this year switched their tv's from syncing w/ 3d glasses via IR to syncing via Bluetooth. As with any 3DTV purchase... pay extra attention to how your 3dtv syncs w/ glasses before purchasing these.
The unit worked after messing with the settings, the windows PC's needed to be reset but the Apple and android tablet and phones connected without any settings changes. Strong signal
Great product, works as expected but creates lots of shadows on the screen that are not there when plugged in directly so they are artifacts from the switch box.
I had to return it because you can fit the laptop into it well but it leaves little room for anything else. A bigger bag is probably best.
This switcher seems to get the job done, but, it does have some issues. The output isn't always consistent.

The price can't be beat. I just can't seem to get anything more than about 4-5 feet away. 6 feet would be acceptable, but I really hit the 5 foot mark and the remote just wont communicate with the camera. I'll take it though, simply because of the price. Opteka usually puts out pretty good products and this one is good, with the exception of the range.

I owned one of these for compact flash worked great.Bought this one for my new digital camera and found out that it doesn't support anything above 512mb.  Too bad it wasn't listed on the item at amazon.com.Tech support from Sandisk is the one who informed me of the limitation after struggling to get the PC Card to work correctly.Probably works great for anything 512mb and under.
I've only used the cable once or twice, but I like it. The jacks are nice and sturdy, and I don't feel concerned that they'll fall apart like my older one.
Have had this speaker for about 7 years and it still works. It's very easy to install. It is louder than my cb speaker but the speaker quality could be better.
Definitely not one of Samsung's market leading products but it works ok. Keys are tacky to the touch. But you get what you pay for so cannot complain.
Have had this for a few weeks, and mostly works well. Seems like it has problems with WiFi being on the back of my TV against the wall

This Auxiliary cord works but it is difficult to use. The cord often gets caught and I have trouble untangling it. While I'm driving the last thing I want to be doing is messing with a cord. I ended up purchasing a different Aux cord (from Griffin) to replace this one. It will work in a pinch but the cord problem was too annoying for me. The sound is okay though.

I really liked the idea of running windows on a tablet. I was not ready to give google doc's a chance.  It is fast and does a lot of things well. It was just too small for me.  Using exel I could hardly read the numbers and trying to click on a cell was a pain. I upgraded to a IPad and am much happier. This may not be a bad product just did not meet my needs.

This is great for connecting some standard tablets, cameras, and even some phones to a larger computer screen or television. If you have need for something like this, check it out and make sure that this product is exactly what you are looking for. If it is, it is both a great value and a useful tool.
This is about what I expected, but a little bit on the cheap side. It looks a little more like plastic than I hoped it would. It is functional and fits the iPad Mini perfectly.

It's trivial to hook up (it can only go in one way so there's no way to hook it up incorrectly), but the image that showed up on the TV was VERY grainy/pixelated. I don't know if it's this device, or the repeater/extension HDMI cable. Research carefully before buying

nice cover,  I like the flip thing makes it look like a notebook, only issue is the grooves, they should be sealed or something the grooves are put in to allow you to set the stand up thing,  but they also let dust in,  so you get 2 lines of dust down your screen.
An OK camera but too small for my big hands.  Seems the picture quality was inconsistent. Some were great but many came out on the blurry side.  Probably operator error! I returned it.

I installed this to increase recording capacity of my cable box, which was too low.  I can't tell when it takes over from my cable box, as just a % is given.  When the new season of shows start and recording is at peak, I will write more and tell you if it is working.  T'was easy to install.
It does what it's designed to do, but I expected a little different function. (it wasn't as easy to use as I'd expected)
It is the standard mouse. It was otherwise clean but the little feet on the bottom appeared worn, which makes me wonder whether it was actually a refurb.

I sent mine back and bought the E2.If this is your first PDA then it could be the right choice, but if your upgrading to color from an older model the smaller screen may disappoint.The E2 is just fine if you want to spend the extra money.
This isn't the best zoom eyepeice out there but its ok for the price.  I would have preferred it to have click stops at the major eyepeice sizes.

But not the screen.  I am meticulous about having a smudge free and scratch free screen.  I will need to find another case to assist me with that, so I can put it in my purse or backpack without fear!!

I used these for at least 3-4 hours every day and they fit my ears really well.  I used them to workout at the gym and while running outside and didn't have trouble keeping them in.  Just disappointed that they broke down after 6 months.

Good - The product fits a specific need and fits that need wellThe bad - The quality is.... not strong sturdy nor worth writing home aboutThe Ugly - The instructions were tiny pictures illegible, and only came in chinese.If it was higher quality I would had given it 5 stars for the value, but as is and due to the stress of installing, 3 starts for meeting the need at a great price.

As long as this product does what it is supposed to then I have no problem with it. I tried to do it but I was in a hurry so I have not done it yet. I thought it would be really fast but it wasn't so I will try again to set it up.

The battery compartment clip broke the very first time I tried to open it to connect the battery. It feels solid and works as advertised but the thickness of the tap for the battery compartment was way too thin and it just snapped when I put pressure on it to open the compartment.  I'll have to use it for some time before I can give it a better rating.

This is an OEM naked drive. which means that it has no software in the box and it also doesn't have the SATA cables or the mounting screws. the product description isnt clear about that. Many of the other reviews stated as such. pretty good price though.

This unit has great sound for such a low price, and it comes with a remote, but all the remote does is turn up and down the sound. It won't do anything else. Maybe I did not read the information well enough or it was not stated, but I thought it would have been able to change songs with the remote.

In my first review I noted that this unit would not play blu-ray disksbut played dvd nicely by simply connecting a USB.  I added 5V 1.9 amps to the unit, and it now plays blu ray nicely.  In short it appears underpowed for blu ray through usb only.
Gets so hot after the nights backup - you can hardly touch it - and then it died....I like the drive but....
Not bad.  The power seems to come and go sometimes which causes my iPhone to make that noise it makes when you plug it into power constantly.  It was cheap, though so whatevs.

Cameras have now become WiFi so having to work with wired cameras even through outlets is kind of a step back. The features of the unit are also limited unless you get a paid subscription. I loaned this unit to my boss since he likes this kind of stuff, but he was unable to get the software to load. It wanted to disable all his firewalls and this freaked him out so he passed.

This flash drive was incredibly cheap compared to others when I bought it. That is the only reason I purchased it, to be honest.Using it is easy, but don't expect to transfer GBs of files in less than a couple of hours.

I plugged the drive in and my Win 7 PC indicated it was downloaded a driver.  After that I could read and writes files just fine.  It does have an annoying habit of refusing to eject disks with labels on them.  I've had to simultaneously hold the eject button and extract the disk with tweezers.
I wanted some extra chargers for some phones/other devices.  This has turned out to be a good generic replacement for the "name-brand" ones.
I use it but I don't love it and I don't hate it, it stays on but I think there are better versions of the same thing that would probably be better. This was cheap so I got this.

The title may say professional DJ headphones but they are mid level at best.  The range on these isn't very good but for the price they are just okay.  You want a pair of good headphones for under $100 buy the Sony MDR-V6 Monitor Series Headphones with CCAW Voice Coil, these things really perform...which is what I replaced this set with.

I've had mixed results with this adapter. it's a great concept, but not every USB port recognizes it or installs the drivers properly. However - it's cheap, and when you have the right "microSD/Computer" combo - it works great!

I ordered a pair; put them thru very wet and hard conditions, battery lasts a lot, it has a very strong mile range, only problem is that one of the radios mic failed after a couple of day hiking, good thing I brought the other one as an emergency. I think all the sweat and rain damaged it.
The reason I gave this 3 and not 5 stars is the surface is slippery.  It isn't as easy to hold onto as some of the others that are sold.  Other than that, it's fine.
The switch for S-Video and Composite is labeled backward.  The converter converts analog signal (yellow, red, white) to a digital HDMI signal but does not convert to HD quality.

I know these are fluorescent lights, so with that in mind, you have to adjust your white balance to avoid the greenish hue in your images. For the price though, you can't go wrong. I bought these for my two soft boxes, and they fit just fine. No problems.

The sound pick up seems to be alright, but the little light that lets you know it is only only blinks once when you turn it on, so it is very easy to leave it on and not know it. Since it takes non standard batteries this can leave you without a battery and a bit of a hassle finding a new one.
they sound great but sometime make a hissing sound which is so annoying. i would still recommend for this price tho
Fix NETFLIX and I will change this to 5 stars.Pro: Great everything I could want.CON: NETFLIXNow Fix NETFLIX it is 50% of the reason people buy this thing.

Not a bad purchase. It's around $5 and won't break the bank taking a chance on it. Overall, it's worth the price. Pros and Cons:Pros:- Good flower shape- Sturdy plasticCons:- screw on part is not very strong so be careful and don't force it.Overall, I got what I paid for and am content with it.

I used this on my iPod Classic 5th Generation for taking notes of the class lectures. It is fine if you are in the front row of the class. I have also tried to use this to record myself on the piano, but the sound dynamic is not really suitable for that type of recording. This model is only use for old iPod classic's due to the size of the iTalk.

it is only a magnifying glass, it pretty much does what you would do with your macro functions but with the benefit of not having to get too close to the subject.don't forget you will need a adapter if you, like me, use a sony HX1 or similarcheers

This thing works pretty well. It is cheap and flimsy, but what do you expect? It does broadcast audio to your radio, and there is only a tiny amount of static unless you are using a frequency that is already being used. I was disapointed that I couldn't get my ipod touch to charge off of the included USB port using my standard ipod cable.

Not very loud, bass is lacking badly!  I ended up buying a powered sub and hooked it up and now the bass is perfect.  I was a little shocked that a 1000w system had such limited volume.  But on the other hand the smaller speakers are great and the sound is very precise and crisp.  So all in all not a bad system.
It works. Looks somewhat cheap. The black one is better and comes with screws. Also the black one is cheaper than the blue one!
It would have been better if I could have had the right tower. I did my research and this checked all the important boxes. However, I didn't have the right tower for it to work.

I have had these for a few weeks and love the sound they reproduce, but I don't care for the piece itself. The shape of the earpiece does not fit correctly in the ear and therefore consistently falls out. Luckily I bought them for $4.99 and not the full retail. Maybe people with siphon shaped ear canals will have a better fit with this. (LOL).
I purchased if for my Nikon camera. Its good product and protected my camera. Buy it only if you are buying Nikon camera...

It is ok but nothing special; the quality is not so great.They cannot make the software to work fine, just ok.They made a simple thing more compliacted.I wish someone makes a REALLY good touchpad mouse-one-day.

It isn't as fast as the class10 I used before, and the file structure only allows 29.7G free to put data on.  I can see SOME loss, but I'm very displeased with losing over 2G of space!  That's a big waste percentage.
Works okay, but does not seem to hold a charge as well as the original battery that came with the camera.  Not sure why, but the price was fair and I will continue to try and use it.

I love the design, but the cord is SUPER short. I originally ordered these because of their style and I'd be okay with them being on top of the desk for the plugs, but the cord won't reach to the outlet.

I bought a dozen of these for a project.  The keystone Snap-in worked just fine and stayed secure.  It is very simple product, but I had one problem with one of the jacks.  I inserted a USB cable into the jack with a little bit of force (very little) and the black part pushed right through the white part (broken).  Careful not to use too much force when inserting USB cable I guess.

These worked well initially, but were worse quality than the ultra-cheap adapters we bought from China. Ultimately they started falling apart after a year of use. Not worth replacing, we started using DP-HDMI and DP-DVI cables instead of adapters.
Bought this to match the router. Worked great, but upgraded to a newer Linksys model router later on for larger 2 floor houses.

The Tecsun PL398BT functions almost flawlessly, and feels well built.  My only big disappointment is that the sound is overly thin from the speakers.  I have other, smaller radios, even by the same manufacturer, that sound much, much better, tonally.  Bluetooth connections are solid, with good stability and range.  Battery life seems exceptionally good.

Nothing special but useful when needed.  It has worked when I needed it.  Keeping track of where I put the cable is more of a problem.  If only someone would make an easy to use and organize cable storage box or case.
I've used this backdrop many times and if there is any light on it the color is not the dark black I would prefer.
did bring all features back but some better than nothing so its ok but not the best one out there

This headset has average sound quality and an average fit.  It might just be me, but the headset was tight and made my ears sweat after about an hour of wear.  The price is cheap, but I think with more research folks can find an above average headset for a good deal.

Not sure why all the rave reviews.  The speakers sound OK, but not that great for music, and not nearly as good as my 2 speaker Polks for music.  I'm using them w/ a Denon AVR 590 receiver, and surround sound for movies is pretty good.  I wish they had these in a store so I could compare them to others side by side.

I was doing some customizing on the case for my Nexus 7. Worked great for the mods I needed to do. As for their original purpose, I only used the various sized USB and 3.5mm and they seemed to fit but did not have a lot of confidence that they would not fall out with normal everyday use.
Very inexpensive. Huge amounts of noise but that's to be expected with such a tiny wire and and no amplification to the signal. Probably need inline amp with wire this long and this small.
It's okay it's straight. Works well, has a cord to attach it to your device so you don't lose it.

Having ordered 2 Kindle Fire HD's, it was nice to find a three (3) pack instead of ordering them individually or a pack of two (2) and then an extra single one.This was easy to apply and press the bubbles out compared to others I've applied to family members Kindles, this may not be the case for all users but it was for me.So far there are no complaints

These sound good in the highs and low's. Some sounds are way to dim to enjoy and you cant use any male to male 3.5mm cord because when i did i got cracking sound maybe a bad pair? idk. wouldn't buy again thoUpdate. The bass nob can get glitchy and they are bright i prefer Koss portapros to these and those are cheaper then the Steez.

These are poor build quality, one came with unstitched zipper and the play sand I used to fill them works through the fabric.  I would suggest putting the sand inside of a large plastic bag first.  You get what you pay for, they will work with a little stitching but nothing to rave about.

Losing my ear buds became a problem during exercise sessions.  When I saw these phones at the Amazon site, I thought they might be a solution to my annoying pop-out issue.  In fact, they're not too comfortable and because they don't go all the way into my ears, I have to pump up the volume on my MP3 player to hear the audio.  I have had better -- more comfortable -- phones.

This is an attractive, nicely designed leather cover which does not add meaningfully to the minimal bulk of the Kindle Touch.  The materials appear to be of high quality with the exception of the flimsy plastic arm in which the light is located.  I'll be shocked if there aren't significant problems with that arm breaking due to normal wear and tear.  Otherwise, a fine product at a fair price.
My son did not really like these, it may be a personal thing, they sort of sit ON your ear, not around it. sort of like those 1980';s walkman headphones with the orange cushions.

This product arrived on time and as described.  It works well and keeps the screen clean and protected which is why I purchased it.  I had a problem getting the bubbles out during the installation but all in all I am happy with it.
we made the mistake we though work with lap topnop just work with  pc the product work propertygood quality

You don't need a voltage converter for an iPhone/iPod/iPad. Their chargers are dual voltage (I.e. 100-240V-50/60Hz). You only need a plug converter for less than $2. Look at your power supply or plug before you buy unnecessary (and expensive) transformers
These are the matte/anti-glare style protectors.  Please update description of this item.  I would have preferred the clear ones, but I guess these will do.
