Positive:-Good size for the hand-Very comfortableNegative:-The wheel is highly sensative, if you scroll, it'll scroll a little more than you intended to scroll. Furthermore, the extra scroll is up or down.
But the cord that comes with it is garbage. The quality once you get a proper 3,5mm cord in it is ok, but it sounds distant (but loud at the same time)

This battery was advertised as "OEM Fit" for the equivalent Apple part. That is not exactly true... the back lip is about 1mm too wide. But... it does fit in my Macbook, and does power it up nicely. I reset PRAM as recommended by earlier posters, and it charged and worked properly after that.If you want exact Apple fit, be prepared to pay about 3x for the privilege. If you want 'close enough', this battery works just fine.
Overpriced.nice quality for the cheap lens, overpriced for the quality.
para resolver esta bien, pero si puedes pagar algo mas completo mejor busca otra option. is good diffuser to solve, but the light does not diffuse far
This is not leather, it's vinyl. It works okay, and the feature that allows you to prop the iPad up is nice, but it is cheaply made and wears on the edges.
Product is not as expected because it does not have a good fit (loose) on new generation classic ipods. It is built for old generation ones with bigger dimensions. Not entirely happy with it.

It has a great resolution, big monitor perfect for LAN parties since it is light weight, yet there is one issue. In almost the middle of the screen, there are dead pixels with a dark area around them. I play allot of games with dark rooms and watch Netflix, so when ever there is a dark color over were the dead pixels are, they are very much noticeable.

This is a good product.  I like the fact that there are 3 sizes of tips available.  The sound is quite good, but not noticeably any better than the Jbuds, which I have. The price I paid was good for a Bose product. However, if I had to do it again, I would go with good quality headphones/ear buds that cost less than Bose.

I needed a longer optical cable...Cable works fine...but is Extremely thin...about 1/3 the thickness of the cable I was previously using. This cable is as thin as those small paper clips are. I question the quality or this cable...works fine on my xbox360..it is optical, so not to worried about interference or anything, but still, very thin and cheap feeling cable.

This is very durable and has a nice look and feel. However the ipod slides out the case when it is held upsided down. I have to put an on a rubber case so that it does not slide out and break. Its worth the price.

Holds the ipod Classic perfectly for the price. Stays on my arm okay (as a 22 year old female).  Gave it 3 stars because it can get a bit itchy where the straps meet but i just tuck a t-shirt underneath that area.

The keys on the keyboard...suck. A soft touch will NOT trigger the keys. You have to hit them almost like typewriter keys to get action. The rest of it is GREAT....though it does smell like plastic (I mean leather?)...
Mine was as pictured. It works but feels pretty lightweight compared to a real Dell adapter. Cords are shorter than Dell.
Some parts for installation, so 3 star, not elegant, not to mount a beautiful speaker, it will use for other applications
I'm afraid that to say anything one way or the other about this product would be ridiculous.  I wouldn't even know how to rate this.  The one thing I will say is that it seems to be working.Knight68
This unit was an improvement over plain rabbit ears on my HDTV set, but just barely. However it works fairly well on my analog set. The model DB2 made by Antennas Direct solved my HDTV problem.

This is the most expensive backpack I purchased. I purchased it at this high price, because I thought it would be indestructible. I started noticing breakage in the third month. I could have gotten a cheaper Backpack for a fraction of the cost.

I have this flash drive on my key chain, as it appears it was designed for, and the metal casing has started to separate and come apart at the flash drive end. Have to wiggle to get it to read in the computer, but works okay once you've found it's sweet spot.  For something designed to be moved around and placed with keys, it should really be a little more durable.
The transmitter works ok but it could be better. It picks up quite a bit of static. The volume level is also low although the iPhone and the 2006 Civic's factory stereo are at max volume.
I liked it very much, but the technology is outdated.  It does not do well with speed.I bought it because my wife wanted it....naturally it would be outdated.

Used it for a couple of months now with no major issues until last month.  The device would not power on coming out of sleep.  Now it seems to disconnect even when the computer is in use.  Had to replug it in every time for it to work.  Suspecting it has a loose USB connection.

It's nice to have control of all my tv things from my iPhone and iPad, but this thing eats batteries like no tomorrow.  I was thinking of rigging a switch on the side to shut off the power while I'm not using it, but I can't find the hardware to do it.
It functions well but is set to power down when not immediately in use. Waiting to power up again slows things down and is quite annoying. Thermaltake does not have this feature.
If you need to go a distance to more than one VGA monitor, make sure you get a powered splitter that boosts the VGA signal.
I have seen and purchased these at lower prices so I was disappointed on the cost but I needed them pretty quickly and I knew Sandisc's are good SD cards.

My husband used this headphones during his workouts at the gym and stated that he did not like them. He said that the volume control kept hitting against his chest and was really distracting. The cord kept twisting and he had to stop and untwist it multiple times. He did say that the earbuds stayed securely in his ear and the sound quality was okay. But, for working out, he will not continue to use them.

Once again, another cheap plastic lens from Tamron, including the PLASTIC LENS MOUNT! Save your money and buy the 18-250mm lens for another 100 bucks. You lose a whopping 50mm at the long end, but the optics and build are superior plus a gain on the short end.If you don't want to spend that much then consider the Sigma 28-300mm, unfortunatly the optics are a bit less than the Tamron 28-300mm, but the build quality is definitely superior.
This product worked great for when your child drops his ipad, but did not last that long, I had to replace it with a Kracken after 6 months.

Not at all worth $60.I'd be happy with it at $25 or less, and would see it being a very good value at $19.Simply, it's cheap... and not overly impressive.  For $60 I expected higher quality.  It's fine, works, ok to buy, just not a good value.

I purchased the front and rear covers. I installed both but ended up removing the screen cover because it made the screen look horrible. My iPad 2 screen is so clear that covering it with a dirty looking plastic sheet just made no sense. So i would only recommend the rear cover and the Apple cover. The rear protection is great so I set it down anywhere.
It is not so quiet.  I bought it to replace a fan in my HTPC.  I need to reopen the box to unhook the fan.  It is just annoyingly loud for my taste.

I don't like the keyboard layout as well as some other models.  Also, the screen isn't as bright as my 3 year old HP was.  Also, the glide pad isn't as positive feeling as some I've had.  This is my 5th laptop in 10 years.  It's all right, but I wish I'd have held out for a Sony or maybe even a Mac.  I don't like Vista, but that's not the computer's fault.

For those who have invested in a lot of firewire 800 accessories, this adapter is a must, but if you are not too invested, it may be faster/easier to go with USB 3.0 which has a theoretical max transfer of 5Gbps.
It definitely takes maybe an hour learning curve but once your past that this thing is a blast to use. I use it on my laptop because my finger grows weary after have to use the trackpad all day.

The case is nice and sturdy but if you re looking for a case to hold everything you need such as an extra battery or lens-forget abot it.  It is ONLY to hold the camera and nothing else.  Has a nice clip on the side to attach to your belt if you like but you will also need yt anotrase to hold everything else.

I bought one of these combos to my personal PC, it does almost well in everyday tasks. But gamers beware of it, it will lag and lose the signal in the worst moment, even with the receptor very near of the combo.It bugs me a lot when I'm playing some game and it stops working, i.e. running with your caracther and it stops working every time.
Function-wise, it does its job.  I just think it doesn't fit into the netbook as well as it should like the original one.
doing its work, but the tunning knobs work hard like the bolts are be crocked... but for this price I can accept that

It's okay.  Didn't find out til after I bought it that this tablet has WiFi issues. Drop, drop, drop,. Even obtained a new router thinking it was my problem and nope. Come to research the model number, and there are loads of customers in the Samsung forums asking "why wont wifi stay connected?". Paid top dollar for it  cause it's one of the highest rated tablets. It has some descent features but I don't think it's worth the price.

The concept and idea is pretty good but they could not execute it right. The video quality was horrible. I think it will improve over time but this time it went back to Amazon.I may try it after couple of years if the company still exits!
Trying to adjust on the fly is to many maneuvers. Especially between two viewers. Slick looking and its headed in the right direction.

I don't know why but this doesn't work for me.  There seems to be some interference with my programmable lighting system and this thing. I've had that problem with a few other electrical items so I'm sure this product works fine...just not with my setup.
I used it for almost 1week, and one of the fan starts to make loud noise. But it still does is job without breaking so I will give 3 starts. I think Im unlucky case when I read other reviews.

For the price of the filter set, I can't complain at all.  These lenses are well constructed and their quality are good enough for semi-pro photographers.  Why pay 5-10 times more for similar lenses if you only use them once in a while?
It's very difficult to insert the SDHC card into the slot.  The fit is just too snug.  After the battle to insert the card, the reader works fine.

but they are not nearly as good as the Canon packs they are compatible with.  The Vivitars charge up quickly but they simply don't yield the same run time.  They give me the same number of snaps with the flash off that the Canon genuine pack yields with 100% flash shooting.  The chargers is good and the squeeze bellow was a nice score for the money
determined that I did not need it for the application since the ethernet cable was wired in the apartment for which I purchased it.

The device works as a perfectly good bluetooth speakerphone.  However the metal clip used to mount it on the visor just simply will not even stay hooked into the device.  It just pops off no matter what.  It was cheap so I will probably just use it in some other location - but be warned, those metal clips don't like to stay attached to the back of the device so using it on your visor may not work.
I couldn't resist the price.  Good for some fill light.  But beware-- if you dim it (not full blast), and it's your only source of light, you'll see some strobing.
The amplifier was not working on one channel when I received it. I needed to use it so I opened it up and found an unsoldered component.  After the fix, the amplifier worked fine for the application.
This item was decent for its price.  However, if you do not unplug it when not in sue it devours batteries and it is a bit limiting in the station selections it allows.

I would recommment this product to one who can figure out electronics without much direction. So far I have not had the opportunity to work with the product. It is difficult with the directions that came with it to figure out how to use it and what it's capabilities are.

This USB hub works well; however, it is poorly made. The female USB connectors come out of their housings and the female USB connectors themselves bend easily when pressure is applied to the top and bottom of the housings.Good for short term use if you are rough on your electronic equipment.
This was not what I was looking for, so I gave it an average rating.  It looked well made but did not serve the function that I desired.
Okay keyboard.  Battery does not last long and the left click button gets stuck, but otherwise functional.  Much prefer Aerb Portable Mini Wireless Bluetooth Keyboard Handheld.

I bought this to go with the "CowboyStudio Pro 30-Inch Octagon Umbrella Speedlite Softbox for Nikon Canon Flash Light" instead of using flash units.  It works well for that.... ....  be sure and get the big boy 110wt CFL lights when you use it....  The umbrella holder is weak, but the price was weak too...... Lets see if it holds up for a few years....happy Shooting!

Unless you want to wrap extremely big cords do not order this product.  It does not have enough velcro to wrap a computer cord!  May be great for big extension cords, even hoses, but not made for everyday cord wrapping use.

Much cheaper than it looks. This case might protect the ipad if it falls flat on its back, though I'm pretty sure the case itself would break. We DID drop our iPad mini screen down, which shattered the glass, and this did not protect it. To be fair, I would not have expected it to.

If you ever plan to get this product, don't expect to get it for about a month. I was planning on getting another monitor so that I could play my Xbox right next to my PC. Instead I got this cheap item and it was a simple AUTOMATIC switch! I am so impressed with the fact that it automatically switches to what I'm doing. I wasn't expecting much, but was blown out of the waters.

This works well and is very pretty with all the blue lights. But why, oh why, did they make the 10th high-power iPad port only a charging port, not a data port? I have to plug into that port to charge, but switch to another port to sync! It's just illogical and frustrating.

It was ok. I did not like wearing the armband at all. Not that it was uncomfortable or anything. It just did not suit me. I did use the silicone skin.I purposely bought this run with, turn out I just stuck my ipod into my pocket, less cord swinging around.
Connects my controllers to the ps3 with ease. Also works great on couple cellphones in the house. It's not factory but it works great.
It's nice except that it said its does'nt require external power, but it does. So for me it was useless. If pluging it into a 110 power source is not an issue for you nice little hub

This charger does what it is supposed to, it charges the laptop.  However, it also produces the common squeal of all low-life-span and low-quality power supplies.  I am worried it will die.  Also, it has a light on it, a light that benefits nothing except people who love to see you lying awake at night because a stupid light is shining on your laptop charger.  Nobody likes the light.

looks good, doubles the battery time, no instructions on how to use the intervalometer so that's essentially useless now, also the remote needs to be within 10 feet of the camera and pointing directly at it to take the picture. But it looks good and seems to be a well built product. It also makes you look like a professional photographer.

This touchpad is a must for anybody that struggles with the confines of their current laptop. Windows 8 gestures really bring the new OS to life. Only issue for me is the unifying receiver you plug into your computer sometimes loses connectivity with my laptop, but this could be a personal issue of course. I'd recommend it to anybody that wants a great, quality touchpad. Of course, there's just no replacement for a traditional mouse for me.
Good idea. Can buy locally.

Works pretty good, but it isn't easy to learn and even then kind of difficlult/clumsy to use. The buttons are so small and so close together, it's hard to type and the airmouse is too sensitive. I do like that it does both IR and RF, but don't really "get" how to program it. The manual really sucks. Not sure that I'd buy another one.

I've used this drive to back up important data from two PCs and it performed well.Update:08/04/2010This drive died on me. It had no response. I contacted Western Digital and they have replaced it already at no charge. I did have to pay shipping on the old one to them.

This keyboard isn't the crisp scissor kind found in most modern laptops, or the old style click keys with a deep depression. It's just mushy and slow. It is however comfortable, and quiet. If you used it as your only keyboard, I assume you could get used to it. I returned it because it was hard to switch from the crisp keys on my laptop to this.

I installed this to monitor my garage doors and it is just a bit finicky. Sometimes when it closes it gives an alert that it is closed, then open, then closed all in a span of about 1 second. Other than that, it works like it's supposed to. Oh, the range isn't great compared to my hard-wired z-wave equipment -- but that's part of the price you pay with battery operated wireless products.

I was really happy with this for 14 months.  Suddenly it stopped working for the mouse,  keyboard and sound on the second computer while still working on the first.  I still get the internet on both computers though.  Maybe I should be happy it lasted this long, but I would have felt better if it  held out for another couple of years.
Nice compact product, good idea. Very time consuming to enter data. Needs interface so data could be imported from PC.

Maybe it is 24 dBi, but I could not get it to work alone without another omnidirectional antenna. Een if it works, one needs to figure out how to point it exactly in the right direction: I spent about 5 hours tinkering with it, and I could not find a good point...
Beware extension cord will not work at USB3.0 speed. Very hard to lock with SSD installed. Cheaply made but very light. The pouch does fitted.

The cover is very nice, just it does not fit snugly.  There is extra room and unless I am very carefully about inserting the Macbook Air into the cover, the cover shifts around.If iPearl provided a better fit, I would have rated it 4 or 5 stars.
...what you pay for.My wife used it for a couple of weeks then we got a Motorola T505 Bluetooth unit for her. The Soundfly is better than nothing.

so far... my console has frozen and while playing BF4 it has crashed twice.... EA says it's a firmware issue... Sony hasn't responded...while trying to play war frame it asked for an update and it froze the ps4... :/ who knows....NOT A FANBOY of Sony or Xbox :p...
It looks nice on your keyboard and really protects it. My only complaint is that at least as of today I think that it has slowed down my speed in typing. I don't understand why.

I received a defective unit that only played through one side of my HD595s and produced a loud hum at all times. I sent it back and got the Fiio E7/E9 combo DAC and amp and have been very pleased. It seems like from previous reviews it's hit or miss, I just happened to get a bad one. Sucks, because I wanted it to be good.
Good but not perfect. Makes the Air considerably heavy but all of the Keyboards do. A little flimsy but works well and easy for me to type on.

Products were very poorly packaged, one of the units arrived with broken belt clip.  The other is still intact, but the frail plastic construction looks like it could break at any moment.  Sound quality is okay, albeit a tad on the weak side.  Haven't had a chance to test the range, but if I do, I'll be sure to update my review accordingly.

Amazon product page stated that the protector sleeve is antistatic, but there product arrived practically unlabeled and I didn't notice any indication that it, indeed, was antistatic.Other than that, it fits 3.5 drive well.

Transformer Prime is right now the best tablet out there but there are still problems that should give anyone pause when considering buying it - apparently the GPS issue is hardware related (the alluminium backplate is causing it) and the WiFi signal seems to be worse than on all other WiFi devices. Still, Asus promised unlocking the devices bootloader which makes it quite interesting Android tablet. Especially with ICS coming very soon.

The packaging is literally a ziploc bag with a paper inset and some extra rubber part replacements. This lack of packaging may be how they keep the prices down. The earbuds are average to look at, average to use. Mine came in a pearly-pink color, "L" and "R" are marked. As long as inexpensive and average is what you want, these are a solid choice. If you want fancy-schmancy, keep shopping.
The product works fine and I would buy another.  The tab that holds the battery in place is a bit flimsy.  I constantly remind myself when I am handling it that I need to be careful with that tab.
It is okay, but I would not recommend it; the keyboard does not appears to be functionaly frendly to my taste.
Works, but is inexpensively built. Take care, sides will split apart when batteries andcover are replaced. A nice deal at the price.

it's a simple watch that i use for hiking. unfortunately the thermometer broke a month in after I took it to the beach... but it never really worked that well anyways because my body temp always skewed it up. So it didn't matter much.
It is sturdy for cardboard.  The buttons didn't stay hooked, and the glue came off.  I'm sure there are better systems out there that work better.

This adapter worked somewhat well and for the price still isn't a bad deal.  If you use tape adapters as much as I have you know they all crap out eventually with heavy every day use.  This one lasted 8 months before it stopped working so I guess I cant complain.

This didn't "blow me away," but it's a nice addition to a computer case with a window in it. The problem with these kind of lights is, the actual "cathode" tube is white, and just the outer casing is green, which means the output looks more white than green...this would be true of any color. It's the same light used in scanners.Overall, for the price, it looks pretty nice, and very easy to install with a basic molex connector.
If you want LEDs in your system, do not buy this, I bought 3 of these, all 3 LEDs are unresponsive.They do however make a good fan.

I hate to do this to Canon since I love the SD870IS Camera.  But in deference to the Amazon community that has helped me so much, I went to Fry's and purchased a LowePro Ridge 1 for 8.99 that is absolutely great AND INCLUDES SPACE FOR BATTERY AND MEMORY.  LowePro has slightly larger sizes as well.  Delighted with the quality of the LowePro.  Maybe Amazon offers it as well - I did not look.

Bad:sound level very low and weak bass (I'm also audiophile as it's name but I didn't like its sound)treble good but not satisfiedpouch has very good quality but useless (not practical and you need CIA Agent to solve how to use it)Good:material quality is very high standard (You feel high German quality in every detail)

This fits the difficult SkullCandy headphone input.  The quality of the product is great, a thicker cable than the OEM, even if it is red in color making the headphones look as if they had a red headed step child.Pros:  Fits ..great quality cable.Con:  Cable is short.  Does not have the volumne control as OEM.You get what you pay for, it works, and that is the bottom line until I can find a OEM cable.
Charges and transfers to the Ipod with ease, but, will not charge from a wall outlet! This is ithe only downfall in this product. If your on the go as I am, this product must have a CPU to charge!

This antenna works as described in the add, we were only having problems picking up one of the local stations. Its been up in some of the coldest weather we have had around here in a while and seems to hang in there. Not bad for an antenna that we just pointed in the direction of 60 miles away where the stations are located and not even in line of sight.

We ditched cable in September 2010, put this unit between the antenna and our TiVo series 2 with lifetime service.  TiVo does all the channel changing.  All good until about January 2013 when the zinwell started freezing up.  So not great lifespan but I'm buying another anyway - not a lot of options really for feeding broadcast to the analog only TiVo.
Not too great but at the same time not a bad keyboard. The back light is pretty cool as well.

These are utilized by by our field investigators and we have had mixed results. The picture quality is surprisingly good considering the price and size of the camera unit. The problems are that the units record sound and you can't turn this feature off. Also, we received multiple units that were DOA and had to return to Amazon for refund. As usual, Amazon was great and refund our money promptly.

Nice to have case for Nexus 7 tablet. The stand is not all that adaptable, but the case does serve the basic purpose of covering up the tablet (with quite some ventilation on the sides), and holding it at a vertical angle on a flat surface. It does sleep/wake the Nexus 7 tablet when closed/opened -- though I'm not sure if it's a Nexus 7 feature or whether the case does something.
very slow upload rate on my macOS 10.7. I wouldn't be surprised if apple was limiting it so it could promote Thunderbolt though.

You can take this speakers anywhere and specs say battery last 10+ hours (I haven't tried this yet) however for $299 I expected better sound quality. If you are happy with your iPhone standard earphones then you will find this unit very useful. I did not return it because I want to carry it with me on my travels.

I INSTALLED THIS HARD DRIVE IN A USED PC I PURCHASED.  THOUGH THERE ARE NO INSTRUCTIONS, INSTALLATION WAS PRETTY STRAIGHT FORWARD.  I SHOPPED PRICES AND COULD NOT BEAT AMAZON'S PRICE.  WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE NEEDING A REPLACEMENT DRIVE AT A BARGAIN PRICE.
I bought this not seeing the SATA so I don't have a HD that will work with it so I am not looking for one but I am sure it is going to work as shown but I can't say yes or no right now. Thank you

The WL-ANT-157 made a slight improvement over the antennas that came with my Asus RT-N16 wireless router.Pros:Easy to installAfforded a slight improvement to signal level at test locationsCons:Limited aiming rangeA bit pricey for the minimal improvement to range and signal

Works great though I think the overall construction is somewhat flimsy.  The mouse buttons at the bottom of the track pad are difficult to press and someway flimsy feeling.  Locks nicely into place and easy to detach.
Case is rugged, and well protected, but hard to move apps side to side sometimes, and kickstand fell off after a while.

I followed the directions, but still got air bubbles. I think it was my lack of skill applying it and not the product. There is a second one included. I will have to get someone with more skill to try again. The product does do its job of protecting the screen.
I like that it is long, but it does not charge the tablet completely and it doesn't charge as fast as the original. It does well enough for a spare which is what I intended.
Plastic cover was hard to strip and some wire came along with the plastic when pulled off. Cant anything be made with quality when it come from China.

They are ok, but they didn't deliver the normally outstanding audio that I have come to expect with Skullcandy. They really don't stay in the ears, though they won't fall off like the earbuds with out an ear hanger. I use them at work when I have to work solo in a building.
its a very thin leather, and its fake leather. My major negative is that there is somehting about it (not sure what) but it attract dirt REALLY easily.
May work on the Nikon flashes but it shape is not  suitable for my flash.  the price may be good. but the shipping is not worth  the package they sent it in.
Didn't work for me but may work for others.  Did not successfully adapt the device as intended. Fits the junk box of new and used useless electronic castoffs just fine however.

Pros:Good qualitynice fluid headCons:Tips over easythe bottom feet caps have all disappeared and I haven't used it muchthe thread for the handle tightening looked used and is getting dullerthe sticker for the knobs to open and lock have all fallen off so I have to test each one every time.the case it what everthe plate had the squishy things come offit's heavy

I read the other reviews and I thought my rikiki would barely fit into this but its actually quite big. although easy to use and sturdy. but does its job well. Feels nice. But could have been smaller.

Like any battery it starts out lasting a long time and then capacity diminishes over time.  After 6 months or so it has gone from about 3 hours to 2 hours.  Not bad, not great.  Had A LOT of trouble with the seller.  They messed up and sent the wrong battery and couldn't figure it out for about a month.  After a scathing review they made it right.

This seemed like a product I would like, and I probably would have continued to like it if it had continued to work after a day. I plugged the headphones in and they worked. The control worked great, too. Then an hour later, I tried again and they'd stopped working. I could listen to music, but the controls did nothing. I returned them to amazon and got a refund.

The mic is awful compaired to some others I've baught. And I've baught a lot.The headphones do not insulate sound from the mic at all. So you get major feedback that annoys people on the other end.Or yourself if you have a audio monitor situation.

This lens is a nice tele for beginners.  It takes fairly crisp images with proper light.  There is no stabilization so low light situations, (even evenings or shaded areas) will require a tripod.  The lens is quite heavy but that is to be expected.  The build quality is a tad suspect.  There is actually several small specs of dust on the inside of the lens.
somehow it doesn't word on my SATA ports. I tried to connect my acomdata 2.5 drive to my computer but this cable won't do the job. I wonder it is the hard drive itself has to be blamed.

The price is great and you think your getting a deal, but they are cheaply made and the compression tool only works for the included connectors. It is much better to buy your equipment separate, even though you might have to spend more.

The feel is fine. The look is fine, maybe a little boring. It worked without software and the response was very good, but there are no side buttons for navigation and I know I have a small laptop mouse that has them and feels a little better.Fine for occasional use.

At First I was crazy about this product, and it did its job 80% of d time, But I need 100% I returnrd it... The ease of use is amazing, the voice is very clear,But it got me into neighborhoods 2 out of 4 times,Risky..... The screen is a thumbs Down... I bought a McNally instead 7inch monitor...... I like d fact is interactive.......u can tell them when they mess up next time u upload ure gps...
The product arrived fine and is very nice I have not been able to get the keyboard to sink with my tablet so it has not been used very frustrated

Got this a while ago and although it's fairly flimsy plastic and you can not use the fan on your lap as the fan part has nothing covering it (use it with a computer lap board), it does the job and hasn't broken yet. It's quiet but kind of odd looking but keeps our computers cool. Not bad for the price

There is an even better version of this drive out,Western Digital WD10EADS 1TB SATA 32MB Cache Green Power Bulk/OEM Hard Drive.  Look for that version instead - it has better speed, and lower power consumption.  Tom's Hardware says "We have to advise against getting the first generation Caviar Green drive--the WD10EACS--because the current model WD10EADS is just so much better. ... If you want an efficient drive go for the WD Caviar Green WD10EADS, not the WD10EACS."

I have a Canon 60D and I had focusing problems @ 300mm.  Pictures were not that good. I even did some comparisons with the Canon EF 70-300mm f/4-5.6 IS USM and liked better the Canon. Even though, the Canon is like $50 more expensive than the Tamron I still preffered the Canon.

This is just what it is a cheap radio.  I got it and the FM with the antenna all the way up can't really get the job done on local stations so don't be moving.  And as for AM all I get out of it is a humming sound no stations.
It was great while it worked, but once the built in light stopped working, it became just another cover.I was disappointed because I used the light all the time.

I purchased this bracket for a 22" HDTV.  As described, the bracket is tilt and swivel.It is easy to install. I mount it up pretty high on the wall, and would recommend having an extra pair of hands to hold the TV when mounting, although if you are good at handy work, you may be able to do it all on your own.Overall a good priced product.

If you have some more bucks don't buy this router! It maybe have the specified range if you use it outdoors which is not usual,of course ,or in any open space without walls,etc. . Inside a building its range is too short. Other problem, it warms a lot after a short use.

No complaints really.  Pretty much satisfied. It does what it is suppose to do, though maybe a little short sometimes when you require some more extension / length.  But happy with the purchase and it was sold at a good price.
It is cheap and good to use, though I have no chance to test it with a monster CPU. But I guess it will be OK to it.
this charger is cheap it's so weak it have to be careful how to plug it on i use it for a Ad255e Acer Aspire one it works ! but be careful

The battery work good after 2-3 charges. The only problem I have is you have to charge two batteries at a time. My device only uses 1 AAA battery and I would have liked to have a fully charged battery ready at all times.
These work great for 4-6 months, then the wires start to break.  For the price, they are disposable.  Buy a few!
Got these at a great price. I find it easier to just stick with using rubber bands to bundle up cords though.

This is the first system we bought, therefore we are not sure how does it stack up against other systems. It gave a good reception for 1.5 miles in city with no tall buildings and then died off. I expect it to cover larger area in rural setting.

It does the job, but I'm having a hard time believing its a class 10. I replaced a 32g class 4 with this sony 64 class10. The class 4 sandisk is a good deal faster.  I needed more space so double my storage with a 64. I'll stick to sandisk.
OK does what it is supposed to.
The unit itself works fine but it was not that comfortable for long periods - I could feel it the whole time.

Great price when I got it, in fact counldnt find a better price for almost a year, but ther was a recall on it and that was fixed easy enough but have had other problems and probably won't get a Samsung again, unless giving a great extended warranty
These are decent for the money headphones. Don't expect audiophile perfection but for simple listening they do the job and handy as an extra pair.
The product itself was okay however, my requirements changed after purchased, so I returned it. I would recommend it to others.

I bought this lens filter to attach to my Olympus digital.I searched first for the correct filter, I ordered and was sent the filter.Turns out you can't add filters to the Olympus.  Threading is wronginternal computer can't adjust to a filter.  Why then does it come upwhen you search for Olympus size filters (By model) ?This is not the fault of the supplier -

The product is just OK. It fits well on my Mac but there are some sharped plastic in the edge of cover (top and bottom) which clearly means that the finishing is not that great.Besides that, the cover looks cool, I do not regret on my purchase, just will look for a different brand next time.
This is my second one of these.  I got this as a backup to the original Directv remote.  Sometimes you have to push hard on the buttons.  Guess you get what you pay for!
THis is a good basic studio kit, but the lights get really hot. This is only good for smaller products. Don't try to put large items in here, only things like: jewelry, cameras, wallets, etc.

Used this keyboard and mouse for about year. The mouse is excellent in ergonomics. The battery life is very good, and range is also fine.The keyboard is too stiff. It may be better than my stock Lenovo keyboard, but not as good as a stock HP keyboard in terms of stroking depth and feel.The mouse deserve 5 stars, and the keyboard deserve 3 stars IMHO.
When you wear these there is some noise cancelling effect but it leaves you wondering if the effect is worth the price. the case is nice but I would try something else.

Decent reflector...though you have to zip, unzip and flip around if you want to use different sides of the reflector. The description sounds as though there are 5 reflector included in one. Item is fairly priced though.

Easy to install with fairly good instructions and squeegee.  There's nothing military about it except for the name; but I didn't expect anything to the contrary.  Most of these film due an adequate job of protecting the screen from minor to moderate scratches however once the film is scratched be prepared to buy another film if you're like me and can't stand having to peer around a noticeable scar on your "ArmorSuit Military Shield."

The sound quality was quite good, and the buds were relatively comfortable in my ear.  But unfortunately the quality of the product is not good - after 6 months of VERY infrequent use, the right bud already has scratchy/reduced sound.  Twirling the plug in the headphone jack makes a scratchy sound and will occasionally improve the sound to the right bud, but it seems like the wires to that side are fraying or otherwise decaying.  Not good.

I don't have this product.  The solution I came up with is to put velcro (I used industrial strength) on the exterior side of the lens cap, and on the bottom of the camera (use the soft velcro on whichever of those will be touching something in your camera bag that the hard velcro will stick to).  I haven't used the camera much since, but it seems good so far.
Cheeply made cable. There are plenty of other cables of amazon for a good price that are of much higher quality.
Cheap and effective!

It worked well for about 2 days, looked great, vivid colors and very fast in BF3, WoW, Skyrim etc., I started getting screen tearing and artifacts, check the temps, it never got over 65 c, tried different drivers, nothing worked. Im a MSI fan, because I have never had a bad pc part from them, this is the first after 15+ years. Amazon was great, they refunded every penny.
This is not compatible with the harmony 720. It works well enough and is inexpensive.

Pros- excellent battery life, decent comfort, light portable, uses disposable batteries good fidelity for an on the ear headphoneCons- thin flimsy connections cords, After a using these for several airplane prips, I lost the right side channel broken wire somehere.For the price they are not durable enough except for very light occasional use. Wont hold up to traveling for any length of time. Sennheiser wants 80.00 to repair. Would not buy these again due to the flimsy wiring used.

A bit pricey but needed it for my ipad2 (16GB Wi-Fi Only).  Works like any other external drive with my PC, just drag and drop files. Very easy to pair with my ipad2.  Considering the price, a carry case or pouch should be included. 5 hours of usage per full charge seems a bit too short. The apps need a lot of improvement (but that's another story). Overall, this will do until a better one comes out.

I bought this for my daughter when I bought her a back-up hard drive. It was listed on Amazon adjacent to the hard drive, which was slightly misleading because I inferred that it would fit the Seagate. The Seagate is slightly larger than the My Passport Essential for which the carrying case is made. It takes some stuffing and maneuvering to get the zipper to close.

It's light and well-shaped. The speed is OK. Long-lasting battery.But I don't like the touch pad. It is not smoothy. In addition, it always very hot.... And when I turn on the laptop, it says the battery is not suitable for this laptop. I really don't know why.
The range on this little guy is only about 30', so if that's all you need then you're set. When you ARE within 30 feet, it is very fast,
This kit has more than what you need. The only con is that the speaker wire is not color coded or marked for pos/neg . I did not use the speaker wire anyway, overall it's okay

Easy to install a hard drive in. However, there is no support for the drive inside the box except the SATA connector so it feels loose.I wish the drive could be mounted on screws. The USB cable connectors are not labeled. My laptop crashed when I connected them incorrectly at first time.
Was not compatible with the USB 3 DVD drive I had. So it's being used as a USB 2 hub, and I returned the DVD drive.

The crimping action of this tool works fine, but the wire cutter/stripper is pretty iffy. You are better off to slice lightly around the jacket, removing about an inch and a half, and then lining up and flattening the necessary strands, and cutting to length (about 1/4" for R11 and 1/2: for R45).  Easier to work with that way, and less errors.
You'd be better off buying a more expensive one, but this does the job for my son. He uses it and hasn't had any problems.
I was aware that the product would be thin but it's quite thin.  Although, I absolutely love the color, I probably won't use it much. There's no protection at all.
Very comfortable with good, detailed sound ... but the bass is lacking. They are much bigger and more plasticky than I had anticipated from the images.
These speakers connected so easily with my computer.  The volume can be adjusted and the speakers are small enough to be placed in a multiple locations.
I hate doing the warranty thing.  The KB was great for the first couple of months but will no longer charge.  Too late to return it.  Just beware that if it breaks, you need a spare KB
As a diffuser, it works fine and easy to carry.  But the fitting is not good. It falls off from my Canon EX430 flash everytime.  I am using tape to keep it in position.
Only complaint is the audio, image wise its great. Would buy another one if it was back at 60ish bucks.
We bought for Tab 3s.  The fit is too loose to trust it.  We will have to buy a 'shell-type' case to make it a little bigger and the fit tighter.  So, until then, the jury remains out.

Cons: The power and volume keys are difficult to press now and not a big deal, but the micro SD slot is covered up. I don't know why there are magnets in the lower right corner of the case when there is nothing on the cover to catch here.Pros: nice build and finish quality. A good looking case.
spend another $10 - $20 and get the Antec Nine Hundred Two instead it is a much nicer case.

I would have loved to have given this product 5 stars because the sound is really good (good bass), but the maker of this product should have extended the flexible part that goes around the back of the ear an extra 1/2 inch.  This would have given it a tighter fit to keep it in the ear more securely.  Overall good product but the short flexi hurts it.

It charges pretty well, but the biggest problem I have with this cable is that it's pretty difficult to plug it into a phone that's in a case because of the thickness of the end. It would be nice if it were just a little bit thinner.

For a dirt cheap lavaliere this thing gets okay results at best...If you are using planning to use a mic for anything other than pure hobby...do yourself a favor and get the ATR899.Do not waste your time on this, you're audio quality will not be professional.
The tip of the lightning end is too thick. Those with a case will have a hard time getting it to fit. I would redesign it with a smaller tip

This product is NOT made to work with an electrical box of any type.  It's designed to knock a hole in your sheet rock and just screw in tiny screws to hold this on the wall which makes for a very flimsy install.  IF you want to use an electrical box you MUST cut lots of the box down and drill the holes of this unit out where the sheet rock screws go

While a little bulky, it looks like a nice case.PROS: Very solid, scissor keyboard for a better feel, swivel back, extra padding to protect the screen.CONS: Just called Targus and none of their cases come with the magnets to put your iPad 2 in sleep mode. (Everyone else seems to have them these days.) Bulky style.Nice try.  Maybe the next version will address the critical missing features.
Trying to get this to work with a Mac suuucks, but it's doable. Only took me three days to figure it out, and even after I got it to work, I don't remember the steps I took. Just glad it works.

These "aftermarket" accessory parts for the Zune player are rather cheap and not very good quality so I supect they are not going to last very long but they do function well enough but I question their longevity.

Quality of product is unknown as product was never receiwed. Order was cancelled after seller got sick and was unable to provided the product in the timeframe promised. Payment has been refunded. Seller sounded like he would be a good person to do business with.
This case was very nice quality but since I returned the IPOD (I hate I-tunes and anything Apple) I returned the case too, but it was a nice case.
The headphones worked great but they broke within about 4 weeks.  Oh well--glad they were too much money.  More like disposable.

Works like a champ on the table, but I got it to use in my recliner and there is isn't all that good. It's better than nothing, but needs to be larger for it to do a real good job. Works well with a pillow behind it, but then I could just fold the pillow and forget using the bean bag.
aumenta bastante el sonido en exteriores aunque se reduce los agudos de los audios algo que no me gusto mucho...

The box said nothing about being mac compatible...not sure whether it is or isn't but from the research I've done online it seems as though airport express is the best way to link the slingbox if you have a mac+airport network.

As stated in other reviews Verbatim has changed and is falling apart. Most of my Verbatim discs have been working but I have had some coasters. Sad part is I never used to have any coasters with Verbatim and I have been doing nothing different. When I pay close attention to detail my discs do have small bubbles in the inner circle and almost looks like if the inside is peeling. Buyers beware of disc quality.

Fit's the HP TouchPad perfectly. Nice svelte casing that feels even better than Apple's own iPad 1 Case. so far I think this is the only TouchPad case that is Touchstone Dock compatible.Update: Just a warning that this case warps on the power and volume parts after prolonged use. I'm not sure why
It's ok for what it is. It was built well enough and it's a good value. If you only have a camera and one lens it works ok for that..If you have more it will be too small.

I have ubuntu by crouton on a chromebook. Was not able to get item to work through no fault of the maker or seller.

Cheap basic slow charger, but at least it does its job. It charges NiCd and NiMH batteries slowly and properly (as "fast chargers" can greatly shorten the life of rechargeable batteries). Paperwork is written in Chinglish (Chinese translated to English), which does state specifically that it charges for 10 hours then automatically shuts off. So far after 4 hours with 2 batteries that were around half full has not stopped the charging process.

I rate this 3 stars it is a good case the only problem is the bottom where the home button the plastic along the bottom is flimsy and irritatin kind of like the strip along the bottom on iphone 5 otterbox commuter only there is no hard plastic to hold it in place on this case

I ordered this 600 mAh battery because in my experience the 600mAh has a longer service life than the 700mAh batteries. I received 700mAh batteries. They work, but were not the description of what I was ordering! Since I expect these batteries only to last about a year as my last set of 700mAh lasted, I only gave a 3 stars. My original 600mAh batteries lasted over 4 years before becoming weak.

It's about a 10x - 35x monocular.  For the $12 I paid, they have a good enough quality to see things, not for birdwatching type of activity.  At max zoom, it's impossible to hold steady by hand, so it luckily has a tripod screw place.  Just remember that the higher zoom ranges lower the amount of light seen by a huge factor.

I bought this item for an LG VX-8700 cell phone.  I already had a Verizon cable with an equally useless softwarre, but good driver.  The Verizon package costs $30, although it comes with a great thick cable.  I ended up using the free BITPIM software with either cable.  My advice is to buy this cable, download the USB driver for your phone, then use BITPIM to sync your contacts with Outlook.

Really the idea of this product is excellent but when you recieve the item, it falls short of expectations by being too short for keyboards. I tried to pull it to expand but alas it could not cover the numbers part of the keyboards

This is perfect for a tiny point and shoot but not for a heavy camera. The magnetic aspect may have some use somewhere but in nature it's useless. For me there is still no beating a real tripod and many of them have become quite small and compact. This is good for a small camera only.
sometimes you have to jiggle the power cord to make it work. My buddy has the same player and the same problem. Gets worse as more use occurs.

I've bought two of these now, and they are nice and small, but they're very finicky about what they will and will not power.  Don't plan to run more than a mouse and maybe one other low powered device off it at any one time, it seems to run into trouble otherwise.

Works ok. I was hoping it had more range. A room mate had a belkin T63 that had a lot of range- 50'.This one has around 30' of unblocked range. Throw your phone in your pocket or close a door and it gets spottie.
Quite good even though the plug configuration is awkward, the distance between each adapter is too little, i.e. cannot use all of them.
The product is good and serves my purpose. There are many options on the website but price matters.. So recommend this

I needed something light to help me carry my Canon Rebel T2i. This seemed to be a good option. I bought it but I find it overpriced. I am trying it in my upcoming Chicago trip. If i dont like it I will return it. I think this should not be more than $10-15.

The converter fits perfectly in my DVD bay but it's very hard to install an inner USB componet because the screw holes are recessed in behind the outer edge making it necessary to have a magnetic screwdriver(which I didn't have) to get the screws started. Could be designed better.

I do like how thick this cable is and its 10ft length.  I bought it to charge my iPhone 5 with a Micro USB to Lightening adapter. It does charge my iPhone 5 when all put together but it will not sync my phone to my iTunes.  So that is the only reason I give this product 3 stars instead of 5.  But cable itself is if good quality and build.

i bought this item so my mom cud watch blu-ray movies and also use netflix. i was never able to use the wireless function so i had to use an ethernet cable. once i was able to use the internet i tried to go on youtube; it worked, however, the streaming speed was horrible. then i tried to use netflix which never worked even with assistance from the lg technicians. so not worth it

These worked fine. Are they as easy to work with as the expensive screen protectors?  No. But it was easy enough to use the rag they give you to remove bubbles. At the end I had like 4 or 5 tiny bubbles and I can deal with that for the price I paid.
the usb on the back caused my mac to restart when i would plug something into about 50% of the time.  very annoying but the fan is really really good!

Be warned, if you got this for the component video output like I did, it won't work with standard component cables. It requires a custom cable sold separately by Roku only that costs $15.I took off two stars for being an incomplete product with extra stuff you have to buy that is available only from Roku.

I found it a pian in the rump to install, had to throw away the first one and start all over again. It is very hard to get the bubbles out with the cardboard they provide. But once u have it on there is no glare. Love it and a product but the 3 rating is because it is hard to put on and get the bubbles out.. Great price.
Bait and switch. Not gold tipped. It works for now but i will be looking for a gold tipped version. These will do in a pinch but i use gold for better contact.

I purchased a Linksys WPC54GS after buying a Dlink wireless card that simply did not work with my IBM laptop.  The installation procedure on the Linksys was very smooth and intuitive and it worked immediately after installation.  The card gets decent wireless reception in all areas of my house (with my Linksys router with SpeedBooster).  All-in-all a decent product with good performance. The speed could be a bit better but at least it works!
Looks good and is sturdy enough for its purpose.  Very hard to open and close, stiff.  I have left mine open, which is not a problem due to its size.
It does protect the iPod but because it is a soft silicon it is a bit thick around the buttons which them hard to press sometimes.

NASA produces TV shows in 3D about current space programs. I use this to watch those shows and 3D photos from the new technology camers that use the red/blue effect to display photos. Note my glasses came in a black frame like sun glasses not white paper as shown on this photo.
I love the fact it has IR for remote control. Will wait for rear facing camera. Plan to buy one as soon as camera upgrades.

There is not much to say about this product.  It holds the Flip and access to the camera is quick because of the flap closure.  There is not much in the way of padding to prevent damage if you drop it and whatever I paid for it was probly more than it was worth but I am not going to complain because it is satisfactory.

Believe it or not the Canon A430 4MP superfine mode is worse than my old Nikon Coolpix 2500 2MP...Wait at least 5 seconds for the flash between shot, and you know the little ones don't sit still.  Kodak moments are gone before the camera cooperated.Color is not quite accurate either...Other than that, has lots of extra features...but that is not the reason I buy a camera.I'm going to give Canon another try with the SD600 model...

I think it's ok but because the sony headphones don't work properly that ADORAMA sold to me and won't replace I don't know if it is the headphones or the sony adapter but the sound breaks up all the time don't buy

This Receiver does surround sound very well. I do not like the feel of these ear buds for longer term wear (an hour in the gym, etc).  I'm really missing my old pair that the cat ate and was hoping that these would be it. So-so. Many of the search features don't work and the unit sometimes can't locate a satellite. The built-in Garmin in our other car works much better.

The screen protector does the job with a few caveats:Pros:-Easy to apply (no bubbles as there is space between screen and LCD protector)-Protects screen as advertisedCons:-The screen protector makes the touch screen on my Nex-5R harder to use.-I have dealt with these type of bubble-less screen protectors before and eventually they will fall off within 3-4 months.-Sony logo is backwards on Nex-5R

It's a small antenna so it's reception isn't going to be excellent..but I thought it would be a bit better than this. It's not an awful product if you have a strong signal nearby but i wouldn't rely on it if you are a bit further from the transmitter.

Tough case with a nice fit but adds significant bulk to the player.  I purchased this case for my son but decided to get the silicone skin ones for myself. I cancelled this order.
Its a ok product but it does leave bubble ( with I hate ) and it does leave a LOT of fingerprints.

i owned the form2 headphones.after i bought them i was dissaponted.they didnt sound as good as they clamed they would.i gave them away.

I want to like this product, and know that some people swear by these, but I really just can't bring myself to get used to it. The added resistance of the plastic, in combination with the odd tactile feedback that it creates, really hampers my ability to type quickly.
The price was right and it does the job well....it does not screw on backwards for storage, but the price was right!

It's a pretty durable, spacious case, but the lining where the Velcro opens the case broke along the seam after continued opening...not too happy about that. The strap it comes with is convenient though.

Had to send this back because it did not fit my Corsair's toolless drive mounts.  Half-length chassis was too short to reach enough mounting holes too allow it be effectively fastened in with screws or I would have still used it.  Compact clean design, cheap plastic case.
Es un producto que rinde en tares normales en HD o Gamer no extremo, por el precio vale la pena la inversión, y no da mayores problemas, funciona con kit 3D de nvidea

This works well and will pay for itself vs. renting one from Comcast/Xfinity in about 10 months.It was essentially plug and play. I connected the cabled feed and the computer with Comcast tech during the install. It worked perfectly. After he left I plugged it into my wireless router. Again - no issues.Would be a 5 star but was a obviously an open box unit - Amazon should have sold it as used...

When it works it's great.  The problem is it has a mind of it's own and just quits from time to time.  It does not shuffle well and is want to play the same tunes over and over and over - you get the idea.  A lot of money for a product with a bunch of electronic glitches.
Does it's job. Would be considered really slow if you have a higher end DSLR, but it would be fine for the lower or consumer end DSLRs.

Had this about 2 years, one moring went to turn it on, no speaker icons, no sound, no network.  HDMI board has fried and from searching the net seems to be a recurring issue with this modle.  No upscaling with ipod Universal doc.
It is a simple nice looking indoor antenna.  Its performance is average.  I am a little disappointed as it did not receive more stations than the flat antenna I had.
Will do in a pinch but what it lacks in price it makes up in being fragile. Originally purchased this for my Samsung 840 pro but unfortunately broke at the head once or twice after use.

It's ok mine is starting to fall apart but it did last about 8 months the retraceable thing fell apart in about 2 months. I now have to jiggle the cord for it to work. You get what you pay for might as well order 5 or get a more expensive one for better quality.

I am disappointed in the sound that comes from this device. It seems to pick up ambient electrical emissions and send them out as a "pop" of a "pip". Very annoying. The directional design does not give much choice in room placement. It is heavy to carry. Not the best Bluetooth in my arsenal.

This works fine as a wireless receiver, but the chipset won't work as an access point in infrastructure mode with raspberry pi, which was the reason I wanted it in the first place. If you're just wanting a receiver, then this should work fine.

Excellent resolution. Just wish I could save video locally. It's frustrating that so many web cams require a subscription to save video. These headphones do not stay seated properly in my ears. The right side continually pops out and dangles a few millimeters outside my ear; far enough to make it inaudible over the left.  That said, I've yet to find. Pair I am happy with.

The measurements are listed, but I still didn't realize how extremely small and thin this stick is. I don't imagine it would survive being stepped on, and its size makes it particularly easy to misplace. It goes into the USB port label side up, and fits very loosely.It occurred to me that it could be a good medium for hiding personal data in case of theft, because it's so small that it's easy to miss if hidden.

This update of our old Garmin has lifetime updates for US and Canada.  It's handsome and has a few very good improvements over the older model.It suffers from the same problems as the old Garmin.  It gives you a choice: "Shortest Distance" or "Shortest Time."  What I really want is "SMARTEST ROUTE."  You, Garmin, pick the best route based on the kinds of roads and other factors - perhaps a compromise between distance and time.Perhaps I'm asking too much.

I found this remote unreasonably difficult to program for some of my components, particularly my Yamaha receiver.  The receiver is a relatively new model, and should not have been that difficult.  I could have made it work, eventually, but I ended up not using it and using the RCA RCRPS06GR 6-Device Remote with Presets instead.  It is a much better remote in my opinion.
These were OK, but the tips did not hold up after a few months. I don't think you really need one to use a tablet anyway.

Opened package set up monitor and it automatically calibrated. I tweaked the settings a bit. Acceptable Monitor. Has trouble adjusting to different Resolutions in different games. I notice a kind of distortion that fuzzes out vertical lines. When it is set to the recommended resolution, it performs wonderfully. The speakers are unacceptable, Very thin sounding. Low Price decent picture.

I bought this for my parents, as my mother was ill and she wanted a two-way system rather than the one-way baby monitor.  It is fine for it's intended purpose, but a little complicated for older persons (and a little for us in our 40's).  It is also very light weight, so it is easily knocked off.  You have to use batteries, or find a DC adapter.  Fortunately we had a couple laying around.

well, the remote doesnt work, it doesn't automatically switch over when i turn on my blue ray.  but it does allow me to hook 2 devices to the one HDMI line, and the picture quaity doesn't seem to suffer.

I am giving 3 Stars only because the refund was processed quickly and handled without issue. The product absolutely will not fit a Nook as advertised.  The case is a full inch too short, and so narrow that I felt it would rip while sliding the nook in.
Like this product initially when i bought which is 8-10 months back.The only problem i see with this one is that whenever i connect this to computer, it becomes slow.Started seeing this recently.

Generally pleased with this flash drive if it has any drawbacks I would say It could have a faster write time. I have read of some drives failing but not so far for me.

These are perfect for my needs. They are a bit flimsy so don't expect them to hold up to alot of use. However, my intended use is only occassional. I was just trying to consolidate collections so it worked well. I would like to find the same product but a bit beefier but still unable. Overall, for the cheap price they are great so far.

I've owned these cables for a few months now and while the cables themselves are extremely sturdy and resilient, the latches on the micro-usb connectors have stopped holding themselves into my devices on both of the cables I own. They kind of "slip out" as described by another review.. This makes connecting devices difficult because if i jostle it around the tiniest bit, the device will disconnect. I wanted to use this to split MacBook Pro's DVI-I to 1x DVI-D and 1x VGA. DVI-D would go to KVM switch, VGA would go directly to a monitor. It's kinda OK, it does its job to put the tablet in front your radio. movement mechanism needs improvement. A little bit pricey for what it does really.
I think Belkin should stay away from China made junk in flimsy stand. This make Belkin as the very crappy company just like Made in Japan in 1930's.

Was hoping for something a touch nicer but overall this is what i expected.  It's rigid and cheaper feel plastic.  The connectors are good and well shielded.  3 stars is what i expected and it meets expectations.

The plastic used in the outer cover is a somewhat hard type. Making the cable very stiff and difficult to work.

This model is probably out of production since all TV broadcasts are not digital.  The radio works fine.  I like the weather radio feature although it is unable to receive any but analog television signals.

for the right PriceI first put a JVC in it and after that an Pioneer Radio .... it is a pain to cut a hole into it to get the USB ports from the back trough it but this also shows - how strudy it is and the price is also great

I thought the bag would be a little bigger.. Its just the right size for me to turn the camera sideways in order for it to fit in bag

it was new but didn't come with many ear piece option so it don't fix over the ear very good. The keyboard only reaches about 2 feet if the receiver isn't placed in a high spot with line of site. Mouse was clunky, even with my large hands. Started using a portable wireless mouse instead. These ear buds ended up being very disappointing. I do not hear any enhanced bass, and they don't even sound as good as other regular (cheaper) ear buds I've tried. It seems that they really missed the mark on this one.
