This worked perfectly with my Dell when docked but when the Dell was replaced by an HP, the KVM switch would not consistently output video.  After email and phone calls to both Bell and Belkin, it was decided that there was a product limitation on the KVM switch and that it just wouldn't work.  Belkin said there recommendation is not to use the Flip with a docking station although it does NOT state that in their product literature.

This tripod is ok for it's price.  It's Chinese, not Italian.It does what it's supposed to, but I'm not too happy about a NASTY pinch I got when unlocking one of the levers.I would get one that has different locking levers.

It worked with my Samsung plasma TV, but I didn't like the quality of picture I was getting.  I'm sure it's the same with all 3D glasses, but I'd rather just watch the movie in 2d and get all the vibrant colors and clarity.

Works.  But once they are locked in it's very hard to remove.  Can't disconnect them with my bare hands.  I have had to use something with a flat surface to remove.  If installed in a cabinet with limited access.  I would be very very difficult to disconnect.

I bought this memory card for my son's innotab..unfortunately it won't pe work in his device so I end up switching it to my camera and it works pretty well. I just hope that  my son's device sees this memory card than expecting it working on my camera

I intended to use this Walkman at the health club while I exercised.  I like to listen to sports talk radio so it was meant to replace a MP3 player.  Unfortunately AM radio reception is NOT one of its strong points -- the sound is either full of static or fades in and out.  However, it does work fairly well outdoors when I walk.  But if you are thinking of using this indoors, you will probably be disappointed.

Overall gets the job done.  Use it with a HTPC nettop.  Biggest complaint is that it feels awkward to type with thumbs with the trackpad on the right side and that the trackpad is not very responsive as a laptop trackpad.

I got them for an App on my ipad.  They work ok, but if I had it to do again, I wouldn't buy them.  I've not used them for anything else, so wouldn't know if they work for the 3D movies or other types of viewing.

fits well, hard to open.  have dropped my tablet several times and nothing has broken.  it is awkward to get the case into the other positions.  they definitely have fixed the problem where you open it and it comes and close it and it goes to sleep.  it's pretty good but could use some tweaking.

The price was right for this but in the end I wish I had bought something else. In my Toyota deck, I get a lot of background hum while listening to podcasts. I find myself messing with the Treble to try and improve the voice quality.This lasted 16 months from purchase to broken wire - but I used it daily.
Too much writing by the maker on the upper side makes it hard to write your own descriptions on the disks. Quality of recording is high though.
Got one of the three in package applied.  Once on, it is awesome but had lots of issues with bubble removal.
... but no big investment or install time so I guess I will try the shield over the cruise control fix next time I have the top shelter off!

It works, but is not really muti-directional.  I had to purchase a rotator which I could have done for my old UHF.  In fact my old $25.00 may be better... I have yet to try it with the motorized rotator.
I was looking for a sound system with FM, and this unit has.Sound is good, but not much power so is ok for small spaces.  Easy installation and really nice design, the unit slips by in the room

So I installed this, it comes with directions which I used it still doesn't work. It will charge my GSIII but not much else. I installed the Appradio app and it doesn't do anything either. I would recommend you don't buy this, Pioneer includes no direction on how to get to work on an Android phone. Which is stupid, Android is 90% of the phone market worldwide and all Pioneer develops for is the iPhone.
The most expensive part of this is the lanyard - bad news is that the lanyard was missing the thread loop.  Grey card works as expected.

It was a convenient dock...when the HDD for it actually worked. It did feel a little cheap though, which I came to expect. My experiences with Seagate have been terrible so I will no longer buy their products.Their frequent HDD failures (2 failed HDDs with casual, responsible use) and overall poorly made products have caused me to no longer support them.
It's doing its job, and has great variety of compartments, though some arrangements are a little awkward its good for the price.
The touch screen is not responsive as iPad or Samsung. The universal remote I had to program every single day as device kept forgetting all programmed remotes.

I got this off amazon and although I got it at a great price, it became more of a burden to use. Maybe it's just me, but I like to see the entire month ahead of me.  Felt too robotic and inflexible, to cancel an appointment you'd have to click on lots of tabs.  WIth paper and pencil, you just erase.  In a rush, you don't have time to be clicking around.  Ended up selling it on eBay.

The plastic is too thick over the selection wheel and half the time I would have to press to spin it over and over to change songs.  Not a great solution, but I cut out the plastic over the wheel and that worked out OK. I like the color.  It was tight but fairly easy to get on.
I am giving this 3 stars because is is not heavy duty but does protect the Garmin. I bought this case middle of the road instead of leather. It will do the job so you want be sorry. Hope this helps.
I used this product on a Lenovo Tablet 2.  Product became flimsy and awkward to use over time.  Not what I expected.

The sound is average. The control does control TV. The only thing I don't like is that it does not have blutooth connection nor a display panel to know what is the sound level or something like that. Is a good purchase for the cost.
Amazon description says with software, box it came in says with software but it did not come with software.  I saw another review on here with the same complaint so I am not alone.

This is a really nice player in general, and so far has played every DVD I put in it including various region codes without trouble.  However, it has the very annoying feature that you often cannot just skip right to the main menu without being forced to watch the previews and other advertisements at the beginning.  You can't even fast forward through them.  For this reason, I would look for a different player.
We got this for our mother's iPad.  It has several notches to hold the bottom of the iPad, giving you several viewing angles.  But the fit to the iPad isn't nearly as nice as the one I have on mine.

I am being generous by giving this 3 stars only because of the amount of data you can store on it. However, it is extremely slow. If you plan on filling it with files, say MP3's, plan on a whole days wait. Just filling it to 25 gig was over a four hour process. No my computer isn't old and slow. Top of the line.

I picked this up for about $3.00  for a quick download of pictures to my PC it can't be beat.  My PC doesn't have a SD or SDHC slot so I need one of these to download the pictures.Only complaint is I needed a six inch long USB extension cable to make it fit my USB slot... the shape of this card reader did not allow me to fully insert the unit.

They work app programs fine. Only isse is it kicks off connect on movies. Especially during quiting the app.Average quality.Good priceYou provide your own cable.Lousy boxing made me wonder if the adapter broke.No charging port however has USB port in not sure if one can do it this way.Tested for ipad2

Not the fastest or easiest to install in a MacBook Pro, but does the job as advertised. Though I'm not sure it will be possible to remove it from my laptop without removing the bottom plate of the laptop. There's no mechanism for ejecting the card reader from the computer. Weird.
I ordered 5 of them, all came with silver connectors, not gold. They work but I did not get what was advertised.
good combination for general use in home or theatre. clip ons useful as they to not interfere with regular glasses, full glasses lightweight and comparable image

I bought this mouse to replace a Logitech mouse I use with my laptop.  Big mistake!  The mouse works really well but!! it has this transmitter/receiver (it is almost as large as the mouse) on the end of a cord.  Portabilty zero.  I have bought a new Logitech mouse for use with the laptop (Small USB transmitter/receiver).  The microsoft mouse will be used on my desktop.  Don't buy this if you want portability!!
I run hot and cold on this product.  Maybe it is my PC but I have good and bad days with it....sometimes noise (whines mostly) other times seems ok.

There's a limitation in Windows 7 that make it impossible for Windows Backup to create a system image on this drive.  Unless, of course, you reformat the drive in some way that makes it now impossible to use on an older Windows XP machine.Things might be better using the included backup software, but if you just expected to use it as a big raw disk for infrequent Windows backups, you might be a little disappointed.

To be honest, I'm not sure where the enhanced bass comes from in the description.  My husband and I both felt that they sounded tinny, not enough bass at all.  We both thought they were inferior to the ones that come standard with apple products.  They did have a very comfortable fit, though.
I got this to attach the big monitor to my laptop and was not able to do so it might work on a desk top  but not on my laptop.

You are getting a great picture with this television for the price, just know that you will very likely want to add a sound-bar or audio system to this as to call the sound "tinny" would be doing it a favor.
I have this and I really like it.  I want to love it but whenever I use more than three of the connectors it shuts off my usb port.  I'm not sure if it's my laptop or the device.
It works, but the feel of the device isn't right for me.  Right-handed usage is uncomfortable, since the strap is left of center and there's a hard plastic clip on the right side.
I rated the battery this way because it was a perfect fit.but only has about 2 hours of battery life.  Much less than I expected.
The product is as advertised.  Battery life is very short.  But then again, it is a i5 processor.  I would recommend this product.
This camera is good for watching but if you want it for recording and making out people over 50 ft it is not great
I thought I could deal with this in my back pocket for at work. Instead, it holds all the spare flash drives in my desk. Still work the buy.
the case was a nice looking case.  would have given it a better rating but the keyboad does not work very well.  you have to really push down on the keyboard to get the letters to enter sometimes.
I ordered these thinking they were something different. Not exactly what I had in mind but are useful for framing.

Labels are okay, but I just wish they were thicker. Unlike wanting to use on my mother's files, I was sliding mine thru the tabs on the page separators that you use in a binder. At this time, I prefer binders to hanging file folders. It is a little quicker for me.

The CD install blew up - installing through Windows worked. There are no Linux drivers and this is a Broadcom chipset card AFAIK ... Dual boot users note that I am still searching but ndiswrapper has been suggested as a Linux solution.This is a fine replacement for the internal card on my laptop, but it is not directly compatible with Linux. That's the bottom line.WinXP is still on my system and saving my butt.

The plastic housing for the lightning connector is larger than the standard apple connector. So if you use a case that expects an Apple connector, like the new 5S leather case, you will have to remove your iPhone from the case in order to use this cable. Very inconvenient.
I'm reviewing this the same as the newer routers. It works, but the AC adapter is a bad design, and there is no wall mount option.

I had high hopes for this coiled cable but after a month in my car it stopped working. I know it's the cable because a new straight cable is working just fine with the same charger. It's a great idea if you have the luxury of babying it, but the life of a car charger's cable can be hard. ​
these wipes did get the job done but the fabric doesn't hold up long but for a quick cleaning its good just to have around when u are on the go...

This splitter does what it was designed to do. With it, you can split a single cigarette lighter socket into two sockets and a USB port. Each socket swings approximately 90 degrees so that you can configure it to the best fit for your car. Externally, it appears to be a bit longer than it needs to be. Internally, the cigarette lighter sockets are a bit too short, which can cause plugs to pop out after a little while.
Spend a little more extra money and get the newer version, it's well worth it.  But this unit is very nice too, but the extra cost gets you a lot more

My wife really likes hers. It;s great for low light music applications. I got this before I purchased Amazon Prime membership, but this is a great little light for the low price, and really nice for bulk ordering. A working product was delivered within the time stated, and was received in good working order. I o mixing and patching with my midi musical configuration a lot, and having the right amount of light to work with is important.
that is the best i can do. i haven't used it yet but seems like its going to be just fine

We recently bought a Kindle WiFi and a JKase for it.  We then received a gift of the new Paperwhite model and purchased an amCase for it.  The amCase is adequate, nicely styled but bulkier and harder than the JKase, which I prefer.  However, the amCase is acceptable and does a good job of protecting the device.
Write speed 6 AND 26 mbps Read speed compared to my old 16 gb attaché flash drive, that even fell in the washing machine of 9 write 18 read.. it also came from stock 62.6 gb
Provides satisfactory performance for its price range . Looks to be durable so far. Hope it lasts atleast for a year.
This quick release plate was inexpensive but fits and works as well as the original plate. This brand is proving to be reliable.

So this mount is really well built, but there are two problems with it. First is that you can no adjust the height of the individual monitors. Second is that this most certainly can not hold three 27 inch monitors. I used one 27 and two 23 inch monitors and it barely held them all and there is not much room for adjustment. This is a good deal for the price but it definitely  could stand for some improvement.

I bought this belt to use with my modular accessories, camera holster, lens case and accessories.  Works well but it should come with a suspender type unit to support the weight of the camera and lenses.  It came with one shoulder strap.  Fortunately I had one laying around so I can use.  Otherwise, the weight would pull the belt down.

These things were lower quality than I was expecting.  They seem easy to break... mind you, I haven't broken any of them yet, but they just seem weak.  I surely wouldn't trust them to hold anything moderately expensive.
Made my transformers buzz on my battery charger. It is not a pure sine wave. It can overwork transformers a little.Pay a little more and get a pure sine wave inverter!!

for the cheap price these are some good backup earbuds to use temporarily. But the pair I purchased has very little bass, which is the opposite of what a lot of other people said. Would not buy again.

It works as advertised but not much better.The problem with the item is soft and flimsy.  It does not stay where it should.  So, when you try to clip it to anything, it comes off.  I eventually purchased a hard plastic shell and it works much better.
If you are a hobbyist on a budget you may want to consider this product. Serves the purpose but not durable enough for heavy use
As others have said, the cord that comes with it looses contact so easy it is annoying. I use this drive a lot less than I would if the cord was more reliable.

I don't think it really makes a lot of sense to buy some really expensive piece of equipment to play 30 year old tapes.  They are going to sound pretty bad regardless.  So this deck does the trick.  It is inexpensive, and seems to be a sturdy reliable deck.  As others have stated though, the omission of a remote control is kind of shocking, and unforgiveable in this day and age.

Bought this for the hard edges and the open screen.  Fit is a lot less secure than I'd expected and difficult to get the pod in evenly - feels like it's just not sitting right.  Fine protection in my bag but not good when the kids use it.

This silicone sleave was clearly designed for the original Sansa clip.  It does work with the Clip+ and provides some minimal protection.  The armband is not long enough and is also of poor quality, but for the price, the overall purchase is an OK value.

The mouse is great, ergonomically comfortable, and very easily programmable with the software. The only downside is that the wheel seems too loose. When "unlocked", or the wheel spins freely, I scroll on webpages but every time I lift my finger the wheel moves slightly, that also moves the webpage. Battery life is un-match-able.
Very small and light. It was easy to load songs but the volume buttons broke shortly after I bought it.

.i just learned that listening music while swimming is a must :) i really recommend to everyone. earplugs are problematic, they destroy the quality of the music and your enyojmenti stronglt recommond you pay more and buy a different brand instead of trying to fix your earplugs every 5 minutes. still blue color, np with that. no warning when batteries are dying.you can record many songs and use full battery if u swim everyday (30 minutes) around 4 days

For a replacement on Apple's expensive products, it's perfect. But as far as quality goes, it really only last for a while. I mean, mine is still working, but the end is coming loose from the cable itself. Thank goodness for quality electrical tape.
I just needed a replacement speakers for my desktop. Nothing fancy, I do not listen to much music on by PC...sound is quite tinny, but for just listening to basic speech, it works fine for the price
This is actually the charger storage unit for the Head set so Since I returned the Head set I had no use.

These are not working that well for me. Very streaky.  I'm not sure why, I don't think other lens cleaners streaked as much.  Also the paper used for the "cloth" is very porous and dries almost while you are using it.  Of course, alcohol evaporates quickly, still, these do not seem to be that great for cleaning glasses.

After reading all the reviews I was expecting more from these speakers. They are JUST well packaged cheap speakers.But for around $50 they are a good buy.They do sound better with a decent amount of power.I did like how the grill mount with the speakers for my project it was a plus.

I like these headphones as they fit well over my ears and have nice audio.  However I've gone through four pairs as they last about one year before breaking.  I am using them a lot while sitting at my computer (often 8 hours/day).  I'm going to see if I can repair them with a soldering iron.

I really like this tool kit because it contains a basic assortment of tools. It has everything I need to tinker with and take apart computers and electronics. This kit lost two stars because of one problem, the wire striper/cutter does not cut well. They strip fine, but don't seem to be sharp enough to cut well. Three stars is a pass, but wish I had paid less for this kit which such a major flaw.
Nothing fancy, but, it does the job.Good for a small or not to heavy TVWe got it for a 32" LED screen. It holds it well.Careful with something heavy.
cable is very light.. i assume that if it is not handled well, it will tear soon since the material is very thin

I found it a little inferior to the brand-name LensPen products.  The cap tends to come off easily and the end element (cleaning surface) is quite small.It works great on a small-lens such as a point-and-shoot or view finder, but not so well on a full size DSLR lens.  The brush tends to want to pop out as the slider is a little "loose"

It is not as solid as I wanted. I thought it was going to be a hard case. It is like shoe box cardboard only made of synthetic material. The best protection it can offer is from scratching. If that is what you are looking for then you might like it.

So this does work the first time, but if you change your setup, I am not sure how to persuade its BIOS to pop back up to change its configuration a second time.  When it does pop up, pay close attention to everything it asks before you let it go away.  Its not bad exactly but it sits on my shelf now should I want to mess with it again later.  Good luck with yours.
This was a quirky unit that required more effort to use than one would expect. More of a Science Project than an appliance. Low resolution.

The Headphones sound good and are fairly light weight.The headband and stretch band are a bit too small for those of us with massive skulls (I wear a size 8.25 hat). I also felt my earlobes where folded up inside the earcups.The headphones did fit well on my wife and she found them comfortable.Good Luck.
This mouse was okay.  It used a lot of batteries.  I was constantly having to recharge them.  It got annoying and I switched back to a corded mouse.

The product did not come in standard microsoft packaging and the COA had obviously been removed from something else and reaixed to the plastic CD envelope it was delivered in.I latter had to call Microsoft to re authenticate the product. It does seem to be real MS but NEW???

I hoped I could pick up some football games from my local TV stations with this antenna. It got some signals but not many and not with great strength. My apartment is made of cement and the windows are only on one side, so it may not be the fault of the antenna.
I needed it at the time because of an older cm system for Skype.  I rate it as mediocre because of the sound quality and wiring. OAN, it served it's purpose.
for some reason the tip on this optical cable broke pretty easily. Dint bother replacing it though. make i just got a bad piece.
These are the best drives for the money, but all the manufacturers are cutting their warranties, including seagate.  I get 2-5 years out of a drive before they go bad.

this is very thin and you can barely tell it is on. it does not affect typing whatsoever! it fits perfectly as well. that being said i wish it had some sort of adhesive to make it stick on. i use my macbook a lot while lying in bed and at any angle this thing tends to slide off or be picked up unintentionally by my fingers. if you use it on a flat surface it stays put however.
These work nicely on breadboards. I especially appreciate the long legs, which will work in my prototypes easily. An effective switch for many projects.

Super cheap and works great, the best combination. I bought this for my raspberry pi, hard to imagine there could be any issues with an HDMI cable besides maybe a loose connect or bad signal. This cable delivers solid picture and sound.Update 12/30/2013: This cable randomly produces a magenta hue picture but is resolved by unplugging it and plugging it back in. This solution may not be acceptable for people with hard to reach connections.

In the $100 price range, this recorder was a bargain, but I returned it to Amazon because of the noise and speed of the mechanical functions.  If you don't think that will bother you, it's a steal.  I think a newer version is now available, model DR-420.  Maybe they've made that one a little quieter and a little faster in loading up the DVD.The return to Amazon was pain free.  I really like doing business with them.
Havent really had a chance to hear how they sound. The amp wasnt right, I will redo another review, Thanks!
The one works very well. The other just holds charge for a little while. Kind of a bummer but you get what you pay for. I suggest buying a different brand.

I intended to use this inside a Mau5head to give video capabilities instead of cutout holes. It may still work, but I need to lengthen the video screen from the camera. It has an easily rechargeable battery, and depending how I can lengthen the wire, may work for my odd purpose. Other than that, it is hard to initialize it because of the foreign default language, and the infrared capabilities aren't spectacular. Overall, bot a bad product.
Don't even bother with the software.  In fact, buy the cheaper model.  All you need is dispcalGUI, some free software that is worlds better than the packaged one you pay extra for.

This product was really inexpensive.  One good hit and it broke : /Yes, I should have been more careful, but I've dropped laptops with more expensive HDMI cables plugged in, this one cracked and was instantly unusable.I guess it's okay if you're gentle all the time.  But, you're not really paying for a durable item.

A good entry level graphics card. It has been playing every game i throw at it. The graphics are on par with xbox 360 and ps3. If you want to be blown away from graphics, save your money and get a higher end graphics card. Example: gtx 770 or 780.  Ive had this card for a month and havent had any issues

Personally, I didn't do a lot of research when I pre-ordered this. The games are not that great and the system is lacking upnp/dlna features. I'm hoping that Sony has an update to allow these features again and that the games will get better. For now, the choices are not there. I find myself playing the PS4 a couple of hours per month now.

This was ordered from what I saw in the picture which was what looked like "gold plated" connectors.  It was just a little more than ones without gold plating so I ordered them.  What I got was connectors that did not have gold plating.

Everything about the keyboard is great, particularly how portable it is. I've only had it for a week, so can't comment on longevity.Do feel the keys could be more tactile or require more pressure to push, so it feels more responsive. Some function keys could also help though I guess the appeal of this keyboard is its simplicity
the screen doesn't tilt up and down at all. This was a deal breaker for me. I returned it for an ASUS.It looked beautiful and worked great, but the tilt ....
I've only took it out once and took a lot of pic. Great pic for a white guy I need to get out more.

Pros: the color is almost identical to that one in the photo, it fits nice, protection to the laptop is ok. I like the rubberized texture.Cons:  could fit better (a little tighter) and came with may be 5 mm broken in the upper side of the screen case,

Do you like to listen to your music with treble only?  Like, with no base?  Okay, I wasn't expecting a boom box, but I've heard tiny portable speakers that blew me away with the quality of the sound.  But they cost 4 or 5 times more than than this device.  So, I'll find someone who doesn't know better - like maybe a 2 year old - and give this away!

For the price its pretty good. Its very lightweight and a nice size to use with a HTPC. The keyboard layout is very strange, the mouse is very slow in response, and for some reason the keypresses are extremely loud. It has an extremely cheap feel to it, but so far its worked without a problem.

The atheros chips don't support all the dd-wrt functionality.  Vlans don't work, logging only works to external syslog server.  crashed and was hacked with a dados attack but that is likely a software issue.  Had to resort to command line to configure as the GUI doesn't work for atheros chips on certain functions.  Need to know Linux well
Bought this car charger for my wife's iPhone. This cable is too short. Not suitable for use in an SUV of other big vehicles. They could have just added an extra two feet in length.
I got this to use with my iPad. It's okay, but not quite what I wanted. Will give it to my 14 year nephew to use.

I bought a set of these recently from an outside vendor for much more than is offered here on Amazon.  Great fit but horrible sound quality...unless you like music which is all mids and hi's (jazz maybe?).  Returned and refunded - sorry Apple.

Update 09202013Lifespan for cable is poor.Both cables work for only one speakers.Poor build qualityGood product When  it works.Worked as it claimed.Got a couple of them and told my friends.All of them have bought this and using it.
Not bad for the price. However, plastic locking tabs, 2-section shaft does not allow for rotation.and stiff to open. Good for light weight use ONLY!

I purchased this for my desk top and found this doesn't work with desktop. Because the wire is not big enough to hook up to the desktop and to the desk. Would have good for the laptop though. So I had to exchange this. Wished the description would clearly say this is not suitable for desk top. Would have helped in making choices.

The camera itself seem to be ok but the telescopic lens was not impressive. I took a couple of test shoot and the picture quality was pretty good. The 50-200 lens will probably be a better lens but it's sold separately and it's quite expensive. I did not hate the product but it could be better.
I ordered the one listed for an HD. I received a normal kindle one. So i just returned the item because the system would not allow me to exchange it. Things happen

Picture is not what you get . It says Dell, but is not a true Dell charger.My fault for going by picture and not reading write up. Late night purchase, wasn't thinking clearly. However, it does work and is compatible. I read Genuine but didn't read it's compatible. I gave it three stars because the seller says it's genuine, but it's not. But like I said it does work!
It works.  But like others have said, you really can only use it for macro work with it just turned on.  Don't expect a great TTL integrated flash.  It's not.  But, for the price, it's a good deal.

I could have gotten a defective one, but while on my trip to Tokyo this battery barely made it past 200 shots, while my OEM of lower mAh stretched beyond 300. Still this price is great and buying 2 or 3 is still cheaper than 1 OEM.

Price was good but for a last year tablet I hoped for better performance. Tablet is slow and reboots unexpectedly in middle of an application. Most of applications give a massage "Application stopped responding - do you want to kill the pages?" After replying "Wait" - one or two times - application loads. It is not an internet problem - my Kindle runs just fine.

This product was bought new, but when I had a little trouble installing it, and called for support, I was told that the warranty had expired, even though it had been out of the box less than a couple of hours. I did end up solving the problem myself, and the product has been working since, but if you have never done this before, I would hesitate.

The JFJ cleaning machine itself is fantastic...let me start there...it just works fantastic...now the pads just don't last as long as they say they will but in order to use the machine you have to have the pads...so here I am ordering them...maybe a bit disgruntled but still very happy with the machine in itself.
Poor quality images, a bit difficult to learn to use but cheap and fun to play with. Works great with windows

If you do a lot of MMORPG'ing (online role playing games) this is not the mouse for you. After only 2-3 months the right button started to fail. I literally had to push very hard to right click for dragging and dropping files from folder to folder because of you didnt it would release b4 you got to the fold to drop it on.

I bought this for my iPad 2 and it works just great.  Charges and plays back video.  I tested it with my iPhone 3GS and got audio only when playing back a video.  I did not get the warning that the device is not compatible message, but it definitely would not playback the video.  I don't have an iPhone 4 with which to test, so I can not comment on that.

After reading the reviews I was aware that the connector with the exposed pins are very fragile so I ordered a spare, and I still would up bending one of the pins. Its very cheaply made, the "pins" are flat pieces of copper not glued down, so if the edge of the pin catches it bends.. and you cant see it or feal it. Other than that it worked great once you get it connected

Item came faster than expected though shipping time was not the issue. The DVD works fine I'm just still having trouble getting the player to play after burning video.As it turns out this is a DVD+RW disc so you will need a newer dvd player to play it.The difference being the (+) means its meant for newer DVD players.Other than that great item.

I have heard many mini-speakers and after reading the reviews online for New AYL I thought it should have a better sound quality than it does. It works fine, but I would personally buy a higher quality speaker next time and pay a bit more.
Removable vent mount works ok ,but the clamps don't grip tight enough.Tends to slip out easily.
Very stiff cable. Very stiff connectors. I feel like I'm going to break the connector in the back of my CD player putting these cables in.The work...just allow lots of space behind your device.
LCD screen could not rightly be seen when the sun was behind or overhead.Video quality was disappointing.Returned the product
Seems to be a nice item but of the two I ordered, one was DOA. Since I liked the first one, I reordered a 3rd one.

Cable is useful and works perfectly. The only downside is that is VERY thick and quite inflexible. This makes it a bit difficult to route when in use.  I like it overall but would definitely look for a thinner cable if I had to buy another one.

Not the quickest drive on the block.  Have since switched to Western Digital Black Caviar drives which have a great performance and warranty..  Western Digital support is excellent whereas Seagate can be tough to reach.  YMMV, but depending on your needs and price points it's a solid drive, but I believe WD are better.
It was good but I believe I ordered the wrong one and was miss informed by other forums and searching I did for a tablet charger. It looks good just wish I had gotten the right one.
this DVI splitter doesn't actually allow you to have two separate displays with extended desktops, this simply duplicates the graphics output.

This technically does what it says, but it's much thicker and coarser than similar products such asVelcro Cable Tie Roll, 3/4" x 5 yards, and seems to shed the cottony material ("loops") that fastens to the hooks.  Seems to be made of two layers (one hooks, one loops) glued back to back, rather than a single thin layer (like other products) with hooks on one side and loops on the other.Keep shopping, there are better options.
Plays fine but takes forever to load a cd or dvd and of course, HD is dead. Would not recommend even if the format had continued.

I bought these for my teenage daughter, because she seems to break her earphone buds every 2-3 months. I was tired of spending $20 or more for something that doesn't last. The price was right, but my daughter says the sound is not good and they do not block out the noise like her other skullcandy earbuds.

The keyboard sometimes stops responding when I'm typing notes on my tablet. It would be fine, but I don't want to miss writing notes down for school because the keyboard can't keep a strong Bluetooth signal.The keys are a bit cramped, which isn't the fault of the keyboard since it did say ultra slim. I guess it takes a little getting used to. Other than the bluetooth fading in and out, it works fine.
It's a charger.  It charges.  Takes forever to get to 100% charge but charges to close enough for my purposes.  It has a very short cord but can charge while my tablet is in use.

New and improved, Hah, The biggest change no fine tuning on the headphone,only a three channel switch.There  seems to be less range with the newer model,about half the range. The reason I bought these was for the fantastic 300 foot range from base to headphone but not with the new one.Really disappointed with this model.Wish RCA would return to the WHP150 model.900MHZ is far superior to Bluetooth but not cheaper so there is your bottom line.Thanks, Gordon

These are nice headphones in some ways.  They seem solid. The case they come in is nice. The cord they are attached to is long.  However, they will not stay in my ears.  I have tried positioning them in all kinds of ways and they just won't stay.  If they fit in your ears, they are a good option.  In not, then they really aren't worth the money.

I had multiple issues with it. Like other people complained, I disliked that I had to cut stuff to fit. I would recommend purchasing a item that is specifically for your car. I had to use oem parts and metra parts so it would fit properly. Ones fitted it looked clean. In a difficulty range I would say Moderate.

While this has decent sound it doesn't seem much different from the sound from the internal chips in our newer computers. If you need a sound card it isn't bad but I'd not call it an upgrade to an existing internal sound chip.

We bought this, installed it, and used it for about ten days before it began to "crackle."  Amazon took it back with no questions asked.It's been replaced with a Sony Sound Bar with a built-in wireless subwoofer.  It cost twice as much as the Vizio, but it's four times as good at producing great sound.

I'm not really rating this item, I am ordering the red one and I will rate that.  For some reason....the blue one costs more than the red or the black.  They appear to be exactly the same item except for color.  Go figure!

This product feel cheap cheap cheap. The pen it comes with is neat. Case feels cheap. My wife uses it. She seems to like it. Thin  plastic product. Don't expect this to protect your phone much. I like the incipio products more.

The product works as it should, however I am removing 2 stars due to the price and outrageously wasteful packaging.  This device is just a couple of inches long, however the box it shipped in was massive.

These are quick and easy to set-up but were not compatible with one of my flashes because of power reasons, oddly it was a more expensive flash the cheap ones work fine. I recommend truly checking compatibility.

Is that a word, plasticy?  This is an inexpensive, and inexpensively made tablet.  Good for kids, but beware, the digitizer will crack pretty easy.  But you won't be too upset because you didn't pay much for it.
I've used this cable while using a setup to video DJ and anytime I plug it into my HDMI input on my computer there is a very loud buzz it's quite annoying.

If you are intended to reproduce media file stored in your usb hard disk drive, dont buy the WD TV Live Media Player, just buy the WD TV Media Player, it is cheaper and does the same functions and the file reading speed is the same...

I've had this radio several years. While I bought it for emergencies, I use it every day including often in the bathroom where it's exposed to a lot of steam next to the shower. It does it's job reliably EXCEPT the emergency light died within the first few months. I cannot find a replacement.

Picture quality is not that great: over exposed sometimesCharging is a pain as you have to remove the battery ans stick it into a charger every timeWon't be returning it but would probably not buy it again if I had to do it all over again

I was not sure I needed a new power supply, the supplier of the motherboard suggested I replace the original because the board never worked. after replacing power supply the mother board still does not work.

I bought two of these for my daughters' Dell 1525 laptops.  One is still working fine, but one has lost it's ability to hold a charge for more than 1 hour.  I only paid $23 so I can live with the depleted battery life since I only have to make these laptops work another 6 months before they get replaced.
This unit is not for electronic cameras.Other than that it is great. If you have a conventional camera. BUY IT
The product worked well once we added a hub to it which allowed all of the components to work.
I like the concept of what they do. The item we had bought it for was defective and we returned it to the seller and cancelled the plan.
The battery life is so short if you use it on a daily basis. Your thumb and index finger won't feel comfortable when you hold this mouse.

Does anyone know why that after a few weeks, the MP3 player no longer plays things in sequence and starts playing random?  I have experimented with the replay setting for both the MP3 file and the System Replay Mode setting. None have any affect.If I erase everything and then add 3 new files, in alphabetical order, it still will play them random.  It used to play things in the order I loaded them.Thanks for any help.

It's good.Bokeh is great.Contrast is not. I'm not sure if it's not coated with some of the better coatings that other companies use, but I didn't like it for the quality of photos I like to produce.So I returned it.
It does it's job but it's really loose and falls off allot when I'm taking it out of the camera bag.  Other than that it's indistinguishable from the Canon part.

This soundbar is really meant to be used with its companion Subwoofer for a full sound.I bought this model without the subwoofer for my mom to help with the clarity of speech and it does a good job for that. With thin walls, she does not need the subwoofer.If you want full sound, I would suggest trying the model VSB210WS or other model that includes a Subwoofer.

Not only is the case on the heavy side, it does not put the tablet to sleep when you close the cover.  This may be because of the device, but I have a similar case on my Nexus 7 and when I close the case the tablet goes to sleep.  The case does not fit quite as good as I had hoped.
The built-in microphone picks up the pen-on-paper noise very well.  Still, I prefer this to my tables or laptop for note taking during meetings.  Battery life is remarkable.
I bought this for myself and I don't like it.  I found it made the buttons harder to press and access.  But, I think it's probably a good purchase for your child's iPad.

The product looks and works as expected. Sound is decent for size and form.The major warning I have is cruddy warranty. They CHARGE $15 for shipping one way to repair it. After two happy months of ownership the unit will not respond play any sound  on my iPod and iPhone 4s. It however charges. So turn around time is 3 weeks and charged $15 to boot.That being said when it works I like the product.
It is what it is. Cheap ram. My comp skips and sputters with this ram but whatever, there's not much out there in this older ram so you have to go with what you can get.

I prefer this case over the Acase brand.  This case does not smell like the Acase does. It also holds the Kindle Fire HD 7" more securely in my opinion.  It has Velcro on the inside to keep the Kindle in and the edges have less cut outs.  My only complaint is that the speakers are not fully cut out.  There are 5 hole punches over the speakers.  The sound seems OK though...

They look like the sony earbuds, but clearly aren't the same. The sound was about the same, but the build quality wasn't. I have the authentic sony earbuds, and you can immediately spot the differences. These are a cheap replacement, but just know what you are purchasing.
... for the priced. The screen doesn't seem tack sharp and just acceptable, but what can you expect for a monitor around $150?

G-Tech is my preferred drive.  Works fairly well on my systems, but I'm using the USB (only have USB2 bus) because I have some conflict with this drive and other FW 800 devices that was causing severe corruption of files on this drive.  Don't know who's devices are the problem for that.This is a decent drive for the money, but next time I'd go with a G-Drive mini or Quad.

Its beautiful around my ipad2... though i still have about 3 teeny weeny bubbles that has solidified and will never go away.The video instruction says they (bubbles) will disappear after 48hrs, i followed that timeline...still got the bubbles though.

Compared to other 16Gb flash drives it was very affordable. Only downside is that it's slower than the expensive ones.  Takes about 3 min to transfer 1 GB while others take 1 min or less to transfer 1 GB. Great product though.

The batteries are great spares, I'm using them in my Nikon D5000, they definetly are not the original battery in performance and longevity, but for the cost I'd buy them again. Just knowing I have a spare is worth the money.
be careful with the tip, it is easy to bend. Use the protector cap with comes with it. Capacitive screen are vastly inferior to pressure sensitive digital ink but this pen makes it more bearable.

Does what it's suppose to.  If all you want is something to protect your IPAD, you will like it.If you want to use this an a business tool, it lacks storage. Could be 1 half inch thicker to carry a pad of paper. needs a couple more pen holders. A phone pocket on the outside would be nice too.
Bought this in hope that I could make a Sony HVL-F32X flash to work with a Canon DSLR.  But it DIDN'T. I just wasted 10 bucks for nothing ;).

I received this today and ran some benchmarks. Write speed for my Kingston 64GB DataTraveler is 15MB/Sec on a USB 3.0 port. It does the job, but a little slower compared to my Sandisk Extreme USB, which averages about 113MB/Sec copying the same files.
Works great, I can connect my HDMI monitor, desktop hard drive and a bunch of USB devices all at the same time.
I have never used this. How am I going to say good or bad about it. James S. Deaton ,,,,
I bought this to replace an older one which broke.  This one seems to work fine.  The price was very fair, far below the in-store price for the same product.

Not sure what to do with this cord now. I wish it could have been "plug and play" in a manner of speaking. I mean it goes from one port to the other port, and it just didn't work. Oh well, it wasn't expensive.
there isn't anyway of securing this so it flops around a little which is annoying but it does help in sun light.

I bought this unit for my brother's children as a gift.  He's an electrical engineer and great with electronic stuff but it took him quite a bit of messing around with the set up to get this unit working correctly with the various services, e.g., Hulu, Netflix, etc. Sony didn't seem to want it to make it too easy.

This is a GREAT addition to the GoPro HERO/HERO2, and mine arrived in great condition. However, in order to use it, you must go to the GoPro website to update the BacPac's software, that that's where my trouble began. Once I tried to update it, it quit! Deader than a doorknob.

Although this extension cable probably works fine for basic USB devices, I am sad to say that it did not work for my Samsung Galaxy Note 2. It would power the device fine, but would not allow for the transfer of data. Seems odd that something "to spec" would not work for a basic function like this. I returned it.

very very very expensive feature to add to your xbox 360. the drive is really good, no problems so far (been about 2 months). Other than the price it is a must for every xbox, if you can afford it you should get it.
